2nd row: (RS). Join B with sl st in top of first ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 1 dc) in same sp as sl st. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp – first corner made. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp - second corner made. (1 dc. Ch 3. Sl st) in top of last ch-3 sp. Fasten off. Do not turn. 
3rd row: (RS). Join A with sl st in top of first ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 1 dc) in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 3. Sl st) in top of last ch-3 sp. Fasten off. Do not turn.

4th row: (RS). Join B with sl st in top of first ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 1 dc) in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 3. Sl st) in top of last ch-3 sp. Fasten off. Do not turn. 

5th row: (RS). Join A with sl st in top of first ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. Sl st in top of last ch-3 sp. Fasten off. 

ASSEMBLY 
Note: Sew pieces tog with A through back loops only using whipstitch as indicated below, as shown here in video tutorial. 
Using Assembly Diagrams XS/S, M, L, XL, 2/3XL on page 5 and 4/5XL on page 6, sew Motifs tog to form Sleeve (make 2), Back, Front Left and Front Right pieces. 

Sleeve Edging: Sizes M, L, XL, 2/3XL and 4/5XL only: With RS facing, join A with sl st at corner of Sleeve, as indicated with star in Assembly Diagram. 
1st row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Work 65 dc evenly across edge of Sleeve. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row 1 (2-3-3-0) time(s) more. Fasten off. 
Rep along opposite edge of Sleeve. 
Sew pieces tog along red lines in Assembly Diagrams. 
Fold pieces in half along green dotted line. Sew side and underarm seams. 

EDGING 
1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st at back neck. Ch 1. Work sc evenly across back neck, down right front, across bottom, up left front, and across rem of back neck, working 3 sc at front bottom corners. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. *Work sc evenly around to 1 st before next neck edge (indicated with circle in Assembly Diagram). Sc3tog. Rep from * once, working 3 sc at each corner. Work sc evenly to end of rnd. Join. 
Fasten off. 

Cuffs: With RS facing, join A with sl st at sleeve edge. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 44 (56-60-64-64-70) sc evenly around sleeve opening. Join. 
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 

Fasten off.

pattern_name: Big Bear Comfort Crochet Blanket Hoodie
materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 194 yds/177 m) Corduroy (61028) 10 14 balls
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit chest measurement XS/XL 28-46" [71-117 cm] 2/5XL 48-62" [122-157.5 cm] Finished chest measurement XS/XL 65" [165 cm] 2/5XL 84" [213.5 cm]
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/XL. If changes are necessary for larger size the instruction will be written XS/XL (2/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Notes:
• Hoodie is worked in 5 pieces and seamed together in Finishing.
• Hood is worked from neck in Finishing.

CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: EASY

BACK
**Ribbing: Ch 5.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 32½ (42)" [82.5 (106.5) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Proceed as follows:
Set-up row: (RS). Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 65 (83) sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn.
PM at end of row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.**
Rep last row until work from marker measures 33 (36)" [84 (91.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Back. Rep last row until work from marker measures 27 (28½)" [68.5 (72.5) cm], ending on a WS row.

Shape Left Front Neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 29 (38) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. PM at end of row.
***2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 6 (7½)" [15 (19) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.***
 
Shape Right Front Neck: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 7 sc after Left Front neck. Join yarn with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of last 28 (37) sc. Turn. PM at end of row. 29 (38) sc.
Rep from *** to *** as given for Left Front Neck.

SLEEVES
Ribbing: Ch 5.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 10 (11½)" [25.5 (29) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Proceed as follows:
Set up row: (RS). Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 19 (23) sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn.
PM at end of row.
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 21 (25) sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: As 1st row. 
4th row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 1st to 4th rows 5 times more, then rep 1st row (1st to 3rd rows) once, ending on a WS row. 57 (65) sc.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams 11¼ (15)" [28.5 (38) cm] in from side edges leaving 10 (12)" [25.5 (30.5) cm] center back neck opening. PM 14 (16)" [35.5 (40.5) cm] down from shoulders on side edges. Sew in sleeves between markers. Sew side and sleeve seams.

HOOD
1st row: (RS). Beg at right front neck, join yarn with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. Work 6 (8) sc evenly up right front neck, 20 (24) sc evenly across back neck edge and 6 (8) sc evenly down left front neck. Turn. PM at end of row. 32 (40) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. [2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 2 (4) sc] 9 (7) times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 42 (48) sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 42 (48) sc.
Rep 4th row until Hood from marker measures 13 (16)" [33 (40.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 19 (22) sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of last 19 (22) sc. Turn. 40 (46) sts.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 18 (20) sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of last 18 (20) sc. Turn. 38 (44) sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Fold Hood in half and sew top seam.

Hood Edging: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to bottom corner of right front neck opening. Ch 1. Work 83 (102) sc evenly up side of right neck edge, across Hood opening, and down side of left neck edge. Turn.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off.
Sew ends of Hood Edging to bottom of neck opening (7 skipped sts). Sew edges of Hood Edging tog 2" [5 cm] up from Bottom of neck opening.

POCKET
Ch 35 (39).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 34 (38) sc.
2nd to 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 32 (36) sts.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 8th and 9th rows 4 (5) times more. 24 (26) sc rem, ending on a RS row.
Next 4 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn at end of 4th row.
Cont working edging around Pocket as follows:
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Work sc evenly around Pocket, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Sew Pocket in position centered across Front and 11" [28 cm] above bottom edge (see diagram on page 4).

EARS (make 2)
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral, PM on first st of rnd for easier counting.

Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th to 7th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 15 sts.
9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 10 sts.
Fasten off.

Flatten Ear, pushing one side into the other, noting Ear will naturally cup. Fold last rnd in half, aligning cupped edges together. Sew last round together, working through all 4 thickness to close Ear.

Sew Ears into position, one on each side of Hood, approx 4" [10 cm] back from front edge and 1" [2.5 cm] down from top seam of Hood (as shown in photo).

Cont even in pat until Hood measures 8 (8½-8½-9)" [20.5 (21.5-21.5-23) cm] from neck edge, ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

Pompom
Wind yarn around 3 fingers approx 100 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to end of Hood.

pattern_name: Gotta Have It Cable Crochet Sweater
materials: Red Heart® With Love™ (7 oz/198 g; 370 yds/338 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made
Dtr = (Double treble crochet). (Yoh) 3 times. Insert hook in next stitch and pull up a loop. (Yoh and draw up a loop through 2 loops on hook) 4 times
Dtrfp = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times. Skip st behind dtrfp.

Fdc (foundation double crochet) = Ch 3 (counts as first fdc). Yoh. Insert hook under top 2 strands of first ch and pull up a loop. Ch 1. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops) twice. 2 fdc complete. *Yoh. Insert hook under both loops of ch st at base of previous fdc and pull up a loop. Ch 1. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Rep from * to desired number of fdc.
LCC (Left Cross Cable) = Skip next post st. Dtrfp around next 2 post sts. Working in front of sts just worked, dtrfp around skipped post st.
gauge: 11 dc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
NOTES: Sweater is made from four pieces; Back, Front, and two Sleeves. Front is worked in sections of plain dc with Cable Panel and dtrfp-sts. Back and sleeves are worked in dc. Sleeves are worked from the top down to wrist. When working RS of cable section, it is helpful to turn work toward you to clearly see where to place dc between post sts. Remember to skip sts that post sts replaced. Ch 1 (work loosely) at beg of each row. It is worked only to help reach the height of first dc in next row. Work first st in last dc of previous row.
Cable Panel (worked over 23 sts)
1st row: (RS). Dtrfp in each of next 2 post sts. (1 dc in next st. LCC over next 3 post sts. 1 dc in next st. Dtrfp in each of next 2 post sts) 3 times.
2nd row: 1 dc in each st across.
3rd row: Dtrfp in each of next 2 post sts. (1 dc in next st. Dtrfp in each of next 3 post sts. 1 dc in next st. Dtrfp in each of next 2 post sts) 3 times.
4th row: 1 dc in each st across.
Rep 1st to 4th rows for Cable Panel.
BACK
Fdc 57 ( 61-65-73-77-81). Turn. 
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 dc in each st across. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. (1 dc in next st. Dtrfp around dc made in Fdc row) across to last st. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each st across. Turn. 
Rep 3rd row until work from beg measures 18½ ( 18½-18½-18½-18½-19)" [ 47 ( 47-47-47-47-48) cm]. 
Shape Armholes 
Next row: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 7 sts. Ch 1. 1 dc in same st as last slip st. 1 dc in each of next 44 ( 48-52-60-64-68) sts. Turn. Leave rem 6 dc unworked. 45 ( 49-53-61-65-69) dc. 
Rep Row 3 until armhole measures 8½ ( 9-10-10½-11½-12)" [ 21.5 ( 23-25.5-26.5-29-30.5) cm]. 
Shape Neck
First Side
Next row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 9 ( 11-13-16-18-19) dc. Dc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 10 ( 12-14-17-19-20) sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Second Side
Next row: Skip center 23 ( 23-23-25-25-27) dc on last full row worked for neck. Join yarn with sl st in next dc. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of rem 9 ( 11-13-16-18-19) dc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 10 ( 12-14-17-19-20) sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FRONT 
Fdc 57 ( 61-65-73-77-81). Turn. 
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 dc in each st across. Turn. 
2nd row: (Set up row). Ch 1. Dtrfp around each of first 17 ( 19-21-25-27-29) sts. Dtrfp around each of next 2 sts. (1 dc in next st. Dtrfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in next st. Dtrfp around each of next 2 sts) 3 times. Dtrfp around each of last 17 ( 19-21-25-27-29) sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each st across. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each of first 17 ( 19-21-25-27-29) sts. Dtrfp around each of next 2 sts. (1 dc in next st. LCC in next 3 post sts. 1 dc in next st. Dtrfp around each of next 2 post sts) 3 times. 1 dc in each of last 17 ( 19-21-25-27-29) sts. 
5th row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each st across. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each of first 17 ( 19-21-25-27-29) sts. Dtrfp around each of next 2 sts. (1 dc in next st. Dtrfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in next st. Dtrfp around each of next 2 sts) 3 times. 1 dc in each of last 17 ( 19-21-25-27-29) sts. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each st across. Turn.
Rep Rows 4-7 for pattern st until work from beg measures 18½ ( 18½-18½-18½-18½-19)" [ 47 ( 47-47-47-47-48) cm].
Shape Armholes 
Next row: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 7 sts. Ch 1. 1 dc in same st as last slip st. 1 dc in each of next 44 ( 48-52-60-64-68) sts. Turn. Leave rem 6 dc unworked. 45 ( 49-53-61-65-69) dc.
Cont in pat st until measures 8½ ( 9-10-10½-11½-12)" [ 21.5 ( 23-25.5-26.5-29-30.5) cm].
Shape Neck
First Side
Next row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 11 ( 13-15-18-20-21) sts. Dc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 12 ( 14-16-19-21-22) sts. 
Next row: Ch 1. Dc2tog. Work in pattern to end of row. Turn. 11 ( 13-15-18-20-21) sts. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 9 ( 11-13-16-18-19) sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 10 ( 12-14-17-19-20) sts.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 10 ( 12-14-17-19-20) sts. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Second Side
Next row: Skip center 19 ( 19-19-21-21-21) sts on last full row worked for neck. Join yarn with sl st in next st st. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each rem 11 ( 13-15-18-20-21) sts. Turn. 12 ( 14-16-19-21-22) sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 10 ( 12-14-17-19-20) sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 11 ( 13-15-18-20-21) sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Dc2tog. Work in pat to end of row. Turn. 10 ( 12-14-17-19-20) sts.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 10 ( 12-14-17-19-20) sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
SLEEVES 
Fdc 51 ( 55-61-63-69-71) sts. Turn.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 dc in each st across. Turn.
Decrease row: Ch 1. Dc2tog. 1 dc to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 49 ( 53-59-61-67-69) sts.
Cont to work in dc rows, rep Decrease Row every 3rd row 4 ( 4-0-1-0-0) times, then every other row 7 ( 8-14-13-15-15) times. 27 ( 29-31-33-37-39) sts rem. 
Work even until work from beg measures 17 ( 17½-17½-18-18-18½)" [ 43 ( 44.5-44.5-46-46-47) cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. Sew shoulder seams. Sew in sleeves. Sew side and sleeve seams. 
Neckband
1st rnd: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at left shoulder seam. Ch 1. Work 70 ( 70-70-74-74-78) dc evenly spaced around neck. Join with sl st to first dc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 dc in next st. Dcfp around next st) around. Join with sl st to first dc. Fasten off.
Sew top of Sleeve in Armhole, sewing upper side edge of Sleeve to slip st edge of Armhole shaping, easing to fit. Sew side and sleeve seams.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 2 (2, 3, 5) balls 8699 Olive A
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6mm [US J-10] and 5mm [US H-8] (for neckband only)
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: With larger hook, 12 sts = 4” (10cm); 11 rows = 4” (10cm) in Seed st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CHEST
Beginning at lower edge with larger hook and A, ch 15 (23, 31, 41).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch, sc in last ch, turn—14 (22, 30, 40) sts consisting of 8 (12, 16, 21) sc and 6 (10, 14, 19) ch-1 spaces.
Work even in Seed st pattern until piece measures 2 (3½, 6, 9)” (5 [9, 15, 23] cm) from beginning.
Shape Sides at Top of Piece
Row 1 (decrease row): Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sc, sc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next sc, sc2tog over last ch-1 space and last sc, turn—12 (20, 28, 38) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last 2 sc, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 3 (decrease row): Ch 1, sc2tog over first sc and first ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last 2 sc, sc2tog over last 2 sc, turn—10 (18, 26, 36) sts.
Row 4: Work even in Seed st pattern.
Rows 5-8 (8, 12, 16): Repeat last 4 rows 1 (1, 2, 3) more times—6 (14, 18, 24) sts.
Row 9 (9, 13, 17): Repeat Row 1—4 (12, 16, 22) sts.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 5¼ (7½, 11, 15)” (12.5 [19, 28, 38] cm) from beginning. Do not fasten off.
Finished Neck: 7 (10½, 13, 17)” (18 [26.5, 33, 43] cm), buttoned at neckband (worked with smaller hook)
Finished Chest: 14 (19, 25, 31)” (35.5 [48.5, 63.5, 79] cm), buttoned.
Finished Length: 10 (14, 18, 22)” (25.5 [35.5, 45.5, 56] cm), including neckband
Special Stitches
FPdc (Front Post double crochet): Yarn over, insert hook from front to back to front again around the post of designated st, yarn over and draw up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook (2 loops on hook), yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook.
sc2tog (single crochet 2 together): [Insert hook in next st, yarn over and draw up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Pattern Stitch
Seed Stitch (multiple of 2 sts)
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across to last sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Repeat Row 2 for pattern.
Notes
1. Sweater is made from 2 pieces, back and chest. Neckband is worked across top edge of both pieces to form sweater.
2. Different breeds and different dogs vary greatly in size. Place pieces on your dog as you go to check for appropriate length and placement of buttonholes.
GAUGE: With larger hook, 12 sts = 4” (10cm); 11 rows = 4” (10cm) in Seed st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

EDGING
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc evenly down long side edge, across lower edge, and up other long side edge, ensuring that you work an even number of sts, turn. Fasten off A.
Row 2 (right side): With right side facing, join B with sc in first st of previous row, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc. Fasten off B.
Row 3 (right side): With right side facing, join A with sc in first st of previous row, sc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, to last ch-1 space, ch 1, sc in last sc. Fasten off A.
Row 4 (right side): With right side facing, join B with sc in first st of previous row, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc. Fasten off.

BACK
Beginning at lower edge with larger hook and A, ch 15 (23, 31, 41).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch, sc in last ch, turn—14 (22, 30, 40) sts consisting of 8 (12, 16, 21) sc and 6 (10, 14, 19) ch-1 spaces.
Row 2 (increase row): Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last sc, ch 1, sc in last sc, turn—16 (24, 32, 42) sts.
Row 3 (increase row): Ch 1, sc in first sc, ch 1, sc in first ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last 2 sc, ch 1, skip next sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—18 (26, 34, 44) sts.
Rows 4-5: Repeat Rows 2-3—22 (30, 38, 48) sts.
Work even in Seed st pattern until piece measures 4 (7, 10, 13)” (10 [18, 25.5, 33] cm) from beginning.
Shape Sides at Top of Piece
Row 1: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sc, sc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next sc, sc2tog over last ch-1 space and last sc, turn—20 (28, 36, 46) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last 2 sc, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog  over first sc and first ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last 2 sc, sc2tog over last 2 sc, turn—18 (26, 34, 44) sts.
Row 4: Work even in Seed st pattern.
Rows 5-8: Repeat Rows 1-4—14 (22, 30, 40) sts.
Work even in Seed st pattern until piece measures 7 (11, 15, 19)” (18 [28, 38, 48.5] cm) from beginning. Do not fasten off.
Edging
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc evenly down long side edge, across lower edge, and up other long side edge, ensuring that you work an even number of sts, turn. Fasten off A.
Notes: Before beginning next row, notice that there are 4 “corners” near the lower edge. You will work increases in these corners. If desired, place a marker in each corner. There are less noticeable corners at the beginning of the top side shaping. Do not work increases in these top corners.
Row 2 (right side): With right side facing, and larger hook, join B with sc in first st of previous row, [*ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to next marked “corner”, ch 1, skip next sc, (sc, ch 1, sc) in corner sc] 4 times, **ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from ** to last sc, sc in last sc. Move markers up to ch-1 spaces. Fasten off B.
Row 3 (right side): With right side facing, and larger hook, join A with sc in first st of previous row, sc in next ch-1 space, [*ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to next marked corner ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next sc, (sc, ch 1, sc) in corner ch-1 space] 4 times, **ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from ** across. Fasten off A. Remove markers.
Place chest piece on top of back piece to determine positions of buttonholes. Place 1 (2, 3, 3) markers in ch-1 spaces evenly spaced across the section of both sides of back piece that overlap with straight sides of chest. Work Row 4, working 3 sc (instead of just 1 sc) in each marked ch-1 space for buttonholes.
Row 4 (right side): With right side facing, and larger hook, join B with sc in first st of previous row, [*ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to next corner ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next sc, (sc, ch 1, sc) in corner ch-1 space] 4 times, **ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from ** to last sc, sc in last sc. Fasten off.

NECKBAND
With right side of chest facing and smaller hook, draw up a loop of A in top corner to work across top of chest piece.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 4 ch; work 6 (14, 18, 24) sc evenly spaced across top of chest, work 16 (24, 32, 42) sc evenly spaced across top of back—26 (42, 54, 70) sts. Fasten off.
Rows 2-3: Work same as Rows 2-3 of Chest Edging.
Row 4 (right side): With right side facing, join B with sc in first st of previous row, ch 1, skip next sc, 3 sc in next ch-1 space (for button hole), *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc. Fasten off.

LEASH
With larger hook and B, ch 4.
Handle
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across.
Notes: A stitch “2 rows below” is in the row numbered 2 less than the row you are currently working. For example, if you are working Row 3 a stitch 2 rows below is in Row 1. You will be working FPdc on both sides of handle, this makes the handle reversible and more sturdy.
Rows 3-4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, FPdc around next sc 2 rows below, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, FPdc around FPdc 2 rows below, sc in last sc, turn.
Repeat Row 5 until piece measures 12” (30.5 cm) from beginning.
Joining Round: Ch 1, sc in first sc, FPdc around next FPdc 2 rounds below, sc in last sc, fold handling bringing foundation row up to meet current row; working across opposite side of foundation, sc in next st, FPdc around next post st, sc in next st; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sts. Do not place a stitch marker, the beginning of round will move. Simply work the stitches as instructed.
Next Round: Sc in next st, FPdc around next st, sc2tog over next 2 sc, FPdc around next st, sc2tog over next 2 sts,
Continue Leash: FPdc around each st working around and around until Leash measures about 50” (127 cm) from beginning.
Tab
Work now progresses in rows.
Row 1: Sc in next 4 sts, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, [sc2tog over next 2 sts] twice—2 sts.
Row 3-4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Thread tab through eye of swivel latch and sew last row to last round of leash.

FINISHING
Sew one button to end of neckband opposite buttonhole. Sew remaining buttons to chest piece opposite buttonholes on back piece. Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Grace™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 136 yds/125 m)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sctbl = Single crochet through back loop
gauge: 21 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 5 shells and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
BACK
**Ribbing: Ch 21.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 20 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.**
Rep last row until ribbing measures 19 ( 21-23-25-29-33)" [ 48 ( 53.5-58.5 -63.5 -73.5 -84) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 97 ( 109-117-129-149-173) sc evenly along side edge of Ribbing. Turn.
Proceed in pat as follows (see diagram on page 3):
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. 4 dc in same sc as last sc. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 24 ( 27-29-32-37-43) ‘Shells’ .
2nd row: Ch 5. 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Ch 2. 4 dc into side of sc just worked. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Turn.
Rep last row for pat until piece measures 11" [28 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Shape Square Armholes:   
1st row: Ch 5. 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top in top of ch 2. Ch 2. 4 dc into side of sc just worked. Rep from * to last 8 dc. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: As 1st row. 22 ( 25-27-30-35-41) ‘Shells’ .
3rd row: Ch 5. 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Ch 2. 4 dc into side of sc just worked. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Turn.
Rep last row until armhole measures 7½ ( 8¼-8¼-8¾-9-10½)" [ 19 ( 21-21-22-23-51.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
FRONTS  (make 2 alike noting Fronts are reversible)
Ribbing: Work from ** to ** as for Back ribbing.
Rep last row until ribbing measures 8 ( 9-10-11-13-15)" [ 20.5 ( 23-24.5-28-33-38) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 41 ( 45-49-53-69-77) sc evenly along side edge of Ribbing. Turn.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. 4 dc in same sc as last sc. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 10 ( 12-12-13-17-19) ‘Shells’ .
2nd row: Ch 5. 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Ch 2. 4 dc into side of sc just worked. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Turn.
Rep last row for pat until piece measures 11" [28 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Shape Square Armhole and V-neck: 1st row: Ch 5. 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Ch 2. 4 dc into side of sc just worked. Rep from * to last 8 dc. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
9 ( 10-11-12-16-18) ‘Shells’ .
**2nd row:  Ch 5. 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Ch 2. 4 dc into side of sc just worked. Rep from * to last 2 shells. (Skip next 4 dc. Draw up a loop in top of ch-2) twice. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook – Shell dec worked. Turn. 8 ( 9-10-11-15-17) ‘Shells’ .
3rd row: Ch 5. 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Ch 2. 4 dc into side of sc just worked. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Turn.
Rep last row 2 ( 2-0-0-0-0) time(s) more.** 
Work from ** to ** 2 ( 2-3-3-5-6) times more. 6 ( 7-7-8-10-11) Shells at end of last dec row.
Work even in pat until armhole measures same length as Back, ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
SLEEVES
Ribbing: Ch 11. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until ribbing measures 15 ( 16½ -16½ -17½ -18 -20 )" [ 38 ( 42-42-44.5 -45.5 -51) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 77 ( 85-85-93-97-105) sc evenly along side edge of Ribbing. Turn.

Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. 4 dc in same sc as last sc. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 19 ( 21-21-23-24-26) ‘Shells’ .
2nd row: Ch 5. 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Ch 2. 4 dc into side of sc just worked. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 2. Turn.
Rep last row for pat until Sleeve measures 4 ( 4-4-5-5-5)" [ 10 ( 10-10-12-12-12) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. Place markers on side edges of Sleeves 2" [5 cm] down from top edge.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Sew in sleeves placing edges above markers along unworked sts of Back and Front armholes to form square armholes.
Sew side and sleeve seams.
Scalloped Edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom Right Front. 
1st row: Ch 1. Work 56 sc evenly up Right Front edge to V-neck shaping, 42 ( 44-46-50-54-58) sc evenly along V-neck shaping to shoulder, 21 ( 36-42-47-51-61) sc evenly along neck edge, 42 ( 44-46-50-54-58) sc evenly down Left Front V-neck shaping and 56 sc down Left Front edge. Turn. 217 ( 235-247-259-271-289) sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in next sc. Ch 6. Sl st in same sc as last sl st (Button loop made). Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. 7 tr in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 3 times more. **Skip next 2 sc. 7 tr in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from ** to end of row. Fasten off.
Covered Buttons
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for attaching Button.
Insert purchased button. Thread tail through rem sts and pull to secure.
Sew Buttons to correspond to Button loops.

materials: Red Heart® Baby Hugs™ Light (4.5 oz/127 g; 318 yds/290 m)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or sizes needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Shell = 3 dc in indicated stitch or space
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 6 mos  17" [43 cm], 9 mos  17½" [44 cm], 12 mos  18" [45.5 cm], 18 mos  19" [48.5 cm], 24 mos  20"  [51 cm]. Finished chest: 6 mos  20" [51 cm], 9 mos  22" [56 cm], 12 mos  24" [61 cm], 18 mos  26" [66 cm], 24 mos  27" [68.5 cm].
gauge: 16 dc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. 
SHOP KIT
For accessibility support, please contact customer care at 1-888-368-8401 or access@yarnspirations.com. 
SWEATER
Beg at neck edge, with A, ch 44 (49-54-59-64).
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook and each of next 6 (7-8-9-10) ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 (5-6-7-8) ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 16 (17-18-19-20) ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 (5-6-7-8) ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in last 7 (8-9-10-11) ch. Turn. 46 (51-56-61-66) dc. 
2nd row: Ch 3. *1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 3 times. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 54 (59-64-69-74) dc. 
Rep last row 3 (3-4-5-5) times more. 78 (83-96-109-114) dc at end of last row. Join B at end of last row. 
Next row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn. 82 (87-100-113-118) sc. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 13 (14-16-18-18) sts. Ch 9 (12-13-14-16). Skip next 14 (15-18-21-24) sts (first armhole). 1 sc in each of next 28 (29-32-35-34) sts. Ch 9 (12-13-14-16). Skip next 14 (15-18-21-24) sts (2nd armhole). 1 sc in each of last 13 (14-16-18-18) sts. Join A. Turn. 
Note: In next, when instructed to work into a stitch, you may be working into a sc or ch. 
Body: 1st row: With A, ch 2. 1 dc in first st. Ch 1. Skip next st. Shell in next st. *Ch 1. Skip next 2 sts. Shell in next st. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 1. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 23 (26-29-32-33) shells. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc) in each ch-1 sp to end of row. 1 sc in in last dc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first sc. *(Ch 1. Shell) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 3 (4-4-5-6) times more, then 2nd row once. Fasten off. 
FINISHING 
Edging 
1st rnd: With RS facing and working in rem loops of foundation ch, join A with sl st in center ch of 1st row. 1 sc in each ch to front edge. Working in ends of rows down front edge, work 2 sc around post of each dc and 1 sc around each sc. Work across bottom edge of Sweater: 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. (Sl st. Ch 3. 1 dc. Ch 3. Sl st) in each ch-3 space to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Working in ends of rows down front edge, work 2 sc around post of each dc and 1 sc around each sc. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to end of rnd. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off. 
Rosette 
With C, ch 21. 
1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 2 sc in each of next 4 ch. 2 hdc in each of next 10 ch. 2 dc in each of last 5 ch. Ch 2. Join with sl st in first ch. Fasten off, leaving 12" [30.5 cm] end of yarn for sewing. Beg with sc end, coil strip to form rosette. With end of yarn, secure through all layers. Sew rosette to sweater where desired. 
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: Striped to a Tee Crochet Pullover
materials: Caron® Simply Soft® O’Go™ (5 oz/141 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Contrast A and B: Strawberry/Soft Blue (40026) 4 4 5 6 7 9 O’Gos
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in indicated space. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Note: • To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet. • Pull tie to remove. • Follow color guide shown in Materials section for each O’Go (Contrast A and B).
FRONT and BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ribbing: With A, ch 19.
1st row: (RS). 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 18 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, sl st in each sl st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 17 (19-21-23-26-30)" [43 (48-53.5-58.5-66-76) cm]. Fasten off A.
Next row: (WS). Join B. Ch 1. Work 73 (81-89-97-109-125) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn. (See Diagram I on page 3)
1st row: (RS). Ch 4 (counts as tr). 1 tr in each sc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. 1 hdcfp around post of next tr and each tr to last tr. 1 sc in top of ch 4. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4. 1 tr in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Break B. Join A. Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. *Skip next tr. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next tr. Skip next tr. 1 sc in next tr. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 4. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *(1 dc. Ch 2. Cluster. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to end of row. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to end of row, working 1 hdc in last ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in top of ch 3. Turn. Break A. Join B.
7th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc and ch-1 sp to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 2. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 2 sc in first sc (inc made). 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc (inc made). Turn.
9th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in first sc (inc made). Working into back loops only, 1 tr in each sc to last sc. 2 tr in last sc (inc made). Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first tr (inc made). 1 hdcfp around post of next tr and each tr to last tr. 2 sc in top of ch 4 (inc made). Turn.
11th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in first sc (inc made). 1 tr in each st to last sc. 2 tr in last sc (inc made). Turn. 81 (89-97-105-117-133) tr.
12th to 18th rows: As 4th to 10th rows. 87 (95-103-111-123-139) sts. PM at beg of last row.
Pull long loop to secure sts from unravelling. Remove hook.
Shape sleeves: Join B with sl st at top of marked st. Ch 13 (13-9-9-5-5) for sleeve. Fasten off.
19th row: (RS). With working yarn, ch 16 (16-12-12-8-8). 1 tr in 5th ch from hook (counts as 2 tr). 1 tr in each of next 11 (11-7-7-3-3) ch. 1 tr in each st to end of row. 1 tr in each of 13 (13-9-9-5-5) ch. Turn. 113 (121-121-129-133-149) sts. PM at each end of last row. (See Diagram II on page 3).
20th to 23rd rows: As 4th to 7th rows.
24th row: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
25th row: Ch 4. Working into back loops only, 1 tr in each sc to end of row. Turn.
26th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. 1 hdcfp around post of next tr and each tr to last tr. 1 sc in top of ch 4. Turn.
27th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 20th to 27th rows for pat until work from marked row measures approx 8 (8-8-9-9-9)" [20.5 (20.5-20.5-23-23-23) cm], ending on a 25th or 27th row of pat. Fasten off.
Neck edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st at shoulder seam. Work sl st evenly (not too tightly) around neck edge. Join with sl st to first sl st.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, sl st in each sl st around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.
Sleeve Ribbing: With A, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, sl st in each sl st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 16 (16-16-18-18-20)" [40.5 (40.5-40.5-45.5-45.5-51) cm]. Do not fasten off.
Join ends: Place RS tog and working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sl st through back loops of final row and rem loops of foundation ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
PM for shoulders, leaving neck opening 10 (10-10-10½-10½-10½)" [25.5 (25.5-25.5-26.5-26.5-26.5) cm] wide.
Sew shoulder seams. Sew side and sleeve seams. Sew Ribbing to side of sleeve edge, matching seam to underarm seam.

materials: Bernat® Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.

BACK
Ribbing: With smaller hook, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 9 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece measures approx 20 (22-24-27-29-32)" [51 (56-61-68.5-73.5-81.5) cm] (when slightly stretched), ending on a RS row. Do not turn at end of last row.
Change to larger hook.
Rotate piece to beg working along long side edge of Ribbing.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 40 (44-48-54-58-64) sc evenly along edge. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row for Pebble St Pat until work from beg measures 25" [63.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Fasten off.

Shape armholes: Next row:  (RS). Skip first 5 (6-7-9-11-13) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 1. Beg in same st as last sl st, pat across next 30 (32-34-36-36-38) sts. Turn. Leave rem 5 (6-7-9-11-13) sts unworked.
Cont even in pat over 30 (32-34-36-36-38) sts until armhole measures 8½ (9-9-10-10-10½)" [21.5 (23-23-25.5-25.5-26.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

Shape shoulders: Next row: (RS). Skip first 4 (4-4-5-5-5) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 1. Beg in same st as last sl st, pat across next 22 (24-26-26-26-28) sts. Fasten off. Turn. Leave rem 4 (4-4-5-5-5) sts unworked.
Next row:  Skip first 4 (5-5-5-5-5) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 1. Beg in same st as last sl st, pat across next 14 (14-16-16-16-18) sts. Fasten off. Leave rem 4 (5-5-5-5-5) sts unworked.

LEFT FRONT
**Ribbing:  With smaller hook, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 9 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in horizontal bar created below stitch in previous row. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece measures approx 10 (11-12-13-14-16)" [25.5 (28-30.5-33-35.5-40.5) cm] (when slightly stretched), ending on a RS row. Do not turn at end of last row.
Change to larger hook.
Rotate piece to beg working along long side edge.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 20 (22-24-28-30-34) sc evenly along edge of Ribbing. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row for Pebble St Pat until work from beg measures 25" [63.5 cm], ending on a WS row.**
Fasten off.

Shape armhole: Next row:  (RS). Skip first 5 (6-7-9-11-13) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Beg in same st as last sl st, pat to end of row. Turn.
Cont even in pat over 15 (16-17-19-19-21) sts until armhole measures 6 (6-6-8-8-10) rows less than Back to shoulder, ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to first st. Ch 1. Pat across 13 (14-14-16-16-17) sts (neck edge). Turn. Leave rem 2 (2-3-3-3-4) sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 (1-1-2-2-3) time(s) more, then 2nd row 1 (1-1-0-0-1) time(s) more. 8 (9-9-10-10-10) sts rem.

Sizes XL and 2/3XL only: Next row: Ch 1. Pat to end of row. Turn.
All sizes: Fasten off.

RIGHT FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Front. Do not fasten off.
Shape armhole: Next row:  (RS). Ch 1. Pat to last 5 (6-7-9-11-13) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont even in pat over 15 (16-17-19-19-21) sts until armhole measures 6 (6-6-8-8-10) rows less than Back to shoulder, ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

Shape neck: 1st row:  (RS). Skip first 2 (2-3-3-3-4) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Beg in same st as last sl st, pat to end of row. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 (1-1-2-2-3) time(s) more, then 2nd row 1 (1-1-0-0-1) time(s). 8 (9-9-10-10-10) sts rem.

Sizes XL and 2/3XL only: Next row: Ch 1. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Shape shoulder: Next row:  (RS). Ch 1. Pat across 4 (5-5-5-5-5) sts. Fasten off. Leave rem sts unworked.

SLEEVES
Ribbing: With smaller hook,  ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 9 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece measures approx 10 (10-11-11-12-12)" [25.5 (25.5-28-28-30.5-30.5) cm] (when slightly stretched), ending on a RS row. Do not turn at end of last row.
Change to larger hook. Rotate piece to beg working along long side edge of Ribbing.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 20 (20-22-22-24-24) sc evenly along edge of Ribbing. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
4th row (inc row): Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last st. (1 dc. 1 sc) in last st. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
6th row (inc row): Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 dc) in first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. (1 sc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows 1 (1-1-2-2-2) time(s) more. 28 (28-30-36-36-36) sts.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
Next row (inc row):  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last st. (1 dc. 1 sc) in last st. Turn. 30 (30-32-38-38-38) sts.
Next 2 rows: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Next row (inc row):  Ch 1. (1 sc.  1 dc) in first sc. *1 sc in next dc.  1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. (1 sc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 32 (32-34-40-40-40) sts.
Sizes XS/S, M, L and 4/5XL only: Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
Next row (inc row):  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last st. (1 dc. 1 sc) in last st. Turn. (34-34-36-42) sts.
Size M only: Next 2 rows:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Next row (inc row):  Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 dc) in first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. (1 sc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 36 sts.
All sizes:  Cont even in pat until work from beg measures 17 (17-17-16½-16-16)" [43 (43-43-42-40.5-40.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Place markers at each end of last row.
Work a further 5 (6-7-9-10-10) rows in pat. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams.
Neckband: With smaller hook, ch 9.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 7 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Neckband, when slightly stretched, measures length to fit along neck edge, sewing in place as you work, taking care to allow stretch in seam.
Front Band: 1st row:  (RS). With smaller hook, join yarn with sl st to bottom Right Front and work 66 (68-68-70-70-70) sc evenly up Right Front edge to top of neckband. Turn.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of last row.
Rep for Left Front, beg at top of neckband.
Sew in sleeves, placing rows above markers along unworked sts of Front and Back to form square armholes. Sew side and sleeve seams.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Harvest Red (39763) - 1 ball for 6 mos, 2 balls for 12 mos, 2 balls for 18 mos, 3 balls for 24 mos
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times all in same stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 6 mos 17" [43 cm], 12 mos 18" [45.5 cm], 18 mos 19" [48.5 cm], 24 mos 20" [51 cm]
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes: Body is worked in one piece to armholes. Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
Ribbing: With smaller hook, ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS-see diagram) in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 21 (22-23-24)" [53.5 (56-58.5-61) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not turn.
Change to larger hook and proceed as follows:
Body: 1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Working across straight side edge of ribbing, work 67 (71-75-79) sc evenly across edge. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. Bobble in next sc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 hdc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row.
Rep last 2 rows until Body from lower edge measures 6½ (7-7½-8)" [16.5 (18-19-20.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Divide for armhole of Back and Fronts:
Right Front: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 15 (16-17-18) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 17 (18-19-20) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from armhole divide measures 3 (3½-4-4)" [7.5 (9-10-10) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 4 (5-5-6) hdc. Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 12 (12-13-13) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 11 (11-12-12) sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off. 10 (10-11-11) sts.
Back: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to next unworked hdc.
1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc same hdc as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 32 (34-36-38) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc across. Turn.
Rep last row until Back measures same length as Right Front. Fasten off.
Left Front: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to next unworked hdc.
1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same hdc as last sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 17 (18-19-20) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from armhole divide measures 3 (3½-4-4)" [7.5 (9-10-10) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 11 (11-12-12) hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 12 (12-13-13) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 11 (11-12-12) sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Fasten off. 10 (10-11-11) sts.
SLEEVES
Ribbing: With smaller hook, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS), in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing measures 5½ (5½-6½-6½)" [14 (14-16.5-16.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not turn.
Wrong side of work shown
Change to larger hook and proceed as follows:
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Working across straight side edge of ribbing, work 19 (19-23-23) sc evenly across edge. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first sc. Bobble in next sc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 hdc in last sc. Turn. 21 (21-25-25) sts.
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 5th rows 1 (3-2-2) time(s) more. 25 (29-31-31) hdc.
Cont even until Sleeve from lower edge measures 6½ (7-7-7½)" [16.5 (18-18-19) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Sew in sleeves. Sew sleeve seams.
Buttonhole Band: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to bottom right corner. Ch 1. Work 34 (36-40-42) sc evenly up Right Front.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 (3-3-2) sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 (5-6-7) sc. Rep from * 3 times more. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 (3-3-2) sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 2 sc in each ch-2 sp to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Button Band: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Work 34 (36-40-42) sc evenly up Left Front.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of 4th row.
Sew on buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

materials: Patons® Linen™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 275 yds/251 m)
Sizes XS/S M L/XL 2/3XL 4/5XL Catheline (14002) 5 6 6 7 7 balls
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdchb = Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS)
gauge: 17 dc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: The instructions are written for XS/S. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written XS/S (M-L/XL-2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. BACK Bottom Ribbing Ch 18. 1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 hdc. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures approx 20 (22-26-30-32)" [51 (56-66-76-81.5) cm] when slightly stretched. Work Back in Honeycomb Pat as follows: (see Diagram on page 6) 1st row: (WS). Ch 2. Work 85 (95-111-129-139) dc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 5 (10-7-5-10) dc. [(Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 5 times. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc] 3 (3-4-5-5) times. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 5 times. 1 dc in each of last 4 (9-6-4-9) dc. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 4 (9-6-4-9) dc. [Ch 1. Skip next st. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc] 3 (3-4-5-5) times. Ch 1. Skip next dc. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of last 4 (9-6-4-9) dc. Turn. 4th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 3 (8-5-3-8) dc. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc) 3 (3-4-5-5) times. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 (8-5-3-8) dc. Turn. 5th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 2 (7-4-2-7) dc. [Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times] 3 (3-4-5-5) times. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in last 2 (7-4-2-7) dc. Turn. 6th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 2 (7-4-2-7) dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. [Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp] 3 (3-4-5-5) times. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 2 (7-4-2-7) dc. Turn. 7th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 3 (8-5-3-8) dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 (3-4-5-5) times. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 3 (8-5-3-8) dc. Turn. 8th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 4 (9-6-4-9) dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. [(Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp] 3 (3-4-5-5) times. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 4 (9-6-4-9) dc. Turn. Rep 3rd to 8th rows for Honeycomb Pat until work from Ribbing measures approx 24½ (24½-24½-29-29)" [62 (62-62-73.5-73.5) cm], ending on an 8th row of pat. Fasten off. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 5 times. 1 dc in each of last 4 (6-10-4-7) dc. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 4 (6-10-4-7) dc. [Ch 1. Skip next st. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc] 1 (1-1-2-2) time(s). Ch 1. Skip next dc. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of last 4 (6-10-4-7) dc. Turn. 4th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 3 (5-9-3-6) dc. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc) 1 (1-1-2-2) time(s). Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times] 1 (1-1-2-2) time(s). Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp] 1 (1-1-2-2) time(s). Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) 1 (1-1-2-2) time(s). Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 3 (5-9-3-6) dc. Turn. 8th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 6 (6-10-4-7) dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. [(Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp] 1 (1-1-2-2) time(s). (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 6 (6-10-4-7) dc. Turn. Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. Dc2tog. Work in pat to end of row. Turn. 2nd row: Work in pat to last 3 sts. Dc2tog. 1 dc in last st. Turn. Rep last 2 rows 5 times more. 29 (33-41-51-57) sts. Work even in pat until work from Ribbing measures 24½ (24½-24½-29-29)" [62 (62-62-73.5-73.5) cm], ending on an 8th row of pat. Fasten off. RIGHT FRONT Work from ** to ** as given for Left Front. Keeping cont of Front Honeycomb Pat, proceed as follows: 1st row: (WS). Ch 2. Work in pat to last 3 sts. Dc2tog. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. Dc2tog. SLEEVES Honeycomb Sleeve Pat (see Diagram on page 6) 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 5 times. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 5 times. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. 2nd row: 1 dc in each of first 3 sts. Ch 1. Skip next st. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. 3rd row: 1 dc in each of first 2 dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1.
