Turn. 32 ( 34-35-38-49-58) sts. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 3rd row:  Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 30 ( 32-33-36-47-56) sts. Rep last 2 rows 5 ( 6-6-7-10-14) times more. 20 ( 20-21-22-27-28) sts. Sizes  XS/S,  L and 2/3XL only: Next row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. Rep last 2 rows 1 ( 0-4) time(s) more. 18 ( 20-22) sts. All sizes: 18 ( 20-20-22-22-28) sts. Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until armhole measures same length as Back, ending on a WS row. Fasten off. RIGHT FRONT Work from *** to *** as given for Left Front. Shape armhole and V-neck:   1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last last 7 ( 10-12-14-18-18) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 32 ( 34-35-38-49-58) sts. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 3rd row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 30 ( 32-33-36-47-56) sts. Rep last 2 rows 5 ( 6-6-7-10-14) times more. 20 ( 20-21-22-27-28) sts. Sizes  XS/S,  L and 2/3XL only: Next row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last 2 rows 1 ( 0-4) time(s) more. 18 ( 20-22) sts. All sizes: Next row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until armhole measures same length as Back, ending on a WS row. Fasten off. SLEEVES Ch 11. 1st row:  (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. ** Rep last row until ribbing measures 15 ( 16½ -16½ -17½ -18 -20¼ )" [ 21.5 ( 21.5 -26.5-26.5-30.5-30.5) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a WS row. ( Do not fasten off ) Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 77 ( 85-85-93-97-105) sc evenly along side edge of Ribbing. Turn. Proceed in pat as follows: 1st row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until Sleeve from beg measures 4 ( 4-4-5-5-5)" [ 10 ( 10-10-12-12-12) cm], ending on a WS row. Shape Top: 1st row:  Sl st in each of next 8 ( 11-11-15-19-19) hdc. Ch 2  ( does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 7 ( 10-10-14-18-18) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 63 ( 65-65-65-61-69) hdc. Next row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 61 ( 63-63-63-59-67) sts. Sizes XS/S, M and L only: Rep last row 25 ( 26-26) times more, dec 2 sts every row. 11 sts rem. Fasten off. Sizes XL, 2/3XL and 4/5XL only: Next row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. ( 61-57-65) sts. Rep last 2 rows ( 3-9-7) times more, dec 2 sts every other row. ( 55-39-51) sts. Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. ( 53-37-49) sts. Rep last row ( 19-11-17) times more. 15 sts rem. Fasten off. FINISHING Sew shoulder seams. Sew in sleeves. Sew side and sleeve seams. BUTTONBAND With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom Right Front. 1st row: Ch 1. Work 62 ( 62-68-68-78-78) sc evenly up Right Front edge to V-neck shaping, 42 ( 44-46-50-54-58) sc evenly along V-neck shaping to shoulder, 21 ( 36-42-47-51-61) sc evenly along neck edge, 42 ( 44-46-50-54-58) sc evenly down Left V-neck shaping and 62 ( 62-68-68-78-78) sc evenly down Left Front edge. Turn. 187 ( 248-270-283-315-333) sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *Ch 4. Skip next 4 sc (buttonhole made). 1 sc in each of next 9 ( 9-11-11-13-13) sc. Rep from * 4 times more. (5 buttonholes made). 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 4 sc in each ch-4 sp to end of row. Turn. 5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. Sew on buttons to correspond to buttonholes. EMBROIDERY Using template on page 5 and color guide on page 6, embroider Floral design on either side of Cardigan. Stems: Using 0877, embroider Stems using Stem Stitch. Leaves:  Using 0875, embroider Leaves using Lazy Daisy Stitch. Flower Petals: Using 1023, 1092 and 0279, embroider Petals using Lazy Daisy Stitch. Flower Centers: Using 0884, 0893 and 0279 embroider Flower Centers using French Knots. Optional Fabric Stabilizer: • Using template, transfer design using a washable fabric pen or printer onto Fabric Stabilizer. • Peel and stick stabilizer to front of Cardigan – Have fun! You may wish to play around with the placement! • Once in position, work on top of stabilizer, and through fabric of Cardigan as indicated in embroidery instructions. • When you have completed embroidery, peel up edges and cut away any excess stabilizer to ease in rinsing it away. • Place Cardigan in warm water, with warm running water over it. • Once stabilizer has dissolved, squeeze out excess water and lay flat on a towel to dry.

materials: RED HEART® Fashion Soft™: 6 (7, 8) balls 4702 Bright Pink
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Sweater measures 45 (53, 61)" (114.5 (134.5, 155) cm) around bust and 30 (31½, 33)" (76 (80, 84) cm) in length.
gauge: 18 hdc = 4" (10 cm) in plain hdc rows; 20 sts = 4" (10 cm) in Wave st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SPECIAL STITCHES
Shallow fpsc = Shallow front post single crochet. Insert hook from the front of the work to back in top of indicated st, bring it to front again through top of next st, yarn over and pull up a loop (2 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook.
Dtr = Double treble crochet. Yarn over 3 times, insert hook in indicated st and pull up a loop (5 loops on hook), [yarn over and draw through 2 loops] 4 times – 1 loop remains on hook.
WAVE STITCH
Foundation is a multiple of 19 sts + 1.
Row 1 (right side): Skip 2 sts (counts as 1 hdc), hdc in each st to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, shallow fpsc around each st to last st, sc in last st, turn.
Row 3: Ch 5 (counts as 1 tr), 4 tr in first st, tr in next st, [skip next st, tr in next st] 8 times, * 5 tr in each of next 2 sts, tr in next st, [skip next st, tr in next st] 8 times; repeat from * to last st, 5 tr in last st, turn.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2.
Row 5: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc), 4 dc in first st, dc in next st, [skip next st, dc in next st] 8 times, * 5 dc in each of next 2 sts, dc in next st, [skip next st, dc in next st] 8 times; repeat from * to last st, 5 dc in last st, turn.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2.
Row 7: Ch 6 (counts as 1 dtr), dtr in each st to end, turn.
Row 8: Repeat Row 2.
Repeat Rows 3-8 for Wave st.
BACK
Ch 103 (121, 139).
Row 1 (right side): Skip 2 ch (does not count as a st), hdc in each ch to end, turn – 101 (119, 137) hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in each hdc to end, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 21 (21½, 22)" (53.5 (54.5, 56 cm), ending after a wrong side row.
Fasten off.
Add Width for Sleeves
Place 11 (14, 17) markers evenly spaced across top row.
Next 2 rows:
Row 1 (right side): With new yarn, ch 39 (38, 37), * hdc in each hdc to next marked st, 2 hdc in marked st, remove marker; repeat from * until all markers have been removed, hdc in each remaining hdc to end, ch 40 (39, 38), turn – 191 (210, 229) sts including ch sts.
Row 2: Skip 1 ch (does not count as a st), sc in each st to end – 190 (209, 228) sc.
Work in Wave st beginning with a pattern Row 3 until piece measures 10 (11, 12)" (25.5 (28, 30.5) cm) from sleeve foundations.
Fasten off.
FRONT
Make same as back.
FINISHING
Sew side seams, leaving bottom 3" unsewn.
Sew bottoms of sleeves together.
Sew together 15 (16¾, 18¼)" (38 (42.5, 46.5) cm) at each side of top seam, leaving center 8 (8½, 9)" (20.5 (21.5, 23) cm) open for neck.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Caron® Chunky Cakes™ (9.8 oz/280 g; 297 yds/271 m) Mystic Chip (17008) 2 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit bust measurement 32-44" [81.5-112 cm].
gauge: 7.5 sts and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
Ch 66.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 64 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row for pat until work measures 36" [91.5 cm] (when slightly stretched), ending on a RS row. Fasten off.
Sleeves: Fold corners of foundation row and final row tog. Sew 7" [18 cm] seams to create armholes.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st at lower edge of center back. Work 1 rnd of sl st loosely around entire neck edge (allowing some stretch in neck edge). Join with sl st to first sl st.
2nd rnd: Working in back loops only, sl st loosely in each sl st around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby™ (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds /331 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 11 sts and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat with 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

BACK
With 2 strands of yarn held tog, ch 36 (38-40-44).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 35 (37-39-43) sts.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures 9 (10-11-12)" [23 (25.5-28-30.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape armholes: Next row: (RS). Sl st across first 3 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat to last 2 sts. Turn. Leave rem 2 sts unworked.
Cont even in pat over rem 31 (33-35-39) sts until armhole measures 5 (5½-6-6½)" [12.5 (13-15-16.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

RIGHT FRONT
With 2 strands of yarn held tog, ch 26 (28-30-34).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 25 (27-29-33) sts.
Cont in pat as given for Back until work from beg measures 9 (10-11-12)" [23 (25.5-28-30.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape armhole: Next row: (RS). Pat to last 2 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont even in pat over rem 23 (25-27-31) sts until armhole measures 6 rows less than Back, ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Skip first 9 (11-12-15) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 2 (does not count as st). Hdc2tog over same st as last sl st and next st. Pat to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Pat to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). Hdc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more, then 2nd row once. 8 (8-9-10) sts. Fasten off.
Place markers for 6 buttons on Right Front in 3 rows (double breasted), spaced as follows:
Top row of 2 buttons positioned 2 rows down from neck edge – first button 1" [2.5 cm] from front edge; second button 4½" [11 cm] from front edge (3½" [9 cm] apart from each other).
Bottom row of 2 buttons positioned 18 (18-20-22) rows down from neck edge – first button 1" [2.5 cm] from front edge; second button 4½" [11 cm] from front edge (3½" [9 cm] apart from each other).
Center row of 2 buttons positioned evenly between top and bottom rows – first button 1"  [2.5 cm] from front edge; second button 4½" [11 cm] from front edge (3½" [9 cm] apart from each other).

LEFT FRONT
Note: Work buttonhole row to correspond to markers on Right Front as follows:
Buttonhole row: (RS). (Pat to button marker. Ch 1. Skip next st) twice. Pat to end of row.
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Front.
Shape armhole: Next row: (RS). Sl st across first 2 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Cont even in pat over rem 23 (25-27-31) sts until armhole measures 6 rows less than Back (working buttonhole row to correspond to markers on Right Front), ending on a WS row.
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Pat across 12 (12-13-14) sts. Hdc2tog (neck edge). Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). Hdc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Pat to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: As 3rd row
6th row: As 2nd row. 8 (8-9-10) sts.
Fasten off.

SLEEVES
With 2 strands of yarn held tog, ch 22 (24-26-28).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 21 (23-25-27) sts.
Cont in pat as given for Back for 3 (5-7-9) more rows.
Shape sides: 1st row: (Inc row). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in next sc. (1 sc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 3 rows 3 times more. 29 (31-33-35) sts.
Cont even in pat until work from beg measures 10 (11½-13-14½)" [25.5 (29-33-37) cm], ending on a WS row. Place markers at each end of last row.
Work 2 rows even in pat. Fasten off.

POCKETS
With 2 strands of yarn held tog, ch 12 (12-14-14).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 11 (11-13-13) sts.
Cont in pat as given for Back for 3 (3-3½-3½)" [7.5 (7.5-9-9) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape bottom: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2 (does not count as st). Hdc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. Rep last row once more. 7 (7-9-9) sts. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Pockets in position (see photo). Sew shoulder seams. Sew in sleeves, placing rows above markers along unworked sts of Body to form square armholes. Sew side and sleeve seams, reversing seam for 2" [5 cm] sleeve cuff turnback.

HOOD
Place markers on neck edge 3½" [9 cm] in from front edge. With RS facing, join 2 strands of yarn held tog with sl st at Right Front neck marker. Ch 1. Work 47 (47-51-51) sc evenly around neck edge to opposite marker. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * end of row. Turn. Place marker on center back st.
Next row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) 11 (11-12-12) times. (1 sc. 1 dc. 1 sc) all in next dc (center back st). (1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc) 11 (11-12-12) times. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. Work 3 rows even in pat.
Next row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) 11 (11-12-12) times. 1 sc in next dc. (1 dc. 1 sc. 1 dc) all in next sc (center back st). (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) 12 (12-13-13) times. Turn. Work 3 rows even in pat.
Next row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) 12 (12-13-13) times. (1 sc. 1 dc. 1 sc) all in next dc (center back st). (1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc) 12 (12-13-13) times. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 53 (53-57-57) sts.
Cont even in pat until Hood measures 9½ (10-10-10½)" [24.5 (25.5-25.5-26.5) cm] from neck edge, ending on a WS row. Fasten off. Fold Hood in half and sew top Hood seam.

Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 100 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to end of Hood.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170.1g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: 14 hdc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 1 square of pat should measure approx 1½" [3 cm] square.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

NOTES:
• When changing colors, work hdc to last 3 loops on hook and draw new color through last 3 loops and proceed in new color, keeping color change to WS of work.
• Carry color not in use along top of last row and work new sts around carried color.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.

BACK
With A, ch 67 ( 77-87-97-107-117).
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 65 ( 75-85-95-105-115) hdc.

2nd to 4th rows: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

5th to 8th rows: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

9th to 12th rows:  With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

Rep 5th to 12th rows for Check Pat 3 times more. Fasten off.

Shape Armholes: 1st row:  (WS). Skip first 5 sts. Join A with sl st to next st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same st as join. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 55 ( 65-75-85-95-105) hdc.

2nd to 4th rows: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

Cont in Check Pat until Armholes measure 9 ( 9-9-11-11-11)" [ 23 ( 23-23-28-28-28) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

RIGHT FRONT
Sizes  XS/S,  L and 2/3XL only: 
With A, ch 32 ( 42-52).
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 30 ( 40-50) hdc.

2nd row: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

3rd row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

4th row: As 2nd row.

5th to 7th rows:  As 2nd to 4th rows.

8th row: As 3rd row.

9th to 12th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows twice.

Rep 5th to 12th rows for Check Pat 3 times more.

Shape Armholes: 1st row:  (RS). With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 25 ( 35-45) hdc.

**Sizes M,  XL and 4/5XL only: 
With B, ch ( 37-47-57).
1st row: (RS). With B, 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. ( 35-45-55) hdc.

2nd to 4th rows: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

5th to 8th rows: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

9th to 12th rows: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

Rep 5th to 12th rows for Check Pat 3 times more.

Shape Armhole: 1st row:  (RS). With A, Ch 2.  1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc, ending with 5 hdc in B. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. ( 30-40-50) hdc.

All Sizes: 
Cont in Check Pat until Armhole measures 14 rows less than Back, ending on a WS row.

Shape Neck: 1st row: (RS). Keeping cont of pat, ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. Pat to end of row. Turn. 24 ( 29-34-39-44-49) sts.

2nd row: Pat across row. Turn.

Rep last 2 rows 6 times more. 
18 ( 23-28-33-38-43) sts. Fasten off.

LEFT FRONT
Sizes  XS/S,  L and 2/3XL only:  
With B, ch 32 ( 42-52).
1st row: (RS). With B, 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 30 ( 40-50) hdc.

2nd row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

3rd row: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

4th row: As 2nd row.

5th to 7th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.

8th row: As 3rd row.

9th to 12th rows:  As 3rd and 4th rows twice.

Rep 5th to 12th rows for Check Pat 3 times more.

Fasten off.

Shape Armholes: 1st row:  (RS). Skip first 5 hdc. Join B with sl st to next hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same st as join. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
25 ( 35-45) hdc.

Sizes M, XL and 4/5XL only: Work from ** to ** as given for Right Front.

Fasten off.

Shape Armhole: 1st row: (RS). Skip first 5 hdc. Join B with sl st to next hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same st as join. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. ( 30-40-45) hdc. 

Cont in Check Pat until Armhole measures 14 rows less than Back, ending on a WS row. 

All Sizes: 
Shape Neck: 1st row:  (RS). Pat to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 24 ( 29-34-39-44-49) sts.

2nd row: Pat across row. Turn.

Rep last 2 rows 6 times more. 
18 ( 23-28-33-38-43) sts. Fasten off. 

SLEEVES
With A, ch 67 ( 67-67-77-77-77).
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 65 ( 65-65-75-75-75) hdc.

2nd to 4th rows: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

5th to 8th rows: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

9th to 12th rows:  With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

Cont even in Check Pat until Sleeve measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

Place marker at center of last row.

FINISHING
With WS tog, sew shoulder seams. 
Sew Sleeves to Body, matching center st marker to shoulder seams.
Sew Sleeve and side seams.

Sleeve Cuffs
Edging: 1st rnd: Join C with sl st at Sleeve seam. Ch 1. Work 64 ( 64-64-76-76-76) sc evenly around bottom of Sleeve. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2  ( does not count as st). *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 32 ( 32-32-38-38-38) sts. 

Ribbing: 1st rnd:  Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 
Rep last rnd until Cuff measures 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off.

Bottom Edging and Ribbing:
Edging: 1st row:  With RS facing, join C with sl st to bottom Left Front corner. Ch 1. Work 30 ( 35-40-45-50-55) sc along Front Left bottom edge (1 sc in each rem loop of foundation ch). Work 66 ( 76-86-96-106-116) sc along bottom Back edge. Work 30 ( 35-40-45-50-55) sc along Right Front bottom edge. 126 ( 146-166-186-206-226) sc. Turn.
Ribbing: 1st row: Ch 2  (counts as a st). *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st.  Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
Rep last row 5 times more. 
Fasten off.

Front Edging and Collar
Edging: 1st row: (RS). Join C with sl st to bottom right corner of Ribbing. Ch 1. Work 92 ( 92-92-98-98-98) sc evenly up right side edge. Work 16 sc across Back neck edge. Work 92 ( 92-92-98-98-98) sc evenly down Left Front. 200 ( 200-200-212-212-212) sc. Turn.

2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 2  (counts as st). *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.

4th row: Buttonhole row:  (WS). Ch 2. Pat across next 3 sts. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. Pat across next 12 sts.  Rep from * 3 times more. Pat to last st. 1 hdc in top of ch-2. Turn. (4 buttonholes made).

5th row: Ch 2. Pat across, working 2 hdc in each ch-2 buttonhole sp to last st. 1 hdc in top of ch-2. Turn.

6th row: Ch 2. Pat across, working dcfb or dcbp as appropriate to keep cont of pat around hdc sts of previous row. 1 hdc in top of last ch-2. Turn.

7th and 8th rows: Ch 2  (counts as st). *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.

Fasten off.

Sew on buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

materials: Bernat® Softee Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 30" [76 cm] around x 15" [38 cm] tall.
gauge: 7 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Carry colors when not in use loosely up side of work. To change colors at end of rows, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st in row. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed with new color.
With A, ch 53.
1st row: (RS) 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 52 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join A. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join B. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 15" [38 cm], ending on a 6th row. Fasten off.
Sew sides of Cowl tog.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® O’Go™ (5 oz/141 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Contrast A and B: Harvest Red/Soft Pink (40019) 6 6 7 7 8 8 O’Gos
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Long sc = Draw up a loop in indicated st and pull to height of working row. Yoh and draw through all 2 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
gauge: 13 sts and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger crochet hook in pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section for each O’Go (Contrast A and B).
• Cardigan is worked in one piece to armholes, then divided for Back and Fronts.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

BODY
Ribbing: With smaller hook and B, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work when slightly stretched measures 38 (42-46-50-58-62)" [96.5 (106.5-117-127-147.5-157.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Turn work sidewise. With larger hook and B, working across longer side, proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 123 (137-153-163-189-201) sc evenly across. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Join A. Do not break B. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join B. Turn.
5th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat, working 2 rows with B and 2 rows with A until work from beg (lower edge of Ribbing) measures 11" [28 cm], ending on a WS row.
Keeping cont of Pat, proceed as follows:

DIVIDE FOR FRONTS AND BACK
Right Front and Armhole Shaping: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Pat across first 27 (31-35-37-43-45) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont even in pat on 27 (31-35-37-43-45) sts until armhole measures 6 (6-7-7-8-9½)" [15 (15-18-18-20.5-21.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Shape neck: With RS facing, skip first 9 (12-14-14-17-17) sts. Join appropriate color with sl st to next st and proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Pat to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: As 1st row.
4th row: Work even in pat.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 13 (14-16-18-21-23) sts.
Cont even in pat until armhole measures 9 (9-10-10-11-11½)" [23 (23-25.5-25.5-28-29) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
BACK: (RS). Skip next 7 (7-7-7-9-11) sts. Join appropriate color with sl st to next st. Ch 1. Beg in same st as last sl st, pat across next 55 (61-69-75-85-89) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Work even in pat across 55 (61-69-75-85-89) sts until Back measures same length as Right Front to shoulder, ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

LEFT FRONT: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 7 (7-7-7-9-11) sts. Join appropriate color with sl st to next st. Ch 1. Beg in same st as last sl st, pat to end of row.
Cont even in pat on 27 (31-35-37-43-45) sts until armhole measures 6 (6-7-7-8-9½)" [15 (15-18-18-20.5-21.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape neck: With RS facing, join appropriate color with sl st to next st and proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Pat to last 15 (16-18-20-23-25) sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 17 (18-20-22-25-27) sts rem.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Pat to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
4th row: Work even in pat.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 13 (14-16-18-21-23) sts.
Cont even in pat until armhole measures 9 (9-10-10-11-11½)" [23 (23-25.5-25.5-28-29) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

SLEEVES
Ribbing: With smaller hook and B, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work when slightly stretched measures 10 (10-10-10-12-12)" [25.5 (25.5-25.5-25.5-30.5-30.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Turn work sidewise. With larger hook and B, working across longer side, proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 33 (33-33-33-39-39) sc evenly across. Turn. 33 (33-33-33-39-43) sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Join A. Do not break B. Turn.
Sizes XS/S, M, L and XL only:
3rd row: (Inc row). With A, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: With A, as 2nd row. Join B. Turn.
5th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. *Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last sc. Join A. Turn.
7th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
8th row: With A, as 2nd row.
Rep 3rd to 8th rows to form Pat and side incs.
Keeping cont of pat, work 2 sc each end of row on next and every following 6th row until there are 49 (49-43-43) sts, taking inc sts in pat.
Sizes L, XL, 2/3XL and 4/5XL only:
3rd row: (Inc row). With A, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: With A, as 2nd row. Join B. Turn.
5th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. *Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last sc. Join A. Turn.
7th row: (Inc row). With A, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
8th row: With A, as 6th row.
9th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 long sc in skipped sc 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
10th row: With B, as 2nd row.
Rep 3rd to 10th rows to form Pat and side incs.
Keeping cont of pat, work 2 sc each end of next and every following 4th row until there are 55 (55-63-69) sts, taking inc sts into pat.

All sizes: Cont even in pat until work from beg measures 17 (17-18-18-17-16)" [43 (43-45.5-45.5-43-40.5) cm], ending on a WS row. PM each end of last row. Work 4 (4-4-4-5-6) rows even in pat.
Shape top: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
2nd row: Work even in pat.
Rep last 2 rows 4 times more, then 1st row once. 37 (37-43-43-51-57) sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. Sew shoulder seams. Sew sleeve seams to markers. Sew in sleeves placing rows above markers along unworked sts of Back and Front armhole edges to form square armholes.
Neckband: With smaller hook and B, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row, until band, when slightly stretched, measures length to fit around neck edge, sewing in place as you work. Fasten off at end of last row.
PM for 7 buttons, having bottom button 1" [2.5 cm] up from bottom edge, top button ¼" [1 cm] below neck edge and rem 5 markers spaced evenly between.
Buttonhole Band
Note: Work buttonholes as follows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 2 sc. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 2 sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 scbl in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 7 sc.
With smaller hook and B, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row, until band, when slightly stretched, measures length to fit up Left Front, noting buttonholes to match button markers and sewing band in place as you work. Fasten off at end of last row.

Button Band
Work as given for Buttonhole Band for Right Front edge, omitting references to buttonholes. Sew on buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

materials: RED HEART® Bunches of Hugs™: 1 (1, 1) ball 6327 Princess
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5 mm [US H-8]
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Chest: 20 (22½, 24½)" [51 (57, 62) cm]; Finished Length: 10½ (13½, 16½)" [26.5 (34.5, 42) cm], not including hood
gauge: 14 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 8½ rows = 4" [10 cm], in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SWEATER
Yoke
Beginning at neck edge, ch 52.
Row 1 (foundation row): Dc in 4th ch from hook (3 skipped ch count as dc), dc in next 6 ch for first front, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch, dc in next 8 ch for first sleeve, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch, dc in next 14 ch for back, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch, dc in next 8 ch for second sleeve, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch, dc in last 8 ch for second front—54 dc and 4 ch-2 spaces.
Row 2 (increase row): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, [dc in each dc to next ch-2 space, (dc, ch 2, dc) in ch-2 space] 4 times, dc in each dc across—62 dc and 4 ch-2 spaces.
Rows 3–9 (11, 13): Repeat Row 2 for 7 (9, 11) more times—118 (134, 150) dc and 4 ch-2 spaces.
Note: At this point, you will have 17 (19, 21) sts for each front, 26 (30, 34) sts for each sleeve, and 32 (36, 40) sts for the back.
Body
Row 1 (dividing row): Ch 3, turn, *dc in each dc to next ch-2 space, dc in ch-2 space, ch 4 for underarm, skip all sts of next sleeve, dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * once more, dc in each dc across—70 (78, 86) dc and 2 ch-4 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st and ch across—78 (86, 94) dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st across.
Repeat Row 3 until body measures about 6 (8, 10)" [15 (20.5, 25.5) cm] from underarm.
Fasten off.
Sleeves
Round 1: Working over sts of one sleeve and beginning along opposite side of underarm ch, join yarn with slip st in 3rd underarm ch, ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each underarm ch and dc of sleeve and also work 1 dc in edge of body row at each end of sleeve opening; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—32 (36, 40) dc.
Round 2 (decrease round): Ch 3, dc2tog, dc in each dc to last 2 dc, dc2tog; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—30 (34, 38) dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Repeat Rounds 2 and 3 for 4 (6, 7) more times—22 (22, 24) dc. Repeat Round 3 until sleeve measures about 6 (8, 9)" [15 (20.5, 23) cm] from underarm. Fasten off. Repeat for second sleeve.
Hood
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing and working along opposite side of foundation ch, skip ch at base of first dc, join yarn with slip st in ch at base of second dc of neck edge, ch 3, dc in next 17 ch, 2 dc in each of next 14 ch, dc in next 18 ch; leave last ch unworked—62 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across. Repeat Row 2 until hood measures about 8" [20.5 cm] from neck edge. Do not fasten off.
Fold last row of hood in half to bring the right side of stitches together. Working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across to seam top of hood.
EARS (make 2)
Ch 5.
Row 1: Work 6 tr in 5th ch from hook (4 skipped ch count as tr)—7 tr.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as tr), tr in first st, 2 tr in each remaining st across—14 tr. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Use tail to sew ear to hood, curving ear into a crescent shape toward the front as you sew. Repeat for second ear.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block as desired. Sew buttons along left front, spaced as desired. Use spaces between dc stitches along right front for buttonholes.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (Heathers: 5 oz/141.7 g; 250 yds/228 m): 5 (6, 7, 8, 9, 10) balls
Caron® Simply Soft® (Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m): 5 (5, 6, 7, 8, 9) balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sctbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 13 sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
BACK
Ribbing: Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 18½ (20¼- 22¼- 24½- 27½- 31½) " [47 (51.5-56.5-62-70-80) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Do not turn.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 61 (67-73-81-91-103) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from lower edge measures 16 (16-16-16½-16½-16½)" [40.5 (40.5-40.5-42-42-42) cm] for Her Version or 17 (17-17-17½-17½-17½)" [43 (43-43-44.5-44.5-44.5) cm] for His Version, ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Shape armholes: Next row: (RS). Skip first 6 (8-10-12-14-18) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat across next 48 (50-52-56-62-66) sts. Turn. Leave rem 6 (8-10-12-14-18) sts unworked.
Cont even in pat over 49 (51-53-57-63-67) sts until armhole measures 8½ (9-9-9½-10-10½)" [22.5 (23-23-24.5-25.5-27.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. Turn.
Shape shoulders: Next row: (RS). Skip first 6 (6-8-8-10-10) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat across next 36 (38-36-40-42-46) sts. Fasten off. Turn. Leave rem 6 (6-8-8-10-10) sts unworked.
Next row: Skip first 7 (7-6-7-8-8) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Pat across next 23 (25-25-27-27-29) sts. Fasten off.
LEFT FRONT
**Ribbing: Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 9 (10-11-12-13½-15½)" [23 (25.5-28-30.5-34.5-39) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Do not turn.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 31 (33-37-41-45-51) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from lower edge measures 16 (16-16-16½-16½-16½)" [40.5 (40.5-40.5-42-42-42) cm] for Her Version or 17 (17-17-17½-17½-17½)" [43 (43-43-44.5-44.5-44.5) cm] for His Version, ending on a WS row.** 
Fasten off.
Shape armhole: Next row: (RS). Skip first 6 (8-10-12-14-18) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Cont even in pat over 25 (25-27-29-31-33) sts until armhole measures 8 rows less than Back to shoulder, ending on a WS row.
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Pat across 19 (19-20-21-24-24) sts (neck edge). Turn. Leave rem 6 (6-7-8-7-9) sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 13 (13-14-15-18-18) sts rem.
Work 1 row even in pat. Fasten off.
Shape left shoulder: Next row: (RS). Skip first 6  (6-8-8-10-10) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat to end of row. Fasten off.
RIGHT FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Front. Do not fasten off.
Shape armhole: Next row: (RS). Pat to last 6 (8-10-12-14-18) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont even in pat over 25 (25-27-29-31-33) sts until armhole measures 8 rows less than Back to shoulder, ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Shape neck: With RS facing, skip first 6 (6-7-8-7-9) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st and pat to end of row.
Next row: Ch 3. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 13 (13-14-15-18-18) sts rem.
Work 1 row even in pat.
Shape shoulder: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Pat across first 6 (6-8-8-10-10) sts. Fasten off. Leave rem sts unworked.
SLEEVES
Ribbing: Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 9½ (9½-10-10-10½-10½)" [24.5 (24.5-25.5-25.5-26.5-26.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Do not turn.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 31 (31-33-33-35-37) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
4th row (inc row): Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 dc) in first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next dc. (1 dc. 1 sc) in last sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
6th row (inc row): Ch 3 (counts as d.c.). 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in next sc. (1 sc. 1 dc) in top of ch 3. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows 2 (3-3-4-6-7) times more. 43 (47-49-53-63-69) sts.
Sizes XS/S, M, L, XL and 2/3XL only: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
Next row (inc row): Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 dc) in first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next dc. (1 dc. 1 sc) in last sc. Turn.
All sizes: Cont even in pat until work from lower edge measures 17 (17-17-16½-16-16)" [40.5 (40.5-40.5-42-42-42) cm] for Her Version or 18 (18-18-17½-17-17)" [43 (43-43-44.5-44.5-44.5) cm] for His Version, ending on a WS row. Place markers at each end of last row.
Work a further 6 (6-8-10-12-14) rows in pat. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams.
Neckband: Ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Neckband (when slightly stretched) measures length to fit along neck edge, sewing in place as you work, taking care to allow stretch in seam.
Button Band: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st and work 71 (73-73-77-77-81) sc for Her Version up Left Front edge to top of neckband or 75 (77-77-81-81-85) sc for His Version down Right Front to lower edge. Turn.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Place markers on band for 7 buttons, having bottom button ½" [1 cm] above lower edge, top button in center of neckband and rem 5 buttons spaced evenly between.
Buttonhole Band: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st and work 71 (73-73-77-77-81) sc for Her Version down Right Front to lower edge or 75 (77-77-81-81-85) sc up Left Front edge to top of neckband for His Version. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc to next button marker. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * 6 times more. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 2 sc in each ch-2 sp to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew in sleeves, placing rows above markers along unworked sts of Front and Back to form square armholes. Sew side and sleeve seams.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1401 Pewter A, 1704 Bubblegum B, and 1502 Iced Aqua
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Length: 12½ (13½, 14½)" [32 (34.5, 37) cm]; Finished Chest: 14½ (19½, 24¼)" [37 (49.5, 61.5) cm]
gauge: 12 sts = 4" (10 cm); 16 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SWEATER
Neckband
With A, ch 6.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in back lp of each sc across, turn.
Repeat last row 27 (37, 47) times; change to B in last sc of last row. 
BODY
Row 1 (Right Side): Working in end of rows, ch 1, sc in each row across, turn—29 (39, 49) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, work 1 (2, 1) sc in first sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across—43 (59, 73) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; change to B, turn. 
Rows 4 and 5: Work Rows 1 and 2 of pattern st.
DIVIDE FOR LEG OPENINGS 
Right Underbody
Row 1 (wrong side): Work Row 1 of pattern st in first 5 (7, 9) sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—5 (7, 9) sts.
Rows 2–10 (14, 18): Work even in pattern st. 
Fasten off.
Center Back
Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side facing, skip next 3 (5, 7) sts of Row 5 of Body, join same color as Row 1 of Right Underbody with slip st in next st, beginning in same st as join, work Row 1 of pattern st in first 27 (35, 41) sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—27 (35, 41) sts.
LEFT UNDERBODY
Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side facing, skip next 3 (5, 7) sts of Row 5 of Body, join same color as Row 1 of Right Underbody with slip st in next st, beginning in same st as join, work Row 1 of pattern st in last 5 (7, 9) sts, turn—5 (7, 9) sts.
Rows 2–10 (14, 18): Work even in pattern st. 
Do not fasten off.
BACK
Row 11 (15, 19): Ch 1, *sc in first sc, [Lsc in next sc 1 row below, sc in next sc] 2 (3, 4) times*, ch 3 (5, 7), sc in next sc, [Lsc in next sc 1 row below, sc in next sc] 13 (17, 20) times, ch 3 (5, 7), repeat from * to * once, turn—37 (49, 59) sts and 6 (10, 14) ch.
Row 12 (16, 20): Ch 1, sc in each st and ch across, turn—43 (59, 73) sts. 
Row 13 (17, 21): Work Row 1 of pattern st.
Row 14 (18, 22): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—41 (57, 71) sts.
Rows 15–39 (19–43, 23–47): Repeat last 2 rows 12 times, then repeat last row once—15 (31, 45) sts. 
Fasten off.
LEG OPENING (work twice)
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, sc join A in any st at leg opening, sc evenly around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, *sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from * around, adjusting at end of round as needed; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 4 and 5: Repeat Rounds 2 and 3. 
Round 6: Ch 1, reverse sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING 
With ends of rows held together, sew seam from Neckband to Row 14 (18, 22) of Back.
Edging
Round 1 (right side): With right side of Back facing, sc join C (B, A) in seam, working in ends of rows and across last row, sc evenly around working 3 sc in each corner; join with slip st in first sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, reverse sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Astra (50 g/1.75 oz) Sizes: 2 (4-6-8-10) yrs (Lilac) 3 (3-4-4-4) balls
Sizes 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) and 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 2 yrs 21 ins [53.5 cm], 4 yrs 23 ins [58.5 cm], 6 yrs 25 ins [63.5 cm], 8 yrs 26 1/2 ins [67.5 cm], 10 yrs 28 ins [71 cm]
gauge: 13 1/2 hdc and 10 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with larger crochet hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Note: Bolero is worked in one piece to armholes. Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as stitch.
With larger crochet hook, ch 52 (56-58-60-64).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of row. Turn. 50 (54-56-58-62) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep last row 5 (7-8-9-9) times more. 62 (70-74-78-82) hdc.
Work 1 (1-2-1-1) row(s) even.
Divide for armholes: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. Yoh and draw up a loop in each of first 2 hdc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Hdc2tog made. 1 hdc in each of next 6 (8-9-9-10) hdc. Hdc2tog over next 2 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Work on these 8 (10-11-11-12) sts for Left Front.
**2nd to 4th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 1 (2-2-2-3) time(s) more. 4 (4-5-5-4) sts.
Sizes 2 and 8 only: Next 2 rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
All sizes: Next row: (WS). Ch 2. Hdc2tog over next 2 sts. (1 hdc in next hdc) 0 (0-1-1-0) time. Hdc2tog over next 2 sts. Turn. 2 (2-3-3-2) sts.
Sizes 2, 4 and 10 only: Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over next 2 sts. Fasten off.
Sizes 6 and 8 only: Next row: Ch 2. Yoh and draw up a loop in each of first 3 hdc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Hdc3tog made. Fasten off.**
All sizes: With RS of work facing, miss next 4 (4-4-6-6) sts of Body. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 2. Hdc2tog over same hdc as last sl st and next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 30 (34-36-36-38) hdc. Hdc2tog over next 2 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Work on these 32 (36-38-38-40) sts for Back.
Next row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog over last 2 hdc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 (2-2-5-7) time(s) more. 28 (30-32-26-24) sts.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog over last 2 hdc. Turn.
Rep last row 6 (6-6-2-0) times more. 14 (16-18-20-22) sts.
With RS of work facing, miss next 4 (4-4-6-6) sts of Body. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 2. Hdc2tog over same hdc as last sl st and next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 (8-9-9-10) hdc. Hdc2tog over next 2 hdc. Turn. Work on these 8 (10-11-11-12) sts for Right Front.
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Front.
SLEEVES
With larger crochet hook, ch 20 (22-23-25-26).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 18 (20-21-23-24) hdc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: (Increase row). Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
5th row: As 2nd row.
Rep last 2 rows 5 (5-7-8-9) times more. 30 (32-37-41-44) hdc.
Cont even until work from beg measures 5 1/2 (6 1/2-7-8 1/2-10) ins [14 (16.5-18-21.5-25.5) cm], ending with RS facing for next row.
Shape raglans: 1st row: Sl st in each of first 4 (5-5-5-6) hdc. Hdc2tog over same sp as last sl st and next st. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 5 (6-6-6-7) hdc. Hdc2tog over next 2 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 2 (4-2-2-4) times more, then 3rd row 5 (3-7-9-7) times more. 6 (6-7-7-8) sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Pin garment pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry.
Body edging: Sew raglan seams. 
***With smaller hook, ch 4. 
1st row: (RS). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in 4th ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 6. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook – Picot made. Ch 2. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in ch-2 sp. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in ch-2 sp. Turn.***
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work measures length to fit entire outer edge around body of Bolero.
Beg at center bottom of back, sew edging around outer edge of Bolero as you work.
Sleeve edging: Work from *** to *** as given for Body edging. Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work measures length to fit bottom edge of Sleeve. Sew edging to bottom of Sleeve.
Sew Sleeve seams.

materials: Bernat® Lattice™ (7.8 oz/220 g; 389 yds/356 m)
Contrast A 2 2 2 balls Teal Mix (19010) 635/572 692/630 775/705 yds/m
Contrast B 2 2 2 balls Ocean Blues (19011) 635/572 692/630 775/705 yds/m
Sizes XL 2/3XL 4/5XL Contrast A 3 3 3 balls Teal Mix (19010) 845/768 946/865 1067/970 yds/m
Contrast B 3 3 3 balls Ocean Blues (19011) 845/768 946/865 1067/970 yds/m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdchb = Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram)
V-st = (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) all in indicated stitch
gauge: 5½ V-sts and 9½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in V-st Pat.
instructions: The instructions are written for size XS/S. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written XS/S (M-L-XL-2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Notes: • Body is worked in one piece to armholes, then divided into Back and Fronts.• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. • To change color, work to last 3 loops on hook and draw new color through last 3 loops, then proceed in new color. Stripe Pat With A, work 2 rows. With B, work 2 rows. These 4 rows form Stripe Pat. BODY With A, ch 172 ( 187-205-223-241-262) (multiple of 3 + 16). See diagram on page 3. 1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each of next 6 ch. Skip next ch. *V-st in next ch. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 9 ch. V-st in next ch. Skip next ch. 1 hdc in each of last 7 ch. Turn. 52 ( 57-63-69-75-82) V-sts. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of first 7 hdc. *V-st in next V-st. Rep from * to last 7 hdc. 1 hdchb in each of last 7 hdc. Turn. First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row for V-st Pat until work from beg measures 15" [38 cm], ending on a WS row. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows: Divide for Right Front and shape V-neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of first 7 hdc. (V-st in next V-st) 12 ( 14-15-17-18-20) times. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 2nd row: Ch 2. V-st in each V-st to last 7 hdc. 1 hdchb in each of last 7 hdc. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of first 7 hdc. 1 hdc in next V-st. V-st in each V-st to end of row. Turn. 11 ( 13-14-16-17-19) V-sts. 4th row: Ch 2. V-st in each V-st to last 8 hdc. Skip next hdc. 1 hdchb in each of last 7 hdc. Turn. 5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of first 7 hdc. V-st in each V-st to end of row. Turn. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd to 5th rows 1 ( 3-2-4-3-4) time(s) more. 10 ( 10-12-12-14-15) V-sts. Next row: (WS). Ch 2. V-st in each V-st to last 7 hdc. 1 hdchb in each of last 7 hdc. Turn. Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of first 7 hdc. V-st in each V-st to end of row. Turn. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rows until work from dividing row measures 10 ( 10-11-11-12-13)" [ 25.5 ( 25.5-28-28-30.5-33) cm], ending on a WS row. PM at end of last row. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows: Neckband extension: 1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of first 7 hdc. 1 hdc in first hdc of next V-st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of next 8 hdc. Turn. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until neckband extension from marked row measures 3 ( 3¼-3¼-4-4-4½)" [7.5 ( 8.5-8.5-10-10-11.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off. Back With RS facing, join appropriate color with sl st to first hdc of next unworked V-st. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows: 1st row: Ch 2. V-st in same sp as last sl st. V-st in each of next 27 ( 28-32-34-38-41) V-sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 28 ( 29-33-35-39-42) V-sts. 2nd row: Ch 2. V-st in each V-st to end of row. Turn. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until work from dividing row measures 10 ( 10-11-11-12-13)" [ 25.5 ( 25.5-28-28-30.5-33) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. Left Front and shape V-neck: With RS facing, join appropriate color with sl st to first hdc of next unworked V-st. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. V-st in same sp as last sl st. V-st in each V-st to last 7 hdc. 1 hdchb in each of last 7 hdc. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of first 7 hdc. V-st in each V-st to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 2. V-st in each V-st to last V-st. 1 hdc in next V-st. 1 hdchb in each of last 7 hdc. Turn. 11 ( 13-14-16-17-19) V-sts. 4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of first 7 hdc. Skip next hdc. V-st in each V-st to end of row. Turn. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 1st to 4th rows 1 ( 3-2-4-3-4) time(s) more. 10 ( 10-12-12-14-15) V-sts. Next row: (RS). Ch 2. V-st in each V-st to last 7 hdc. 1 hdchb in each of last 7 hdc. Turn. Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of first 7 hdc. V-st in each V-st to end of row. Turn. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rows until work from dividing row measures 10 ( 10-11-11-12-13)" [ 25.5 ( 25.5-28-28-30.5-33) cm], ending on a RS row. PM at end of last row. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows: Neckband extension: 1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of first 7 hdc. 1 hdc in first hdc of next V-st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of next 8 hdc. Turn. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until neckband extension from marked row measures 3 ( 3¼-3¼-4-4-4½)" [7.5 ( 8.5-8.5-10-10-11.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off. Sleeves Note: Foundation ch for Sleeve is different than for Body to create “puffy cuff”. With A, ch 25 (25-26-26-27-28). 1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. *V-st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 23 ( 23-24-24-25-26) V-sts. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. V-st in each V-st to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row 4 ( 4-2-2-0-0) times more. Shape sides: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. V-st in each V-st to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. V-st in each V-st to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. V-st in each V-st to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. V-st in each V-st to last 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn. 5th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. V-st in each V-st to last 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. V-st in each V-st to last 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 4 hdc. Turn. 7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Skip next hdc. V-st in next hdc. Skip next hdc. V-st in each V-st to last 4 hdc. Skip next hdc. V-st in next hdc. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 25 ( 25-26-26-27-28) V-sts. 8th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. V-st in each V-st to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 8 rows 1 ( 1-2-2-3-3) time(s) more. 27 ( 27-30-30-33-34) V-sts. Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. V-st in each V-st to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until work from beg measures 16" [40.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off. FINISHING Sew shoulder seams. Sew sleeve seams. Sew in Sleeves. Sew neckband extensions across back neck edge, meeting them at center back neck edge. Sew back seam.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Worsted™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 194 yds/177 m)
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook. Ch 1 to close bobble. Push bobble to RS of work.
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 14 hdc and 10½ rows = 4” [10 cm] with larger hook
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

Notes: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. 
Cardigan is worked in one piece to armholes, then divided for Back and Fronts.  
Bobbles are created on WS of work and pushed to RS of work.

POCKET LINING (make 2)
With larger hook, ch 25.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 23 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 4½” [11.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. 

BODY
Ribbing: With smaller hook, ch 14.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. 12 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures 40 (44-49-53-58-65)” [101.5 (112-124.5- 134.5- 147.5- 165) cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off. 
Change to larger hook and proceed as follows:

1st row: (RS). Turn work sidewise, ch 2. Work 139 (155-171-187-203-227) hdc evenly across side of Ribbing. Turn. 139 (155-171-187-203-227) hdc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc.  *Bobble in next hdc, pushing bobble to RS of work. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *Bobble in next hdc, pushing bobble to RS of work. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row.
6th to 8th rows:  As 2nd to 4th rows.
9th row: As 3rd row.
10th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
11th row: As 3rd row.
12th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to last 6 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 5 hdc. Turn.
13th to 21st rows: Rep 9th to 12th rows twice more, then 9th row once.
Note: Work from beg measures approx 11½” [29 cm].
Place pocket:  Next row:  (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 10 (12-12-14-16-18) hdc. 1 hdc in each of 23 hdc from Pocket Lining. Skip next 23 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 33 (35-35-37-39-41) hdc .
1 hdc in each of 23 hdc from 2nd Pocket Lining. Skip next 23 hdc.
1 hdc in each of last 10 (12-12-14-16-18) hdc. Turn. 139 (155-171-187-203-227) hdc.

Cont in Bobble Pat as follows: 
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
3rd to 5th rows:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to last 6 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 5 hdc. Turn.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 1st to 6th rows once more.
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 19” [48.5 cm], ending on a WS row.

Divide for Fronts and Back: 
Right front V-neck and armhole shaping: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 29 (33-36-39-42-47) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 31 (34-38-41-44-49) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
5th row: As 3rd row. 
Rep 2nd to 5th rows 4 (4-4-4-5-5) times more. 16 (19-23-26-26-31) sts. 
Sizes L, XL, 2/3XL and 4/5XL only: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows once. (21-24-24-29) sts.
All sizes: Cont even until armhole measures 9 (9-10-10-11-11½)” [23 (23-25.5-25.5-28-29) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. 

Back: Next row: (WS). Skip next 6 (8-8-10-12-14) hdc. Join yarn with sl st to next hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 62 (68-76-82-88-98) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 63 (67-77-83-89-99) hdc.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until Back measures same length as Right Front to shoulder, ending on a WS row. Fasten off. 

Left Front V-neck and armhole shaping: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 6 (8-8-10-12-14) hdc. Join yarn with sl st to next hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 31 (34-38-41-44-49) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
5th row: As 3rd row. 
Rep 2nd to 5th rows 4 (4-4-4-5-5) times more. 16 (19-23-26-26-31) sts. 
Sizes L, XL, 2/3XL and 4/5XL only: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows once. (21-24-24-29) sts.
All sizes: Cont even until armhole measures 9 (9-10-10-11-11½)” [23 (23-25.5-25.5-28-29) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. 

SLEEVES 
Ribbing: With smaller hook, ch 14.
1st row:  (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 12 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures 10 (10-10-12-12-12)” [25.5 (25.5-25.5-30.5-30.5-30.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off. 

Change to larger hook and proceed in pat, noting side incs as follows:
1st row: (RS). Turn work sidewise, ch 2. Work 35 (35-35-35-43-43) hdc evenly across side of Ribbing. Turn. 35 (35-35-35-43-43) hdc. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Bobble in next hdc, pushing bobble to RS of work. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each st to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. *Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row. 
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
7th row: As 3rd row. 41 (41-41-41-49-49) hdc.
8th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. Bobble in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn.

Bobble Pat is now complete. 
Cont to inc sides as follows:
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each st to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 0 (0-4-4-4-8) times more. 43 (43-51-51-59-67) hdc.
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each st to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Next 3 rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 4 (4-3-3-3-1) time(s) more. 53 (53 -59 -59 -67-71) hdc.

Cont even until Sleeve measures 17 (17-18-18-17-16)” [43 (43-45.5-45.5-43-40.5) cm], ending on a WS row. PM each end of last row. 
Work 2 (2-3-4-5-6) rows even.
Shape top:  1st row:  Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 
Rep last row 7 times more. 37 (37-43-43-51-55) sts. Fasten off.

FINISHING 
Push all bobbles to RS of work. Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. Sew shoulder seams. 
Collar: Sew shoulder seams. 
1st row: (RS). With smaller hook, join yarn with sl st at lower edge of Right Front. Ch 2. Work 1 row of hdc evenly up Right Front, across back neck edge, and down Left Front. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Collar measures 4 (4-4½-4½-5-5)” [10 (10-11.5-11.5-12.5-12.5) cm]. Fasten off.
Sew in Sleeves placing rows above markers along unworked sts of Front and Back and shaped edge along sides of armhole. Sew sleeve seams.  Sew Pocket Linings in position on WS of Fronts.

materials: Sizes 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) and 4 mm (U.S. G/6) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Length of ¾" [2 cm] wide elastic for pants
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = (Draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Chest measurement 6 mos 17" [43 cm] 12 mos 19" [48 cm]; Finished chest 6 mos 19½" [49.5 cm] 12 mos 22" [56 cm]
gauge: Not specified
instructions:
SIZES
MATERIALS 
Bernat® Baby Coordinates™ (140 g / 5 oz)
Sizes 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) and 4 mm (U.S. G/6) crochet hooks or size 
needed to obtain gauge. Length of ¾" [2 cm] wide elastic for Pants.
INSTRUCTIONS
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for 
largest size the instructions will be written thus ( ).
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop in next color 
through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color.

BACK
**With A and larger hook, ch 46 (52).
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch 
across. 44 (50) dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc).Miss first dc. 1 dc in each dc across. Turn.
3rd row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across.
Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
5th row:With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss first sc. 1 dc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for Stripe Pat until work from beg measures approx 
5½" [14 cm] ending on a 2nd row. Break A.
Next row: (RS). With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1.Working in back loop only, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc).Miss first sc. 1 dc in each st across. Turn.**
Rep last row until work from beg measures 10½ (11¼)" [26.5 (28.5) cm] 
ending with RS facing for next row. Fasten off.
FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Back.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 5 rows less than Back to 
shoulders, thus ending with WS facing for next row.
Shape neck: Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss first dc. 1 dc in each of next 
14 (16) sts (neck edge). Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Dc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 dc in each st to end 
of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to last 3 sts. Dc2tog over next 
2 sts. 1 dc in last st.
Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more. 11 (13) sts. Fasten off.
With WS of work facing, miss center 14 (16) sts.
Join MC to next st. Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss first st. 1 dc in each st across. 
Turn.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc).Miss first st. 1 dc in each st to last 3 sts. Dc2tog 
over next 2 sts. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Dc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 dc in each st to end 
of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more. 11 (13) sts. Fasten off.
