gauge: 3 pattern repeats = 4½" (7.5 cm); 8 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CARDIGAN
Back
Ch 92 (98, 104, 110, 122, 128). 
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 2, skip next 2 ch, V-st in next ch, ch 2, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—16 (17, 18, 19, 21, 22) sc and 15 (16, 17, 18, 20, 21) V-sts.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as first tr here and throughout), (2-dc Cl, [ch 1, 2-dc Cl] twice) in ch-2 space of first V-st, [ch 1, 2-dc Cl] 3 times in ch-2 space of each remaining V-st, tr in last sc, turn—2 tr and 44 (47, 50, 53, 59, 62) ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first tr, (ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space across to beginning ch, ch 1, sc in top of beginning ch, turn—44 (47, 50, 53, 59, 62) sc and  45 (48, 51, 54, 60, 63) ch-1 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first ch-1 space, (ch 1, dc) in each ch-1 space across, dc in last sc, turn—45 (48, 51, 54, 60, 63) dc and 44 (47, 50, 53, 59, 62) ch-1 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *ch 2, skip next ch-1 space, V-st in next dc, ch 2, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last 2 ch-1 spaces, ch 2, skip next ch-1 space, V-st in next dc, ch 2, skip next ch-1 space and d c, sc in top of beginning ch, turn—16 (17, 18, 19, 21, 22) sc and 15 (16, 17, 18, 20, 21) V-sts.
Repeat Rows 2–5 until Back measures 
26 (26, 28, 28, 30, 30)" [66 (66, 71, 71, 76, 76) cm]. Fasten off.
Front (make 2)
Ch 38 (44, 44, 50, 50, 56). 
Work same as Back until Front measures 
same length as Back. Fasten off.
Sleeve (make 2)
Ch 38 (38, 44, 44, 44, 44). 
Rows 1–15 (15, 15, 11, 7, 7): Work same as 
Back for 15 (15, 15, 11, 7, 7) rows, ending 
on Row 3—19 (19, 22, 22, 22, 22) sc and 
18 (18, 21, 21, 21, 21) ch-1 spaces.
Row 16 (16, 16, 12, 8, 8): Ch 4 (counts as 
dc, ch 1 here and throughout), dc in next 
ch-1 space, (ch 1, dc) in each ch-1 space 
across, ch 1, dc in last st, turn—20 (20, 
23, 23, 23, 23) dc and 19 (19, 22, 22, 22, 
22) ch-1 spaces.
Repeat last row 14 (14, 13, 13, 16, 16) 
times—34 (34, 36, 36, 39, 39) dc and 33 
(33, 35, 35, 38, 38) ch-1 spaces.
Next row: Ch 3, dc in first ch-1 space, 
(ch 1, dc) in each ch-1 space across, dc 
in top of beginning ch, turn.
Next row: Ch 4, dc in first ch-1 space, 
(ch 1, dc) in each ch-1 space across to 
last 2 sts, ch 1, skip next dc, dc in top of 
beginning ch, turn.
Repeat last 2 rows as needed until 
Sleeve measures 17 (16, 16, 15, 15, 14)" 
[43, (40.5, 40.5, 38, 38, 35.5) cm].
ASSEMBLY
Matching sts, sew Fronts to Back at 
shoulders. 
With right side of Body and Sleeve held 
together, slip st across to seam. Sew or 
slip st sides and Sleeve seams together.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat Softee® Baby™ (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m) Soft Peach (30410) 1 2 2 2 ball(s)
Bernat Softee® Baby Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Aqua Mist (52010) 2 2 2 3 balls
Size U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements:
To fit chest measurements:
6 mos 17" [43 cm] 
12 mos 18" [45.5 cm] 
18 mos 19" [48 cm] 
24 mos 20" [51 cm] 
Finished chest measurements:
6 mos 19" [48.5 cm] 
12 mos 21" [53.5 cm] 
18 mos 23" [58.5 cm] 
24 mos 25" [63.5 cm]
gauge: 16 hdc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written 6 (12-18-24) mos. Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pat. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

BODY
Beg at neck edge, ch 41 (45-49-53). 
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 39 (43-47-51) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around first st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Proceed with Body as follows:
1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 (5-6-7) sts. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc – V-st made) in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. V-st in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 15 (17-19-21) sts. V-st in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. V-st in next st. 1 hdc in each of last 4 (5-6-7) sts. Turn. 43 (47-51-55) hdc and 4 ch-1 sps.
Next 9 (10-11-12) rows: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each hdc to ch-1 sp of next V-st. V-st in ch-1 sp of next V-st. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 115 (127-139-151) hdc and 4 ch-1 sps at end of last row.
Divide Sleeves and Body
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 14 (16-18-20) hdc. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of V-st. Ch 4 for underarm. Skip next 26 (28-30-32) hdc. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 35 (39-43-47) hdc. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of V-st. Ch 4 for underarm. Skip next 26 (28-30-32) hdc. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of V-st. 1 hdc in each of last 14 (16-18-20) hdc. Turn. 75 (83-91-99) hdc
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc or ch to end of row. Turn.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from underarm measures 4½ (5½-5½-6)" [11.5 (14-14-15) cm]. Do not fasten off.
Ribbing: 1st row: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around first st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 2 (2-3-3) times more. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

SLEEVES
1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to 3rd ch of underarm ch. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same ch as last sl st. 1 hdc in each ch or hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 34 (36-38-40) hdc. Turn.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Rep last rnd (turning at end of each rnd to match Body fabric) until work from underarm ch measures 1 (1½-2-2½)" [2.5 (4-5-6.5) cm]. 1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last st. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn. 32 (34-36-38) hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rnds twice more. 28 (30-32-36) hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Rep last rnd until Sleeve from underarm ch measures 4 (5-5½-6)" [10 (12.5-14-15) cm]. 
Sleeve Ribbing: 1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around first st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcfp around last st. Join with sl st to first dcbp. Rep last rnd 4 (5-5-6) times more. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

Right Front Band: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom Right Front.
1st row: Ch 2. Work 43 (47-51-55) hdc evenly up Right Front edge. Turn.
**2nd row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 dcbp around first st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 2 (2-3-3) times more. Fasten off.**

Left Front Band
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to top Left Front.
1st row: Ch 2. Work 43 (47-51-55) hdc evenly down Left Front edge. Turn.
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Front Band.
Sew button to top of Left Front Band approx ¾" [2 cm] from top of band as shown in photo.

Embroidery
Using template, embroider Wheel Roses on either side of Cardigan as follows:
Beg by outlining “spokes” of Wheel Roses using Straight (Spoke) st. Draw up needle in center of Wheel Rose. Weave Wheel Rose by threading needle under next “spoke”. *Thread needle over next spoke. Thread needle under next spoke. Rep from * until spokes are fully covered. Fasten off.

pattern_name: CROCHET SIDE TO SIDE SLOUNGE PULLOVER
materials: Caron® Cloud Cakes™ Perfect Phasing (8 oz/227 g; 720 yds/658 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® jumbo locking stitch markers.
abbreviations: Hdchb = Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram)
Hdchb2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in horizontal bar created below in previous row of each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
gauge: 16 hdchb and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in hdchb pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus XS/S (M-L-XL-2/3XL-4/5XL). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes.
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
• Sweater is worked sideways in one piece, from Right Sleeve to Left Sleeve.
• To achieve phasing effect, begin first Cake working from inside (darkest) to outside (lightest). When needed, join 2nd cake from outside (lightest) and work to inside (darkest). 3rd cake and 4th cakes (if needed) will be joined from inside (darkest).
RIGHT SLEEVE
Ch 74 (74-82-82-90-90).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 72 (72-80-80-88-88) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Sleeve measures 16" [40.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Fasten off.
BODY
Ch 56 (56-56-64-64-64). (This will be Right Front Side of Body).
Join Body ch to Sleeve: 1st row: With RS of Sleeve facing, 1 hdchb in first hdc of Sleeve (Right Side of Body now joined). 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of Sleeve. Ch 58 (58-58-66-66-66) (This will be Right Back Side of Body). Turn.
2nd row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to Sleeve sts. 1 hdchb in each of next 72 (72-80-80-88-88) hdc of Sleeve. 1 hdc in each of next 56 (56-56-64-64-64) ch. Turn. 184 (184-192-208-216-216) sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work measures 7 (8-8½-9½-10½-11½)" [18 (20.5-21.5-24-26.5-29) cm] from Side Body shaping, ending on a WS row.
Divide for Right Front neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of next 92 (92-96-104-108-108) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdchb2tog. Turn. 91 (91-95-103-107-107) sts.
4th row: Ch 2. Hdchb2tog. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
5th and 6th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows once more. 88 (88-92-100-104-104) sts at end of 6th row.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until neck opening measures 6 (6-7-7-8-8½)" [15 (15-18-18-20.5-21.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Left Front neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to last 2 hdc. 2 hdchb in next hdc. 1 hdchb in last hdc. Turn. 89 (89-93-101-105-105) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in first hdc. 2 hdchb in next hdc. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 90 (90-94-102-106-106) hdc.
3rd and 4th rows: As 1st and 2nd rows once more. 92 (92-96-104-108-108) hdc at end of 4th row.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.
Right Back neck: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to first unworked st of neck divide.
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdchb in same st as sl st. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 92 (92-96-104-108-108) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdchb2tog. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 91 (91-95-103-107-107) sts.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdchb2tog. Turn.
5th and 6th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows once more. 88 (88-92-100-104-104) sts at end of 6th row.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until neck opening measures 6 (6-7-7-8-8½)" [15 (15-18-18-20.5-21.5) cm], ending on a RS row.
Left Back neck: 1st row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to last 2 hdc. 2 hdchb in next hdc. 1 hdchb in last hdc. Turn. 89 (89-93-101-105-105) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in first hdc. 2 hdchb in next hdc. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows: As 1st and 2nd rows once more. 92 (92-96-104-108-108) hdc at end of 4th row.
Join Front and Back: Next row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc of Back. Join Front by working 1 hdchb in each hdc of Front to end of row. Turn. 184 (184-192-208-216-216) hdc.
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from Neck join measures 7 (8-8½-9½-10½-11½)" [18 (20.5-21.5-24-26.5-29) cm], ending on a WS row.
Fasten off.
Shape Left Sleeve: With RS facing, skip first 56 (56-56-64-64-64) hdc of Front Body. Join yarn with sl st to next hdc.
1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in same st as sl st. 1 hdchb in each of next 71 (71-79-79-87-87) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 72 (72-80-80-88-88) hdc.
Rep last row until Sleeve measures 16" [40.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold Pullover in half, aligning Sleeve and side seams.
Sew Sleeve seams using Whipstitch. Sew side seams.
Neckband: Ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures length to fit around neck edge.
Fasten off.
Beg at center back, sew neckband into place along neck edge. Sew neckband seam.

materials: Patons® Lincoln Fog™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 190 yds/174 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of indicated stitch, inserting hook from back to front to back. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of indicated stitch, inserting hook from front to back to front. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
gauge: 11.5 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. When working with 2 colors within a row or from charts, carry color not in use loosely across top of row and work sts around it. To change colors, work to last loops on hook of last st, yoh with new color and proceed.
BODY
Note: Body is worked in 1 piece to armholes.
With B, ch 123 (133-139-153-169-183).
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 121 (131-137-151-167-181) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcfp around next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: (RS). Ch 1. With B, 1 sc in first st. *With A, 1 sc in next st. With B, 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
5th row: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 dc. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
7th and 8th rows: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. Sizes XS/S, M, XL and 4/5XL only: 9th row: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 60 (64-74-90) dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 122 (132-152-182) dc. Sizes L and 2/3XL only: 9th row: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
All sizes: 122 (132-137-152-167-182) dc.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). With B, ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *With A, 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. With B, 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
3rd to 9th rows: Work rows 1 to 7 of Chart I, noting 8-st rep will be worked 15 (16-17-19-20-22) times. Chart I is shown on page 4.
10th row: (WS). With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Join B. Turn.
11th row: As 1st row.
12th row: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
13th to 15th rows: Work rows 1 to 3 of Chart II, noting 5-st rep will be worked 24 (26-27-30-33-36) times. Chart II is shown on page 4.
16th row: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Join B. Turn.
Rep these 16 rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 20½" [52 cm], ending on an 8th row of pat.
Divide for armholes: Right Front: Next row: (RS). Pat across 29 (31-31-35-38-42) dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 3. Pat to last 3 sts. Dc2tog (neck edge). 1 dc in last st. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3. Dc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 4 (4-4-5-5-5) times more. 19 (21-21-23-26-30) sts rem.
Sizes XS/S, M, L and 4/5XL only: Next row: Ch 3. Pat to last 3 sts. Dc2tog. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 18 (20-20-29) sts rem.
All sizes: Work 0 (0-2-1-3-2) row(s) even in pat. Fasten off.
Back: With RS facing, skip next 4 (4-6-6-8-8) dc. Rejoin appropriate yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 3 (counts as first st). Pat across next 55 (61-62-69-74-81) dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Work a further 11 (11-13-13-15-15) rows even in pat. Fasten off. Place markers 18 (20-20-23-26-29) dc in from each side for shoulders.
Left Front: With RS facing, skip next 4 (4-6-6-8-8) sts. Rejoin appropriate yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 3 (counts as first st). Pat to end of row. Turn. 29 (31-31-35-38-42) sts.
Next row: Ch 3. Dc2tog (neck edge). Pat to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3. Pat to last 3 sts. Dc2tog (neck edge). 1 dc in last st. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 4 (4-4-5-5-5) times more. 19 (21-21-23-26-30) sts rem.
Sizes XS/S, M, L and 4/5XL only: Next row: Ch 3. Dc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn. 18 (20-20-29) sts rem.
All sizes: Work 0 (0-2-1-3-2) row(s) even in pat. Fasten off.
SLEEVES
With B, ch 31 (31-37-37-41-41)
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 29 (29-35-35-39-39) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcfp around next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: (RS). Ch 1. With B, 1 sc in first st. *With A, 1 sc in next st. With B, 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
5th row: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
6th row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 dc. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
7th row: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row Turn.
8th row: With A, ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. Turn. 31 (31-37-37-41-41) dc.
Work Chart III in dc to end of chart, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right. 45 (45-53-53-59-59) dc. Fasten off. Chart III is shown on page 4.
Place markers on side edges of Sleeves 1 (1-1½-1½-2-2)" [2.5 (2.5-4-4-5-5) cm] down from final row.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Sew sleeve seams to markers. Sew in sleeves placing rows above markers along unworked sts at armholes to form square armholes.
Front edging: 1st row: (RS). Join B with sl st at lower corner of Right Front. Work sc evenly up Right Front, across back neck edge and down Left Front to opposite corner (must total an odd number). Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcfp around next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows until Front edging measures 3½" [9 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Softee Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit chest measurement 4 yrs 23" [58.5 cm], 6 yrs 25" [63.5 cm], 8 yrs 26½" [67.5 cm], 10 yrs 28" [71 cm], 12 yrs 30" [76 cm]
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for size 4. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written 4 (6 -8 -10 - 12). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. 

Notes: 
• Body is worked in one piece from lower edge to armholes. 
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. 
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. 

BODY
Ribbing: With MC, ch 5 (6-6-6-7). 1st row: (WS). 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 (5-5-5-6) sl sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sl st in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 4 (4-4-6-6) times more. Join A. Break MC. 
With A, rep 2nd row until work, when lightly stretched, measures 25½ (27½ -29½ -31½ -33½)" [65 (70-75-80-85 cm], ending on a RS row. Join MC. Break A.
With MC, rep last row 7 (7-7-9-9) times. Do not fasten off. Turn ribbing sidewise and proceed as follows:
Set-up 1st row: (RS). With MC, ch 1. Work 55 (59-63-67-71) sc evenly across long edge of ribbing. 
2nd row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures 9½ (10½-11-11½-13)" [24 (26.5-28-29-33) cm], ending on a WS row.

Divide for armholes: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. (1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc) 5 (6-6-7-7) times. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 11 (13-13-15-15) sts.

Right Front: Cont even in pat until armhole measures 4 (4½-5-5½-6)" [10 (11.5-12.5-14-15) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. 
Shape right neck: 1st row: (RS). Skip first 4 (5-5-5-5) sts. Join MC with sl st to next st - PM on this st. Ch 2. Hdc2tog (over same sp as sl st and next st). Pat to end of row. Turn. 6 (7-7-9-9) sts.

Cont even in pat until armhole measures 6 (6½-7-7½-8)" [15 (16.5-18-19-20.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.

Back: Shape armholes: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 5 (4-5-4-5) sts. Join MC with sl st in next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc) 11 (12-13-14-15) times. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 23 (25-27-29-31) sts.

Cont in pat until armhole measures same length as Right Front to shoulder, ending on a RS row. Fasten off.

Left Front: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 5 (4-5-4-5) sts. Join MC with sl st in next st. Pat to end of row. Turn. 11 (13-13-15-15) sts.

Cont even in pat until armhole measures 4 (4½ -5-5½ -6)" [10 (11.5-12.5-14-15) cm], ending on a WS row. 
Shape right neck: 1st row: (RS). Pat to last 6 (7-7-7-7) sts. PM on next st. Hdc2tog. Turn. Leave rem 4 (5-5-5-5) sts unworked. 

Cont even in pat until armhole measures 6 (6½-7-7½-8)" [15 (16.5-18-19-20.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.

SLEEVES
Ribbing: With MC, ch 5 (6-6-6-7). 1st row: (WS). 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 (5-5-5-6) sl sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sl st in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, when lightly stretched, measures 8½ (9½-9½-10½-10½)" [15 (18-18-20.5-20.5) cm], ending on a RS row. 
Set-up 1st row: (RS). With MC, ch 1. Work 17 (19-19-21-21) sc evenly across long edge of ribbing. Join A. Fasten off MC.

2nd row: (Inc row). With A, ch 3. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in next sc. (1 sc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn. 19 (21-21-23-23) sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
5th and 6th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows. 
Rep 2nd to 6th rows 2 (2-3-3-4) times more. 23 (25-27-29-31) sts.

Cont even in pat until work from beg measures 9 (10½-11½-13-14)" [23 (26.5-29-33-35.5) cm], ending on a WS row. PM at each end of row. Work a further 2 rows in pat.

Shape Sleeve Cap: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 5 sts. Pat to last 5 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: As 2nd row. Fasten off. 

FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Sew sleeve seams to markers. Sew in sleeves, placing rows above markers along skipped sts on Fronts and Back to create square armholes. 
Note: Buttonholes are worked on both Left and Right Bands. If desired, choose which Band will have buttonholes and omit buttonhole instructions on opposite band.

Button/Buttonhole Band of Left Front: 1st row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to top corner at neck edge. Ch 1. Work 29 (32-34-36-40) sc evenly down Left Front edge. Turn. 
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sl st in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Sl st in each of first 2 (3-2-3-3) st(s). [Ch 2. Skip next st. Sl st in each of next 5 (5-6-6-7) sts] 4 times. Ch 2. Skip next st. Sl st in each of last 2 (4-3-4-4) sts. Turn.
5th to 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sl st in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Fasten off at end of 7th row. 

Button/Buttonhole Band of Right Front: 1st row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to bottom corner of Right Front. Ch 1. Work 29 (32-34-36-40) sc evenly up Right Front edge. Turn. 
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sl st in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 2 (4-3-4-4) sts. [Ch 2. Skip next st. Sl st in each of next 5 (5-6-6-7) sts] 4 times. Ch 2. Skip next st. Sl st in each of last 2 (3-2-3-3) sts. Turn.
5th to 7th rows: Sl st in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Fasten off at end of 7th row. 

Neck edging: With A, ch 7 (8-8-8-8). 1st row: (WS). 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 (7-7-7-7) sl sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sl st in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Neck Edging measures length around neck edge between markers without stretching. Sew in place as you work.
Sew side edges along skipped sts of Fronts, stretching outer edge. Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes on appropriate side.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (100 g/3.5 oz; 99 m/108 yds)
Sizes 8 mm (U.S. 11) and 9 mm (U.S. M/13) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times in next sc. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook. Yoh and draw tightly through rem 2 loops on hook. Push bobble to RS of work
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook
measurements: To fit bust measurement: Extra-Small/Small   28-34" [ 71-86.5 cm ], Medium                       36-38" [ 91.5-96.5 cm ], Large                             40-42" [ 101.5-106.5 cm ], Extra-Large               44-46" [ 112-117 cm ], 2/3 Extra-Large       48-54" [ 122-137 cm ], 4/5 Extra-Large       56-62" [ 142-157.5 cm ]. Finished bust: Extra-Small/Small        39" [ 99 cm ], Medium                             43" [ 109 cm ], Large                                   49" [ 124.5 cm ], Extra-Large                      52" [ 132 cm ], 2/3 X-Large                      57" [ 144.5 cm ], 4/5 Extra-Large              65" [ 165 cm ].
gauge: 7½ sts and 7½ rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook in Body Pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

BODY
Note: Garment is worked from the neck edge down.
With larger hook, ch 42 (42-42-49-49-49).
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. [1 sc in each of next 4 (4-4-5-5-5) ch. 2 sc in next ch] 7 times. 1 sc in each of last 5 ch. 48 (48-48-55-55-55) sts. Turn. See Diagram 1 on page 4.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp around post of next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp around post of next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp around post of next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp around post of next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 60 (60-60-69-69-69) sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 72 (72-72-83-83-83) sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 84 (84-84-97-97-97) sts.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Sizes XS/S, M and XL only: 9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 96 (96-111) sts.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc.  Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 2 sc in next sc.  Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 108 (108-125) sts.
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc.  Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc.  Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Sizes L, 2/3XL and 4/5XL only: 9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. (96-111-111) sts.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc.  1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc.  Turn. (108-125-125) sts.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Sizes L and 2/3XL only: 13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc . Turn.
15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. (120-139) sts.
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in next sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Size 4/5XL only: 13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 139 sts.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc.  Turn.
15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 15 sts. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts.  2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcbp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.  153 sts.
18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Dcfp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.

FINISHING
Sew sleeve seams.
Button Band: 1st row: With RS facing and smaller hook, join yarn with sl st at neck edge of Left Front. Ch 1. Work 51 (51-55-55-55-55) sc evenly down front edge. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. 
Place markers for 6 buttons on this band having top button ½" [1 cm] below neck edge, bottom button ½" [1 cm] above lower edge and rem 4 buttons spaced evenly between.
Buttonhole Band: 1st row: With RS facing and smaller hook, join yarn with sl st at lower edge of Right Front. Ch 1. Work 51 (51-55-55-55-55) sc evenly up front edge. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row, working buttonholes to correspond to button markers as follows: Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row, working 2 sc in each ch-2 sp. Do not fasten off. Cont as follows for neck edging.
Neck edging: Work 1 row of sc evenly across top of buttonhole band and neck edge to opposite corner of button band. Fasten off.
Sew buttons on button band to correspond to buttonholes.

materials: Patons® Norse™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 211 yds/193 m)
Sizes U.S. J/10 (6 mm) and U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of indicated stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
gauge: 10 dc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes: 
• Ribbing for Back, Fronts and Sleeves are worked first, and then sts for each piece are worked across long side edge of Ribbing.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc
BACK
Ribbing: With smaller hook, ch 20. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 18 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures 20 ( 22-24-26½-29-32½)" [ 51 ( 56-61-67.5-73.5-78.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Change to larger hook and proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Turn work sideways. Ch 2 ( does not count as st). Work 50 ( 56-62-66-74-82) hdc evenly across side of Ribbing. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from top edge of Ribbing measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape armholes: Next row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 7 ( 7-9-9-12-13) dc. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to last 6 ( 6-8-8-11-12) dc. Turn. Leave rem dc unworked. 38 ( 44-46-50-52-58) dc rem.
Next row: Ch 2. Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice  – beg dc2tog made. 1 dc in each dc to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 36 ( 42-44-48-50-56) sts.
Rep last row 1 ( 3-3-3-3-5) time(s) more. 34 (36-38-42-44-46) sts.
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until armhole measures 8 ( 8-9-9-10 -10)" [20.5 (20.5-23-23-25.5-25.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
POCKET LININGS (make 2) 
With larger hook, ch 14 ( 14-14-16-18-18).
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 (12-12-14-16-16) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
RIGHT FRONT
**Ribbing:  With smaller hook, ch 20. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 18 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures 6 ( 7-8-9¼-10½-13)" [ 15 ( 17.5-20.5-23.5-26.5-33) cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Change to larger hook and proceed as follows: 
1st row: (RS). Turn work sideways. Ch 2 ( does not count as st). Work 16 ( 18-21-24-26-32) hdc evenly across side of Ribbing. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Place pocket: Next row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 1 ( 2-2-3-3-5) dc. Skip next 12 (12-12-14-16-16) dc. 1 dc in each hdc from Pocket Lining. 1 dc in each of last 2 ( 3-6-6-7-10) dc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 16 (18 -21-24-26-32) dc.
Rep last row until work from top edge of Ribbing measures  
18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape armhole: Next row:  (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to last 6 (6-8-8-11-12) dc. Turn. Leave rem 6 ( 6-8-8-11-12) sts unworked. 10 ( 12-13-16-16-20) dc rem.
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 9 ( 11-12-15-15-19) sts.
Next row: Beg dc2tog. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 8 ( 10-11-14-14-18) sts.
Rep last 2 rows 0 ( 1-1-1-1-2) time(s) more. 8 (8-9-12-12-14) sts. 
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until Armhole measures 8 ( 8-9-9-10-10)" [20.5 (20.5 -23-23-25.5-25.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
LEFT FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Front.
Place pocket: Next row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 1 ( 2-5-5-6-9) dc. Skip next 12 ( 12-12-14-16-16) dc. 1 dc in each hdc from Pocket Lining. 1 dc in each of last 2 ( 3-3-4-4-6) dc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 16 ( 18-21-24-26-32) dc.
Rep last row until work from top edge of Ribbing measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Shape armhole: Next row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 7 ( 7-9-9-12-13) dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. 
Turn. 10 ( 12-13-16-16-20) dc rem.
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 9 ( 11-12-15-15-19) sts.
Next row: Beg dc2tog. 1 dc in each ddc to end of row. Turn.  8 ( 10-11-14-14-18) sts.
Rep last 2 rows 0 ( 1-1-1-1-2) time(s) more. 8 (8-9-12-12-14) sts. 
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until armhole measures 8 ( 8-9-9-10-10)" [20.5 (20.5-23-23-25.5-25.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
SLEEVES
Ribbing: With smaller hook, ch 12.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. 10 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures 9 ( 9-10-10-11-11)" [23 ( 23-25.5-25.5-28-28) cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Turn work sideways. Change to larger hook. and proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. Work 24 ( 24-26-26-28-28) hdc evenly across side of Ribbing. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 2. *Work 2 hdc into each horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS). Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 48 ( 48-52-52-56-56) hdc.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Shape sides: Next row:  (RS-dec row). Beg dc2tog. 1 dc in each dc to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 46 ( 46-50-50-54-54) hdc.
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 6 ( 5-5-5-6-5) times more. 34 ( 36-40-40-42-44) sts. 
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until Sleeve from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS row.

FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Sew side seams. Sew sleeve seams. Sew in sleeves.
Front Band
With larger hook, ch 14.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 dc.
2nd row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first dc. Dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in next st. Skip next 3 sts. Trfp around each of next 3 sts. Working in front of sts just worked , 1 trfp around each of 3 skipped sts. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next dc. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat, until band, when slightly stretched, measures length to fit up Left Front, across back neck edge and down Right Front edge, joining as you work (see below). Fasten off at end of last row.

Joining Front Band to Cardigan: 
With WS of Band and Cardigan tog, join yarn with sl st at bottom of Left Front. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses , work sc to join front edges with Front Band.

Pocket Borders 
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to first dc at pocket opening.  
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 12 ( 12-12-14-16-16) dc. Turn.  
2nd row:  Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS). Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off. 
Sew pocket linings in position on WS.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 9 (9, 10, 11, 12, 15) balls 4604 Navy A
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6mm [US J-10], 10mm [US N-15], and 11.5mm [US P-16]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
gauge: 6 hdc = 4” (10 cm); 5 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern.
instructions:
Rows 2–15: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), hdc in each st across, turn.
Rows 16 and 17: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in each st to last st, 2 hdc in last st, turn—27 (30, 33, 36, 39, 41) hdc.
Shape Armholes
Row 18: Slip st in first 1 (1, 1, 2, 2, 2) sts, hdc2tog, hdc in each st to last 3 (3, 3, 4, 4, 4) st, hdc2tog; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—23 (26, 29, 30, 33, 35) hdc.
Rows 19 and 20: Ch 2, hdc2tog, hdc in each st to last 2 sts, hdc2tog, turn—19 (22, 25, 26, 29, 31) hdc.
Rows 21–27 (27, 28, 29, 30, 30): Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Shape Neck and Shoulders
Row 28 (28, 29, 30, 31, 31): Slip st in first 3 sts, sc in next 3 sts, hdc to last 6 sts, sc in next 3 sts, slip st in last 3 sts. Fasten off.
Front
Work same as Rows 1–20 of back—19 (22, 25, 26, 29 31) hdc.
Shape Left Neck and Shoulder
Row 21 (right side): Ch 2, dc in first 4 (5, 5, 6, 7, 8) sts, hdc2tog; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—5 (6, 6, 7, 8, 9) hdc.
Row 22: Ch 2, hdc2tog, hdc in each st, turn—4 (5, 5, 6, 7, 8) hdc.
Rows 23–27 (27, 28, 29, 30, 30): Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn.
Row 28 (28, 29, 30, 31, 31): Ch 2, hdc in first 2 (3, 3, 4, 5, 6) sts, sc in last 2 sts. Fasten off.
Directions are for size Small. Changes for sizes Medium, Large, 1X, 2X, and 3X are in parentheses
Shape Right Neck and Shoulder 
Row 21 (right side): Skip first 7 (8, 11, 10, 11, 11) unworked sts on Row 20 following left shoulder, join A with slip st in next stitch, ch 2, beginning in same st as join, hdc2tog, hdc in remaining sts, turn—5 (6, 6, 7, 8, 9) hdc.
Row 22: Ch 2, hdc to in each st to last 2 sts, hdc2tog, turn—4 (5, 5, 6, 7, 8) hdc.
Rows 23–27 (27, 28, 29, 30, 30): Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn. 
Row 28 (28, 29, 30, 31, 31): Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, hdc in remaining sts. Fasten off.
Sleeves
With largest hook and 3 strands of A held together, ch 15 (16, 16, 17, 17, 18).
Row 1 (right side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch does not count as st) and in each ch across, turn—13 (14, 14, 15, 15, 16) hdc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn. 
Increase Row: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in each st to last st, 2 hdc in last st, turn—15 (16, 16, 17, 17, 18) hdc.
Next 3 (3, 2, 2, 1, 1) Rows: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn. 
Next Row: Repeat Increase Row—17 (18, 18, 19, 19, 20) hdc.
Repeat last 4 (4, 3, 3, 2, 2) rows 3 (3, 4, 4, 5, 5) times—23 (24, 26, 27, 29, 30) hdc.
Shape Cap
Row 1: Slip st in first 3 (3, 3, 4, 4, 4) sts, hdc2tog, hdc in each st to last 5 (5, 5, 6, 6, 6) sts, hdc2tog; leave remaining sts unworked, turn— 15 (16, 18, 17, 19, 20) hdc.
Rows 2–6 (6, 7, 8, 10, 10): Ch 2, hdc2tog, hdc in each st to end, turn—10 (11, 12, 10, 10, 11) hdc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Sew sleeve into armhole, then sew side and sleeve seams.
Neckband
Round 1 (right side): With right side of neck facing, medium hook, and 3 strands of A held together, join yarn with sc in any st at center back, sc evenly around the neck edge. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2 and 3: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around. Fasten off.
Lower Edging
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, smallest hook, and working across opposite side of foundation ch, join 1 strand of B with sc in any st, sc in each ch around. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2 and 3: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around. Fasten off.
Sleeve Edging 
Work same as lower edging on each sleeve. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Red Heart® All in One™ Flower Power™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Size U.S. I/9 [5.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: To fit chest measurement: XS/S/M/L 28-42" [ 71-106.5 cm], XL/2/3XL 44-54" [ 112-137 cm], 4/5XL 56-62" [ 142-157.5 cm]; Finished chest: XS/S/M/L 48" [ 122 cm], XL/2/3XL 60" [ 152.5 cm], 4/5XL 72" [ 183 cm]
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S/M/L. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written XS/S/M/L ( XL/2/3XL - 4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

With A, make 13 Squares. With B, make 14 Squares.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off.

Using mattress stitch, seam squares tog as shown in Assembly Diagrams (page 5). Leave 4" [10 cm] open at center front. Using mattress stitch, seam Hood around circumference of neck as shown in photo, with opening aligned at front. Join Color 3 to ch-3 sp at corner ch-3 sp (See Hood Edging Diagram)
1st row: Ch 2. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. *(3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. 3 dc in between next 2 corner ch-3 sps. Ch 1. Rep from * once more. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. 2 dc in last corner ch-3 sp. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first dc. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 14 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size. Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
BACK
Ribbing: Ch 8 ( 8-10-10).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 ( 7-9-9) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until ribbing (when slightly stretched), measures 13 ( 15-16-17)" [ 33 ( 38-40.5-43) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Do not turn.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 47 ( 51-55-59) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 2 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.
These 8 rows form Bobble St Pat. Cont even in Bobble st pat until work from lower edge measures approx 8 ( 8-10½-10½)" [ 20 ( 20-26.5-26.5) cm], ending on an 8th row of pat.
Shape armholes: 
1st row: (RS). Skip first 6 ( 6-6-8) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 ( 5-5-3) sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 ( 2-2-0) sts. Turn. Leave rem 6 ( 6-6-8) sts unworked. 35 ( 39-43-43) sts
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 ( 3-3-5) sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 0 ( 0-0-2) sts. 1 sc in each of last 0 ( 0-0-2) sts. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.
Cont even in pat over 35 ( 39-43-43) sts until armhole measures approx 5½ ( 6-6½-7)" [ 14 ( 15-16.5-18) cm], ending on either a 1st or 5th row of pat. Fasten off. Turn.
Shape shoulders: Next row: (RS). Skip first 4 ( 4-5-5) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 26 ( 30-32-32) sts. Turn. Leave rem 4 ( 4-5-5) sts unworked. 
Next row: Sl st in each of first 4 ( 5-6-6) sts. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same st as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 18 ( 20-20-20) sts. Fasten off. Leave rem 4 ( 5-6-6) sts unworked.
LEFT FRONT
Ribbing: Ch 8 ( 8-10-10).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 ( 7-9-9) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 7 ( 7½-8-8½)" [ 18 ( 19.5-20.5-21.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Do not turn.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 23 ( 27-27-31) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn. 
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 2 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.
Cont even in Bobble St Pat until work from lower edge measures approx 8 ( 8-10½-10½)" [ 20 ( 20-26.5-26.5) cm], ending on an 8th row of pat. Fasten off. 
Shape armhole: 1st row: (RS). Skip first 6 ( 6-6-8) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 ( 4-4-2) sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 17 ( 21-21-23) sts
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 ( 3-3-5) sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 0 ( 0-0-2) sts. 1 sc in each of last 0 ( 0-0-2) sts. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.
Cont even in pat over 17 ( 21-21-23) sts until armhole measures approx 3½ ( 4-4-4½)" [ 9 ( 10-10-11.5) cm], ending on either a 1st or 5th row of pat. Turn.
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to last 9 ( 12-14-14) sts. Hdc2tog (neck edge). Turn. Leave rem 6 ( 7-5-7) sts unworked. Turn. 10 ( 13-15-15) sts
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 9 ( 12-14-14) sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 8 ( 11-13-13) sts/
Size 4 only: Next 2 rows: Work even in pat.
Sizes 6, 8 and 10 only: 4th row: Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. ( 10-12-12) sts.
5th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. ( 9-11-11) sts.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
All sizes: Shape shoulder: Next row: Skip first 4 ( 4-5-5) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
RIGHT FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Front.
Cont even in Bobble St Pat until work from lower edge measures 8 ( 8-10½-10½)" [ 20 ( 20-26.5-26.5) cm], ending on an 8th row of pat. Turn.
Shape armhole: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 ( 2-2-0) sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 ( 2-2-0) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 17 ( 21-21-23) sts.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 0 ( 0-0-2) sts. 1 sc in each of next 0 ( 0-0-2) sts. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Cont even in pat over 17 ( 21-21-23) sts until armhole measures approx 3½ ( 4-4-4½)" [ 9 ( 10-10-11.5) cm], ending on either a 1st or 5th row of pat. 
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of next 5 ( 6-6-6) sts. Ch 2. Skip st last sl st was worked in. 1 hdc in next st (counts as hdc2tog). 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 12 ( 15-15-17) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 11 ( 14-14-16) sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. Skip first st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 10 ( 13-13-15) sts.
Size 4 only: Next 2 rows: Work even in pat.
Sizes 6, 8 and 10 only: 4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn. ( 10-12-12) sts.
5th row: Ch 2. Pat to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. ( 9-11-11) sts.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
All sizes: Shape shoulder: Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to last 4 ( 4-5-5) sts. Fasten off. Leave rem sts unworked.
SLEEVES
Ribbing: Ch 8 ( 8-10-10).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 ( 7-9-9) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 8½ ( 9-9-9½)" [ 21.5 ( 23-23-24) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Do not turn.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 23 ( 27-27-31) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn. 
Proceed in Bobble St Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.
Cont even in pat until Sleeves measure approx 10 ( 12-13-14)" [ 25.5 ( 30.5-33-35.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams.
Neckband: Ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Neckband (when slightly stretched) measures length to fit along neck edge, sewing in place as you work, taking care to allow stretch in seam.
Button Band: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st and work 45 ( 49-55-61) sc evenly up Left Front edge to top of neckband. Turn. 
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Place markers on band for 6 buttons, having bottom button ½" [1 cm] above lower edge, top button in center of neckband and rem 4 buttons spaced evenly between. 
Buttonhole Band: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st and work  45 ( 49-55-61) sc evenly down Right Front edge. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc to next button marker. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * 5 times more. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 2 sc in each ch-2 sp to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew in sleeves, placing rows above markers along unworked sts of Front and Back to form square armholes. Sew side and sleeve seams. Sew on buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

materials: Red Heart® “Stripes™” 5 (5, 6, 7) skeins 930 Posh Stripe A.
Red Heart® “Pomp-a-Doodle™” 1 (1, 2, 2) skeins 9955 Berries & Cream B.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 15 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
SHOP KITCROCHET GIRLIE HOODIE | CROCHET

Crochet Girlie Hoodie
Designed by Sharon Mann.
Directions for sweater are for child’s size small (2). 
Changes for medium (4), large (6) and extra large (8) 
are in parentheses.
Note: For best results when using Pomp-a-Doodle yarn, 
work with the yarn between the pom-poms and do not pull 
the pom-poms through the loop on the hook.
SWEATER 
BACK
With A, ch 47 (51, 55, 59).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn 
– 46 (50, 54, 58) sc.
Row 2-4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next
ch-1 space; repeat from * across, sc in last sc; turn – 22
(24, 26, 28) ch-1 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in each st and space across;
turn.
Row 6-28 (6-32, 6-36, 6-36): Repeat Rows 2-5 [5 (6, 7, 7)]
times; repeat Rows 2-4 once.
Shape Armhole
Row 29 (33, 37, 37): Slip st in next 4 sts, ch 1, sc in next 
st, sc across to last 4 sts; turn, leaving remaining sts 
unworked – 38 (42, 46, 50) sc.
Rows 30-49 (34-53, 38-57, 38-57): Repeat Rows 2-5, 5 
times, 
Right Shoulder
Rows 50-51 (54-55, 58-59, 58-59): Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc 
in each of next 8 (9, 10, 11) sts; turn, leaving remaining sts 
unworked – 9 (10, 11, 12) sc. Fasten off.
This hoodie design may have been inspired 
by a basic man’s hooded sweatshirt, but this 
version is as feminine as can be. Young girls 
will love having the fluffly pom-pom yarn as 
an edging on this colorful sweater.

Left Shoulder
With wrong side facing, skip next 20 (22, 24, 26) sts to the 
left of last st made in Row 1 of right shoulder.
Rows 50-51 (54-55, 58-59, 58-59): Ch 1, sc in same st, sc 
across; turn– 9 (10, 11, 12) sc. Fasten off.
FRONT
Work same as Back until 45 (49, 53, 53) rows have been 
completed from beginning.
Right Shoulder
Row 46-48 (50-52, 54-56, 54-56): Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 
1, skip next sc, sc in next st; repeat from * 3 (3, 4, 4) times, 
sc in last st; turn – 9 (9, 11, 11) sts.
Sizes Small and Large only 
Row 49 (-, 55, -): Ch 1, sc2tog in first 2 sts, sc in each st 
and space across; turn – 8 (-, 10, -) sc.
All Sizes
Rows 50-51 (53-55, 56-57, 57-59): Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc 
in each st and space across; turn – 8 (9, 10, 11) sc.
Fasten off.

Left Shoulder
With wrong side facing, skip next 20 (22, 24, 26) sts to the 
left of last st made in Row 1 of right shoulder. 
Row 46-48 (50-52, 52-54, 54-56): Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 
1, skip next sc, sc in next st; repeat from * 3 (3, 4, 4) times, 
sc in last st; turn – 9 (9, 11, 11) sts. Fasten off.
Sizes Small and Large only
Row 49 (-, 55, -): Ch 1, sc in each of first 7 (-, 9, -) sts, 
sc2tog in first 2 sts; turn – 8 (-, 10, -) sc.
All Sizes
Rows 50-51 (53-55, 56-57, 57-59): Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc 
in each st and space across; turn – 8 (9, 10, 11) sc.
Fasten off.

SLEEVES  (make 2)
With A, ch 25 (25, 27, 27).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn 
– 24 (24, 26, 26) sc.
Row 2-3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in each st across; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each st across to last st,
2 sc in last st; turn – 26 (26, 28, 28) sc.
Row 5-7: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next
ch-1 space; repeat from * across, sc in last sc; turn – 12
(12, 13, 13) ch-1 spaces.
Row 8: Repeat Row 4 – 28 (28, 30, 30) sc.
Rows 9-40 (9-44, 9-48, 9-52): Repeat Rows 5-8 [8 (9, 10,
11) times] – 44 (46, 50, 52) sc.
Row 41-43 (45-47, 49-51, 53-55): Repeat Rows 5-7– 21 
(22, 24, 25) ch-1 spaces.
Row 44 (48, 52, 56): Ch 1, sc in each st and space across. 
Fasten off.

Assembly
With A, sew front to back across shoulders. Fold sleeve 
in half lengthwise. Matching fold to shoulder seam, sew 
top of sleeve into armhole, sew sleeve seam. Repeat with 
other sleeve.

HOOD
Row 1: With right side facing, skip first 10 (11, 12, 13) sts 
on neck edge, join A in next st, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in 
each st across right front neck edge, sc in each st across 
back neck edge, sc in each st across left front neck edge 
to beginning; turn – 40 (44, 48, 52) sc.
Row 2-4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next 
sc; repeat from * across, sc in last st; turn – 19 (21, 23, 25) 
ch-1 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in each st and space across; 
turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 until hood measures 8 1/2 (9, 9 1/2, 10)” 
from beginning. Fasten off. 
Finishing
With right side facing, fold hood in half and with A, sew top 
of hood together.
Hood Edging
Row 1: With right side facing, join A at the center of the 
front neck, ch 1, work 72 (76, 78, 80) sc evenly spaced 
across the front edge of hood to center front; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc across working 14 (16, 18, 
18) decreases, evenly spaced across – 58 (60, 60, 62) sts.
Row 3: With right side facing, join B in first st, ch 1, sc in
each st across; turn.
Row 4-6: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
Lower Trim
Round 1: With right side facing, join B to side seam on 
bottom edge of sweater, ch 1, sc in each st around, join 
with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in 
first sc. Fasten off.
Video link for how to crochet with Pomp-a-Doodle: 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5yB9TsmGUd0

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (Prints: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Lsc (Long Single Crochet) = Insert hook in stitch indicated one row below and draw loop through. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Skip stitch under Lsc.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop
measurements: To fit chest measurement: S 10" [25.5 cm], M 14" [35.5 cm], L 17" [43 cm]. Finished chest: S 14½" [37 cm], M 19½" [49.5 cm], L 24½" [62 cm].
gauge: 12 sts and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting!
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given it applies to all sizes.

Texture Pat
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Lsc over next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
These 2 rows form pat.

NECKBAND
Ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until 29 ( 39-49) rows have been worked. Fasten off.

BODY
1st row: (RS). Working across long edge of Neckband. Ch 1. 1 sc in each row end to end of row. Turn. 29 (39-49) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 ( 2-1) sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row 43 ( 59-73) sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Proceed in Texture Pat for 2 rows.

Divide for Leg Openings: 1st row: (WS). Keeping cont of pat, pat across first 5 ( 7-9) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Work even in pat on these sts for 9 (13-17) rows more. Fasten off.
With WS facing, skip next 3 ( 5-7) sts of last long row for leg opening. Join yarn and pat across next 27 (35-41) sts for Back for 10 (14-18) rows.
Fasten off.
With WS facing, skip next 3 (5-7) sts of last long row for 2nd leg opening. Join yarn and pat across last 5 ( 7-9) sts for 10 ( 14-18) rows. Do not fasten off.
Next row: (Join Underbody). Pat across first 5 ( 7-9) sts. Ch 3 ( 5-7). Pat across next 27 ( 35-41) sts. Ch 3 ( 5-7). Pat across last 5 ( 7-9) sts. Turn.
Next row: Pat across first 5 ( 7-9) sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 ( 5-7) ch. Pat across next 27 ( 35-41) sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 (5-7) ch. Pat across last 5 ( 7-9) sts. Turn. 43 ( 59-73) sts.
Work 1 row even in pat.

Shape Back: Keeping cont of pat, dec 1 st each end of next row, then every other row 13 times more. 15 (31-45) sts. Fasten off.

Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.

Leg Openings: 1st rnd: (RS) Join yarn with sl st to any st at leg opening. Ch 1. 1 sc evenly around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew underbody seam from Neckband to first shaping row of Back.
Edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at seam. Ch 1. 1 sc evenly around entire edge, working 3 sc in corners. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1 Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Smoothie™: 3 (4, 5, 6, 7) balls 9266 Royal
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 5 pattern repeats = 4" (10 cm) (one pattern repeat consists of one cross st and one chain); 5 rows = 4" (10 cm) in cross st; 6 hdc = 2" (10 cm); 4 rows = 2" (5 cm) in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LACE
Left Front Panel (make 2)
Ch 26 (29, 32, 35, 38).
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 6th ch from hook, working in front of dc just made, dc in 5th ch from hook (first X-st made) (beginning 4 skipped ch count as first skipped ch, dc, ch 1), *ch 1, skip next 2 ch, dc in next ch, working in front of dc just made, dc in 2nd skipped ch (X-st made); repeat from * across to last 2 ch, ch 1, skip next ch, dc last ch, turn—7 (8, 9, 10, 11) X-sts, 2 dc, and 8 (9, 10, 11, 12) ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1 here and throughout), skip first dc, (ch 1, X-st) in each X-st across to beginning ch, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn.
Rows 3–27 (27, 29, 29, 29): Repeat Row 2.
Row 28 (28, 30, 30, 30): Ch 1, hdc in first dc, hdc in each ch-1 space and dc of each X-st across, working last dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—24 (27, 30, 33, 36) hdc.
Rows 29–31 (29–31, 31–33, 31–33, 31–34): Ch 1, hdc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Left Front Band
Row 1 (right side): With right side of first Panel facing and working in ends of rows, join yarn with slip st in first row at top left, ch 1, evenly space 58 (58, 62, 62, 64) hdc across, turn—58 (58, 62, 62, 64) hdc.
Rows 2–5 (2–5, 2–6, 2–6, 2–6): Ch 1, hdc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
Right Front Band
Row 1 (right side): With right side of other Panel facing and working in ends of rows, join yarn with slip st in first row at bottom right, ch 1, evenly space 58 (58, 62, 62, 64) hdc across, turn—58 (58, 62, 62, 64) hdc.
Rows 2–5 (2–5, 2–6, 2–6, 2–6): Ch 1, hdc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
Back Panel (make 2)
Ch 26 (29, 32, 35, 38).
Rows 1 and 2: Work same as Front Panel. 
Rows 3–30 (3–30, 3–32, 3–32, 3–32): Repeat Row 2.
Rows 31–34 (31–34, 33–36, 33–36, 33–37): Work same as Rows 28–31 (28–31, 30–33, 30–33, 30–34): of Front Panel. Fasten off.
Left Back Band
Row 1 (right side): With right side of first Panel facing and working in ends of rows, join yarn with slip st in first row at bottom right, ch 1, evenly space 64 (64, 68, 68, 70) hdc across, turn—64 (64, 68, 68, 70) hdc.
Rows 2–5 (2–5, 2–5, 2–5, 2–6): Ch 1, hdc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
Right Back Band
Row 1 (right side): With right side of other Panel facing and working in ends of rows, join yarn with slip st in first row at top left, ch 1, evenly space 64 (64, 68, 68, 70) hdc across, turn—64 (64, 68, 68, 70) hdc.
Rows 2–5 (2–5, 2–5, 2–5, 2–6): Ch 1, hdc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Back Seam
With right sides of long edges of Back Bands held together and working through both thicknesses, join with slip st in first hdc at lower edge, slip st in next 51 (51, 55, 55, 57) sts across; leave remaining sts unworked— 52 (52, 56, 56, 58) slip sts. Fasten off.
Shoulder and Side Seams
With right sides held together and Front Bands centered, pin Front Panels to corresponding Back Panels. With end tails, sew last rows of each pair of Panels together.
Pin Front Panels to Back Panels at side seam, placing stitch marker 6½, (7, 7½, 8, 8½)" (16.5 [18, 19, 20.5, 21.5] cm) below shoulder seam for bottom of armhole. Beginning 2 (2, 2, 2½, 3)" (5 [5, 5, 6.5, 7.5] cm) from bottom edge of Front Panel, seam sides together, ending at marker.
FINISHING
Lower Edging: With right side of lower edge of Back facing and working in opposite side of foundation ch and in ends of rows, join yarn with sc in first ch, evenly space 59 sc across—60 sc. Fasten off.
Repeat Edging across lower edges of each Front Panel, evenly spacing 29 sc across—30 sc.
Armhole Edging: With RS of Armhole facing, join yarn with sc at bottom edge, working in ends of rows, evenly space 49 sc around; join with slip st in first sc—50 sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Unforgettable™: 4 (5, 5, 6, 6) balls 3950 Petunia A
abbreviations: A and B = Color A, and color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 11 sts = 4”; 9 rows/rounds = 4” in sweater body pattern; 12 sts = 4”; 7 rounds = 4” in sleeve pattern
instructions:
SWEATER
Front
Front Square
With A, ch 12.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc), dc in each remaining ch across; change to B in last st, turn—10 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 3 sc in first st, sc in next 8 sts, 3 sc in next st; working down side edge, sc in end of Row 1; working across opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in next 8 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working down side edge, sc in end of Row 1; join with slip st in first sc, turn—30 sc. Place a marker in the center sc of each 3-sc corner.
Round 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), [dc in each st to next marker, 3 dc in marked st, move marker to center dc of 3-dc just made] 4 times, change to A in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—38 dc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in each st to next marker, 3 sc in marked st, move marker to center sc of 3-sc just made] 4 times, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc, turn—46 sc.
Round 5: Ch 3, [dc in each st to next marker, 3 dc in marked st, move marker to center dc of 3-dc just made] 4 times, dc in each st a round; change to B in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—54 dc.
Round 6: With B, repeat Round 4—62 sc.
Round 7: Repeat Round 5; change to A in last st—70 dc.
Rounds 8–23 (23, 27, 27, 31): Repeat last 4 rounds 4 (4, 5, 5, 6) times—198 (198, 230, 230, 262) dc.
Small (Large, XX-Large) only
Round 24 (28, 32): Repeat Round 4 once more—206 (238, 270) sc. Fasten off.
Medium (X-Large) only
Rounds 24 (28)–26 (30): Repeat Rounds 4–6 once more—222 (254) sc. Fasten off.
Top of Front
Row 1 (Right Side): With Right Side facing, join A with slip st in a marked st to work across a short edge, ch 3, dc in each st across to next marked st, dc in marked st and change to B, turn—49 (53, 57, 61, 65) sts.
Remove all st markers. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in each st across; change to A in last st, turn.
Continue to change color every other row, throughout remainder of front.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2.
Shape Front Neck
Row 7: Ch 3, dc in next 11 (13, 15, 17, 19) sts, hdc in next 8 sts, sc in next 9 sts, hdc in next 8 sts, dc in each remaining st across; change to A in last st, turn.
Row 8: With A, repeat Row 2.
Medium (Large, X-Large, XX-Large) only
Rows 9–10 (10, 12, 12): Repeat Rows 3–4 (4, 6, 6).
Shape First Shoulder
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 3, dc in next 14 (16, 18, 20, 22) sts, turn; leave remaining sts unworked for neck and second shoulder—15 (17, 19, 21, 23) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across, turn—14 (16, 18, 20, 22) sts.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4–7: Repeat last 2 rows twice—12 (14, 16, 18, 20) sts.
Row 8: Repeat Row 2—11 (13, 15, 17, 19) sts. Fasten off.
Shape Second Shoulder
Row 1 (Right Side): With Right Side facing, skip next 19 unworked sts following first shoulder (for front neck), join yarn with slip st in next st, ch 3, dc in each remaining st across, turn—15 (17, 19, 21, 23) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—14 (16, 18, 20, 22) sts.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4–7: Repeat last 2 rows twice—12 (14, 16, 18, 20) sts.
Row 8: Repeat Row 2—11 (13, 15, 17, 19) sts. Fasten off.
Back
Using A throughout (do not change color), work same as front.
Sew shoulder seams. Sew side seams, beginning at lower edge and sewing to just below top corner of front square.
Sleeve (Make 2)
With Right Side facing, join A with slip st at underarm.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 48 (54, 54, 60, 60) sc evenly spaced around armhole edge; join with slip st in first sc—48 (54, 54, 60, 60) sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), dc in same st as join (first V-st made), skip next st, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next st (V-st made), skip next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—24 (27, 27, 30, 30) V-sts.
Round 4: (Slip st, ch 3, dc) in first ch-1 space, 2 dc in each remaining ch-1 space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 6–37: Repeat last 4 rounds 8 more times (or until sleeve is desired length).
