Next rnd: (RS). Skip first V-st and next 17 (18-20-22-23) groups of 3-dc (Sleeve). Skip next V-st. Join yarn with sl st in sp between last skipped V-st and next group of 3 dc. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp. *3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to next V-st, ending with 3 dc in sp.

materials: Girl’s Poncho: Hot Blue 12½ oz (350 g), Hot Pink 2½ oz (70 g), Bright Yellow 3 oz (85 g), Hot Lime 2½ oz (70 g), Ultra Peach 1½ oz (40 g)
Doll’s Poncho and Headscarf: Hot Blue 2¼ oz (60 g), Hot Pink 1 oz (30 g), Bright Yellow 1½ oz (40 g), Hot Lime 1 oz (30 g), Ultra Peach ½ oz (15 g)
measurements: Girl's Poncho: One Size to fit child 4 to 8 yrs; Doll's Poncho: To fit 18 ins [45 cm] Springfield CollectionTM Doll.
gauge: Girl’s Poncho: Basic Motif = 3¾ ins [9.5 cm] square with size G/6 hook; Doll’s Poncho: Basic Motif = 2½ ins [6 cm] square with size H/8 hook; Girl’s Headscarf: 16 sts and 7 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in pat with size H/8 hook; Doll’s Headscarf: 16 sts and 10 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in pat with size H/8 hook.
instructions:
Instructions
Girl’s Poncho
Motif 1: A = Blue, B = Lime, C = Pink.
Motif 2: A = Peach, B = Blue, C = Yellow.
Motif 3: A = Blue, B = Lime, C = Peach.
Motif 4: A = Yellow, B = Blue, C = Lime.
Motif 5: A = Blue, B = Pink, C = Lime.
Motif 6: A = Blue, B = Yellow, C = Pink.
Motif 7: A = Lime, B = Blue, C = Yellow.
Motif 8: A = Yellow, B = Blue, C = Peach.
Basic Motif: With A and size G/6 hook, ch 5. Join with ss to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc in ring) 3 times. Ch 2. Ss in top of ch-3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join B with ss to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last ss. Ch 1. [(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Ss in top of ch-3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join C with ss to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last ss. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Ss in top of ch-3. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join Blue with ss to any ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp. *1 sc in each of next 11 sts. 3 sc in next corner sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Ss in first sc. Fasten off.
Make 6 each of Motifs 1, 2, 3, 4, 6 and 7.
Make 4 of Motif 5 and 2 of Motif 8.
Crochet Motifs tog as shown in Diagram for Front and Back.
Crochet Front and Back tog along shoulders. (See page 16).
Neck Edging: 1st rnd: With size G/6 hook and RS of work facing, join Yellow with ss at right shoulder seam. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd sc evenly around neck edge working sc3tog in corners as follows: Draw up a loop in each of next 3 corner sc. Yoh and draw through 4 loops on hook. Break Yellow. Join Pink. Ss to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around working sc3tog in corners as before. Break Pink. Join Blue. Ss to first sc.
3rd rnd: As 2nd rnd.
4th rnd: Ch 4. *Miss 1 sc. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Rep from * around, working dc3tog in corners as follows: (Yoh and draw up a loop in next corner st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Ss in 3rd ch of ch-4. Fasten off.
Lower Edging: 1st rnd: With size G/6 hook and RS of work facing, join Yellow with ss to lower edge of right shoulder seam. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd sc evenly around lower edge working 3 sc in corners. Break Yellow. Join Pink. Ss to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around working 3 sc in corners. Break Pink. Join Blue. Ss to first sc.
3rd rnd: As 2nd rnd. Ss to first sc. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut lengths of Blue, 8 ins [20.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, knot into fringe around lower edge of Poncho. Trim fringe evenly.
Cord: Cut 2 strands of Blue, each 8½ feet [2.5 m] long. With both strands tog hold one end and with someone holding other end, twist strands to the right until they begin to curl. Fold the 2 ends tog and tie in a knot so they will not unravel. The strands will now twist themselves tog. Adjust length if desired. Weave Cord through 4th rnd of Neck edging. Sew Tassel to each end of Cord.
Tassel: (Make 2). Cut a piece of cardboard 4 ins [10 cm] wide. Wind Blue yarn around cardboard 40 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through a needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1 inch [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly.
Girl’s Headscarf
With Pink and size H/8 hook, ch 5. Join with ss to form ring.
1st row: Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc and ch 2). 3 dc in ring. Ch 2. 3 dc in ring. Ch 2. 1 dc in ring, changing to Lime at end of dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 5. 3 dc in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in last ch-2 sp, changing to Yellow at end of last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 5. 3 dc in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in last ch-2 sp, changing to Pink at end of last dc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 5. 3 dc in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in last ch-2 sp, changing to Lime at end of last dc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 5. 3 dc in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in last ch-2 sp, changing to Yellow at end of last dc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 5. 3 dc in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in last ch-2 sp, changing to Pink at end of last dc. Turn.
Rep last 3 rows once more, omitting color change at end of last row and working extra repeats of 3 dc groups as established. Do not turn. Next row: Ch 1. 3 sc in loop created by last dc worked. 3 sc in side of each dc and ch-5 loop (including foundation ring) along bottom edge of Headscarf. Fasten off.
Edging and Ties: With size H/8 hook, join Blue with ss to first sc worked at bottom edge of Headscarf. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sc as last ss. 1 sc in each sc across bottom of Headscarf. 2 sc in last sc (corner). Ch 45. Ss in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of ch. 1 sc in same st as last sc. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp along side of Headscarf to next ch-2 sp (point of Headscarf). 3 sc in point. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp along other side of Headscarf. Ss in first sc. Ch 45. Ss in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of ch. Ss in next sc. Fasten off.
Doll’s Poncho
Motif 1: A = Lime, B = Yellow; Motif 2: A = Yellow, B = Pink; Motif 3: A = Pink, B = Lime; Motif 4: A = Peach, B = Yellow.
Basic Motif: With A and size H/8 hook, ch 4. Join with ss to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in ring. (Ch 1. 3 hdc in ring) 3 times. Ch 1. Ss in top of ch-2. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join B with ss to any ch-1 sp. Ch 2. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 3 hdc) in same sp as last ss. [(3 hdc. Ch 1. 3 hdc) in next ch-1 sp] 3 times. Ss in top of ch-2. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Blue with ss to any ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as last ss. (1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 3 sc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Ss in first sc. Fasten off.
Make 6 of Motif 1, 5 each of Motifs 2 and 4 and 4 of Motif 3.
Crochet Motifs tog as shown in Diagram for Front and Back. Crochet Front to Back tog along shoulders, matching W to Y and Z to X. (See page 16).
Neck Edging: 1st rnd: With size H/8 hook and RS of work facing, join Blue with ss at right shoulder seam. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd sc evenly around neck edge working sc3tog in corners. Ss in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around working sc3tog in corners as before. Ss to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. Miss first sc. *1 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * around, working dc3tog in corners. Ss in top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Lower Edging: With size H/8 hook and RS of work facing, join Blue with ss to lower edge of right shoulder seam. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd sc evenly around lower edge working 3 sc in corners. Ss to first sc. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut lengths of Blue, 4 ins [10 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, knot into fringe around lower edge of Poncho. Trim fringe evenly.
Cord: Cut a length of Blue 100 ins [254 cm] long. Fold yarn in half and work as given for Cord of Girl’s Poncho. Lace cord through 3rd rnd of Neck Edge as illustrated.
Doll’s Headscarf
With Pink and size H/8 hook, ch 5. Join with ss to form ring.
1st row: Ch 5 (counts as 1 hdc and ch-3). 3 hdc in ring. Ch 2. 3 hdc in ring. Ch 2. 1 hdc in ring, changing to Lime at end of hdc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 5. 3 hdc in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 hdc. Ch 2. 3 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-3 sp, changing to Yellow at end of last hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 5. 3 hdc in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 hdc. Ch 2. 3 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-3 sp, changing to Pink at end of last hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 5. 3 hdc in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 hdc. Ch 2. 3 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in last ch-3 sp, changing to Lime at end of last hdc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 5. 3 hdc in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. (3 hdc. Ch 2. 3 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. (3 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in last ch-3 sp, changing to Yellow at end of last hdc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 5. 3 hdc in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. (3 hdc. Ch 2. 3 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. (3 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in last ch-3 sp, changing to Pink at end of last hdc. Turn.
Rep 4th and 5th rows once more, omitting color change at end of last row and working extra repeats of 3 hdc groups as established. Do not turn. Ch 1. 2 sc in loop created by last hdc worked. 2 sc in side of each hdc and ch-5 loop (including foundation ring) along bottom edge of Headscarf. Fasten off.
Edging and Ties: With size H/8 hook, join Blue with ss to first sc worked at bottom edge of Headscarf. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sc as last ss. 1 sc in each sc across bottom. 2 sc in last sc (corner). Ch 22. Ss in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of ch. 1 sc in same st as last sc. 1 sc in each hdc and ch-1 sp along side to next ch-2 sp (point). 3 sc in point. 1 sc in each hdc and ch-1 sp along other side. Ss in first sc. Ch 22. Ss in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of ch. Ss in next sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat ® Handicrafter Cotton (50 g/1.75 oz/73 m/80 yds) or Bernat ® Satin (100 g/3.5 oz/149 m/163 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 16 hdc and 12 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.
Notes: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw a loop in next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color.

BACK
With MC, ch 74 (82-90-101-117-133).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 73 (81-89-100-116-132) sc. Join A.
**2nd row: With A, ch 1. Working through front loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Join B.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. Working through back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Join MC.
4th row: With MC, as 2nd row. Join A.
5th row: With A, as 3rd row. Join B.
6th row: With B, as 2nd row. Join MC.
7th row: With MC, as 3rd row. Join A.
8th row: With A, as 2nd row. Join B.
9th row: With B, as 3rd row. Join MC.
10th row: With MC, ch 2. Working through front loops only, 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn.**

Sizes XS/S, M and L only: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 hdc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – hdc2tog made. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog over last 2 hdc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more, then 1st row once. 67 (75-83) sts.
Work 3 rows even.
Next row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Work 4 rows even.
Rep last 5 rows 3 times more. 75 (83-91) sts.

All sizes: Cont even until work from beg measures 11 (11 ½-11 ½-14-15-15) ins [28 (29-29-35.5-38-38) cm], ending with a WS row.

Shape arm holes: Next row: Sl st in each of first 6 (7-9-10-15-17) hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 6 (7-9-10-15-17) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 63 (69-73-80-86-98) hdc.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Rep last row 4 (6-7-8-9-13) times more. 53 (55-57-62-66-70) sts.
Cont even until arm hole measures 7 ½ (7½-8-8 ½-9-9 ½) ins [19 (19-20.5-21.5-23-24) cm], ending with a WS row.

Shape back neck: Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 8 (9-9-15-15-17) hdc. Hdc2tog over next 2 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. 8 (9-9-15-15-17) sts. Fasten off.
With RS facing, miss next 33 (33-35-28-32-32) sts. Join MC with sl st to next st. Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Pat to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. 8 (9-9-15-15-17) sts. Fasten off.

LEFT FRONT
***With MC, ch 37 (41-45-51-59-67).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 36 (40-44-50-58-66) sc. Join A.
Work from ** to ** as given for Back.***

Sizes XS/S, M and L only: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more, then 1st row once. 33 (37-41) sts.

Work 3 rows even.
Next row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Work 4 rows even.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. Work 4 rows even. Rep last 10 rows once more. 37 (41-45) sts.

All sizes: Cont even until work from beg measures 11 (11 ½-11 ½-14-15-15) ins [28 (29-29-35.5-38-38) cm], ending with a WS row. Shape arm hole: 1st row: Sl st in each of first 6 (7-9-10-15-17) hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. 31 (34-36-40-43-49) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 (2-3-3-4-6) time(s) more, then 1st row 1 (1-0-1-0-0) time more. 26 (27-28-31-33-35) sts.
Cont even until arm hole measures 5 (5-5 ½-6-6-6) ins [12.5 (12.5-14-15-15-15) cm], ending with a WS row.

Shape neck: Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 11 (12-12-18-18-20) hdc. Hdc2tog over next 2 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more. 8 (9-9-15-15-17) sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until arm hole measures same length as back before shoulder. Fasten off.

RIGHT FRONT
Work from *** to *** as given for Left Front.
Sizes XS/S, M and L only: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog over last 2 hdc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more, then 1st row once. 33 (37-41) sts.

Work 3 rows even.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Work 4 rows even.
Next row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Work 4 rows even.
Rep last 10 rows once more. 37 (41-45) sts.

All sizes: Cont even until work from beg measures 11 (11 ½-11 ½-14-15-15) ins [28 (29-29-35.5-38-38) cm], ending with a WS row.

Shape arm hole: 1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 6 (7-9-10-15-17) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 31 (34-36-40-43-49) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 (2-3-3-4-6) time(s) more, then 1st row 1 (1-0-1-0-0) time more. 26 (27-28-31-33-35) sts.

Cont even until arm hole measures 5 (5-5 ½-6-6-6) ins [12.5 (12.5-14-15-15-15) cm], ending with a WS row.

Shape neck: Next row: Sl st in each of first 13 (13-14-11-13-13) hdc. Ch 2. Hdc2tog over next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 11 (12-12-18-18-20) hdc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more. 8 (9-9-15-15-17) sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until arm hole measures same length as back before shoulder. Fasten off.

SLEEVES
With MC, ch 39 (39-41-41-45-47).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 38 (38-40-40-44-46) sc.
Work from ** to ** as given for Back.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. Work 3 (3-3-1-1-1) rows even in hdc.
Rep last 4 (4-4-2-2-2) rows 2 (7-7-3-11-15) times more. 44 (54-56-48-68-78) hdc.
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. Work 4 (4-4-2-2-2) rows even in hdc.
Rep last 5 (5-5-3-3-3) rows 4 (1-1-9-3-1) time(s) more. 54 (58-60-68-76-82) hdc.
Cont even until work from beg measures 17 ½ (18-18-18 ½-17 ½-17) ins [44.5 (45.5-45.5-47-45.5-43) cm], ending with a WS row.

Shape top: 1st row: Sl st across first 4 (5-6-7-10-11) sts. Ch 2. Hdc2tog over next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 6 (7-8-9-12-13) sts. Hdc2tog over next 2 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 44 (46-46-52-54-58) sts.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 4 (2-5-3-4-2) times more, then 2nd row to 16 (16-16-18-18-18) sts. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Pin garment pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry.
Sew shoulder seams.
Neck edging: Join MC with sl st to right front corner of neck edge. Work 24 (24-25-27-31-35) sc up right front neck edge, 32 (32-34-34-38-38) sc across back neck edge, 24 (24-25-27-31-35) sc down left front neck edge. Join A. Turn. 80 (80-84-88-100-108) sc.
Next row: (WS). Working in front loops only, with A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join B. Turn.
Next row: Working in back loops only, with B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join B. Turn. Fasten off.
Button band: With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st to neck edge corner of left front. Ch 1. Work 64 (66-68-80-84-84) sc evenly down left front edge.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row.
Buttonhole band: With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st to bottom corner of right front. Ch 1. Work 64 (66-68-80-84-84) sc evenly down left front edge.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 (7-9-6-10-10) sc. *Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 (9-9-10-10-10) sc. Rep from * 4 (4-4-5-5-5) times more. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row, working 2 sc in ch-2 sps. Fasten off.

FLOWER (Make 6).
With B, ch 5. Join in ring.
1st rnd: 10 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: *Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 5. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Using chain st and lazy-daisy st, embroider stems and leaves. Sew on flowers as shown on Diagram. Sew in sleeves. Sew side and sleeve seams.

pattern_name: Meet in the Middle Crochet Hexagon Cardigan
materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 6 rnds in pat = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written XS/S (M/L-XL/2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

Notes:
• Cardigan is comprised of 2 Hexagons which are folded and seamed along the top to form Sleeves and seamed down center back.
Approx


Hexagon Shape will become wavy as you progress and will not lay flat as it begins to grow. Do not worry if your piece does not lay flat before folding! Trust the process!

HEXAGON (Make 2)
See diagram on page 4.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ring. Ch 2. (3 dc. Ch 2) 5 times in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 6 groups of 3 dc and 6 ch-2 sps.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc to corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same corner ch-2 sp as sl. *Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Repeat (Rep) from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc to corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same corner ch-2 sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep last Hexagon rnd 3 (3-5-5) times more, noting 1 more 3-dc cluster will be worked between corners on subsequent rnds.
Break A and fasten off.

NOTE: Your work will not lay flat at this point, don’t worry! It’s part of the process!
With RS facing, join B with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp.
With B, rep last Hexagon rnd, as before, 4 (4-4-5) times more, noting 1 more 3-dc cluster will be worked between corners on subsequent rnds.
Fasten off at end of last rnd.
With RS facing, join C with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. 
With C, rep last Hexagon rnd, as before, 3 (4-4-5) times more, noting 1 more 3-dc cluster will be worked between corners on subsequent rnds.
With RS facing, join D with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. 
With D, rep last Hexagon rnd, as before, until piece measures 10½ (12-14½-16½)" [26.5 (30.5-37-42) cm] from Center Back to side when folded into shape as shown in diagram.
Fasten off at end of last rnd.

FOLD INTO SHAPE
Fold Hexagon as shown, to create upside down L shape:
Top of Sleeve
10½ -12-14½-16½
Sew shoulder seams
Thread yarn needle with length of D approx twice the length of top of Sleeve.
With RS facing, align sts along top of Sleeve. Working through both front and back of Sleeve, join yarn through corner ch-2 sp of Front and corresponding corner ch-2 sp of Back.
Insert needle through top of next dc at Front and corresponding dc at Back. Pull yarn through to join.
Keep a nice, relaxed tension on the sewing yarn making sure not to pull too tightly as this will cause the seam to pucker.
Cont in this manner, inserting needle through corresponding sts and ch-1 sps at Front and Back of Sleeve, until end of shoulder seam. Work through last corner ch-2 sp and fasten off, leaving a length to weave in end.
Weave in and secure yarn end by inserting needle down through sts and through bottom loops of dc on WS of work. Trim yarn end.

Center Back Seam
Align Left and Right sides at center back. Sew center back seam using whipstitch as given for shoulder seam. Fasten off and secure end at bottom ch-2 sp.

Bottom Hem
See diagram on page 4.
Note: Bottom Hem is worked back and forth in rows.
With RS facing, join C with sl st in corner ch-2 sp at bottom corner of Left Front.
1st row: Ch 3  (counts as dc). 2 dc in same ch-2 sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * across bottom edge to ch-2 corner sp at bottom corner of Right Front, taking note that at center back seam, 3 dc will be worked in last ch-2 sp of left side. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-2 corner sp of right side.1 dc in bottom right front ch-2 corner sp. Turn.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as dc. Ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. Fasten off C.
3rd row: (RS). Join B in beg ch-1 sp of previous row. With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as sl st.*Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Turn.
4th row: (WS). With B, as 2nd row. Fasten off B. Join A.
5th and 6th rows: With A, as 3rd and 2nd rows. Fasten off A. Join D. 
7th and 8th rows: With D, as 3rd and 2nd rows. Fasten off.

Sleeve Cuffs
See diagram on page 4.
Note: When working next rnd, work 3 dc in last ch-sp before shoulder seam. Ch 1, then work 3 dc in next sp of the right side and cont to end of rnd.
With RS facing, lay Sleeve flat. Join A with sl st to ch-1 sp on last row of Sleeve at bottom of Sleeve.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same ch-1 sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same ch-1 sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break A.
Join B with sl st to last ch-1 sp of previous rnd.
3rd and 4th rnds: With B, rep last 2 rnds. Break B at end of last rnd.
Join C with sl st to last ch-1 sp of previous rnd. 
5th and 6th rnds: With C, rep last 2 rnds. Break C at end of last rnd.
Join D with sl st to last ch-1 sp of previous rnd.
7th and 8th rnds: With D, rep last 2 rnds. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Heathers™ (5 oz/141 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Sizes: XS/S 6 balls; M 6 balls; L 7 balls; XL 8 balls; 2/3XL 9 balls; 4/5XL 11 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

BACK
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. 
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
• There is no RS or WS. Fabric is reversible. 
**Ch 39 (41-45-49-53-57). 
1st row:  1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 37 (39-43-47-51-55) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 sc in next hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 
Rep last row for Texture Pat, noting side incs on every row until there are 73 (79-85-91-101-109) sts,
Next row:  (RS). Ch 3. 1 sc in next hdc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. Turn. 
Next row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row.** 
Rep last 2 rows for Texture Pat until work from beg measures 23" [58.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. 

FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Back.
Rep last 2 rows for Texture Pat until work from beg measures 20" [51 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 3. (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) 13 (14-15-16-18-20) times. Hdc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
2nd row:  Ch 2. Hdc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Pat to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows once more. 
24 (26-28-30-34-38) sts. 
Cont even in pat until work from beg measures 23" [58.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. 
With RS facing, skip next 15 (17-19-21-23-23) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 2. Hdc2tog over same sp as last sl st and next st. Pat to end of row. Turn. 
Next row:  Pat to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 
Next row: Hdc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows once more. 
24 (26-28-30-34-38) sts. 
Cont even in pat until work from beg measures 23" [58.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. 

SLEEVES
Note: Sleeves are worked side to side.
Ch 49. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 47 hdc. 
2nd row:  Ch 2. Working in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, (see diagram), 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 14 (14-16-16-18-18)" [35.5 (35.5-40.5-40.5-45.5-45.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. 

FINISHING
Pin garment pieces to measurements. Cover with damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry. Sew shoulder seams. PM 7 (7-8-8-9-9)" [18 (18.5-20.5-20.5-23-23) cm] down from shoulder seams on Front and Back. Sew side edge of Sleeve between markers. Sew foundation ch and last row of Sleeve together. Sew 5" [12.5 cm] side seam below armholes. Leave rem side seam open.
Bottom edging:  With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to right side seam opening. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around Front and Back bottom edges. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Collar: Ch 31. 
Note: Collar is worked side to side.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 29 hdc. 
2nd row:  Ch 2. Working in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, (see diagram), 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Collar from beg (when slightly stretched) measures length to fit around neck opening. Beg at left shoulder seam, sew in position as you work. Fasten off. Sew side seam, reversing 5" [12.5 cm] for turn back. 
Kangaroo Pocket: Ch 35 (35-35-41-41-41). 
1st row:  (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 33 (33-33-39-39-39) sts.
2nd row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row:  Ch 1. *1 sc in first dc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row:  Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows for pattern until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Shape Pocket: 1st row:  (RS). Sl st in each of first 3 sts. Ch 2. Hdc2tog over next 2 sts. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. Leave rem 3 sts unworked. 
2nd row:  Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 
Fasten off. 
Pin Pocket to center of Front as shown in photo. Sew Pocket in position.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 (1, 2, 2) Skeins 964 Primary.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 11 dc = 4”; 6 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SWEATER
Right Armhole and Back
Ch 26 (30, 34, 38), slip st in first ch to form ring. Place marker for beginning of round.
Armhole Round: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each ch around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 26 (30, 34, 38) sts.
Upper Back
Rows 1-6 (7, 8, 9): Ch 3, turn, dc in next 11 (12, 14, 15) dc, place marker in first st worked, leave remaining sts unworked for Front – 12 (13, 15, 16) dc.
Last Row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in each dc across. 
Fasten off.
Left Armhole and Back
Ch 26 (30, 34, 38), slip st in first ch to form ring. Place marker for beginning of round.
Armhole Round: Ch 3, dc in each ch around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 26 (30, 34, 38) sts.
Upper Back
Row 1: Ch 3, dc in next 11 (12, 14, 15) dc, place marker in last st worked, leave remaining sts unworked for Front – 12 (13, 15, 16) dc.
Rows 2-6 (7, 8, 9): Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc.
Last Row: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each dc across. 
Do not fasten off.
Joining Upper Backs: With right sides of both Upper Back pieces together and working through both layers, sc in each st across to join Backs. 
Fasten off. 
Sleeves
Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn in any space between 2 dc on Round 1 of Armhole, ch 4, (counts as tr here and throughout), 2 tr in same space, [working in space between dc, 3 tr in each space] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 78 (90, 102, 114) tr.
Rounds 2-3 (3, 4, 4): Ch 4, tr in each tr around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Decrease Round 1: Ch 2, hdc in every other tr around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 39 (45, 51, 57) hdc.
Decrease Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in every other hdc around to last st, hdc in last st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 20 (23, 26, 29) hdc.
Next Round: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc, slip st in top of beginning ch. 
Last Round: Ch 1, sc in each hdc around, slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
Lower Back
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn in first st along lower edge of Joined Backs, ch 3, dc 24 (28, 32, 36) sts evenly across edges of Lower Backs – 25 (29, 33, 37) dc.
Rows 2-5 (6, 9, 11): Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across. 
Fasten off.
Left Front 
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn in marked st of Row 1 of Upper Back, ch 3, dc in next 14 (17, 19, 22) unworked sts, dc 10 (12, 16, 20) sts evenly along edge of Lower Back – 25 (30, 36, 43) dc. 
Rows 2-6 (7, 8, 9): Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across, 
Fasten off.
Right Front
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn in last row of Lower Back, ch 3, dc 10 (12, 16, 20) sts evenly along edge of Lower Back, dc in next 15 (18, 20, 23) unworked sts of Row 1 of Upper Back – 25 (30, 36, 43) dc. 
Rows 2-6 (7, 8, 9): Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across, 
Fasten off.
Join Shoulders
Place markers 1¼ (1¼, 1½, 1½)” either side of center Back seam for Back neck. 
With right sides together and working through both layers, slip st edges of rows of Front and Back together, easing in fullness and leaving marked section . 
Peplum
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn to lower corner of Left Front, ch 1, sc 12 (13, 16, 17) evenly across lower edge of Left Front, sc 26 (30, 34, 38) across Lower Back, sc 12 (13, 16, 17) evenly across lower edge of Right Front – 50 (56, 66, 72) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in next 11 (12, 15, 16) sc, ch 2, skip 2 sc, hdc to end of row.
Rows 4-5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across– 50 (56, 66, 72) sc.
Row 6: Ch 4, turn, tr in each sc across. 
Edging Round: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first tr, 3 hdc in each tr across bottom edge, turn 90 degrees to work up along front edges of Peplum, work 6 sc along edges of Peplum (up to row 4 of Peplum, ch 60 (60, 70, 70), sc into row 3 of Peplum, forming a long loop, and in each st along Front edge, sc 6 (6, 7, 7) sts along skipped sts of Back neck, sc in each st along opposite Front edge to row 3 of Peplum, ch 90 (90, 100, 100), work 6 sc along edges of Peplum, slip st in first st. One of the tying loops IS longer than the other. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Pull chain through skipped sts on Row 3 of Peplum and tie chains together to close.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 12 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Sc/Ch-1 Pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.
• Follow color guide shown in Materials section (Contrast A, B, C, D, E). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A, B, C, D, E.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

BACK
**With D, ch 32 ( 38-40-44-48-52). With E, ch 32 ( 38-40-44-48-52). 64 ( 76-80-88-96-104) ch total.
1st row: (RS). With E, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 15 ( 18-19-22-23-25) times, joining D in last sc. With D, *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn. 63 ( 75-79-87-95-103) sts.
2nd row: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 15 ( 18-19-22-23-25) times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Join E. With E, *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: With E, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 15 ( 18-19-22-23-25) times, joining D in last sc. With D, *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Sc/Ch-1 pat until piece measures 11 ( 11-11-12-12-12)" [ 28 ( 28-28-30.5-30.5-30.5) cm], ending on a 2nd row. Fasten off.
Shape square armholes:
1st row: (RS). Skip first 4 ( 4-6-6-8-8) sts. Join B with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. Pat across next 27 ( 33-33-37-39-43) sts, joining A in last st. With A, pat across next 28 ( 34-34-38-40-44) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 55 ( 67-67-75-79-87) sts.**
Cont even in pat, changing colors at center of row as before, until Armholes measure 8 ( 9-9-10-10-11)" [ 20.5 ( 23-23-25.5-25.5-28) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Back.
Cont even in pat, changing colors at center of row as before, until work from beg measures 8 rows less than Back, ending on a WS row.
Shape neck: Left side: 1st row:  
(RS). Ch 1. Pat across 24 ( 28-28-32-34-36) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog (over first sc and ch-1 sp). Pat to end of row. Turn. 23 ( 27-27-31-33-35) sts.
3rd row:  Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog (over next ch-1 sp and st). Turn. 22 ( 26-26-30-32-34) sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog (over first st and ch-1 sp). Pat to end of row. Turn. 21 ( 25-25-29-31-33) sts.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 17 ( 21-21-25-27-29) sts. Fasten off.
Right side:  With RS facing, skip next 7 ( 11-11-11-11-15) sts. Join A with sl st to next ch-1 sp. 
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat to end of row. Turn. 24 ( 28-28-32-34-36) sts.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn. 23 ( 27-27-31-33-35) sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn. 22 ( 26-26-30-32-34) sts.
Rep last 2 rows twice more, then 2nd row once more. 17 ( 21-21-25-27-29) sts. Fasten off.

SLEEVES
With C, ch 50 ( 56-56-62-62-68). 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn. 49 ( 55-55-61-61-67) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Sc/Ch-1 pat until work from beg measures 8 ( 9-9-10-10-11)" [ 20.5 ( 23-23-25.5-25.5-28) cm]. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Sew in Sleeves to form square armholes. Sew side and sleeve seams.
Neckband: With RS facing, join A with sl st at right shoulder seam. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 21 ( 23-23-25-25-27) sc along back neck, 8 sc down left front neck edge, 7 ( 9-9-11-11-13) sc along front neck edge, 8 sc up right front neck edge. Join with sl st to first sc. 44 ( 48-48-52-52-56) sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Bottom Edging: With RS facing, join D with sl st to rem loop of foundation ch at side seam. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 126 ( 150-158-174-190-206) sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

abbreviations: Sctbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch

gauge: 13 sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

**BACK**
Ribbing: Ch 8 ( 8-8-10-10).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 ( 7-7-9-9) sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 13 ( 14-15-16-17)" [ 33 ( 35.5-38-40.5-43) cm], ending on a WS row. 
Do not fasten off. Do not turn.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 43 ( 45-49-53-57) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st.
*1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from lower edge measures 9 ( 10-11-11½-12½)" [ 23 ( 25.5-28-30-32.5) cm], ending on a WS row.

Shape armholes: Next row: (RS). Skip first 4 ( 4-4-4-6) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat across next 34 ( 36-40-44-44) sts. Turn. Leave rem 4 ( 4-4-4-6) sts unworked.
Cont even in pat over 35 ( 37-41-45-45) sts until armhole measures 5 ( 5½-6-6½-7)" [ 12.5 ( 14-15-16.5-18) cm], ending on a WS row. 
Fasten off. Turn.

Next row: Skip first 4 ( 4-5-7-7) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Beg in same sp as last sl st, pat across next 14 ( 16-18-18-18) sts. Fasten off. Leave rem sts unworked.

Ribbing:  Ch 8 ( 8-8-10-10). 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 ( 7-7-9-9) sc.

Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. * 1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
**
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from lower edge measures 9 ( 10-11-11½-12½)" [ 23 ( 25.5-28-30-32.5) cm], ending on a WS row. 
Fasten off.
Shape armhole:  Next row : (RS). Skip first 4 ( 4-4-4-6) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Work 1 row even in pat.
Shape neck:  1st row : (RS). Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog (neck edge). Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 ( 1-1-1-1) time(s) more. 12 ( 13-13-17-17) sts rem.
Work 1 row even in pat.
Next row:  Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 ( 2-1-3-3) time(s) more. 10 ( 10-11-13-13) sts rem.
Cont even in pat until armhole measures same length as Back to shoulder, ending on a WS row. 
Fasten off. Turn.
Shape shoulder:  Next row: (RS). Skip first 6 sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat to end of row. Fasten off.

**RIGHT FRONT**
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Front.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from lower edge measures 9 ( 10-11-11½-12½)" [ 23 ( 25.5-28-30-32.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape armhole:  Next row : (RS). Ch 1. Pat to last 4 ( 4-4-4-6) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Work 1 row even in pat.
Shape neck: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Sctog. Pat to end of row. Turn. 
Next row:  Ch 3. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 ( 1-1-1-1) time(s) more. 12 ( 13-13-17-17) sts rem.

Next row:  Ch 3. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 ( 2-1-3-3) time(s) more. 10 ( 10-11-13-13) sts rem.
Cont even in pat until armhole measures same length as Back to shoulder, ending on a WS row. Turn.
Shape shoulder:  Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Pat across first 6 sts. Fasten off. Leave rem sts unworked.

**SLEEVES**
Ribbing: Ch 8 ( 8-8-10-10).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 ( 7-7-9-9) sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures  8 ( 8½-9-9-9½)" [ 20.5 ( 21.5-23-23-24.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Do not turn. 
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 25 ( 27-29-29-31) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st.
* 1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: As 3rd row.
6th row (inc row): Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 dc) in first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts.  1 sc in next dc. (1 dc. 1 sc) in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
8th row (inc row): Ch 3 (counts as dс). 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in next sc. (1 sc. 1 dc) in top of ch 3. Turn.
Rep 5th to 8th rows 1 ( 1-1-2-2) time(s) more. 33 ( 35-37-41-43) sts.
Sizes 6 and 10 only: Rep 5th and 6th rows once more. ( 39-43) sts.
All sizes:  Cont even in pat until work from lower edge measures 8½ ( 10-11½ -12½ -13½ )" [ 21.5 ( 25.5-29-32-34.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Place markers at each end of last row.
Work a further 4 ( 4-4-4-6) rows even in pat. Fasten off.

**FINISHING**
Sew shoulder seams. 
Button and Buttonhole Band:  
1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st at lower edge of Right Front. Ch 1. 
Work 34 ( 38-42-46-48) sc evenly up front to first neck dec, 19 ( 21-23-25-27) sc up right front neck edge, 14 ( 16-18-18-18) sc across back neck edge, 19 ( 21-23-25-27) sc down left front neck edge to first neck dec and 34 ( 38-42-46-48) sc down left front neck edge. 120 ( 134-148-160-168) sc. Turn.
Place markers for 5 buttonholes on Right Front for Her Version or Left Front for His Version, having bottom buttonhole ½" [1 cm] above lower edge, top buttonhole ½" [1 cm] below first front dec and rem 3 buttonholes spaced evenly between.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc to next buttonhole marker. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 
1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 2 sc in each ch-2 sp to end of row. 
Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew in sleeves, placing rows above markers along unworked sts of Front and Back to form square armholes. Sew side and sleeve seams. Sew on buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

materials: Bernat® Roving (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sctbl = Single crochet through back loop only of next stitch
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit bust measurement XS/S/M 28-38" [71-96.5 cm], L/XL 40-48" [101.5-122 cm], 2/4XL 50-58" [127-147 cm]. Finished bust measurement XS/S/M 50" [127 cm], L/XL 54" [137 cm], 2/4XL 58" [147 cm]
gauge: 9 sts and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Texture Pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
BACK and FRONT (make alike)
Beg at lower edge, ch 22 (26-30).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 hdc in next ch. Sl st in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 21 (25-29) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st (inc made). *Sl st in next hdc. 1 hdc in next sl st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sl st in next hdc. 2 sc in last st (inc made). Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st (inc made). Sl st in next st. *1 hdc in next sl st. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in next sl st. Sl st in next st. 2 sc in last st (inc made). Turn.
Rep last row 16 times more, noting increased sts will be taken into Texture Pat. 57 (61-65) sts. Place marker at each end of last row.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sl st in next st. *1 hdc in next sl st. Sl st in next hdc. Rep Texture Pattern from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in next sl st. Sl st in next st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Shape raglans: Next row: (RS). Sl st across first 3 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next st. Turn. Leave rem 2 sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Pat to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next 3 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Pat to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 3 (2-2) times more. 45 (51-55) sts.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Pat to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 12 (14-16) times more. 19 (21-21) sts rem. Fasten off.
SLEEVES
Cuff: Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Cuff (when slightly stretched) measures approx 9½ (10-11)" [24 (25.5-28) cm]. Do not fasten off.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 25 (25-29) sc evenly across long edge of Cuff. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 hdc in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sl st in next hdc. 1 hdc in next sl st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sl st in next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 hdc in next sl st. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 hdc in next sl st. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more. Texture Pat is now in position.
Shape sides: Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st (inc made). Pat to last st. 2 sc in last st (inc made). Turn.
Rep last row 8 times more, noting increased sts will be taken into pat. 43 (43-47) sts.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Pat to last st. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Shape raglans: Next row: (RS). Sl st across first 3 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next st. Turn. Leave rem 2 sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Pat to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next 3 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Pat to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 6 (6-7) times more. 25 (25-27) sts.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Pat to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 6 times more. 11 (11-13) sts rem. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew raglan seams. Sew side and sleeve seams, leaving side seams open below markers.
Lower edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st in right side seam. Work sc evenly around all curved edges of Front and Back. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Collar
Ch 19 (19-21).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 18 (18-20) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures length to fit around neck edge, ending on a WS row and sewing in position with ease as you work, beg at left back raglan seam. Fasten off. Sew Collar seam.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Main Color (MC) 1 ball
Red Heart® All in One Flower Power™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m) Contrast A Daisy Do (2011) 1 - 2 ball(s)
Red Heart® All in One Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m) Contrast B Black Dove (2016) 1 - 2 ball(s)
U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit chest measurement XS/S/M 28-38" [71-96.5 cm], L/XL 40-46" [101.5-117 cm], 2/5XL 48-62" [122-157.5 cm]. Finished chest XS/S/M 40" [101.5 cm], L/XL 48" [122 cm], 2/5XL 60" [152.5 cm]
gauge:
Granny Square = Approx 6" [15 cm] square with larger hook.
Flower Square = Approx 6" [15 cm] square with larger hook.
12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S/M. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus XS/S/M (L/XL-2/3XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

Granny Square Motifs
Make 12 (13-18) with B.
See diagram on page 7.
Notes:
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 rnd in the Motif with 5 colors in total. If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends, leaving a tail for weaving in. Begin next Motif with Color 1 and repeat 5 rnds for each Motif.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.

With B and larger hook, beg with Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off.

Flower Power Motifs
Make 12 (14-16) with A.
See diagram on page 7.
Notes:
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• 2nd and 3rd rnds will be worked in Color 2.
• 4th, 5th, and 6th rnds will be worked in Color 3.
• If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• Leave long tail of Color 3 (at least 24" [61 cm] long) at end of Motif to use for joining Motifs during finishing.
• Adjust gauge as needed working 4th, 5th and 6th rounds of Flower Motif to maintain 6" [15 cm] square finished size to match finished size of Granny Square Motifs.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st unless otherwise stated.

With A and larger hook, beg with Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join. 10 dc. Color 1 complete.
2nd rnd: Color 2 begins. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next dc. (Ch 3. 1 tr) in same st as last sl st. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. *(1 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around, ending by joining with sl st to top of ch-3 of previous (2nd) rnd. Color 2 complete.
4th rnd: Color 3 begins. Sl st in first dc (top of ch-3 of 3rd rnd), to beg rnd at start of first Petal. Ch 3. *1 dc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 sc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in dc of 2nd rnd below sl st.** 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 6 (counts as tr and ch-2). 1 tr in same sp as sl st. *2 dc in next st. Ch 1. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Ch 1. 2 dc in next st.** (1 tr. Ch 2. 1 tr) all in next st. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join to 4th ch of ch-6.
6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 3 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(3 hdc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp.** (3 hdc. Ch 3. 3 hdc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 hdc in first ch-2 sp. Join.
Fasten off at end of Color 3, leaving approx 24" [61 cm] tail. Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square.

Solid Motifs
Garment Assembly Begins, Side Panels for size XS/S/M only
MC Solid Motif
Make 3 (4-7) Motifs with MC.
See diagram on page 7.

Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
With MC and larger hook, ch 6. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in ring. Ch 3. (4 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. Ch 1. Join with hdc to top of first dc. 4 groups 4-dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc around post of joining hdc. (1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dtr in ring, working between groups of dc. 2 dc in same ch-3 sp as last 2 dc) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dtr in ring, working between groups of dc. Join with sl st to top of first dc. 8 dc between corner dtr on each side.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. (1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 3 for corner. Skip next dtr. 2 dc in next dc) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Skip next dtr. Ch 1. Join with hdc to top of first dc. 10 dc between corner ch-3 sps at each side.

4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc around post of joining hdc. (1 dc in each of next 10 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dtr in next dtr 2 rnds below. 2 dc in same ch-3 sp as last 2 dc) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dtr in next dtr 2 rnds below. Join with sl st to top of first d. 14 dc between corner dtr on each side.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 14 sts. Ch 3. (1 dc in each of next 15 sts. Ch 3) 3 times. Join with sl st to top of first dc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for joining. Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square.

Garment Assembly
Following Diagrams (see page 4), sew Motifs tog through both loops into Body using Whipstitch.
WHIPSTITCH
Size XS/S/M only:
Side Panels
Right Back Side Panel: With RS facing and larger hook, join MC with sl st to bottom corner ch-3 sp. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. Work 16 hdc evenly across first Motif, having last hdc in corner ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in joining seam. Work 18 hdc evenly across next Motif, working last hdc in corner ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in next joining seam. Turn. 38 hdc.
Next row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Side Panel measures 1" [2.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.

Left Front Side Panel: Work as for Right Back Side Panel.

Left Back Side Panel: With RS facing and larger hook, join MC with sl st to joining seam of second Motif. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in corner ch-3 sp. Work 16 hdc evenly across Motif, having last hdc in corner ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in joining seam. Work 19 hdc evenly across next motif, working last 2 hdc in corner ch-3 sp. Turn. 38 hdc.
Next row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Side Panel measures 1" [2.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.

Right Front Side Panel: Work as for Left Back Side Panel.

All Sizes:
Back Neck Panel: With RS facing, and larger hook, join MC with sl st to right corner of Motif at back neck opening. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in corner ch-3 sp. Work 16 hdc evenly across Motif, having last hdc in corner ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in joining seam (refer to Assembly Diagram). Turn. 19 hdc.
Next row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Back Neck Panel measures 3" [7.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.

Sleeve Assembly
Following Diagram (see page 4), sew Motifs tog into Right and Left Sleeves using Whipstitch (Note: Sleeves have different motifs.)

Note: Sleeve Side Sections are worked sideways – 2 Sections for each Sleeve.
Sleeve First Section: With RS facing and larger hook, join MC with sl st to bottom corner ch-3 sp. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. Work 16 hdc evenly across first Motif, having last hdc in corner ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in joining seam. Work 18 hdc evenly across next Motif, working last hdc in corner ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in next joining seam. Turn. 38 hdc.
Next row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Sleeve First Section measures 2½" [6 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape side: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 4 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 4 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
3rd row: Sl st in each of first 5 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 5 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Rep last 2 rows once more, then 3rd row once. Fasten off.

Sleeve Second Section: With RS facing and larger hook, join MC with sl st to joining seam of second Motif. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in corner ch-3 sp. Work 16 hdc evenly across Motif, having last hdc in corner ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in joining seam. Work 19 hdc evenly across next Motif, working last 2 hdc in corner ch-3 sp. Turn. 38 hdc.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Sleeve Second Section measures 2½" [6 cm], ending on a RS row.
Shape side: 1st row: (WS). Sl st in each of first 4 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 4 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
3rd row: Sl st in each of first 5 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 5 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Rep last 2 rows once more, then 3rd row once. Fasten off.

Rep for Sleeve Side Sections on second Sleeve. Sew side edges of Sleeve Side Sections to Motifs.

FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. Sew in Sleeves.

Sleeve Cuff: With smaller hook and MC, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sl sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sl st in back loop of each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until Cuff, when slightly stretched, measures length to fit bottom edge of Sleeve. Fasten off, leaving a long end to join to Sleeve.
Sew Sleeve Cuff to bottom edge of Sleeve. Sew side and sleeve seams.

Body Edging: With smaller hook and MC, ch 12.
1st row: (RS). 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 11 sl sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sl st in back loop of each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until Edging, when slightly stretched, measures length to fit lower edge of Body. Fasten off, leaving a long end to join to Body.
Sew Body Edging to bottom edge of Body.

materials: Patons® Norse™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 211 yds /193 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: 9 hdc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Body is worked from neck edge down in 1 piece. Ch 2 at beg of row or rnd does not count as hdc. Join all rnds with sl st to first hdc. BODY: Beg at neck edge, ch 36 (36-39-41-44-44).
1st row:  2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 3 (3-4-4-5-5) ch. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc  – V-st made) in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 (3-3-4-4-4) ch. V-st in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 16 (16-17-17-18-18) ch. V-st in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 (3-3-4-4-4) ch. V-st in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 (3-4-4-5-5) ch. 2 hdc in last ch. Turn.
2nd to 4th rows:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 sp. V-st in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 sp. V-st in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows until 13 (14-15-16-17-18) rows in total have been worked. Divide Sleeves and Body:  Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 sp. Ch 7 (8-10-12-12-14) for underarm. Skip next 29 (31-33-36-38-40) sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 sp. Ch 7 (8-10-12-12-14) for underarm. Skip next 29 (31-33-36-38-40) sts. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc or ch to end of row. Turn. 98 (104-115-123-132-140) hdc for Body.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until body from underarm ch measures 20½ (20½-20½-20½-20-20)" [ 52 (52-52-52-51-51) cm], ending on a WS (WS-RS-RS-WS-WS) row.
Sizes L and XL only: Next row:  (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first (56-60) hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. (114-122) hdc.
All sizes:  Ribbing: Next row:  (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in next hdc. *1 dcfp around next hdc. 1 dcbp around next hdc. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. Rep last row until Ribbing measures 3" [7.5 cm].
Fasten off. 
SLEEVES
1st rnd:  (RS). Join yarn with sl st to center of underarm ch. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch or hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. Turn. 36 (39-43-48-50-54) hdc.
Sizes XS/S, M and L only: 
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Turn.
Rep last rnd 17 (20-20) times more. 18 (18-22) hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Turn.
Rep last rnd until work from underarm measures 15" [38 cm], ending on a WS rnd. 
Sizes XL, 2/3XL and 4/5XL only: 
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Turn.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Join. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Turn.
Rep last 4 rnds ( 3-3-2) times more. (28-30-39) sts.
Sizes XL and 2/3XL only: 
Next 2 rnds: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Join. Turn. (24-26) sts.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Turn.
Rep last rnd until work from underarm measures 14" [35.5 cm], ending on a WS rnd. 
Size 4/5XL only: 
Next rnd: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Join. Turn.
Rep last rnd 5 times more. 27 sts.
Next rnd:  Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Turn. 26 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Turn.
Rep last rnd until work from underarm measures 13½" [34.5 cm], ending on a WS rnd. 
All sizes: Sleeve Cuffs: Next rnd:  (RS). Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join. Do not turn.
Rep last rnd until Cuff measures 3" [7.5 cm].
Fasten off. Fold cuff back.
Front and Neck Edging:  (RS). Join yarn with sl st to bottom Right Front corner. 
1st row:  Ch 2. Work 179 (181-183-187-189-191) hdc evenly spaced up Right Front, across Back Neck, and down Left Front. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in next hdc. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in next hdc. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 3 times more. Fasten off.
POCKETS (make 2)
Ch 17.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 15 hdc. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in next hdc. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in next hdc. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows once more.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 7" [18 cm].
Fasten off.
Sew bottom of Pockets 3" [7.5 cm] up from lower edge of Cardigan and align side edge to where Front Edging joins Body.

gauge: 15 hdc = 4" [10 cm]; 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in half double crochet.
instructions:
NOTES
Ch 2 at beginning of each hdc row is a turning chain and does not count as a stitch.
BACK
Ch 69 (73, 77, 81, 85).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 68 (72, 76, 80, 84) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each st across.
Rows 3-7: Repeat Row 2.
Next Row (Right Side): Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across – 68 (72, 76, 80, 84) hdc.
Repeat last row until piece measures 26 (27, 28, 29, 30)" [66 (68.5, 71, 73.5, 76) cm] from beginning.
Fasten off.
POCKET (Make 2)
Ch 21.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across – 19 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each hdc across.
Repeat Row 2 until pocket measures 6" [15 cm] from beginning, end with a wrong side row.
Fasten off and mark right side of pocket.
FRONTS (Make 2)
Ch 27 (29, 31, 33, 35).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 26 (28, 30, 32, 34) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across.
Rows 3-7: Repeat Row 2.
Next Row (Right Side): Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across – 26 (28, 30, 32, 34) hdc.
Repeat last row until piece measures 9" [23 cm] from beginning, end with a wrong side row.
Join Pocket
Next Row (Right Side): Ch 2, turn, hdc in next 3 (4, 5, 6, 7) sts, with right side of Pocket facing, hdc through next st of Front and first st of top of Pocket, hdc in each of next 17 Pocket sts, leave next 17 Front sts unworked for opening, hdc through next Front st and last st of Pocket, hdc in last 4 (5, 6, 7, 8) sts of Front – 26 (28, 30, 32, 34) hdc.
Continue to work in hdc until Front measures 26 (27, 28, 29, 30)" [66 (68.5, 71, 73.5, 76) cm] from beginning.
Fasten off.
SLEEVES (Make 2)
Ch 39 (43, 47, 51, 55).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 38 (42, 46, 50, 54) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across.
Rows 3-7: Repeat Row 2.
Next Row (Right Side): Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across – 38 (42, 46, 50, 54) hdc.
Repeat last row until piece measures 15 (16, 17, 17½, 18)" [38 (40.5, 43, 44.5, 45.5) cm] from beginning.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew edges of Pocket to wrong sides of Fronts.
Sew top edge of Fronts to top edge of Back leaving center 4" [10 cm] of Back open for neck edge.
Measure and mark 5 (5½, 6, 6½, 7½)" [12.5 (14, 15, 16.5, 19) cm] down from shoulder seam. Sew top of sleeves between markers. Sew side and sleeve seams.
Front edging
Row 1 (Right Side): With right side facing join yarn at bottom front edge of Right Front, sc evenly around entire front edge of Right Front, Back neck and Left Front edge, end at bottom front edge of Left Front.
Next 2 Rows: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each sc.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (Heathers: 5 oz/141.7 g; 250 yds/228 m): 5 (XS/S) 6 (M) 7 (L) 8 (XL) 9 (2/3XL) 10 (4/5XL) balls
Caron® Simply Soft® (Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m): Version 1 Pistachio (COL0003) 4 (XS/S) 5 (M) 6 (L) 7 (XL) 8 (2/3XL) 9 (4/5XL) balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sctbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit bust/chest measurement: Extra-Small/Small 28-34" [71-86.5 cm], Medium 36-38" [91.5-96.5 cm], Large 40-42" [101.5-106.5 cm], Extra-Large 44-46" [112-117 cm], 2/3 X-Large 48-54" [122-137 cm], 4/5 X-Large 56-62" [142-157.5 cm]. Finished bust/chest: Extra-Small/Small 37" [94 cm], Medium 40½" [103 cm], Large 44½" [113 cm], Extra-Large 49" [124.5 cm], 2/3 X-Large 55" [140 cm], 4/5 X-Large 63" [160 cm]
gauge: 13 sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

BACK
Ribbing: Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 18½ (20¼-22¼-24½-27½-31½)" [47 (51.5-56.5-62-70-80) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Do not turn.

Next row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 61 (67-73-81-91-103) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn.

Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from lower edge measures 16 (16-16-16½-16½-16½)" [40.5 (40.5-40.5-42-42-42) cm] for Her Version or 17 (17-17-17½-17½-17½)" [43 (43-43-44.5-44.5-44.5) cm] for His Version, ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

Shape armholes: Next row: (RS). Skip first 6 (8-10-12-14-18) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat across next 48 (50-52-56-62-66) sts. Turn. Leave rem 6 (8-10-12-14-18) sts unworked.

Cont even in pat over 49 (51-53-57-63-67) sts until armhole measures 8½ (9-9-9½-10-10½)" [22.5 (23-23-24.5-25.5-27.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. Turn.

Shape shoulders: Next row: (RS). Skip first 6 (6-8-8-10-10) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat across next 36 (38-36-40-42-46) sts. Fasten off. Turn. Leave rem 6 (6-8-8-10-10) sts unworked.

Next row: Skip first 7 (7-6-7-8-9) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st, beg in same sp as last sl st, pat across next 23 (25-25-27-27-29) sts. Fasten off.

LEFT FRONT
**Ribbing: Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 9 (10-11-12-13½-15½)" [23 (25.5-28-30.5-34.5-39) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Do not turn.

Next row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 31 (33-37-41-45-51) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn.

Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from lower edge measures 16 (16-16-16½-16½-16½)" [40.5 (40.5-40.5-42-42-42) cm] for Her Version or 17 (17-17-17½-17½-17½)" [43 (43-43-44.5-44.5-44.5) cm] for His Version, ending on a WS row. ** Fasten off.

Shape armhole: Next row: (RS). Skip first 6 (8-10-12-14-18) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat across remaining sts.
Work from ** to ** for Left Front. Do not fasten off.

Shape armhole: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Pat to last 6 (8-10-12-14-18) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.

Work 1 row even in pat.

Shape neck: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 18 (18-20-22-24-26) sts rem.

Work 1 row even in pat. Dec 1 st at neck edge on next row and following alt rows 4 (4-5-6-5-7) times more. 13 (13-14-15-18-18) sts rem.

Cont even in pat until armhole measures same length as Back to shoulder, ending on a WS row. Fasten off. Turn.

Shape shoulder: Next row: (RS). Skip first 6 (6-8-8-10-10) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Pat to end of row. Fasten off.

RIGHT FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Front. Do not fasten off.

Shape armhole: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Pat to last 6 (8-10-12-14-18) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.

Work 1 row even in pat.

Shape neck: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 18 (18-20-22-24-26) sts rem.

Work 1 row even in pat. Dec 1 st at neck edge on next row and following alt rows 4 (4-5-6-5-7) times more. 13 (13-14-15-18-18) sts rem.

Cont even in pat until armhole measures same length as Back to shoulder, ending on a WS row.

Shape shoulder: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Pat across first 6 (6-8-8-10-10) sts. Fasten off. Leave rem sts unworked.

SLEEVES
Ribbing: Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sctbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing (when slightly stretched) measures 9½ (9½-10-10-10½-10½)" [24.5 (24.5-25.5-25.5-26.5-26.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Do not turn.

Next row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 31 (31-33-33-35-37) sc evenly across long edge of Ribbing. Turn.

Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
4th row (inc row): Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 dc) in first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next dc. (1 dc. 1 sc) in last sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
6th row (inc row): Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in next sc. (1 sc. 1 dc) in top of ch 3. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows 2 (3-3-4-6-7) times more. 43 (47-49-53-63-69) sts.

Sizes XS/S, M, L, XL and 2/3XL only: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row, working last sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
Next row (inc row): Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 dc) in first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next dc. (1 dc. 1 sc) in last sc. Turn.
