Rep last row until work from beg measures, when slightly stretched, to fit length between markers for sleeve. Beg at underarm, sew in place as you work. Sew Cuff seams.

materials: RED HEART® Soft® Essentials: 2 balls 7305 Biscuit
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8] and 6.5mm [US K-10½]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Child's Size Hat circumference at neck edge: 20" [51 cm]
gauge: 10 hdc = 4" [10 cm]; 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in half double crochet using larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HOODIE EARS (make 2)
With smaller hook, ch 5.
Row 1:  Sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in next ch, sc in next ch, 2 sc in next ch –  6 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in each st across – 12 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 18 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn piece to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, 2 sc in each ch across, leave remaining sts unworked – 8 sts. 
Row 5: Ch 1, turn piece to work along unworked 18 sts of Row 3, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 24 sts. 
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in next 8 sts along lower edge of Ear, turn to work along upper edges of Ear, ch 1, working in front loops only, slip st in next 24 sts, slip st in first slip st to join. Cut yarn. 
Repeat for second Ear. Secure loop of last st with safety pin to prevent unraveling.
HOODIE Rib
With larger hook, ch 4.
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 3 sts.
Row 2-59: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each st across. Do not fasten off.
Main Body
Row 60: Turn to work along long edge of rib, ch 1, sc 61 sts evenly spaced across length of Rib – 61 sts. Fasten off. Mark as right side.
Row 61 (Right Side): Ch 3, with right side facing, join yarn to front loop only of first st of Row 60 with a slip st, working in front loops only, slip st in remaining 60 sts, ch 3.
Row 62: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 3 ch, working in unworked loops of previous row, sc in each ch across to last 3 ch, sc in last 3 chs – 67 sc.
Row 63: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc here and throughout), turn, skip first sc, hdc in next 64 sts to last 2 sts, hdc2tog – 65 sts.
Row 64: Ch 2, turn, skip first st, hdc in next 62 sts, hdc2tog – 63 sts.
Attach Ears 
Row 65: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 20 sts, with right side facing, line up 8 sts of one Ear with next 8 sts of Hoodie, working through both layers and working through front loops of Hoodie and both loops of Ear, sc in next 8 sts to join, sc in next 7 sts of Hoodie, with right side facing, line up 8 sts of second Ear with next 8 sts of Hoodie, working through both layers and working through front loops of Hoodie and both loops of second Ear, sc in next 8 sts to join, sc in remaining 20 sts across –  63 sts.
Row 66: Ch 2, turn, skip first st, hdc in next 19 sts, hdc in unworked loops of next 8 sts of Hoodie, hdc in next 7 sts, hdc in unworked loops of next 8 sts, hdc in next 18 sts, hdc2tog – 61 sts.
Row 67: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across – 61 sts.
Row 68-73: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across for 6 rows.
Row 74: Ch 2, turn, hdc in next 28 sts, hdc2tog, hdc in next st, hdc2tog, hdc in next 28 sts – 59 sts.
Row 75: Ch 2, turn, hdc in 27 sts, hdc2tog, hdc in next st, hdc2tog, hdc in next 27 sts – 57 sts.
Row 76: Ch 2, turn, hdc in 26 sts, hdc2tog, hdc in next st, hdc2tog, hdc in next 26 sts – 55 sts.
Row 77: Ch 2, turn, hdc in 25 sts, hdc2tog, hdc in next st, hdc2tog, hdc in next 25 sts. Fasten off, leaving long end.
Shape Back of Hoodie
With right side facing, mark 4th st from each edge along last row worked to mark center 45 sts. Back of Hoodie will be worked in rounds.
Round 78: With right side facing, join yarn in next st after first marked st with a slip st, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in next 19 sts, hdc2tog, hdc in next st, hdc2tog, hdc in next 20 sts, slip st in top of beginning ch-2 to join – 43 sts.
Round 79: Ch 1, skip next 2 sts, [hdc2tog, hdc in next 5 sts] twice, hdc in next 11 sts, [hdc2tog, hdc in next 5 sts] twice, hdc2tog, do not join – 36 sts.
Round 80: Ch 1, skip next 2 sts, [sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog] twice, sc in next 8 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts] 2 times, sc2tog – 31 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Fold last round flat and sew closed.
Using long end from Row 77, sew 8 unworked sts of Row 78 at neck edge closed. 
Sew short edges of Rib together for face opening. 
Neck Edging
Row 1: With right side facing, skip first 3 sts at neck edge under Rib, join yarn with slip st in first row end at neck edge of Row 61, ch 1, sc in same space, 3 sc in next space, sc 34 sts evenly spaced across row ends of neck edge, ending at opposite row end of Row 61, 3 sc in next space, sc in last space – 42 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, hdc in same st, hdc in next st, 3 hdc in next st, hdc in next 36 sts, 3 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, slip st in next space – 46 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 38 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, slip st in next space – 50 sts. Fasten off.
Row 4: With right side facing, join yarn with slip st in back loop of first st directly below Rib, ch 2, (counts as first hdc, working in back loop only, hdc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next 2 sts, [hdc in 5 sts, 2 hdc in next st] twice, hdc in next 6 sts, 2 hdc next 3 sts, hdc in next 6 sts, [2 hdc in st, hdc in next 5 sts] twice, hdc in last 5 sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. 
Sew corresponding sides of snap to front flaps so flaps overlap.

materials: Caron® Macchiato Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m)
Contrast A Solitude (71003) 2 cakes or 880 yds/800 m
Contrast B Breathe (71012) 2 cakes or 880 yds/800 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 30 x 76" [76 x 196 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Four 3-dc groups and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
• Turn work every 2 rows: first 2 rows worked with RS facing, then next 2 rows worked with WS facing.
• Colors change every row.
With A, ch 92 loosely (multiple 3 ch + 2). See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 2 sc in next ch. Rep from * to last 3 ch. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Draw a long loop to secure A from unravelling. Remove hook.
2nd row: (RS). Join B with sl st to first sc from previous row. Ch 3. *3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp and sc. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. Draw a long loop to secure B from unravelling. Remove hook.
3rd row:  (WS). Pick up A-loop. Ch 2 ( does not count as st). Sl st to top of first dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 2. Skip next 3 dc. 2 sc in sp between next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next 3 dc. 2 sc in sp between next 2 dc. 1 sc in top of last dc. Do not turn. Draw a long loop to secure A from unravelling. Remove hook.
4th row: (WS). Pick up B-loop. Ch 1. Sl st to top of first sc. Ch 3. *3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp and sc. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. Draw a long loop to secure B from unravelling. Remove hook.
5th row:  (RS). Pick up A-loop. Ch 2 ( does not count as st). Sl st to top of first dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 2. Skip next 3 dc. 2 sc in sp between next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next 3 dc. 2 sc in sp between next 2 dc. 1 sc in top of last dc. Do not turn. Draw a long loop to secure A from unravelling. Remove hook.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat, turning work every 2 rows as established, until Wrap measures approx 38" [96.5 cm], ending on 4th row of pat.
Cont in pat, substituting B for A and A for B until Shawl measures 76" [196 cm], ending on 4th row. Do not fasten off.
Fringe
Next row: (RS). With A, *Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 13 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last dc. Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 13 ch. Sl st in last dc. Fasten off.
For opposite end of Shawl, with RS facing, join B with sl st to first ch of rem loop of foundation chain. *Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 13 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 rem loops of foundation ch. Rep from * to last ch. Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 13 ch. Sl st in last ch. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Big Donut™ O’Go™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 502 yds/459 m)
Sizes XS/S/M L/XL 2/3XL 4/5XL Spiced Ginger (29001) 3 4 4 5 O’Gos
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hhdc = (Herringbone half double crochet). Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch and through first loop on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Scbl2tog = Working in back loops only, draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Separate colors by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section for each O’Go (Contrast A to J). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A to J.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed in next color.
• Cardigan is worked in patchwork squares joined together as shown in diagrams for Back, Fronts and Sleeves.
• Ribbing, button bands and collar are worked during finishing

SINGLE CROCHET SQUARES (make 5 with E and 3 with G)
Ch 19 ( 21-23-27).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 18 ( 20-22-26) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 5½ ( 6-6½-6½)" [ 14 ( 15-16.5-16.5) cm]. Fasten off.

HERRINGBONE HALF-DOUBLE CROCHET SQUARES (make 5 each with C and D, and 4 with I).
Ch 20 ( 22-24-28).
1st row: (RS). 1 hhdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hhdc in each ch to end of row. Turn. 18 ( 20-22-26) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 5½ ( 6-6½-6½)" [ 14 ( 15-16.5-16.5) cm]. Fasten off.

MOSS STITCH SQUARES (make 6 using J as Color 1 and G as Color 2. Make 4 using A as Color 1 and I as Color 2).
Stripe Pat
With Color 1, work 2 rows.
With Color 2, work 2 rows.
These 4 rows form Stripe Pat.
With Color 1, ch 20 ( 22-24-28).
Set up row:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn. 19 ( 21-23-27) sts (sc and ch-1).
First row of Stripe Pat is complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows:
1st row:  (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 5½ ( 6-6½-6½)" [ 14 ( 15-16.5-16.5) cm]. Fasten off.

TEXTURED SQUARES  (make 3 with J and 5 with F).
Ch 19 ( 21-23-27).
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 dc in next ch. *1 sc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 18 ( 20-22-26) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 5½ ( 6-6½-6½)" [ 14 ( 15-16.5-16.5) cm]. Fasten off.

RIBBING SQUARES (Make 5 each in B and H.)
Ch 20 ( 22-24-28).
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 18 ( 20-22-26) sts.
2nd row:  Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in prev row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS. See diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 5½ ( 6-6½-6½)" [ 14 ( 15-16.5-16.5) cm]. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Using Assembly Diagrams on page 5, sew Motifs tog with WS facing tog, using mattress stitch.
MATTRESS STITCH

With WS facing, sew shoulder seams, leaving 10 ( 11-12-12)" [ 25.5 ( 28-30.5-30.5) cm] open at center back/front openings.
PM at sides of Fronts and Back for Sleeves 8¼ ( 9¼-10½-12)" [ 21 ( 23.5-26.5-30.5) cm] from shoulders. Sew in sleeves between markers.

Cuff Ribbing
With A, ch 11.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Cuff Ribbing measures length to fit around Cuff, when slightly stretched, sewing in place as you work. Sew last row and 1st row of ribbing tog. Fasten off.

Bottom Ribbing
With A, ch 15.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 14 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Bottom Ribbing measures length to fit around Cardigan, when slightly stretched, sewing in place as you work. Fasten off.

Button Band
With B, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Button Band measures 24 ( 26-28-28)" [ 61 ( 66-71-71) cm]. Fasten off.  Sew to Left Front.

Buttonhole Band
With B, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 1" [2.5 cm].
**Buttonhole row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only,  1 sc in each of first 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 3 sts. 3 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 scbl in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.***
Rep last row until work from last buttonhole measures 5 ( 5½ - 6-6)” [ 12.5 ( 14-15-15) cm.** Rep from ** to ** times more, ending last rep at ***.
Cont even until work from last buttonhole measures 1" [2.5 cm]. 
Sew to Right Front.

Sew buttons onto Button Band to correspond with buttonholes.

Collar
PM 6" [15 cm] from top of Left Front corner along neck edge.
With B, ch 23.
Shape Left Lapel:
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 22 sts.
2nd to 4th rows:  Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row:  Ch 1. 1 scbl in first st. Scbl2tog. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. 21 sts.
6th row: As 2nd row.
7th to 16th rows: Rep 5th and 6th rows 5 times more. 16 sc. PM at end of row.
Work in short rows as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.

2nd and 3rd rows: As 1st row. 
4th row:  Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of next 12 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 12 sts. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of next 12 sts. Working into side of st just worked, and into first unworked st from 4th row, scbl2tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
Rep these 6 rows for short row pat until Collar measures length to fit from top of Right Front corner around Neck, when slightly stretched, to marker. Beg at top of Right Front corner sew in place as you work, ending on a RS row.

Shape Right Lapel
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to last 2 sts. 2 scbl in next st. 1 scbl in last st. Turn. 17 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.

3rd to 12th rows: Rep 1st and 2nd rows  5 times more. 22 sts.
13th to 16th rows: As 2nd row. 
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Pet™ (8 oz/225 g; 269 yds/246 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2(3)tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit dog chest measurement S 10" [25.5 cm] M 14" [35.5 cm] L 17" [43 cm] XL 20" [51cm] Finished chest measurement S 13" [33 cm] M 15" [45.5 cm] L 26" [66 cm] XL 32" [81.5 cm]
gauge: 11 hdc and 5½ rows= 4" [10 cm].
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size. Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. Collar (worked sideways) With MC, ch 13 (15-19-21) loosely. 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 12 (14-18-20) sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 10 (14-21-24)" [25.5 (35.5-53.5-61) cm] when lightly stretched. Join last row and 1st row tog with 1 row of sc to form tube. Picot Border Working along top edge of ribbing, with MC and RS facing, work 28 (38-58-66) sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, omitting last sc on final rep. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Body Stripe Pat: 2 rows MC. 2 rows A. These 4 rows form Stripe Pat. 1st rnd: Working along bottom edge of ribbing, with MC and WS facing, work 28 (38-58-66) hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 2nd rnd: (Leash Opening) Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 12 (17-27-31) hdc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each st and ch to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. 32 (42-62-70) hdc. 4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 34 (44-64-72) hdc. First 4 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last rnd 1 (3-5-8) time(s) more. 36 (50-74-88) hdc. Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep last rnd 2 (2-2-4) times more. Next rnd: (Leg Openings) Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 3 (5-8-12) hdc. Ch 5 (6-8-10). Skip next 5 (6-8-10) hdc. 1 hdc in each st to last 8 (11-16-22) hdc. Ch 5 (6-8-10). Skip next 5 (6-8-10) hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st and ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep last rnd until work from bottom of Collar measures 8 (12-16-20)" [20.5 (30.5-40.5-51) cm]. Fasten off. Fold Coat in half lengthwise, matching leg openings. Mark center of (back) body on last rnd worked using st marker. Using appropriate color to keep cont of Stripe Pat, beg 12 (16-24-30) sts to right of marked st, work 24 (32-48-60) hdc. Turn. Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 6 (10-18-24) hdc. (Hdc2tog) twice. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 4 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn. 20 (28-44-56) hdc. Rep last row once more 16 (24-40-52) hdc. Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 4 hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. 14 (22-38-50) hdc. Rep last row 1 (2-5-9) time(s) more. 12 (18-28-32) hdc. Fasten off. Picot Border: With RS facing and A, work 36 (50-74-90) sc evenly around bottom opening. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, omitting last sc on final rep. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Leg Edging: 1st rnd: With MC, work 12 (14-18-22) hdc around each Leg Opening. Join with sl st to first hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep last rnd 0 (1-2-4) time(s) more. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Ch 2. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around, omitting last sc on final rep. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Rosette Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Work 19 dc in ring. Join with st st to top of ch-3. 20 dc. 2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 4 dc in first dc. 5 dc in each dc around. Join with st st to top of ch-3. 100 dc. Fasten off. Sew Rosette to Coat as pictured.

materials: One Pound (454 g/16. oz; 742 m/812 yds)
One size US I-9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook, or size to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh. Draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = (Draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Finished Chest: 4 yrs 26" [66 cm], 6-8yrs 29" [73.5 cm], 10 yrs 31" [78.5 cm], 12 yrs 34" [86.5 cm]; Finished Length: 4 yrs 16" [40.5 cm], 6-8yrs 17.5" [44.5cm], 10 yrs 19" [48.5 cm], 12 yrs 20" [51 cm]
gauge: In double crochet, 12 sts and 8 rows = 4"/10cm.
instructions: BACK Ribbing Ch 8. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—7 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn. Rep last row until ribbing measures 10 (11, 12, 13)"/25.5 (28, 30.5, 33) cm from beginning. Do not turn at end of last row. Do not fasten off. Body Row 1: Rotate ribbing, ch 1, work 39 (43, 47, 51) sc evenly spaced across long edge of ribbing, turn. Row 2 (RS): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next 2 sc, *FPdc around next sc, dc in next 3 sc; repeat from * across, turn. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Row 4: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sc, *FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, dc in next 3 sc; repeat from * across, turn. Repeat last 2 rows until back measures 10 1/2 (11 1/2, 12 1/2, 13)"/26.5 (29, 32, 33) cm from beginning, end with a Row 4. Shape Armholes Row 1: Ch 1, sc in each st across to last 4 sts, turn; leave last 4 sts unworked—35 (39, 43, 47) sts. Row 2: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sc, *FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, dc in next 3 sc; repeat from * across to last 4 sts, turn; leave last 4 sts unworked—31 (35, 39, 43) sts. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Row 4: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sc, *FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, dc in next 3 sc; repeat from * across, turn. Repeat last 2 rows until armhole measures 5 1/2 (6, 6 1/2, 7)"/14 (15, 16.5, 18) cm. Fasten off. FRONT Work same as back until armhole measures 3 1/2 (4, 4 1/2, 5)"/9 (10, 11.5, 12.5) cm, end with a Row 4. Shape Neck and First Shoulder Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first 8 (10, 12, 14) sts, turn; leave remaining sts unworked (for neck and 2nd shoulder)—8 (10, 12, 14) sts. Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), dc2tog, dc in each sc to next FPdc (2 rows below), *FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, dc in each sc to next FPdc (2 rows below); repeat from * across, turn—7 (9, 11, 13) sts. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—6 (8, 10, 12) sts. Row 4: Ch 3, dc in each sc to next FPdc, *FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, dc in each sc to next FPdc; repeat from * across, turn. Fasten off. Shape Neck and Second Shoulder Sk next 15 unworked sts following first shoulder, join yarn with sl st in next st. Row 1: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in each remaining st across, turn—8 (10, 12, 14) sts. Row 2: Ch 3, dc in each sc to next FPdc, *FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, dc in each sc to next FPdc; repeat from * across to last 2 sts, dc2tog, turn—7 (9, 11, 13) sts. Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across, turn—6 (8, 10, 12) sts. Row 4: Ch 3, dc in each sc to next FPdc, *FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, dc in each sc to next FPdc; repeat from * across, turn. Fasten off. SLEEVE (make 2) Ribbing Work same as back ribbing until piece measures 6 (6, 6 1/2, 7)"/15 (15, 16.5, 18) cm from beginning. Row 1: Rotate ribbing, ch 1, work 23 (23, 27, 27) sc evenly spaced across long edge of ribbing, turn. Row 2 (RS): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next 2 sc, *FPdc around next sc, dc in next 3 sc; repeat from * across, turn. Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st across to last st, 2 sc in last st, turn—25 (25, 29, 29) sts. Row 4: Ch 3, dc in each sc to next FPdc (2 rows below), *FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, dc in each sc to next FPdc (2 rows below); repeat from * across, turn. Repeat last 2 rows 4 (6, 6, 7) more times—33 (37, 41, 43) sts. Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Next Row: Ch 3, dc in each sc to next FPdc (2 rows below), *FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, dc in each sc to next FPdc (2 rows below); repeat from * across, turn. Repeat last 2 rows until sleeve measures 13 1/2 (14 1/2, 16 1/2, 17 1/2)"/34.5 (37, 42, 44.5) cm from beginning. Fasten off. FINISHING Sew shoulder seams. Neckband Row 1: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st in shoulder seam, ch 1, sc evenly spaced around neck edge; join with sl st in first sc. Row 2: Ch 1, rev sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Sew in sleeves. Sew side and sleeve seams. Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m)
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: Motif A = 33/4" [7.5 cm] square. Motif B = 4½" [9.5 cm] square.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus (). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes. Size XS/S only: Make 65 Motifs A. Make 6 Half Motifs A. Size M/L only: Make 65 Motifs B. Make 6 Half Motifs B. Size XL/2XL only: Make 76 Motifs B. Make 6 Half Motifs B. Size 3/4/5XL only: Make 85 Motifs B. Make 6 Half Motifs B.

MOTIF A
Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in ring - counts as CL2. *Ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in ring. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – CL2 made. Rep from * 10 times more. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 CL2.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next dc. Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st – counts as CL2. *Ch 3. CL2 in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 3. Skip next ch-3 sp. (CL2. Ch 2. CL2. Ch 3. CL2. Ch 2. CL2) all in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3.** Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in top of next CL2. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

MOTIF B
Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 4. 1 tr in ring (counts as Tr2tog). *Ch 2. [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] twice in ring. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Tr2tog made. Rep from * 10 times more. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 Tr2tog.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next tr. Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in same sp. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – counts as CL3. *Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in next ch-2 sp. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - CL3 made. Rep from * around, ending with ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 3. Skip next ch-3 sp. (CL3. Ch 2. CL3. Ch 4. CL3. Ch 2. CL3) all in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3.** Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in top of next CL3. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

HALF MOTIF A
Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: Ch 3. 1 dc in ring - counts as CL2. (Ch 2. CL2 in ring) 6 times. Turn. 7 CL2.
2nd row: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3). (CL2 in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3) 6 times. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). (CL2. Ch 2. CL2) in first ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in top of next CL2. Ch 3. Skip next ch-3 sp. (CL2. Ch 2. CL2. Ch 3. CL2. Ch 2. CL2) all in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in top of next CL2. Ch 3. Skip next ch-3 sp. (CL2. Ch 2. CL2. Ch 1. 1 dc) all in top of turning ch. Fasten off.

HALF MOTIF B
Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: Ch 4. 1 tr in ring - counts as Tr2tog. (Ch 2. Tr2tog in ring) 6 times. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3). (CL3 in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3) 6 times. 1 dc in 3rd ch of ch 4. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). (CL3. Ch 2. CL3) in first ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in top of next CL3. Ch 3. Skip next ch-3 sp. (CL3. Ch 2. CL3. Ch 4. CL3. Ch 2. CL3) all in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in top of next CL3. Ch 3. Skip next ch-3 sp. (CL3. Ch 2. CL3. Ch 1. 1 dc) all in top of turning ch. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Join into Front, Back and Sleeves as shown in diagrams on page 4. Pin garment pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry.
1st rnd: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at left side seam. Ch 1. Work 14 (17-17-17) sc across lower edge of each Motif around. Join with sl st to first sc. 140 (170-204-238) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). Skip next sc. *1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in 3rd ch of ch 4.
Next rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in 3rd ch of ch 4.
Next rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp – counts as CL2. *Ch 1. CL2 in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast A Pagoda (0014) 1 1 2 2 2 3 ball(s)
Caron® Simply Soft® Brites™ shades (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast B Watermelon (9604) 1 1 1 2 2 2 ball(s)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook
Dc4tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook
Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
gauge: 17 sts and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Stripe Pat. Motif = 4" [10 cm] square.
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Notes: • Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. • Motifs are joined as you work. Make all Motifs through 3rd rnd and choose color placement before working 4th rnd to join. First Motif With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.  See diagram on page 5. 1st rnd:  Ch 3. [3 dc. (Ch 2. 4 dc) 3 times] all in ring. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. *Ch 4. Dc4tog. Ch 4. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 4. Dc4tog. Ch 4. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp) twice. Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp) twice. Ch 2. 1 dc in top of first sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc around post of last dc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-4 sp. Ch 3.** 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Joining 2 Motifs Work 1st to 3rd rnds as given for First Motif. 4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc around post of last dc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-4 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Rep from * once more. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 3. **(3 dc. Ch 1. Sl st in corresponding ch-2 sp of adjoining Motif. 3 dc) in next ch-4 sp.** (Ch 1. Sl st in corresponding ch-3 sp of adjoining Motif. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp) twice. Ch 1. Sl st in corresponding ch-3 sp of adjoining Motif. Ch 1. Rep from ** to ** once more. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Joining 3 Motifs Work 1st to 3rd rnds as given for First Motif. 4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc around post of last dc. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 3. *(3 dc. Ch 1. Sl st in corresponding ch-2 sp of corresponding adjoining Motif. 3 dc) in next ch-4 sp.** (Ch 1. Sl st in corresponding ch-3 sp of adjoining Motif. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp) twice. Ch 1. Sl st in corresponding ch-3 sp of adjoining Motif. Ch 1. Rep from * to ** once more.* (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 3) twice. Rep from * to * once more. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. BODY Join 9 ( 10-11-13-14-16) Motifs into ring in the following sequence: Motif 1, Motif 2, Motif 3. Motif 1: Make 3 ( 3-4-4-5-5) Motifs, having B as Color 1, A as Color 2, C as Color 3. Motif 2: Make 3 ( 4-4-5-5-6) motifs, having D as Color 1, B as Color 2, E as Color 3. Motif 3: Make 3 ( 3-3-4-4-5) motifs, having E as Color 1, C as Color 2, B as Color 3. Fold work flat. PM at each side of folds, both top and bottom. Sizes XS/S and XL only: Because there is an odd number of Motifs, center 1 Motif at front or back when folding flat. All sizes: Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. Stripe Pattern Work 2 rows each in the following sequence: A, D, E, B, C, A, B, C. These 16 rows form Stripe Pat FRONT – Upper Body With RS facing, join A with sl st at right marker. 1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work 76 ( 84-92-110-118-136) sc evenly across Motifs to next marker. Turn. 77 ( 85-93-111-119-137) sc. See diagram on page 5. **2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off. Turn. 3rd row: Join D with sl st to first hdc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 sc in last hdc. Turn. 4th row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 hdc in last sc. Fasten off. Turn. First 4 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rows 3 (2-2-5-5-8) times more. Shape sides: 1st row:  (RS). Join appropriate color with sl st to first hdc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1 (inc made). 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last hdc. Ch 1 (inc made). 1 sc in last hdc. Turn. 2nd row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 hdc in last sc. Fasten off. Turn. 79 ( 87-95-113-121-139) sts (hdc and ch-1 sps). 3rd row:  Join appropriate color with sl st to first hdc. Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 2 sc in last hdc. Turn. 81 ( 89-97-115-123-141) sts (sc and ch-1 sps). 4th row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 hdc in last sc. Fasten off. Turn. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 4 rows 2 (2-2-2-2-0) time(s) more, then 1st and 2nd rows 1 (0-1-0-0-0) time(s) more. 91 ( 99-107-121-129-141) sts (hdc and ch-1 sps). Shape Sleeves: 1st row:  (RS). With appropriate color, ch 8. Join with sl st into first st of Body and pat across 91 ( 99-107-121-129-141) sts. Ch 10. Turn. PM at beg of row. 2nd row:  1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Pat across 91 ( 99-107-121-129-141) sts. 1 hdc in each of last 8 ch. Turn. 107 ( 115-123-137-145-157) sts. ** Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, cont in pat until work from marked row measures 6½ ( 7-7½- 7½- 8-8) [ 16.5 ( 18-19-19-20.5-20.5) cm], ending on a WS row. ***Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Join appropriate color with sl st to first hdc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 18 ( 20-22-24-25-28) times. Sc2tog (over ch-1 sp and hdc). Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 39 ( 43-47-51-53-59) sts (sc and ch-1 sps). 2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 37 (41-45-49-51-57) sts. 4th row: Work even in pat.*** Cont even in pat until work from marked row measures 8½ ( 9-9½-9½-10-10) [21.5 ( 23-24-24-25.5-25.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. ****With RS facing, skip next 27 ( 27-27-33-37-37) sts. Join appropriate color with sl st to next st and proceed as follows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn. 2nd row: Pat to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 3rd row: As 1st row. 37 ( 41-45-49-51-57) sts. 4th row: Work even in pat.**** Cont even in pat until work from marked row measures 8½ ( 9-9½-9½-10-10) [21.5 ( 23-24-24-25.5-25.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. Front - Bottom Edging:  With RS facing, join A with sl st at left marker. 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work 76 ( 84-92-110-118-136) sc evenly across Motifs to next marker. Turn. 77 (85-93-111-119-137) sc. Proceed in pat as established for Upper Body, work a further 7 rows in Stripe Pat, ending on a WS row. Next row: (RS – Picot row). Join C with sl st to first hdc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Picot. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Picot. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 sc in last hdc. Fasten off. BACK – Upper Body With RS facing, join A with sl st in same sp as last st of Front. 1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work 76 ( 84-92-110-118-136) sc evenly across Motifs to next marker (working last sc in same sp as first sc for Front). Turn. 77 (85-93-111-119-137) sc. Work from ** to ** as given for Front. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, cont in pat until work from marked row measures 4 rows less than Front before shoulder, ending on a WS row. Work from *** to *** as given for Front. Fasten off. Work from **** to **** as given for Front. Fasten off. Back - Bottom Edging Work as given for Front - Bottom Edging. FINISHING Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. Sew shoulder seams. Sew side and sleeve seams. Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color. Neck Edging: 1st rnd:  (RS). Join A with sl st at left shoulder. Ch 1. Work 9 sc down left front neck edge, 19 ( 21-21-23-27-27) sc evenly across front neck edge, 9 sc up right front neck edge, 4 sc down right back neck edge, 19 ( 21-21-23-27-27) sc evenly across back neck edge and 4 sc up left back neck edge. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 (68-68-72-80-80) sc. 2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 3rd rnd: (Bobble rnd). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With C, Bobble. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. Fasten off C. 4th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join B with sl st to first sc. Fasten off A. 5th rnd: (Picot rnd). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Picot. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Sleeve Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st at bottom sleeve seam. Ch 1. Work 56 ( 60-64-64-68-68) sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep 2nd to 5th rnds as given for Neck Edging. FRONT BACK

materials: Patons® Grace™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 136 yds/125 m)
Sizes U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) and U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) or size needed to obtain gauge. Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: To fit bust measurement XS/S/M/L 28-42" [71-106.5 cm] XL/2/3/4/5XL 44-62" [112-157.5 cm]. Finished bust measurement XS/S/M/L 50" [127 cm] XL/2/3/4/5 XL 70" [178 cm]
gauge: 21 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. Motif = 5" [12.5 cm] square with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes: 
• Motif is worked in a combination of rounds and rows. 
• Ch-3 at beg of rnd/row counts as dc throughout.
MOTIF 
See diagram on page 3.
Size XS/S/M/L: Make 44.
Size XL/2/3/4/5 XL: Make 60.
With larger hook and B, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 3. [2 dc (Ch 3. 3 dc) 3 times] in ring. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd:  Join C with sl st to any corner ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 
[(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1] 3 times. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.  
3rd rnd:  Join D with sl st to any corner ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 
3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
Note:  Next 4 rows are worked across 2 sides of Motif only.
4th row: (RS). Join A with sl st to any corner ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in corner ch-3 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. 3 dc in corner ch-3 sp. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
5th row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1). (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in corner ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.
6th row: (RS). Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in corner ch-3 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. 3 dc in ch-4 sp. Turn.
7th row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1). (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in corner ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.
Note: Next rnd is worked across all 4 sides of Motif.
8th rnd: (RS). Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in ch-4 sp at beg of 7th row. Ch 1. Working across side edges of prev rows, 3 dc in ch-4 sp at beg of 5th row. Ch 1. Working into 3rd rnd, 3 dc in next corner ch-3 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. 3 dc in next corner ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Working across side edge of prev rows, 3 dc around post of last dc of 5th row. Ch 1. 3 dc around post of last dc of 7th row. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Using Assembly Diagram on page 3, sew Motifs tog with A through back loops only using whip stitch, having all Motifs facing same way (see photo). Fold work in half to form Cardigan. Sew side and underarm seams.

Body Edging and Collar
With RS facing and smaller hook, join A with sl st to bottom right corner ch-3 sp of Front opening. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to corner ch-3 sp. 2 sc in corner ch-3 sp. *Working across next Motif, 1 sc in first ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. 2 sc in corner ch-3 sp. Rep from * up Right Front, across back neck, down Left Front and across bottom edge, working 3 sc in Bottom Left Front corner, ending with 2 sc in same sp as first sc. Break A. Join B with sl st to first sc. 
Collar: 2nd row:  (RS). With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc up Right Front, across back neck and down Left Front. 224 dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
3rd row:  Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 dcbp around next dc. Rep from * to last dcfp. 1 hdc in top of ch-3. Turn. 
4th row:  Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in top of ch 2. Turn. 
Rep last row for Ribbing until Collar measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Cuff edging: With RS facing and smaller hook, join A with sl st to Sleeve Cuff at underarm seam. 
Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc as given for Body Edging. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) XS/XL 7 balls or 2014 yds/1842 m; 2/5XL 9 balls or 2763 yds/2526 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit bust/chest measurement: XS/XL 28-46" [71-117 cm], 2/5XL 48-62" [122-157.5 cm]. Finished bust/chest measurement: XS/XL 65" [165 cm], 2/5XL 84" [213.5 cm].
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instruction will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Notes:
• Hoodie is worked in 5 pieces and seamed together in Finishing.
• Hood is worked from neck in Finishing.
Ribbing: Ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 32½ (42)" [82.5 (106.5) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off. Proceed as follows:
Set-up row: (RS). Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 98 (126) sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. PM at end of row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 33 (36)" [84 (91.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Back.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 26¾ (28½)" [68 (72.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape Left Front Neck: 1st row:
(RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 43 (57) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. PM at end of row.
***2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 6¼ (7½)" [16 (19) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.***
Shape Right Front Neck: 1st row:
(RS). Skip center 12 sc after Left Front Neck. Join yarn with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 42 (56) sc. Turn. PM at end of row. 43 (57) sc. Rep from *** to *** as given for Left Front Neck.
SLEEVES
Ribbing: Ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 10 (11½)" [25.5 (29) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off. Proceed as follows:
Set up row: (RS). Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 30 (34) sc evenly along side of Ribbing. Turn. PM at end of row.
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 32 (36) sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: As 1st row.
4th row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 1st to 4th rows 8 (9) times more, ending on a RS row. 84 (94) sc.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams 11¼ (15)" [28.5 (38) cm] in from side edges, leaving 10 (12)" [25.5 (30.5) cm] center back neck opening. PM 14 (16)" [35.5 (40.5) cm] down from shoulder seams on side edges. Sew in sleeves between markers. Sew side and sleeve seams.
HOOD
1st row: (RS). Beg at right front neck, join yarn with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. Work 9 (12) sc evenly up right front neck, 30 (36) sc evenly across back neck edge and 9 (12) sc evenly down front neck. Turn. PM at end of row. 48 (60) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 (2) sc. [2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 (4) sc] 11 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 7 (2) sc. Turn. 60 (72) sc.
4th row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 4th row until Hood from marker measures 13 (16)" [33 (40.5) cm], ending on a RS row.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 28 (34) sc. Sc2tog. PM after last st between sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 28 (34) sc. Turn. 58 (70) sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 2 sts before marker. Sc2tog. PM after last st between sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to end of row. 56 (68) sc.
Rep last row, dec 2 sts every row, until 48 (60) sts rem, ending on a RS row.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
Fasten off.
Fold Hood in half and sew top seam.
Hood Edging: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to bottom corner of right front neck opening. Ch 1. Work 127 (153) sc evenly up side of right neck edge, across Hood opening, and down side of left neck edge. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Edging measures 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew ends of Hood Edging to bottom of neck opening (12 skipped sts). Sew edges of Hood Edging together 2" [5 cm] up from Bottom of neck opening.
POCKET
Ch 53 (59).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 52 (58) sc.
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 50 (56) sc.
12th and 13th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 11th to 13th rows 7 (8) times more, then 11th and 12th rows once. 34 (38) sc.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn. Cont working edging around Pocket as follows:
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Work sc evenly around Pocket, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew Pocket in position centered across Front and 11" [28 cm] above bottom edge (see diagram on page 5).
EARS (make 2)
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral, PM on first st of rnd for easier counting.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th to 12th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
13th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
14th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 18 sc.
Fasten off.
Flatten Ear, pushing one side into the other, noting Ear will naturally cup. Fold last rnd in half, aligning cupped edges together. Sew last round together, working through all 4 thickness to close Ear.
Sew Ears into position, one on each side of Hood, approx 4" [10 cm] in from front edge and 3½" [9 cm] down from top seam of Hood (as shown in photo).

materials: RED HEART® “Kids®”: 1 skein each 2846 Cruise Blue A, 2650 Pistachio B.
abbreviations: A, B, etc= color A, B, etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 14 dc = 4”; 11 rows = 6” using larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BACK
With larger hook and B, ch 48 (51, 55, 58). 
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across – 46 (49, 53, 56) dc. 
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), turn, dc in each dc, dc in top of turning ch.  
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 5 1/2 (5 1/2, 6 1/2, 6 1/2)” from beginning, end on wrong side row.
Shape Armhole
Next Row (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, slip st in first 5 sts, ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each st to last 4 sts, leave last 4 sts unworked – 38 (41, 45, 48) sts. 
Work in dc until Armhole measures 5 1/2 (5 1/2, 6 1/2, 6 1/2)”. Fasten off.
Rib 
With right side facing and smaller hook, join A at lower edge, ch 3 (counts as dc), work 45 (47, 51, 55) dc evenly across opposite edge of beginning ch – 46 (48, 52, 56) sts. 
Ribbing Row: Ch 2 (counts as st), [Fpdc, Bpdc] across to last st, hdc in top of turning ch. 
Repeat Ribbing Row until Rib measures 1 1/2 (2, 1 1/2, 2)”. Fasten off.
LEFT FRONT
With larger hook and B, ch 25 (26, 28, 30). 
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across – 23 (24, 26, 29) dc. 
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), turn, dc in each dc, dc in top of turning ch.  
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 5 1/2 (5 1/2, 6 1/2, 6 1/2)” from beginning, end on wrong side row.
Shape Armhole
Next Row (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, slip st in first 5 sts, ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each st across – 19 (20, 22, 25) sts. 
Work in dc until Armhole measures 4 (4, 5, 5)”, end with a right side row. 
Shape Neck
Next Row (Wrong Side): Ch 3, dc to last 7 (7, 7, 9) sts, leave remaining sts unworked for Neck – 12 (13, 15, 16) sts. 
Dec 1 st at Neck edge every row twice – 10 (11, 13, 14) sts. 
Work until piece measures same length as Back to Shoulders. Fasten off.
Buttonhole Row: Ch 1, turn, [sc to where marked for Button, ch 2, skip 2 sc] 6 times, sc to end. 
Next Row: Ch 1, [sc to ch-2 space, work 2 sc in ch-2 space] 6 times, sc to end. Fasten off. 
Sew on buttons. Weave in ends. 
RED HEART® “Kids”, Art. E711 available in solid 5 oz (141 g), 290 yd (265 m) and multi 4 oz (113 g); 232 yd (212 m) skeins..
Rib 
With right side facing and smaller hook, join A at lower edge, ch 3 (counts as dc), work 22 (23, 25, 28) dc evenly across opposite edge of beginning ch – 23 (24, 26, 29) sts. 
Ribbing Row: Ch 2 (counts as st), [Fpdc, Bpdc] across to last st, hdc in top of turning ch. 
Repeat Ribbing Row until Rib measures 1 1/2 (2, 1 1/2, 2)”. Fasten off.
Right Front
Work same as for Left Front reversing shaping. 
SLEEVES 
With larger hook and B, ch 28 (30, 32, 34). 
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across – 26 (28, 30, 32) dc. 
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), turn, dc in each dc, dc in top of turning ch.  
Repeat Row 2, inc 1 st each side every other row 6 (5, 8, 7) times – 38 (38, 46, 46) dc.
Work even until piece measures 8 (9, 10, 11 1/2)” from beginning. Fasten off. 
Rib 
With right side facing and smaller hook, join A at lower edge, ch 3 (counts as dc), work 21 (21, 22, 25) dc evenly across opposite edge of beginning ch – 22 (22, 24, 26) sts. 
Ribbing Row: Ch 2 (counts as st), [Fpdc, Bpdc] across to last st, hdc in top of turning ch. 
Repeat Ribbing Row until Rib measures 2”. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Shoulders. Sew in Sleeves. Sew side and Sleeve seams. 
Neck Band
With right side facing and smaller hook, join A at Right Front Neck edge, ch 3, work 47 (47, 49, 49) sts evenly spaced around Neck edge – 48 (48, 50, 50) sts.
Work Ribbing Row as for Back. Fasten off. 
Button Band
(Work on Left Front for girls, Right Front for boys)
With right side facing and smaller hook, join A and work 39 (40, 45, 47) sc evenly spaced along Front edge.  
Work 2 more rows in sc. Fasten off. 
Buttonhole Band
Mark for 6 buttons evenly spaced on Button Band.
Work 1 row in sc as for Button Band.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m) Contrast A Pink Punch (2001) 1 ball or 9 Squares
Red Heart® All in One™ Flower Power™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m) Contrast B Peony Pop (2021) 1 ball or 9 Squares + 2 Partial Squares for Pocket Appliques
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Large-eyed sharp needle to sew applique Motifs to pockets.
Coats® Dual Duty thread in shade to match sweatshirt.
measurements: Instructions for Sleeves are one size to fit Adult (over-sized fit).
gauge: Granny Square and Flower Power Motifs = 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
GRANNY SQUARE MOTIF
See diagram on page 4.
Make 9 with A.
Notes:
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 rnd in the Motif with 5 colors in total. If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends leaving a tail for weaving in. Begin next Motif with Color 1 and repeat 5 rnds for each Motif.
• Granny Square how video to here.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.

CROCHET I SKILL LEVEL: EASY

MATERIALS

With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off.
Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square.

FLOWER POWER MOTIF
See diagram on page 4.
Make 9 with B. 
Notes:
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• 2nd and 3rd rnds will be worked in Color 2.
• 4th, 5th, and 6th rnds will be worked in Color 3.
• If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• At end of final rnd, Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square, with long tail (at least 24" [61 cm]) rem for seaming.
• Adjust gauge as needed working 4th, 5th and 5th rounds of Flower Motif to maintain 6" [15 cm] square finished size to match Granny Square Motif.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st unless otherwise stated.

With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join. 10 dc. Color 1 complete.
2nd rnd: With Color 2, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next dc. (Ch 3. 1 tr) in same st as last sl st. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. *(1 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around, ending by joining with sl st to first sl st. Color 2 complete.
4th rnd: With Color 3, sl st in first dc (top of ch-3 of 3rd rnd), to beg rnd at start of first Petal. Ch 3. *1 dc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 sc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in dc of 2nd rnd below sl st.** 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 6 (counts as tr and ch-2). 1 tr in same sp as sl st. *2 dc in next st. Ch 1. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Ch 1. 2 dc in next st.** (1 tr. Ch 2. 1 tr) all in next st. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join to 4th ch of ch-6.
6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 3 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(3 hdc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp.** (3 hdc. Ch 3. 3 hdc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 hdc in first ch-2 sp. Join.
Fasten off at end of Color 3, leaving long tail for seaming.
Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square.

SLEEVES
Block all Motifs to measure 6" [15 cm] square.
Join Motifs as shown in diagrams on page 4 using Flat Sl St seam using long tail of Color 3 from Flower Power Motifs, noting Left and Right Sleeve diagrams.
Seaming with Flat Sl St:
Sl st through back loops only and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work.
Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.
FLAT SL ST JOIN

POCKET MOTIFS (make 2)
With B, work 1st to 4th rnds of Flower Power Motif.
Fasten off, leaving a long end of Color 3 to sew Motif to pocket.

DRAWSTRING
Using 2 strands of Color 3 from B, make a chain 50" [127 cm] long. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Cut cuffs off sweatshirt sleeves leaving approx ¾" [2 cm] of fabric above cuff seam. Fold cuff flat and PM at both fold lines.

Instructions from now on will be referring to Granny Square sleeves.
Turn Sleeves inside out. With WS of Sleeve facing you, place RS of cuff edge along RS of Sleeve. Match 1 marker to joining seam of 2 Motifs on Sleeve and match other marker to next joining seam of 2 Motifs, then pin cuff in position. Using sewing machine, with Sleeve on top, sew cuff to Sleeve lower edge, stretching cuff as you sew to ‘gather’ lower edge of Sleeve to fit. For best results, try to stitch right above seam edge on cuff and along last round of Motifs (see photos). Turn Sleeves inside out. Finish ‘raw’ edge of cuff seam with serger or overcast stitching as desired.

Mark placement for Sleeves on sweatshirt 12" [30.5 cm] down from shoulder seams. Cut sleeves off sweatshirt following seamline and allowing approx ¾" [2 cm] seam allowance (see photo). Discard sweatshirt sleeves. Cut side seam below armhole of sweatshirt to reach marker.
Turn sweatshirt inside out. Place RS of Sleeve along RS of sweatshirt armhole opening. Match top of Sleeve to shoulder seam and base of Sleeve to lower armhole, then pin Sleeve in position. Using sewing machine, with Sleeve facing you, sew armhole seam sewing just outer edge of Sleeve (along last round of Motifs) to ¾" [2 cm] seam allowed on sweatshirt, tapering to a narrow seam for lower armhole as needed. For best results, try to stitch close to seam edge on sweatshirt. Finish ‘raw’ edge of sleeve seam with serger or overcast stitching as desired.
Place cardboard inside kangaroo pocket to make sure you do not catch stitching through more than top layer of pocket. Pin Pocket Motif in position and using yarn end with large-eyed sharp needle, sew Pocket Motif in position. Rep on remaining kangaroo pocket.
Remove hood drawstring. Using safety pin that will fit into hood eyelet hole, attach new Drawstring to safety pin and draw through hood casing. Knot ends and weave in yarn ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby Stripes™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 287 yds/262 m)
Bernat® Softee® Baby™ (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m)
Contrast B Little Red Wagon (54004) 1 1 1 1 ball
Sizes U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) and U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of stitch at back of work, inserting hook from left to right. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of stitch at front of work, inserting hook from left to right. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 6 mos 17" [43 cm], 12 mos 18" [45.5 cm], 18 mos 19" [48 cm], 24 mos 20" [51 cm]
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

Note: Cardigan is worked in one piece from neck downwards. Sleeves are worked after.
With A, beg at neck edge, ch 47 (51-55-59). 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 1 hdc). (2 hdc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch) 22 (24-26-28) times. Turn. 67 (73-79-85) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 sc in next hdc) 22 (24-26-28) times. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next sc). 21 ( 23-25-27) times. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 68 (74-80-86) dc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 sc in sp between last dc and next dc. (1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in sp between last dc and next dc) 22 ( 24-26-28) times. 1 sc in last dc. Turn. 91 (99-107-115) sc.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc (counts as 2 hdc). Skip next 2 sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) 44(48-52-56) times. 1 hdc in last sc. Turn. 91 (99-107-115) hdc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc across. Turn.
7th row: As 5th row.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc across. Turn.
9th to 11th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 1 (2-1-1) sc. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc) 30 (32-35-38) times. 1 sc in each of next 0 (1-1-0) sc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 0 (1-0-0) sc. (3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next sc) 29 (31-34-37) times. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 1 (2-2-1) sc. Turn. 92 (100-108-116) dc.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 1 (2-1-1) dc. 1 sc in sp between last dc and next dc. (1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in sp between last dc and next dc) 30 (32-35-38) times. 1 sc in each of next 1 (2-2-1) dc. Turn. 123 (133-144-155) sc.
15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Divide Sleeves and Body:
16th row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 (14-15-15) sc. Ch 7 (8-9-10). Place marker on last ch. Skip next 32 (36-40-45) sc. 1 sc in each of next 31 (33-34-35) sc. Ch 7 (8-9-10). Place marker on first ch. Skip next 32 (36-40-45) sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 (14-15-15) sc. Turn. 73 (77-82-85) sts (sc and ch) for Body.
Body:
17th row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in first sc. (Skip next sc or ch. 2 hdc in next sc or ch) 35 (37-40-41) times. 1 hdc in each of next 2 (2-1-2) sc. Turn. 73 (77-82-85) hdc.
18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc across. Turn.
19th row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in first sc. (Skip next sc. 2 hdc in next sc) 35 (37-40-41) times. 1 hdc in each of next 2 (2-1-2) sc. Turn.
Rep 18th and 19th rows 6 (8-10-12) times more.
Sizes 6,12 and 24 mos only: Next row: As 18th row. Break A, join B.
Size 18 mos only: Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 40 hdc. 2 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 83 sc. Break A, join B.
All sizes:
Ribbing:
1st row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc) *Dcbp around next st. Dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in top of ch 2. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in top of ch 2. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more. Fasten off.
RIGHT SLEEVE:
With RS facing, join A with sl st to marked ch at right armhole.
Sizes 6, 18 and 24 mos only: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 (4-5) ch. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 1 (3-3) ch. 1 sc in each of next 32 (40-45) sc.
Size 12 mos only: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sts.
**All sizes: 2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) 18 (20-23-26) times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 38(42-48-54) hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next 17 (19-10-25) hdc. Sc2tog] 2(2-4-2) times. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 (40-44-52) sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 2. (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) 17 (19-21-25) times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
5th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next 16 (18-20-11) hdc. Sc2tog] 2(2-2-4) times. Join with sl st to first sc. 34 (38-42-48) sc.
6th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) 16 (18-20-23) times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
7th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next 15 (17-19-22) hdc. Sc2tog] twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 (36-40-46) sc.
8th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) 15 (17-19-22) times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
9th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next 14 (16-18-21) hdc. Sc2tog] twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 (34-38-44) sc.
10th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) 14 (16-18-21) times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
11th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next 13 (15-17-20) hdc. Sc2tog] twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 (32-36-42) sc.
12th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) 13 (15-17-20) times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
13th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next 12 (14-16-19) hdc. Sc2tog] twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 26 (30-34-40) sc.
14th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) 12 (14-16-19) times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
15th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next 11 (13-15-18) hdc. Sc2tog] twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 (28-32-38) sc.
16th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) 11 (13-15-18) times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
Sizes 12, 18 and 24 mos only:
17th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next (12-14-17) hdc. Sc2tog] twice. Join with sl st to first sc. (26-30-36) sc.
18th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) (12-14-17) times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
19th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next (11-13-16) hdc. Sc2tog] twice. Join with sl st to first sc. (24-28-34) sc.
20th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) (11-13-16) times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
Sizes 18 and 24 mos only:
21st rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next (12-15) hdc. Sc2tog] twice. Join with sl st to first sc. (26-32) sc.
22nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) (12-15) times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
Size 24 mos only:
23rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 14 hdc. Sc2tog) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
24th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Miss next sc. (2 hdc in next sc. Skip next sc) 14 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
All Sizes:
Next rnd: Break A, join B with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 22 (24-26-30) sc.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.

materials: Caron Simply Soft Paints 100% acrylic, 4oz/114g, 208yd/190m): #0008 Sunset, 5 (5, 6, 6, 7, 7) skeins
Size US H-8 (5 mm) crochet hook, or size to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Cl (cluster): Work dc until 2 loops remain, work 2nd dc in same st until 3 loops remain, yo, pull thru all loops
gauge: 9 clusters and 8 rows = 4”/10 cm
instructions:
Double Crochet Cluster  (any number of sts, plus 2 for turning ch): Set up row: Cl in 4th ch from hook, cl in each ch across to last ch, dc in last ch, turn. Row 1:  Ch 3, cl in space before first cl, *cl between cl in previous row; repeat from * across, dc in turning ch, turn. Rep Row 1 for Double Crochet Cluster. 

NOTES Vest is worked in one piece from lower edge of front, up and over shoulder to back lower edge. 

LEFT FRONT Ch 22 (24, 26, 30, 34, 38). Work in Double Crochet Cluster until left front measures 12 (12.5, 13, 13.5, 14, 14.5)”/30.5 (32, 33, 34.5, 35.5, 37)cm. Shape neck & sleeve Next row (RS):  Ch 11 at beg of next row for left sleeve, work across front in pattern, working 1 less cl at end of row, turn. Work 1 row even in pattern. Repeat these 2 rows once more—36 (38, 40, 44, 48, 52) sts. Continue to dec at neck edge every other row 3 (3, 4, 4, 7, 9) more times, then every row 6 (6, 5, 5, 2, 0) times—27 (29, 31, 35, 39, 43) sts. Work even until neck measures 8 (8, 9, 9, 10, 11)”/20.5 (20.5, 23, 23, 25.5, 28)cm. Cut yarn and set aside. 

RIGHT FRONT Ch 22 (24, 26, 30, 34, 38). Work in Double Crochet Cluster until right front measures 12 (12.5, 13, 13.5, 14, 14.5)”/30.5 (32, 33, 34.5, 35.5, 37)cm. Shape neck & sleeve Next row (WS): Ch 11 at beg of next row for right sleeve, work across front in pattern, working 1 less cl at end of row, turn. Work 1 row even in pattern. Repeat these 2 rows once more—36 (38, 40, 44, 48, 52) sts. Continue to dec at neck edge every other row 3 (3, 4, 4, 7, 9) more times, then every row 6 (6, 5, 5, 2, 0) times—27 (29, 31, 35, 39, 43) sts. Work even until neck measures 8 (8, 9, 9, 10, 11)”/20 (20, 23, 23, 25.5, 28)cm, end after a WS row with yarn at sleeve edge. Note: Make note of number of rows worked for sleeve after shaping. 

BACK Work across right front, ch 18 for back neck, continue across left front—72 (76, 80, 86, 96, 104) sts. Work even until back sleeves match front sleeves. Shape sleeves Next 4 rows: Work to last 7 sts, turn. Work even on 40 (44, 48, 56, 64, 72) sts until back measures same as front to foundation row. Fasten off. 

FINISHING Sew side and underarm seams. Weave in ends. Fold up sleeve cuff.

materials: Bernat® Satin (100 g/3.5 oz; 182 m/200 yds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 dc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size. Note: Body is worked in one piece to armholes.
BODY
Ch 107 (119-131-143-167-191).
Foundation row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Miss next 2 ch. [(Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops) twice in next ch (counts as 2 dc). Yoh and draw through all 3 loops - cluster made (Ch 3. Cluster) twice] all in same ch - shell made. Miss next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 17 (19-21-23-27-31) shells.
1st row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 3. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in next dc. Shell in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
Last 2 rows form pat. (See diagram on page 3).
Cont in pat until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Divide for armholes: Next row: Pat across first 4 (5-5-5-6-7) shells, ending with 1 dc in next dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: (WS). Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3). *1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
Next row: Pat across, ending with 1 dc in 3rd ch of ch 6. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Right Front until armhole measures 3 (3-5-5-6-6)" [7.5 (7.5-12.5-12.5-15-15) cm], ending with a RS row. Neck shaping: Next row: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3). *1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Rep from * to last 2 (2-2-2-3-3) shells, ending with 1 dc in next dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont even in pat until armhole measures 8 (8-9-9-10-11)" [20.5 (20.5-23-23-25.5-28) cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, miss next shell. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 3 (counts as dc). Pat across next 7 (7-9-11-13-15) shells, ending with 1 dc in next dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3). *1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Rep from * across, ending with 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
Next row: Pat across, ending with 1 dc in 3rd ch of ch 6. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Back until armhole measures 8 (8-9-9-10-11)" [20.5 (20.5-23-23-25.5-28) cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, miss next shell. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 3 (counts as dc). Pat to end of row. Turn.
Cont even in pat until armhole measures 3 (3-5-5-6-6)" [7.5 (7.5-12.5-12.5-15-15) cm], ending with a RS. Fasten off.
Neck shaping: Next row: (WS). Miss first 2 (2-2-2-3-3) shells. Rejoin yarn with sl st in next dc. Ch 6 (counts as 1 dc and ch 3). Pat to end of row. Turn.
Cont even in pat until armhole measures 8 (8-9-9-10-11)" [20.5 (20.5-23-23-25.5-28) cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off.
SLEEVES
Ch 35 (35-35-41-41-47).
Foundation row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Miss next 2 ch. Shell in next ch. Miss next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 5 (5-5-6-6-7) shells.
1st row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 3. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in next dc. Shell in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
Last 2 rows form pat.
3rd row: As 1st row.
4th row: (Increase row). Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. Pat to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 3 (5-6-5-7-7) times more. 6 (8-9-8-10-10) dc before and after shell pat.
Cont even in pat until work from beg measures 10 (10-11-11-11-11)" [25.5 (25.5-28-28-28-28) cm], ending with a WS row. Place markers 1½" [4 cm] down along side edges of Sleeve.
Shape top: Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (Yoh and draw up a loop in next dc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops - dc2tog made. Pat to last 3 sts. Dc2tog over next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last row 4 (4-5-6-7-8) times more. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Sew in sleeves placing rows above markers along back and front armhole shaping. Sew side and sleeve seams.
Outer edging: With RS of work facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom of Right Front. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 36 (36-41-41-44-44) sc up right front edge, 2 sc in corner, 11 (16-11-11-16-16) sc across front neck edge. 14 (14-12-12-12-14) sc up front neck edge, 17 (17-17-27-38-38) sc across back neck edge, 14 (14-12-12-12-14) sc down front neck edge, 11 (16-11-11-16-16) sc across front neck edge, 2 sc in corner, 36 (36-41-41-44-44) sc down left front, 2 sc in corner, 85 (99-111-117-138-158) sc across bottom and 1 sc in corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 232 (256-264-280-328-352) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Miss next 3 sc. (1 dc. Ch 2. Sl st in top of dc – picot made. Ch 1) 5 times in next sc. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, omitting sc at end of last rep. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Sleeve edging: Join yarn with sl st at side seam. Working along foundation ch, proceed as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around, ending with 2 sc in ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to first st. 36 (36-36-42-42-48) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 dc. Picot. Ch 1) 4 times in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, omitting sc at end of last rep. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
