Sew each side of snap fastener in position at top corner of neck edge. Sew button in position as shown in picture. Button is decorative only.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333m)
Sizes U.S. I/9 [5.5 mm] and U.S. J/10 [6 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcbp made
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 12 hdc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes, the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

BACK
**Ribbing
With smaller hook. Ch 65 (71-77-83-89). Foundation row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 63 (69-75-81-87) dc. 1st row: (WS). Ch 2. Skip first st, *1 dcfp into next st. 1 dcbp into next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts, ending with 1 dcfp in next st. 1 hdc into top of beg ch-2. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 2. Skip first st. *1 dcbp in next st. 1 dcfp in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts, ending with 1 dcbp in next st. 1 hdc into top of beg ch-2. Turn. Rep 1st and 2nd rows of Rib Pat pat until work from beg measures 2½" [6.5 cm], ending on a WS row.

Body
Change to larger hook.
1st row: (RS). Ch 2 (counts as hdc). Skip first st. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 63 (69-75-81-87) hdc. Rep last row until work from beg measures 16½" [42 cm], ending on a WS row.

Shape Armholes: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 9 (11-13-15-16) sts. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to last 8 (10-12-14-15) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 47 (49-51-53-57) hdc.** Cont even until work from beg measures 25 (25½-26-26½-26½)" [63.5 (65-66-67-67.5) cm], ending on a WS row.

Right Shoulder Shaping: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. Skip first st. 1 hdc in each of next 11 (12-13-14-16) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 12 (13-14-15-17) hdc. 2nd row: Ch 2. Skip first st. 1 hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. 11 (12-13-14-16) hdc. Work even until work from beg measures 26 (26½-27-27½-27)" [66 (67.5-68.5-70-70) cm] from beginning. Fasten off.

Left Shoulder Shaping: 1st row: (RS). Skip first 23 sts to the left of right shoulder shaping. With larger hook, join yarn with sl st in next st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 12 (13-14-15-17) hdc. 2nd row: Ch 2. Skip first st. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. 1 hdc2tog. 11 (12-13-14-16) hdc. Work even until work from beg measures 26 (26½-27-27½-27)" [66 (67.5-68.5-70-70) cm] from beginning. Fasten off. Fasten off.

Bottom Edging
1st row: (RS). With smaller hook, join yarn with sl st in first ch of foundation row. Sl st in each ch to end of row. Fasten off.

FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Back. Cont even until work from beg measures 22½ (23-23½-24-24)" [57 (58.5-60-61-61) cm], ending on a WS row. Turn.

Left Shoulder Shaping: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 15 (16-17-18-20) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 16 (17-18-19-21) hdc. 2nd row: Sl st in each of first 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip first st. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 14 (15-16-17-19) hdc. 3rd row: Ch 2. Skip first st. 1 hdc in each st to end of row to last 2 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 12 (13-14-15-17) hdc. 4th row: Ch 2. Skip first st. 1 hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. 11 (12-13-14-16) hdc. Work even in hdc until front measures same as back to shoulders. Fasten off.

Right Shoulder Shaping: 1st row: (RS). Skip first 15 sts to the left of right shoulder shaping. With larger hook, join yarn with sl st in next st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 16 (17-18-19-21) hdc. 2nd row: Ch 2. Skip first st. 1 hdc in each st to end of row to last 2 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 14 (15-16-17-19) hdc. 3rd row: Sl st in each of first 3 sts. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 12 (13-14-15-17) hdc. 4th row: Ch 2. Skip first st. 1 hdc in each st to end of row to last 2 sts. 1 hdc2tog. Turn. 11 (12-13-14-16) hdc. Work even in hdc until front measures same as back to shoulders. Fasten off.

Bottom Edging: Work same as back bottom edging.

SLEEVES
With smaller hook, ch 33. Foundation row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 31 dc. Work even in rib pat as given for Back until work from beg measures 2½" [6.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Change to larger hook.
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. Skip first st. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 2. Skip first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 33 hdc.
4th row: Ch 2. Skip first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Rep last 2 rows 7 (11-13-17-17) times more. 47 (55-59-67-67) hdc.
Sizes XS/S, M and L only: Next 2 rows: Ch 2. Skip first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 49 (57-61) hdc.
Next 3 rows: Ch 2. Skip first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Rep last 4 rows 4 (2-1) times more. 57 (61-63) hdc.
Next row: Ch 2. Skip first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 22½ (23½-23½-23½-23½)" [57 (60-60-60-60) cm]. Fasten off.

Bottom Edging
Work same as back bottom edging.

FINISHING
Sew front to back to end of row left shoulder.

NECKBAND
1st row: (RS). With smaller hook, join yarn with a sl st to neck edge of right shoulder seam. Ch 3 (counts as dc). Work 65 dc evenly-spaced around neckline. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Work even in rib pat as given for Back until neckband measures 1½" [4 cm], ending on a WS row. Next row: Sl st in each st to end of row. Fasten off. Sew right shoulder seam and side of neckband. Set in sleeves, using square-indented construction. Sew sleeve and side seams.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit™: 2 (3, 4, 5) skeins of 938 Red/White.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm [US K-10½].
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same stitch
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 10 sts and 11 rows in pattern = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needle to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
BACK
Ch 31 (35, 39, 43).
Set up row: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, dc in next ch, *sc in next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn – 30 (34, 38, 42) sts.
Work in Stitch Pattern A until back measures 8 (9½, 11, 13½)” (20.5 [24, 28, 34.5] cm) from beginning. Place markers at each end of last row for sleeve placement.

FIRST SLEEVE
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn with a slip at marker on right side of Front, ch 1, work 28 (30, 32, 34) sc evenly spaced across edge to other sleeve marker, turn.
Rows 2-5: Work in Pattern Stitch A.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts (decrease made), *sc in next dc, dc in next sc; repeat from * across to last 2 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn – 26 (28, 30, 32) sts.
Rows 7-9: Ch 3, (counts as dc), sc in next dc, *dc in next sc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts (decrease made), *dc in next sc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across to last 2 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn – 24 (26, 28, 30) sts.
Rows 11-13: Work even in Pattern Stitch A.
Maintaining st patterns, decrease 1 st at each end of next row and every 4th row thereafter until 18 (20, 20, 20) sts remain. Work even in pattern until sleeve measures 8 (10, 12, 14)” (20.5 [25.5, 30.5, 35.5] cm) from top.
Fasten off.

SECOND SLEEVE
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn with a slip st at marker on right side of Back, work same as First Sleeve.

FINISHING
Sew side and Sleeve seams.
Neck Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn with a slip st to right shoulder seam, ch 1, work 40 sc evenly spaced around neck opening; join with a slip st in first sc.
Rounds 2-3: Ch 1, working in back loop only, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

Special Stitches Used
sc2tog (decrease): [Insert hook in next st, yarn over, draw yarn through st] twice, yarn over, draw yarn through 3 loops on hook.

Stitch Pattern A 
(worked on an even number of sts)
Ch an odd number of sts.
Set up row: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, dc in next ch, *sc in next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn. 
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first st, dc in next sc, *sc in next dc, dc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn.
Repeat Row 1 for pattern.

Stitch Pattern B 
(worked on an odd number of sts)
Row 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), *sc in next dc, dc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *dc in next sc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across, turn.
Repeat Rows 1-2 for pattern.

FRONT
Work same as for Back until Front measures 11½ (13½, 15½, 18½)” (29 [34.5, 39.5, 47] cm) from beginning.
First Shoulder
Row 1: Work in Stitch Pattern A across first 8 (10, 12, 14) sts, slip st in next st, turn.
Row 2: Skip first slip st, slip st in each of next 2 sts, work in Row 1 of Stitch Pattern B across first 7 (9, 11, 13) sts, turn – 7 (9, 11, 13) sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, work in Row 2 of Stitch Pattern B across next 7 (9, 11, 13) sts, turn.
Work even in Pattern Stitch B on 7 (9, 11, 13) sts until front measures same as finished Back. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.

Second Shoulder
Row 1: Skip next 12 sts to the left of last st made in Row 1 of First Shoulder, join yarn with a slip st in next st, ch 1, skip first st, work in Stitch Pattern A across last 8 (10, 12, 14) sts, turn – 8 (10, 12, 14) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *dc in next sc, sc in next dc; repeat from * 3 (4, 5, 6) times, slip st in next st, turn – 7 (9, 11, 13) sts.
Row 3: Skip first slip st, slip st in next sc, work in Pattern Stitch B across 7 (9, 11, 13) sts, turn.
Starting with Row 2 of pattern, work even in Pattern Stitch B on 7 (9, 11, 13) sts until front measures same as finished Back. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
With wrong sides facing, slip st shoulders together.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc3tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
gauge: 16 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

BACK
Ch 83 ( 91-99-107-115-131). See diagram on page 3.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 81 ( 89-97-105-113-129) hdc.
**2nd row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. *3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 2 dc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts (dc, sc, dc). 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows for Lace Pat until work from beg measures 6" [15 cm], ending on a 3rd row.** Fasten off.

FRONTS (make 2 alike)
Ch 43 ( 47-51-55-59-67). 1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.  41 ( 45-49-53-57-65) hdc.
Work from ** to ** as given for Back. Fasten off at end of Right Front. Do not fasten off at end of Left Front.

BODY
Joining row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. [Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts (dc, sc, dc). 1 sc in next dc] 9 ( 10-11-12-13-15) times. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts. Sc2tog over last dc of Left Front and first dc of Back. [Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts (dc, sc, dc). 1 sc in next dc] 19 ( 21-23-25-27-31) times. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts. Sc2tog over last dc of Back and first dc of Right Front. [Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts (dc, sc, dc). 1 sc in next dc] 9 ( 10-11-12-13-15) times. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts. 1 sc in last dc. Turn. 40 ( 44-48-52-56-64) ch-3 sps.
Beg on a 3rd row, proceed in Lace Pat as given for Back until work from beg measures 20" [51 cm], ending on a 4th row.
Divide for Right Front and Sleeve Shaping: 1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) 9 ( 10-11-12-13-15) times. 2 dc in next sc. Ch 61. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.

2nd row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch) 14 times. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts (dc, sc, dc). 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 24 ( 25-26-27-28-30) ch-3 sps.

Beg on a 3rd row, proceed in Lace Pat as given for Back until work from dividing row measures 6 ( 6-6½-7-8-9)" [ 15 ( 15-16.5-18-20.5-23) cm], ending on a 3rd row. 
Shape neck: 1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts (dc, sc, dc). 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 16 ( 16-20-20-24-24) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Cont in Lace Pat as given for Back until work from dividing row measures 10 ( 10-10½-11-12-13)" [ 25.5 ( 25.5-26.5-28-30.5-33) cm], ending on a 3rd row. Fasten off.

Back and Sleeve Shaping:   1st row: (RS). Ch 60. 2 dc in same sp as last 2 dc of Right Front. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) 19 ( 21-23-25-27-31) times. 2 dc in next sc. Ch 61. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.

2nd row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch) 14 times. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts (dc, sc, dc). 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to ch-60. (Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch) 15 times. Turn. 50 ( 52-54-56-58-62) ch-3 sps.

Beg on a 3rd row, cont in Lace Pat as given for Back until work from dividing row measures 3 rows less than Right Front.

Shape right back neck: PM on sc at each side of center 8 ( 8-10-10-12-12) ch-3 sps.
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. *3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to marked sc. 2 dc in marked sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts (dc, sc, dc). 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. *3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 2 dc in last sc. Fasten off.

Shape left back neck: Skip center 8 ( 8-10-10-12-12) ch-3 sps. 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to next marked sc. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. *3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 2 dc in last sc. Turn.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts (dc, sc, dc). 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. *3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 2 dc in last sc. Fasten off.

Left Front and Sleeve: 1st row:  (RS). Ch 60. 2 dc in same sp as last 2 dc of Back. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) 9 ( 10-11-12-13-15) times. 2 dc in last sc. Turn.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts (dc, sc, dc). 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to ch-60. (Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) 15 times. Turn. 24 ( 25-26-27-28-30) ch-3 sps.

Beg on a 3rd row, cont in Lace Pat as given for Back until work from dividing row measures 6 ( 6-6½-7-8-9)" [ 15 ( 15-16.5-18-20.5-23) cm], ending on a 3rd row. Fasten off.

Shape neck: 1st row:  (WS). Skip first 16 ( 16-20-20-24-24) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next dc (center dc of 3-dc group). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts (dc, sc, dc). 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

Cont in Lace Pat as given for Back until work from dividing row measures 10 ( 10-10½-11-12-13)" [ 25.5 ( 25.5-26.5-28-30.5-33) cm], ending on a 3rd row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. Sew shoulder and sleeve seams.
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. 
Neck edging: 1st row:  (RS). Join yarn with sl st to top right corner at neck edge. Ch 2. Work in hdc evenly around neck edge, having hdc3tog in inner corners. Turn.

2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row, having hdc3tog in inner corners. Fasten off.

Button Band: 1st row:  (RS). Join yarn with sl st to top of Left Front at neck edge. Ch 2. Work in hdc evenly down left front edge. Turn.

2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.

Buttonhole band: 1st row:  (RS). Join yarn with sl st to bottom corner of Right Front. Ch 2. Work in hdc evenly up right front edge. Turn.

2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. [Ch 7. Join with sl st to top of last hdc (button loop). 1 hdc in each of next 16 hdc (button loop)] twice. Ch 7. Join with sl st to top of last hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m)
Contrast A Peony Pink (53417) 1 ball yds/m 182/166 for XS/S, 195/178 for M/L, 228/208 for XL/2/3XL, 295/270 for 4/5XL

Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 6 rnds in pat = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.
NOTE
• The success of this project depends on getting correct row gauge. It is recommended to work a gauge swatch in pattern to ensure you are achieving the stated row gauge of 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
• Cardigan is comprised of 2 Hexagons which are folded and seamed along the top to form Sleeves and seamed down Center Back.
• Hexagon shape will become wavy as you progress and will not lay flat as it begins to grow. Do not worry if your piece does not lay flat before folding! Trust the process!

DETERMINING YOUR SIZE
Click here to learn how to take proper measurements for the best fit.

SIZES XS/S M/L XL/2/3XL 4/5XL
TO FIT CHEST
28-34" [71-86.5 cm]
36-38" [91.5-96.5 cm]
44-54" [112-137 cm]
56-60" [142-152.5 cm]
FINISHED CHEST
38" [96.5 cm]
42" [106.5 cm]
56" [142 cm]
66" [167.5 cm]
Models are wearing size M/L in Bernat® Super Value™
Female model has 34" [86 cm] chest and is 5 feet 5" tall.
Male model has 38" [96.5 cm] chest and is 6 feet tall.

Step 1 - Make a Granny Gauge swatch as follows:
GRANNY GAUGE SWATCH
See Diagram on page 5.
With A, chain (ch) 4. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch to form ring.
1st round (rnd): Ch 6. [3 double crochet (dc) in ring. Ch 3] 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beginning (beg) ch 6.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 space (sp). Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 6.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 6.
4th to 6th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-2 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off at end of 6th rnd.

SIZES XS/S , M/L , XL/2/3XL AND 4/5XL
SIZES XS/S M/L XL/2/3XL 4/5XL
TO FIT CHEST
28-34" [71-86.5 CM]
36-42" [91.5-106.5 CM]
44-54" [112-137 CM]
56-60"[142-152.5 CM]
FINISHED CHEST
42" [106.5 CM]
48" [122 CM]
56" [142 CM]
66" [167.5 CM]
The instructions are written for XS/S size. If changes are necessary, the instructions will be written XS/S (M/L-XL/2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

HEXAGON (Make 2)
With A, chain (ch) 4.
Slip Knot : Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then pull through to make slip knot.
Chain : Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw up a loop – 1 chain made.
Join with slip stitch (sl st) to form ring.
Ch 2. (3 dc. Ch 2) 5 times in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 6 groups of 3 dc and 6 ch-2 spaces (sps).
1st rnd complete.
1st round (rnd): Ch 3 [counts as double crochet (dc)]. 2 dc in ring.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc to corner ch-2 sp.
Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same corner ch-2 sp as last sl st.
*Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp.
Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.

3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc to corner ch-2 sp.
*Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp.
Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same corner ch-2 sp as last sl st.
Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Repeat last Hexagon rnd 3 (3 - 5 - 5) times more, noting 1 more 3-dc group will be worked between corners on subsequent rnds.
Break A and fasten off by cutting yarn and pulling up through loop to secure.
Next rnd: Join B with sl st to corner ch-2 sp. With B, rep last Hexagon rnd, as before, 4 (4 -4 -5) times more, noting 1 more 3-dc group will be worked between corners on subsequent rnds. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Join C with sl st to corner ch-2 sp. With C, rep last Hexagon rnd, as before, 3 (4 -4 -5) times more, noting 1 more 3-dc group will be worked between corners on subsequent rnds.
Join D with sl st to corner ch-2 sp. With D, rep last Hexagon rnd, as before, 3 (4 - 5 - 6) times more. Fasten off at end of last rnd. 16 (18 - 21 - 24) rnds worked in total.

FOLD INTO SHAPE
Fold Hexagon as shown, to create upside down L shape:
Measure from Center Back to side as shown in above diagram: 10½ (12 - 14½ - 16½)" [26.5 (30.5 - 37 - 42) cm].
If you need to work another round to achieve the correct measurement for your size, do that now using D, before seaming.

SEW SHOULDER SEAMS
Note: Sample shown in pictures below uses different color yarn for seaming so that it is easier to follow along. When seaming, use same color yarn as garment to create a nearly invisible seam.
Thread yarn needle with length of D approx twice the length of top of Sleeve.
Sew shoulder seam using Whipstitch as follows: With RS facing, align stitches along top of Sleeve. Working through both front and back of Sleeve, join yarn through corner ch-2 sp of front and corresponding corner ch-2 sp of back.
Insert needle through top of next dc at front and corresponding dc at back. Pull yarn through to join. Keep a nice, relaxed tension on the sewing yarn making sure not to pull too tightly as this will cause the seam to pucker.
Continue in this manner, inserting needle through corresponding sts and ch-1 sps at front and back of Sleeve, until end of shoulder seam.

CENTER BACK SEAM
Align left and right sides at center back. Thread yarn needle with length of D approx twice the length of back seam and join sides together through both top corner ch-2 sps. Note: These will be the same ch-2 sps on either side where shoulder seam was worked.
Sew center back seam using Whipstitch as given for shoulder seam. Fasten off and secure end at bottom ch-2 sp.

BOTTOM HEM
See diagrams on page 18.
With RS facing, join C with sl st in corner ch-2 sp at bottom corner of Left Front.
1st row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same ch-2 sp as sl st.
*Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * across bottom edge to ch-2 corner sp at bottom corner of Right Front, taking note that at center back seam, 3 dc will be worked in last ch-2 sp of left side. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-2 corner sp of right side.

dc in bottom right front ch-2 corner sp. Turn.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as dc. Ch 1).
*Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp.
Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Fasten off C.
3rd row: (RS). Join B with sl st in beg ch-1 sp of previous row. With B, ch 3 (counts as dc).
2 dc in same sp as sl st.*Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Turn.
4th row: (WS). With B, as 2nd row. Fasten off B. Join A.
5th and 6th rows: With A, as 2nd and 3rd rows. Fasten off A, join D.
7th and 8th rows: With D, as 2nd and 3rd rows. Fasten off. Bottom Hem is complete.

SLEEVE CUFFS
NOTE: When working next rnd, work 3 dc in last ch-sp before shoulder seam. Ch 1, then work 3 dc in next sp of the right side and continue to end of rnd.
With RS facing, lay Sleeve flat. Join A with sl st to ch-1 sp on last row of Sleeve at bottom of Sleeve.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same ch-1 sp as sl st.
*Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
1st rnd complete.
**
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same ch-1 sp last sl st.
*Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break A.
2nd rnd complete.
Join B with sl st to last ch-1 sp of previous rnd.
3rd and 4th rnds: With B, rep last 2 rnds. Break B at end of last rnd.
Join C with sl st to last ch-1 sp of previous rnd.
5th and 6th rnds: With C, rep last 2 rnds. Break C at end of last rnd.
Join D with sl st to last ch-1 sp of previous rnd.
7th and 8th rnds: With D, rep last 2 rnds. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Rep for other Sleeve. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™: 5 (6, 7, 7, 8) balls 5687 VIP A
1 ball each 5620 Green Tea C and 5635 Crème de Mint D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10] and 5.5mm [US I-9]
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = Color A, Color B, Color C, Color D
( ) = work directions in parentheses all in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 3 shells = 5¼" (13.5 cm); 8 rows = 4¼" (11 cm) body lace pattern with larger hook; 3 shells = 5¼" (13.5 cm); 8 rows = 5½" (14 cm) in edging pattern with smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BACK
With A and larger hook, ch 90 (98, 106, 114, 122).
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, * skip 3 ch, shell in next ch, skip 3 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn – 11 (12, 13, 14, 15) shells.
Row 2: Ch 7 (counts as 1 tr and 1 ch-3 space), * (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3; repeat from * to last shell, (sc, ch 3, sc) in last shell, ch 3, tr in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr), 3 dc in first tr, * skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next tr; repeat from * to last 3 ch-3 spaces, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, (3 dc, tr) in 4th ch of beginning ch-7, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell; repeat from * to last sc, ch 3, tr in last sc, ch 3, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to last tr, shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in last sc, turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 4 more times, then Row 2 only once more.
SLEEVES
Remove hook and place a marker in last loop to keep it from unraveling.
Join new yarn with slip st in marked ch st at other edge. Ch 16, then fasten off. 
Replace hook in marked loop and remove this marker.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 20, 3 dc in 5th ch from hook, skip 3 ch, sc in next ch, skip 3 ch, shell in next ch, skip 3 ch, sc in next ch, * shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to ending ch, shell in marked ch and remove marker from this ch, skip 3 ch, sc in next ch, skip 3 ch, shell in next ch, skip 3 ch, sc in next ch, skip 3 ch, (3 dc, tr) in last ch, turn – 14 (15, 16, 17 ,18) shells + 2 half shells.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell; repeat from * to last sc, ch 3, tr in last sc, ch 3, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn – 15 (16, 17, 18, 19) shells.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to last tr, shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 4: Ch 7 (counts as 1 tr and 1 ch-3 space), * (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3; repeat from * to last shell, (sc, ch 3, sc) in last shell, ch 3, tr in last sc, turn.
Row 5: Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr), 3 dc in first tr, * skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next tr; repeat from * to last 3 ch-3 spaces, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, (3 dc, tr) in 4th ch of beginning ch-7, turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 only 2 (2, 2, 2, 3) more times.
Next row (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell; repeat from * 4 (4, 5, 5, 5) more times, [ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, sc in next shell] 4 (5, 4, 5, 6) times, repeat from * to * to end, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn.
For sizes S (L, XL) only:
RIGHT FRONT
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first sc, * shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * for 5 (6, 6) shells total, (3 dc, tr) in next tr, turn – 5 (6, 6,) shells and 1 half shell.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell; repeat from * to last sc, ch 3, tr in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr), 3 dc in first tr, * skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next tr; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 4: Ch 7 (counts as 1 tr and 1 ch-3 space), * (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3; repeat from * across, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, (3 dc, tr) in 4th ch of beginning ch-7, turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 only 2 (3, 3) times.
Next row (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in first tr, [ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell] 3 (4, 4) times, [ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, sc in next shell] twice, ch 3, tr in last sc.
Fasten off.
End Right Sleeve
With right side facing, skip 2 tr on last row and join A with slip st in next tr.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr), 3 dc in same tr as joining slip st, * skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next tr; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc, turn. 3 (4, 4) shells + 1 half shell.
Row 2: Ch 7 (counts as 1 tr and 1 ch-3 space), * (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3; repeat from * across, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, (3 dc, tr) in 4th ch of beginning ch-7, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell; repeat from * to last sc, ch 3, tr in last sc, turn.
Row 5: Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr), 3 dc in first tr, * skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next tr; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 6 more times, then repeat Rows 2 and 3 only once more. 
Next Row (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, sc in next shell; repeat from * to last sc, ch 3, tr in last sc.
Fasten off.
LEFT FRONT
Left Neck Edge and Front Panel
With right side facing and using larger hook, skip 8 (8, 10) ch-3 spaces at Back neck edge, and join A with slip st in next tr. 
Row 1 (right side): Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr), 3 dc in same tr as joining slip st, * skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next tr; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc, turn – 5 (6, 6) shells + 1 half shell.
Row 2: Ch 7 (counts as 1 tr and 1 ch-3 space), * (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3; repeat from * to end, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn. 
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to end, (3 dc, tr) in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn. 
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell; repeat from * to last sc, ch 3, tr in last sc, turn.
Row 5: Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr), 3 dc in first tr, * skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next tr; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 only 2 (3) times.
Next row (wrong side): Ch 7 (counts as 1 tr and 1 ch-3 space), [sc in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3] twice, * (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3; repeat from * to end, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn.
End Left Sleeve
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first sc, [shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space] 3 (4, 4) times, (3 dc, tr) in next tr, turn – 3 (4, 4) shells + 1 half shell.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell; repeat from * to last sc, ch 3, tr in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr), 3 dc in first tr, * skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next tr; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc, turn. 
Row 4: Ch 7 (counts as 1 tr and 1 ch-3 space), * (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3; repeat from * to end, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn. 
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to end, (3 dc, tr) in 4th ch of beginning ch-7, turn. 
Repeat Rows 2-5: 6 more times, then repeat Rows 2 and 3 only once more.
Next row (wrong side): Ch 7 (counts as 1 tr and 1 ch-3 space), * sc in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3; repeat from * to end, sc in 4th of beginning ch-4.
Fasten off.
For sizes M (2X) only:
RIGHT FRONT
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first sc, * shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * for 6 (7) shells total, sc in next sc, turn – 6 (7) shells.
Row 2: Ch 7 (counts as 1 tr and 1 ch-3 space), * (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3; repeat from * to last shell, (sc, ch 3, sc) in last shell, ch 3, tr in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr), 3 dc in first tr, * skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next tr; repeat from * to last 3 ch-3 spaces, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, (3 dc, tr) in 4th ch of beginning ch-7, turn. 
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell; repeat from * to last sc, ch 3, tr in last sc, ch 3, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to last tr, shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in last sc, turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 only 2 (3) times.
Next row (wrong side): Ch 7 (counts as 1 tr and 1 ch-3 space), [(sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3] 4 (5) times, sc in next shell, ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, sc in next shell, ch 3, tr in last sc.
Fasten off.

End Right Sleeve
With right side facing, skip 2 tr on last row, and join A with slip st in next tr.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr), 3 dc in same tr as joining slip st, * skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next tr; repeat from * to end, (3 dc, tr) in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn – 3 (4) shells and 2 half-shells.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell; repeat from * to last sc, ch 3, tr in last sc, ch 3, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch-4, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * shell in next tr, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, (3 dc, tr) in 4th ch of beginning ch-7, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell; repeat from * to last sc, ch 3, tr in last sc, turn.
Row 5: Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr), 3 dc in first tr, * skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next tr; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 6 more times, then repeat Rows 2 and 3 only once more.
Next Row (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in first tr, * ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, sc in next shell; repeat from * to last sc, ch 3, tr in last sc.
Fasten off.
LEFT FRONT
With right side facing, skip 8 (10) ch-3 spaces at Back neck edge, and join A with slip st in next sc.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each of next 28 sc, turn.
Rows 2-7: Ch 3, dc in each st to end, turn.
Fasten off.
Pocket Lining Extension –  
Right Front
With right side facing and using smaller hook, join B with slip st in bottom Right 
Front panel corner.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each of next 28 sc, turn. 
Rows 2-7: Ch 3, dc in each st to end, turn.
Fasten off.
Pocket Lining Extension –  
Left Front
With wrong side facing and using 
smaller hook, join B with slip st in 
bottom Left Front panel corner.
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in each of 
next 28 sc, turn. 
Rows 2-7: Ch 3, dc in each st to end, turn.
Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Brushed™ (5 oz/142 g; 255 yds/233 m)
Sizes U.S. H/8  (5 mm) and U.S. I/9  (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. 14 sts and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook in Moss St Pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

Body
Note: Body is worked in one piece to armholes.
Ribbing: With smaller hook and MC, ch 9. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until Ribbing, when slightly stretched, measures 36 ( 40-44-48-56-60)" [ 91.5 ( 101.5-112-122-142-152.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off. Turn Ribbing sideways. Change to larger hook and working across long side, proceed as follows:

1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in corner of ribbing. Work (Ch 1. 1 sc) 63 ( 70-77-84-98-105) times evenly across. Turn. 127 ( 141-155-169-197-211) sts (sc and ch-1).

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts (ch-1 sp and sc). 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.

Rep last 2 rows for Moss St Pat until work from beg measures approx 10 ( 10-10-11-12-13)" [ 25.5 ( 25.5-25.5-28-30.5-33) cm], ending on a WS row.

Right Front: Shape V-neck and armhole: 1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 14 ( 15-17-19-22-24) times. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 29 ( 31-35-39-45-49) sts (sc and ch 1).
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 27 ( 29-33-37-43-47) sts.
Rep last row 4 ( 4-4-6-8-10) times more. 19 ( 21-25-25-27-27) sts.

Shape V-neck only: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 17 ( 19-23-23-25-25) sts.

Proceed as follows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Work even in pat.
Rep last 2 rows 7 ( 7-9-9-9-9) times more. 9 ( 11-13-13-15-15) sts.

Cont even in pat until armhole measures 7½ ( 8-9-10-10½-11)" [ 19 ( 20.5-23-25.5-26.5-28) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

Back: Shape armholes:  With RS facing, skip next 5 ( 7-7-7-9-9) sts (sc and ch 1). Join yarn with sl st to next ch-1 sp.

1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st.  (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 29 ( 32-35-38-44-47) times. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 59 ( 65-71-77-89-95) sts.

2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last row 4 ( 4-4-6-8-10) times more. 49 ( 55-61-63-71-73) sts. 
Cont even in pat until armhole measures 2 rows less than Front.

Shape Neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Pat across first 9 ( 11-13-13-15-15) sts. Sc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. 9 ( 11-13-13-15-15) sts. Fasten off.

With RS facing, skip next 27 ( 29-31-33-37-39) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.

Next row:  Ch 1. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Fasten off.

Left Front: Shape V-neck and armhole: With RS facing, skip next 5 ( 7-7-7-9-9) sts (sc and ch 1). Join yarn with sl st to next ch-1 sp.

1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 14 ( 15-17-19-22-24) times (end of row). Turn. 29 ( 31-35-39-45-49) sts (sc and ch 1).

2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 27 ( 29-33-37-43-47) sts.
Rep last row 4 ( 4-4-6-8-10) times more. 19 ( 21-25-25-27-27) sts.

Shape V-neck only: 1st row: (RS). Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. 17 ( 19-23-23-25-25) sts.

Proceed as follows:  1st row: (RS). Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
2nd row: Work even in pat.
Rep last 2 rows 7 ( 7-9-9-9-9) times more. 9 ( 11-13-13-15-15) sts.

Cont even in pat until armhole measures 7½ ( 8-9-10-10½-11)" [ 19 ( 20.5-23-25.5-26.5-28) cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.

SLEEVES
Ribbing:  With smaller hook and MC, ch 9. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 8 sc.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures 10 ( 10½ -11 -11½ -12 -13½ )" [ 25.5 ( 26.5-28-29-30.5-34.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.

Body of Sleeve:  Turn Ribbing sideways. Change to larger hook and working across long side, proceed as follows:

1st row: (RS). With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in corner of ribbing. Work (Ch 1. 1 sc) 17 ( 18-19-20-21-24) times evenly across. Turn. 35 ( 37-39-41-43-49) sts (sc and ch 1).

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.

3rd row: (Inc row). Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 37 ( 39-41-43-45-51) sts.

4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.

5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.

6th row: As 4th row. 7th row: (RS – Inc row). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 39 ( 41-43-45-47-53) sts.

8th and 9th rows: Rep 5th and 6th rows.
10th row: As 5th row.
Rep 3rd to 10th rows until there are 43 ( 45-47-49-63-69) sts.

Sizes XS/S, M, L, XL only: Cont in pat as established inc 1 st each end of following 6th rows from previous inc until there are 53 ( 55-57-59) sts.

All sizes:  Cont even in pat until work from beg measures 17 ( 17-18-18-17-16)" [ 43 ( 43-45.5-45.5-43-40.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

Shape Top: 1st row: (RS). Skip first 3 sts (sc, ch 1, sc). Join MC with sl st to next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 sts (sc, ch 1, sc). Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 47 ( 49-51-53-57-59) sts.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
4th row: Work even in pat.
Rep last 2 rows 3 ( 4-5-6-7-8) times more. 39 ( 39-39-39-41-41) sts.

Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last row 8 times more. 21 ( 21-21-21-23-23) sts. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry.

Button and Buttonhole Band:  Sew shoulder seams. With smaller hook and MC, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row, until band, when slightly stretched, measures length to fit up Left Front and around neck edge, sewing in place as you work.

PM for 4 ( 4-4-4-5-5) buttons, having bottom button 1" [2.5 cm] up from bottom, top button at beg of V-shaping and rem 2 ( 2-2-2-3-3) buttons spaced evenly between.

Work buttonholes as follows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 scbl in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 6 sc.

Cont working front band until work, when slightly stretched, measures length to fit down Right Front, noting button holes to correspond to button markers and sewing in place as you work. Fasten off.

Sew sleeve seams. Sew in sleeves. Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

FLOWERS (make 20)
With smaller hook and A, ch 3. 1st rnd: 1 sc in 3rd ch from hook counts as (sc, ch 1, sc). (Ch 1. 1 sc) 5 times in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first ch-1 sp. 2nd rnd:  *Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop maintaining length of ch 3) 5 times in same sp as sl st. Yoh and draw up a loop through 10 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through rem 2 loops on hook. Ch 3. Sl st in same ch-1 sp as st just made.** Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** once. Fasten off. Sew on Flowers randomly as shown on Fronts and Sleeves in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Sheen™: 1 ball each 620 Pistachio A; 800 Baby Blue B; 515 Turquoise C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.75mm [US F-5] and 5mm [H-8]
8 stitch markers or small contrasting pieces of yarn
abbreviations: A, B, C = colors A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parentheses into specified st or sp
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: With smaller hook, 19 sc = 4” (10 cm); 13 rows sc = 2½” (6.5 cm) in Yoke pattern; 2 shells = 1” (2.5 cm) in Skirting pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SKIRTING
Row 1: With right side facing and larger hook, join B with slip st to unused back loop of first sc of row 13 of yoke, ch 1, working in back loops only, shell in same sc as joining, [skip 1 sc, shell in next sc] 8 times, ch 5 (7, 9, 11), skip 39 sc for sleeve opening, shell in next sc, [skip 1 sc, shell in next sc] 18 times, ch 5 (7, 9, 11), skip 39 sc for sleeve opening, shell in next sc, [skip 1 sc, shell in next sc] 8 times, turn—37 shells.
Row 2: Ch 2, shell in ch-2 space of next 9 shells, [skip 1 ch, shell in next ch] 2 (3, 4, 5) times, skip 1 ch, shell in ch-2 space of next 19 shells, [skip 1 ch, shell in next ch] 2 (3, 4, 5) times, skip 1 ch, shell in ch-2 space of last 9 shells, turn—41 (43, 45, 47) shells.
Row 3: Ch 2, shell in ch-2 space of each shell across, turn.
Rep row 3 until 19 (21, 23, 23) rows are completed.
Fasten off.
SLEEVE
Round 1: With RS facing and larger hook, join C with slip st in ch at base of first shell at bottom of armhole, ch 1, shell in same st as joining, shell in ch at base of each remaining shell across underarm—2 (3, 4, 5) shells made at bottom of armhole, working in back loops only of row 13 of yoke, shell in first sc, skip 1 sc, shell in next sc, [skip 2 sc, shell in next sc] 12 times; join with slip st in first sc—16 (17, 18, 19) shells.
Round 2: Slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 1, sc in same ch-2 space, shell in each shell around; join with slip st in first sc.
shell—15 (16, 17, 18) shells.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 1, shell in same ch-2 space, shell in each ch-2 space around; join with slip st in first sc—15 (16, 17, 18) shells.
[Repeat rounds 2-3] 1 (2, 2, 2) times—14 (14, 15, 16) shells at end of last round.
[Repeat round 3] 2 (2, 2, 4) times.
Fasten off. Repeat for opposite Sleeve.
COLLAR
Row 1: With right side facing and larger hook, working across opposite side of foundation ch at neck edge of Yoke, skip first 2 ch sts, join B with slip st to 3rd ch, ch 1, shell in same ch, [skip 1 ch, shell in next ch] across to last 2 ch, turn, leaving remaining 2 ch sts unworked—25 shells.
Row 2: Ch 2, shell in each ch-2 space across, to last shell, turn, leaving last shell unworked—24 shells.
Rows 3-4: Repeat row 2—22 shells at end of last row.
Row 5: Ch 2, shell in each ch-2 space across, shell in side of shell of row below, shell in skipped shell, shell in side of shell of next row below, skip 1 ch from row 1 of yoke, shell in last ch of row 1 of yoke, turn—26 shells.
Row 6: Ch 2, shell in each ch-2 space across, [shell in side of shell of row below, shell in skipped shell in row below] twice, skip 1 ch from row 1 of yoke, shell in last ch of row 1 of yoke—31 shells.
Fasten off.
BUTTON BAND
Left Front
Row 1: With right side facing and smaller hook, join B with slip st to side edge of left front at neck corner, ch 1, sc evenly across left front edge to bottom corner edge, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Repeat row 2.
Fasten off.
Right Front
Row 1: With right side facing and smaller hook, join B with slip st to in bottom right-and corner of right front edge, ch 1, sc evenly across to neck corner of right front edge, turn.
Row 2: Place markers for 6 evenly-spaced buttonhole across right front edge. Ch 1, sc in each sc across, working (ch 1, skip 1 sc) at each marker, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch-1 space across.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Using sewing needle and thread sew one button to left front edge, opposite each buttonhole.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Pet™ (8 oz/225 g; 269 yds/246 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit dog chest measurement: S 10" [25.5 cm], M 14" [35.5 cm], L 17" [43 cm], XL 20" [51 cm]. Finished chest: S 12" [30.5 cm], M 16" [40.6 cm], L 19" [48 cm], XL 22" [56 cm].
gauge: 10 sc and 10 rows = 4" (10 cm).
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.
Ch 26 (32-38-44).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 25 (31-37-43) sts. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Proceed in pat as follows: 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 

2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first dc (inc made). *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in next sc. 2 sc in last dc (inc made). Turn. 27 (33-39-45) sts.
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first sc (inc made). *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in next sc. 2 dc in last sc (inc made). Turn. 29 (35-41-47) sts. 
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first dc (inc made). 1 dc in next dc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 2 sc in last dc (inc made). Turn. 31 (37-43-49) sts. 
Rep 4th and 5th rows 0 (1-1-2) time(s) more, then 4th row 0 (0-1-1) time(s) more. 31 (41-49-59) sts. Work 1 row even in pat.
Leg Openings: Next row: (RS). Pat across 2 (3-5-7) sts. Sl st across next 4 (4-4-6) sts. Ch 1. Pat across 19 (27-31-33) sts. Sl st across next 4 (4-4-6) sts. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Note: All Leg sections are worked at same times using separate balls of yarn for each section.
Work 1 (1½-1½-2½)" [2.5 (4-4-6) cm] in pat, ending on a RS row.
Joining row: (WS). Pat across 2 (3-5-7) sts. Ch 4 (4-4-6). Pat across 19 (27-31-33) sts. Ch 4 (4-4-6). Pat to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Pat across 2 (3-5-7) sts. Pat across 4 (4-4-6) ch. Pat across 19 (27-31-33) sts. Pat across 4 (4-4-6) ch. Pat to end of row. Turn. 31 (41-49-59) sts. 
Cont even in pat until work after neckband measures 5 (6½-8-11)" [12.5 (16.5-20.5-28) cm], ending on a WS row. Place marker at each end of last row.
Back Shaping: Next row: Sl st across first 3(3-5-5) sts. Ch 1. Pat to last 3(3-5-5) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 25 (35-39-49) sts. Next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of first 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - Sc2tog made. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Rep last row 1 (4-5-7) time(s) more. 21 (25-27-33) sts rem. 
Cont even in pat until work after neckband measures 10 (12½-15½-21)" [25.5 (32-39.5-53.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Back Edging: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st at marker. Ch 1. Work sc evenly across back edge to opposite marker. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Fasten off. Sew neck and belly seam.
Leg Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st at leg opening. 
Ch 1. Work sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements:
Sizes 6 12 18-24 mos
To fit chest measurement
6 mos 17" [43 cm]
12 mos 18" [45 cm]
18-24 mos 19-20" [48.5-51 cm]
Finished chest measurement
6 mos 21" [53.5 cm]
12 mos 22" [56 cm]
18-24 mos 24" [61 cm]
gauge: 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Sweater is worked in one piece from neck down.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of first st.
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes.
CROCHET I SKILL LEVEL: EASY
YOKE: Beg at neck back edge, ch 46 (50-50). Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain and do not chain too tightly as this foundation ch needs to pull over baby’s head.
Foundation rnd: Ch 2. Working into back bumps of chain, 1 hdc in each ch around. Join.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 6 (7-7) hdc. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc – V-st made) in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 (9-9) hdc. V-st in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 13 (14-14) hdc. V-st in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 (9-9) hdc. V-st in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 7 hdc. Join. 50 (54-54) hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each hdc to ch-1 sp of next V-st. V-st in ch-1 sp of next V-st. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join.
Rep last rnd 4 (4-6) times more. 90 (94-110) hdc.
Next rnd: (Ruffle base rnd). Ch 2. *1 dcbp around each hdc to ch-1 sp of next V-st. V-st in ch-1 sp of next V-st. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 dcbp around each hdc to end of rnd. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each st to ch-1 sp of next V-st. V-st in ch-1 sp of next V-st. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 hdc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
Rep last rnd once more. 114 (118-134) hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 15 (16-18) hdc. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of next V-st. PM. 1 hdc in each of next 26 (27-31) hdc. PM. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 31 (32-36) hdc. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of next V-st. PM. 1 hdc in each of next 26 (27-31) hdc. PM. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of next V-st. 1 hdc in each of last 16 (16-18) hdc. Join. 118 (122-138) hdc.
Sizes 12 mos and 18/24 mos only: Next (2-3) rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
All sizes: Divide for Sleeves and Body:
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 16 (17-19) hdc. Ch 1 for underarm. Skip next 26 (27-31) hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 33 (34-38) hdc. Ch 1 for underarm. Skip next 26 (27-31) hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 17 (17-19) hdc. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc or ch around. Join. 68 (70-78) hdc for Body.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from underarm ch measures 6 (7-9) [15 (18-23) cm].
Next 3 rnds: Ch 2. *1 dcbp around each st around. Join.
Fasten off at end of last rnd. 
SLEEVES:
1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to underarm ch. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st and each hdc around. 27 (28-32) hdc. Join.
Next 3 (4-5) rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Join.
Rep last 4 (5-6) rnds twice more. 23 (23-26) hdc.
Work even in hdc until work from underarm ch measures 5 (6-7) [12.5 (15-18) cm].
Next 3 rnds: Ch 2. *1 dcbp around each st around. Join.
Fasten off at end of last rnd. 
RUFFLE:
Join yarn with sl st to first dcbp st at Yoke. Ch 3. 4 dc in same sp as sl st. 5 dc in each dcbp around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby™ (Solids: 5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m; Ombres: 4.2 oz/120 g; 310 yds/283 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook

gauge: 16 dc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. 

YOKE 
Beg at neck, with MC, ch 78 ( 84-90).

Do not break A. 2 dc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 22 ( 24-26) ch. 2 dc in next ch. Join A. Do not break MC. 2 dc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 13 ( 14-15) ch. 2 dc in next ch. Join MC. Do not break A. 2 dc in next ch. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 84 ( 90-96) dc. 

2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 10 ( 11-12) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 15 ( 16-17) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 24 ( 26-28) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 15 ( 16-17) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 ( 12-13) dc. Turn. 92 ( 98-104) dc. Break A.

With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 26 ( 28-30) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 17 ( 18-19) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 12 ( 13-14) dc. Turn. 100 ( 106-112) dc.

With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 28 ( 30-32) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 19 ( 20-21) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 13 ( 14-15) dc. Turn. 108 ( 114-120) dc. Break B. 

5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 13 ( 14-15) dc. 2 dc in next dc. Join A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 21 ( 22-23) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 30 ( 32-34) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 21 ( 22-23) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 14 ( 15-16) dc. Turn. 116 ( 122-128) dc.

With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 15 ( 16-17) dc. Turn. 124 ( 130-136) dc. Break A.

With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 34 ( 36-38) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 25 ( 26-27) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 16 ( 17-18) dc. Turn. 132 ( 138-144) dc. 

8th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 16 ( 17-18) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 27 ( 28-29) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 36 ( 38-40) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 27 ( 28-29) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 17 ( 18-19) dc. Turn. 140 ( 146-152) dc. Break B.

9th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 17 ( 18-19) dc. 2 dc in next dc. Join A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 29 ( 30-31) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 38 ( 40-42) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 29 ( 30-31) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 18 ( 19-20) dc. Turn. 148 ( 154-160) dc.

10th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 18 ( 19-20) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 31 ( 32-33) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 40 ( 42-44) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 31 ( 32-33) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 19 ( 20-21) dc. Turn. 156 ( 162-168) dc.

Sizes 2 and 4 only:
11th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next ( 20-21) dc. 2 dc in next dc. Join B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next ( 34-35) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next ( 44-46) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next ( 34-35) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next ( 21-22) dc. Turn. ( 170-176) dc.

12th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next ( 21-22) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next ( 36-37) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next ( 46-48) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next ( 36-37) dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next ( 22-23) dc. Turn. ( 178-184) dc. Break B.

Size 4 only:
13th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 23 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Join A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 39 dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 50 dc. 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 39 dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 24 dc. Turn. 192 dc. 

14th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 24 dc. 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 41 dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 52 dc. 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 41 dc. 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 25 dc. Turn. 200 dc. Break A. 

All sizes: Break sections of MC not on hook. Weave in all loose tails. 

BODY 
Proceed with MC only: 
1st row: (RS). With MC, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 20 ( 23-26) dc. Ch 0 ( 3-6). Skip next 35 ( 40-45) dc. 1 dc in each of next 44 ( 50-56) dc. Ch 0 ( 3-6). Skip next 35 ( 40-45) dc. 1 dc in each of next 21 ( 24-27) dc. Turn. 86 ( 98-110) dc and 0 ( 6-12) ch. 

2nd row: (WS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 20 ( 23-26). 1 dc in each of next 0 ( 3-6) ch. 1 dc in each of next 44 ( 50-56) dc. 1 dc in each of next 0 ( 3-6) ch. 1 dc in each of next 21 ( 24-27). Turn. 86 ( 104-122) dc. 

3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 85 ( 103-121) dc. Turn. 

Rep last row until work from 1st row of Body measures 7 ( 8-10)" [ 18 ( 20.5-25.5) cm]. 

Next row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 dc. Sc2tog) 14 ( 17-20) times. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Do not fasten off. 72 ( 87-102) sc. 

Ribbing: Turn work sideways. 
With MC, ch 9. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sl st in 2nd sc of Body. Sl st in next sc. Turn. 

2nd row: 1 scbl in each of next 8 sc of ribbing. Turn. 

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of next 8 scbl of ribbing. Sl st in each of next 2 sc of Body. Turn. 

Rep last 2 rows across bottom edge of Body. Fasten off. 

Buttonhole band: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to bottom left corner. 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc across ribbing. Work 28 ( 32-40) sc evenly up left side of Body to neck edge. Turn. 36 ( 40-48) sc. 

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 ( 8-11) sc. Rep from * twice more. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 ( 4-3) sc. Turn. 

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 ( 4-3) sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. *1 sc in each of next 7 ( 8-11) sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Fasten off. 

Button band: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to top right corner. 
1st row: Ch 1. Work 28 ( 32-40) sc evenly into side of Body rows to top of ribbing. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc across ribbing. Turn. 36 ( 40-48) sc. 

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 

3rd row: As 2nd row. Fasten off. 

SLEEVES 
Note: Turn at end of each rnd to match Body pat. 
Join B ( A-B) with sl st to center of underarm ch 0 ( 3-6). 
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 0 ( 1-3) ch. 1 dc into side of dc of 1st Body row. 1 dc in each of next 35 ( 40-45) dc. 1 dc into side of next dc of 1st Body row. 1 dc in each of next 0 ( 1-2) ch. Join with sl st to first dc. Turn. 38 ( 45-53) dc. 

2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 37 ( 44-52) dc. Join with sl st first dc with A ( B-A). Turn. Break B ( A-B). 

3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 37 ( 44-52) dc. Join with sl st to first dc. Turn. 

4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 37 ( 44-52) dc. Join with sl st to first dc with B ( A-B). Turn. Break A ( B-A). 

5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 37 ( 44-52) dc. Join with sl st to first dc. Turn. 

6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 37 ( 44-52) dc. Join with sl st to first dc with A ( B-A). Turn. Break B ( A-B). 

Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last rnd until Sleeve from 1st rnd measures 6 ( 7-9)" [ 15 ( 18-23) cm] ending on a WS row and join MC at end of last row.

Next row: (RS) With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * 8 ( 10-12) times more. 1 sc in each of next 2 ( 0-1) dc. Join with sl st to first sc. 29 ( 33-40) sts. Do not turn to WS. 

Cuff: Turn work sideways. 
With MC, ch 9. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sl st in 2nd sc of Sleeve. Sl st in next sc. Turn. 

2nd row: 1 scbl in each of next 8 sc of ribbing. Turn. 

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of next 8 scbl of ribbing. Sl st in each of next 2 sc of Sleeve. Turn. 

Rep last 2 rows across last row of Sleeve. Join cuff working 8 sl sts through both thicknesses of 1st and last row. Fasten off. 

Rep for second Sleeve. 

FINISHING 
Pin garment to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. 
Sew buttons to Button band to correspond to buttonholes. 

HOOD 
Stripe Pat 
With B – 2 rows. 
With A – 2 rows. 
These 4 rows form Stripe Pat. 

1st row: (RS). Join B with sl st to 11th ( 12th-13th) foundation ch at front right corner of Yoke. Ch 3. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 13 ( 14-15) ch. 2 dc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 24 ( 26-28) ch. 2 dc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 13 ( 14-15) ch. 2 dc in next ch. Turn. Leave rem 11 ( 12-13) ch unworked. 57 ( 61-65) dc. 

2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Break B. Join A. Turn. 

First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. 

Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until Hood measures approx 8 ( 9-10)" [ 20.5 ( 23-25.5) cm], ending on a WS row. 

Shape top: Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows. 
Next row: (RS). With corresponding color, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 25 ( 27-29) dc. (Dc2tog) 3 times. 1 dc in each of last 25 ( 27-29) sts. Turn. 54 ( 58-62) sts. 

Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 24 ( 26-28) sts. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each of last 25 ( 27-29) sts. Turn. 52 ( 56-60) sts. 

Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 23 ( 25-27) sts. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each of next 24 ( 26-28) sts. 50 ( 54-58) sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With RS facing each other, fold top of Hood in half. Sew top seam. Weave in all ends. Turn RS out. 

Hood Ribbing: (RS). Join MC with sl st to bottom right corner of Hood and Body. Ch 1. Work 2 sc around post of each dc around front edge of Hood. Sl st into top of Body. Turn work sideways. 
1st row: Ch 13. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. Sl st in 2nd sc of Hood. Sl st in next sc. Turn. 

2nd row: 1 scbl in each of next 12 sc of ribbing. Turn. 

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of next 12 scbl of ribbing. Sl st in each of next 2 sc of Hood. Turn. 

Rep last 2 rows around front edge of Hood. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Fold Hood Ribbing lengthwise in half to RS. Using long tail, sew through both thicknesses of Hood Ribbing to secure.

abbreviations: V-st (V-stitch) = (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in indicated stitch
gauge: 3 pat reps [(2-dc Cls. Ch 1) 3 times = 4½" [11.5 cm] (Pat rep: 2-dc Cls and 2 ch-1 sps) 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written XS/S (M-L-XL-2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

BACK
Ch 92 (98-104-110-122-128).
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. V-st in next ch. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 16 (17-18-19-21-22) sc and 15 (16-17-18-20-21) V-sts.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as first tr here and throughout). [2-dc Cl. (Ch 1. 2-dc Cl) twice] in ch-2 sp of first V-st. (Ch 1. 2-dc Cl) 3 times in ch-2 sp of each rem V-st. 1 tr in last sc. Turn. 2 tr and 44 (47-50-53-59-62) ch-1 sps.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. (Ch 1. 1 sc) in each ch-1 sp to last tr. Ch 1. 1 sc in top last tr. Turn. 46 (49-52-55-61-64) sc and 45 (48-51-54-60-63) ch-1 sps.
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout). 1 dc in first ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. 1 dc) in each ch-1 sp to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 47 (50-53-56-62-65) dc and 44 (47-50-53-59-62) ch-1 sps.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 2. Skip next ch-1 sp. V-st in next dc, ch 2. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 ch-1 sp. Ch 2. Skip next ch-1 sp. V-st in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-1 sp and dc. 1 sc in last dc. Turn. 16 (17-18-19-21-22) sc and 15 (16-17-18-20-21) V-sts.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows until Back from beg measures 26 (26-28-28-30-30) [66 (66-71-71-76-76) cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.

FRONT (make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 38 (44-44-50-50-56).
Work as given Back until Front measures same length as Back. Fasten off.

SLEEVE (make 2)
Ch 38 (38-44-44-44-44).
Work 15 (15-15-11-7-7) rows as given for Back, ending on 3rd row. 19 (19-22-22-22-22) sc and 18 (18-21-21-21-21) ch-1 sps.
Next row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1 here and throughout). 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. 1 dc) in each ch-1 sp to last dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 20 (20-23-23-23-23) dc and 19 (19-22-22-22-22) ch-1 sps.
Rep last row 14 (14-13-13-16-16) times more. 34 (34-36-36-39-39) dc and 33 (33-35-35-38-38) ch-1 sps.
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. 1 dc) in each ch-1 sp to last dc. 1 dc in top of last dc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 4. 1 dc in first ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. 1 dc) in each ch-1 sp to last 2 dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until Sleeve from beg measures 17 (16-16-15-15-14) [43 (40.5-40.5-38-38-35.5) cm], ending on a RS row.

FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. Matching sts, sew Fronts to Back at shoulders. With RS of Body and Sleeve tog, sl st across to seam Sleeve to Body. Sew or sl st sides and Sleeve seams tog.

materials: Aunt Lydia® Baby Shower™ (170 yds/155 m)

gauge: 5 groups (3 dc. Ch 1) and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S. If changes are necessary for larger sizes, the instructions will be written XS/S (M - L - XL - 2/3XL - 4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc.
• Cardigan is made in 2 pieces, then sewn tog at center back.
• To join all rnds with sl st to first dc.
• To change color, work to last loop on hook. With new color join with sl st to top of first dc, then proceed in new color.
• Model is wearing size XS/S and has 34" [86.5 cm] chest.

BACK
1. With A, make magic ring. Video is here.
2. 1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1) 5 times in ring. Join. 6 ch-1 sps.
3. 2nd rnd: Sl st in each of first 3 dc and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Ch 1. Join.
4. 3rd rnd: Sl st in each of first 3 dc and next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * 4 times more. Join.
5. 4th rnd: Sl st in each of first 3 dc and next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. [*3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to next ch-3 sp. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp] 5 times. **Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from ** to end of rnd. Ch 1. Join.
6. Rep last rnd 8 (9-10-11-13-15) times more.
7. With B, rep last rnd 3 (3-3-4-4-5) times more.
8. With C, rep last rnd 5 (5-6-6-7-7) times more.
9. With B, rep last rnd 2 (2-2-2-2-3) times more. Fasten off.

FINISHING
1. Fold one side as shown in picture.
2. Pin both pieces to measurements.
3. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. PM 4 (4-4½-4½-5-5) [10 (10-11.5-11.5-12.5-12.5) cm] from left side across top edge for neck and front opening.
4. Sew top sleeve seam from right edge to markers.
5. Sew 2 pieces tog across center of Back.

Bernat® Forever Fleece™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 194 yds/177 m) in Contrast B White Noise (61004)
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: SIZES XS/S/M L/XL/2XL 3/4/5XL TO FIT CHEST 28-38" [71-96.5 cm] 40-48" [101.5-122 cm] 54-62" [137-157.5 cm] FINISHED SQUARE 39" [99 cm] square before assembly 42" [106.5 cm] square before assembly 45" [114.5 cm] square before assembly
gauge: 10 sts and 4.5 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions: The instructions are written for XS/S/M size. If changes are necessary, the instructions will be written XS/S/M (L/XL/2XL - 3/4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. USING THIS GUIDE Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools. NOTES • Chain (ch) 3 at beginning (beg) of row counts as double crochet (dc). • To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color, yarn over hook (yoh) with new color and proceed. DETERMINING YOUR SIZE Click here to learn how to take proper measurements for the best fit. STRIPE PATTERN (PAT) With A work 3 rows. With B work 3 rows. This 6 rows form Stripe Pat. CARDIGAN BODY With A, make a slip knot and place it on hook. Ch 99 (108 - 114) [multiple of 3 ch + 6]. *Yarn over hook (Yoh), draw through loop – 1 chain made. Repeat (Rep) from* 98 (107-113) times more – 99 (108 - 114) chains made. 1st row: [1 double crochet (dc). Ch 1. 1 dc] all in 6th ch from hook (skipped 5 ch counts as: 1 dc and 2 ch). *Skip next 2 ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) all in next ch. Rep from * to last 3 ch. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *(1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 space (sp). Rep from * to end of row. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. Rep last row for pat, keeping continuity (cont) of Stripe Pat, until piece measures approx 39 (42 - 45 )" [99 (106.5 - 114.5 ) cm] long, ending on either 3 rows of A or 3 rows of B. Fasten off. Assembly Following diagram, fold work in half, Wrong Side (WS) together (tog) with first and last rows aligned. Place markers (PM) 8" [20.5 cm], down from fold at each side. With A, sew side seams from marker to bottom using a flat seam. Body Edging: With Right Side (RS) facing, join B with slip stitch (sl st) to Front Opening at side seam. 1st round (rnd): Ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in same space (sp) as join. 1 sc in each ch and dc around. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first sc. Do not turn. 192 (210 - 222) sc total. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Armhole Edging With RS facing, join B with sl st to Armhole Opening at marker. 1st rnd: Ch 1. Working 2 sc around post of each dc, work sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in all yarn ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby®: 1 skein 7737 Powder Pink.
abbreviations: Bphdc = back post half double crochet
Fphdc = front post half double crochet
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 13 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in pattern stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SWEATER
Back
Ch 20 (25, 30, 35, 40, 45). 
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch 
across, turn – 19 (24, 29, 34, 39, 44) sts.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. 
Row 5: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in first 4 sts, 
*Fphdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from * across,
turn.
Row 6: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in first 4 sts,
*Bphdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from * across,
turn.
Rows 7-10 (18, 20, 20, 24, 24): Repeat Rows 5 and 6.
Row 11 (19, 21, 23, 25, 25): Ch 1 (does not count as a st),
sc in each st across, turn.
Repeat last row until piece measures 5 (8, 9, 10, 11, 12)”.
Fasten off.
Left Front
Ch 10 (13, 15, 18, 20, 23).
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch 
across, turn – 9 (12, 14, 17, 19, 22) sts.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. 
Row 5: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), *hdc in first 4 sts, 
*Fphdc in next st; repeat from * across to last 4 (2, 4, 2, 4,
2) sts, hdc in next 4 (2, 4, 2, 4, 2) sts, turn.
Row 6: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in first 4 (2, 4, 2,
4, 2) sts, *Bphdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from *
across, turn.
Rows 7-10 (18, 20, 20, 24, 24): Repeat Rows 5 and 6.
Rows 11 (19, 21, 23, 25, 25): Ch 1 (does not count as a
st), sc in each st across, turn.
Repeat last row until piece measures 5 (8, 9, 10, 11, 12)”.
Fasten off.
It won’t take long to crochet this huggable sweater. 
Pattern includes 5 sizes so you can make it 
in each size and have a rainbow of sweaters 
to fit a growing baby.
Right Front 
Work as for Left Front reversing pattern placement. 
Sleeves
Ch 15 (20, 25, 30, 35, 40).
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch 
across, turn – 14 (19, 24, 29, 34, 39) sts.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. 
Row 5: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in first 4 sts, 
*Fphdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from * across,
turn.
Row 6: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in first 4 sts,
*Bphdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from * across,
turn.
Rows 7-12 (18, 20, 26, 28, 30): Repeat Rows 5 and 6.
FINISHING 
Sew shoulder seams, leaving center 3 (3½, 5, 5, 5½, 6)” of 
Back unsewn for neck. Measure and mark 2 (3, 3½, 4½, 5, 
6)” down from shoulders on Front and Back. Sew last row 
of sleeves between markers. Sew side and Sleeve seams. 
Turn corner at neck edge of each Front over to right side 
and tack in place.
Button Loop
With right side facing, join yarn with a slip st at last row of 
pattern st on edge of Right Front, ch 6, slip st to next st on 
Right Front. 
Fasten off. 
Sew button opposite button loop. 
Weave in ends.
