instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written XS/S (M/L-1/2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes:
• Pullover is comprised of 2 Hexagons which are folded and seamed along the top to form Sleeves and seamed down Center Back and Center Front.
• Hexagon shape will become wavy as you progress and will not lay flat as it begins to grow. Do not worry if your piece does not lay flat before folding! Trust the process!

Stripe Pat
5 rnds of A.
7 rnds of B.
5 rnd of C.
These 17 rnds form Stripe Pat.

HEXAGON (Make 2)
See diagram on page 5.

With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2). (3 dc. Ch 2) 5 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5. 6 groups of 3 dc and 6 ch-2 sps.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2). 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2). 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip last 3 dc. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5.
First 3 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete.
4th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2). 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) twice. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) twice. Skip last 3 dc. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5.
5th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2). 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. [*Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp] 5 times. (Rep from * to * to * to end of rnd. Skip last 3 dc. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5.
NOTE: Your work will not lay flat at this point, don’t worry! It’s part of the process!
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last rnd until work from center to straight side of hexagon measures approx 10½ (12 -14½ -16½) [26.5 (30.5-37-42) cm]. Fasten off.

FINISHING before Hood
Following diagrams below, bring opposite points of Left Side hexagon together and fold to form Left Side of Cardigan. Rep for Right Side. PM between 3-dc groups along top edge 4 (4-5-5) groups of 3-dc from front edge. Sew back seam. Sew top sleeve seams to markers.
Sew front seam, leaving 5" [12.5 cm] from top corners for front opening.

HOOD
See diagrams on page 4.
With RS facing, join A with sl st to corner ch-2 sp of front lapel of Right Front.
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to last 3 dc before right shoulder seam. 3 dc in sp of shoulder seam. Rep from * to * to last 3 dc before Back seam. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in corner ch-2 sp before seam. Ch 3. 3 dc in next corner ch-2 sp after seam. Rep from * to * to last 3 dc before left shoulder seam. 3 dc in sp of shoulder seam. Rep from * to * to last 3-dc group before corner of left side lapel. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in corner ch-2 sp. Turn. 18 (18-20-20) groups of 3-dc and ch-3 sp.
2nd row: (Inc row). Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to center back ch-3 sp. [3 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc (center dc). Ch 1. 3 dc] in center back ch-3 sp. Rep from * to * to last 3 dc. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to ch-1 sp before center dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next (center) dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 20 (20-22-22) groups of 3-dc.
4th row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 9 (9-10-10) times. Ch 3 (center back). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
6th to 11th rows: Rep 2nd to 5th rows once more, then 2nd and 3rd rows once, having 1 more 3-dc group before center. 24 (24-26-26) groups of 3-dc at end of last rep.
12th row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and Ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 12th and 13th rows until Hood measures approx 10" [25.5 cm], ending on 2nd row.

Shape top of Hood
See diagram on page 4.
1st row: Ch 4 (counts as dc. Ch 1). (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 10 (10-11-11) times. Skip next 2 groups of 3-dc. *3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 9 times. Skip next 2 groups of 3-dc. *3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. Fasten off leaving a tail 20" [51 cm] long for seaming. Fold top of Hood in half. Using tail, sew Hood seam, being sure to keep edges flat.

SLEEVE CUFFS
See diagram on page 5.
With RS facing, join corresponding color to keep cont of Stripe Pat with sl st in sp between 2 groups of 3-dc (in last sp between 2 groups of 3-dc before shoulder seam) on last row of Sleeve at bottom of Sleeve.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same ch-1 sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to end of rnd. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last rnd until Sleeve from underarm measures 17" [43 cm]. Fasten off. Rep for opposite Sleeve.

materials: Red Heart® Roll With It Sparkle™ (5.29 oz/150 g; 561 yds/513 m)
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hbhdc = Herringbone half double crochet – Yoh and insert hook into designated stitch. Draw through stitch and first loop on hook. Yoh and draw through both loops.
Hbhdc2tog = Herringbone half double crochet 2 together - (Yoh and insert hook into next stitch. Draw through stitch and first loop on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops.
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 4 yrs 24" [61 cm], 6 yrs 26" [66 cm], 8 yrs 28" [71 cm]. Finished chest: 4 yrs 28" [71 cm], 6 yrs 31" [78.5 cm], 8 yrs 34" [86.5 cm].
gauge: 14 hbhdc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Garment is worked in one piece from neck edge down.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
Beg at neck edge, ch 32.
1st row: (RS). 1 hbhdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hbhdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. (1 hbhdc in next st. 2 hbhdc in next st) twice. 1 hbhdc in next st. PM on last st. 2 hbhdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hbhdc in next st. PM on last st. (2 hbhdc in next st. 1 hbhdc in next st) twice. Turn. 40 sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hbhdc in first st. 2 hbhdc in next st. (1 hbhdc in each st to 1 st before marked st. 2 hbhdc in next st. 1 hbhdc in next st. PM on last st. 2 hbhdc in next st) 4 times. 1 hbhdc in each st until last 2 sts. 2 hbhdc in next st. 1 hbhdc in last st. Turn. 50 sts.
Rep 3rd row 13 (15-17) times more. 180 (200-220) sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hbhdc in first st. 2 hbhdc in next st. 1 hbhdc in each st to last 2 sts. 2 hbhdc in next st. 1 hbhdc in last st. Turn. 182 (202-222) sts.
Divide Sleeves and Body
1st row: Ch 2. 1 hbhdc in first st. 2 hbhdc in next st. [1 hbhdc in each st to marked st. Ch 4. Skip next 34 (38-42) sts] twice. 1 hbhdc in each st to last 2 sts. 2 hbhdc in next st. 1 hbhdc in last st. Turn. 124 (136-148) st rem for Body.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hbhdc in first st. 2 hbhdc in next st. 1 hbhdc in each st and ch to last 2 sts. 2 hbhdc in next st. 1 hbhdc in last st. Turn. 126 (138-150) sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hbhdc in first st. 2 hbhdc in next st. 1 hbhdc in each st to last 2 sts. 2 hbhdc in next st. 1 hbhdc in last st. Turn. 128 (140-152) sts.
Rep 3rd row 9 (11-13) times more. 146 (162-178) sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hbhdc in each st across. Turn.
Rep last row 1 (2-3) time(s) more. Fasten off.
Picot Neck Edging
With WS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom corner of Left Front. Work 1 row of sc evenly up Left Front, across back neck and down Right Front, ending with an odd number of sts. Turn.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd and 3rd ch from hook. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Sleeves
Notes:
• To match stripe pattern of yarn, begin each Sleeve at same point in color transition.
• Turn at end of each rnd to maintain same pat as Body.
1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st in rem loop of 3rd ch of ch-4 armhole. Ch 2. 1 hbhdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hbhdc in next ch. 1 hbhdc in each st around. 1 hbhdc in each of next 2 ch. Join with sl st to first st. Turn. 38 (42-46) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hbhdc in each st around. Join. Turn.
Rep 2nd rnd twice more.
Begin Sleeve Shaping: 1st rnd:
Ch 2. Hbhdc2tog. 1 hbhdc in each st to last 2 sts. Hbhdc2tog. Join. Turn. 36 (40-44) sts.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hbhdc in each st around. Join. Turn.
Rep last 5 rnds 4 (5-6) times more. 28 (30-32) sts.
Rep 2nd rnd until Sleeve measures 10 (11½-13)" [25.5 (29-33) cm].
Picot Border
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd and 3rd ch from hook. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Waistband/Tie
Ch 7.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Waistband/Tie measures 76 (82-88)" [193 (208.5-223.5) cm], when slightly stretched. Fasten off. 
Place a st marker 10" [25.5 cm] from right edge of Waistband/Tie. Place 2nd st marker 42 (46½-51)" [106.5 (118-129.5) cm] from first marker. (See diagram on page 3).  
Sew lower edge of Cardigan Body to Waistband/Tie, between st markers.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft Stripes™ (4 oz/113 g; 194 yds/177 m) The Keys (19005) 3 3 4 4 balls
Caron® Simply Soft Speckle™ (5 oz/141 g; 235 yds/215 m) Lipstick (61016) 2 3 3 4 balls
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: V-st = (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in indicated space
measurements: To fit chest measurement 4 23" [58.5 cm] 6 25" [63.5 cm] 8 26½" [67.5 cm] 10 28" [71 cm]. Finished chest 4 23" [58.5 cm] 6 24" [61 cm] 8 27½" [70 cm] 10 31" [79 cm]
gauge: 14 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus 4 ( 6 - 8 - 10 ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes. 
Note: 
• Garment is worked in one piece from neck edge down. 
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. 

BODY 
Ch 50 ( 54-60-64).
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 ( 6-7-8) ch. V-st in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 8 ( 8-9-9) ch. V-st in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 14 ( 16-18-20) ch. V-st in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 8 ( 8-9-9) ch. V-st in next ch. 1 dc in each of last 7 ( 8-9-10) ch. Turn. 52 ( 56-62-66) dc and 4 ch-1 sps.

2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 7 ( 8-9-10) dc. V-st in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 10 ( 10-11-11) dc. V-st in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 16 ( 18-20-22) dc. V-st in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 10 ( 10-11-11) dc. V-st in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 8 ( 9-10-11) dc. Turn. 60 ( 64-70-74) dc and 4 ch-1 sps.

3rd row: Ch 3. (1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. V-st in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.

Rep last row 7 ( 7-9-11) times more. 124 ( 128-150-170) dc and 4 ch-1 sps.

Divide for Body: 
Next row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 16 ( 17-20-23) dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 4. Skip next 28 ( 28-33-37) dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 34 ( 36-42-48) dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 4. Skip next 28 ( 28-33-37) dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 17 ( 18-21-24) dc. Turn. 

Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 17 ( 18-21-24) dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 1 dc in each of next 36 ( 38-44-50) dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 1 dc in each of last 18 ( 19-22-25) dc. Turn. 80 ( 84-96-108) dc. Place marker at end of last row.

Proceed in Lower Body pat as follows:

Sizes 4 and 8 only: 
1st row: (RS). Ch 3. Skip next dc. *4 dc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 4 dc in next dc. Skip next dc. Rep from * to last 3 ( 4) dc. 4 dc in next dc. Skip next 1 ( 2) dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 31 ( 37) groups of 4 dc.

Sizes 6 and 10 only: 
1st row: (RS). Ch 3. Skip next dc. *4 dc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 4 dc in next dc. Skip next dc. Rep from * to last ( 7- 6) dc. 4 dc in next dc. Skip next ( 2-1) dc. 4 dc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. ( 32-42) groups of 4 dc.

All sizes: 
2nd row:  (WS). Ch 3. *Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Working behind last dc, work 1 dc in first of 3 skipped dc  - Cr2dc made. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 3. *4 dc in ch-2 sp of next Cr2dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in top of turning ch.
Rep last 2 rows for Lower Body pat until work from marker measures 8 (9-11-13)" [20.5 (23-28-33) cm], ending on a WS row of pat. Fasten off.

Sleeve edging: 
1st rnd:  With RS facing, join yarn with sl st in first rem loop of ch-4 at underarm. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next rem 3 ch. 2 sc down side of next dc worked into ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next skipped 28 ( 28-33-37) dc. 2 sc down side of next dc worked into ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 ( 36-41-45) sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Left Front edging: 
1st row:  With RS facing, join yarn with sl st in corner of Left Front neck edge. Ch 1. Work 37 ( 41-45-49) sc evenly down front edge. Turn.

2nd and 3rd rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off at end of 3rd row.

Right Front edging: 
1st row: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st in lower corner of Right Front. Ch 1. Work 37 ( 41-45-49) sc evenly up front edge. Turn.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

Place buttonloop markers on this row, having bottom buttonloop at last marked dc row before beg of Lower Body pat, top buttonloop ½" [1 cm] below neck edge and rem 2 ( 2-3-3) buttonloops spaced evenly between.

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to first buttonloop marker. *Ch 4 for buttonloop. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each sc to next buttonloop marker. Rep from * 2 ( 2-3-3) times more. Ch 4 for buttonloop. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.

Sew on buttons to correspond to buttonloops.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 2 (2, 2, 3) balls each 9600 White A
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10½], 6mm [US J-10] and 3.75mm [US F-5]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 12 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 14 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet using 6.5mm [US K-10½] hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Shape First Shoulder and Neck 
Row 1: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 10 (11, 12, 13, 14) sc, leave remaining sts unworked for Neck and Second Shoulder – 10 (11, 12, 13, 14) sc.
Decrease Row 2: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in each sc across – 9 (10 11, 12, 13) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Repeat last 2 rows 2 more times – 7 (8, 9, 10, 11) sc.
Fasten off.

Shape Second Shoulder and Neck 
Row 1: Skip next 11 unworked sts on Row 1, join A in next st, ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in remaining sts across – 10 (11, 12, 13, 14) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Decrease Row 3: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in each sc across – 9 (10, 11, 12, 13) sc. Repeat last 2 rows 2 more times – 7 (8, 9, 10, 11) sc.
Fasten off.
SLEEVES 
With 6.5mm [US K-10½] hook and A, ch 21 (21, 24, 24, 27).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 20 (20, 23, 23, 26) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Increase Row 3: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc – 22 (22, 25, 25, 28) sc.
Rows 4-10: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Increase Row 11: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc – 24 (24, 27, 27, 30) sc.
Rows 12-27: Repeat Rows 4-11 twice – 28 (28, 31, 31, 34) sc.
Row 28: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Repeat last row until piece measures 7½ (9, 10, 10½, 11½)” [19 (23, 25.5, 26.5, 29) cm] from beginning.
Fasten off.
Directions are for size 1 year. Change for sizes 2, 4, 6 and 8 years are in parentheses.

BACK 
With 6.5mm [US K-10½] hook and A, ch 36 (38, 40, 44, 46).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 35 (37, 39, 43, 45) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Repeat last row until piece measures 5½ (6, 6½, 7½, 9)” [14 (15, 16.5, 19, 23) cm] from beginning.
Shape Armholes
Next Row: Turn, slip st over first 2 (2, 2, 3, 3) sc, ch 1, sc in each sc across to last 2 (2, 2, 3, 3) sc, leave remaining sts unworked – 31 (33, 35, 37, 39) sc.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 9½ (10½, 11½, 12½, 14½)” [24 (26.5, 29, 32, 37) cm] from beginning.
Fasten off.

FRONT 
Work same as Back until piece measures 7½ (8½, 9½, 10½, 12½)” [19 (21.5, 24, 27, 32) cm] from beginning.
CROWN
With 3.75mm [US F-5] size hook and B, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across – 12 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in next st, *ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st; repeat from * across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across – 12 sts.
Row 4: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in first st, dc3tog all in next st, hdc in next st, [dc3tog all in next st] 3 times, hdc in next st, dc3tog all in next st, hdc in next st, dc3tog all in next st, hdc in last st.
Row 5: Ch 6, turn, skip 2 sts, sc in next st, ch 8, skip 2 sts, sc in next st, ch 8, skip 2 sts, sc in next st, ch 6, sc in last st.
Fasten off.
Row 6: Join B in last st of Row 5, ch 1, work 6 sc in ch-6 space, [work 8 sc in next ch-8 space] twice, 6 sc in next ch-6 space, slip st in first st of Row 5. 
Fasten off.
Row 7: Join B in space in between ch-8 spaces on Row 5, (ch 3, dc3tog, ch 3, slip st) all in same st. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Sew Crown in center of Front.
Sew Shoulder seams. Sew in Sleeves. Sew side seams and Sleeve seams. 
Neck Edging 
With right side facing and 6mm [US J-10] hook, join B at Neck edge of one shoulder seam. 
Round 1: Work sc evenly around Neck edge, slip st in first sc to join. 
Rounds 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off. 
Sleeve Edging 
With right side facing and 6mm [US J-10] hook, join B at lower edge at Sleeve seam. 
Round 1: Work sc evenly around lower edge, slip st in first sc to join.
Rounds 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc.
Fasten off. 
Repeat around lower edge of second Sleeve. 
Lower Edging 
With right side facing and 6mm [US J-10] hook, join B at lower edge at side seam. 
Round 1: Work sc evenly around lower edge, slip st in first sc to join.
Rounds 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc.
Fasten off. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Burgundy (0376) 1 ball for sizes S M L XL
Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast B Cherry (7190) 1 O’Go for sizes S M L XL
Contrast C Black (7120) 1 O’Go for sizes S M L, 2 O’Go(s) for size XL
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
measurements: To fit chest measurement: S 10" [25.5 cm], M 16" [405.5 cm], L 24" [61 cm], XL 30" [76 cm]. Finished chest: S 12½" [32 cm], M 18" [45.5 cm], L 26" [66 cm], XL 32" [81.5 cm].
gauge: 14 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of work and work sts around yarn not in use.
• Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc.
Neck Ribbing: With C and smaller hook, ch 5 (6-7-7) loosely.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 (5-6-6) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 34 (50-74-86) times more. Do not fasten off. Turn work sideways, change to larger hook and proceed across longer side of Ribbing as follows:
Body: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 36 (52-76-88) sc across long edge of neck ribbing. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
See charts on pages 4 to 7, depending on your size. With RS facing, join appropriate color with sl st and work Chart I (II-III-IV) as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row:  (Inc row). Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each dc to last d. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 38 (54-78-90) dc.
First 2 rows of Chart I (II-III-IV) are complete.
Keeping cont of chart, noting inc at each end of next 3 (5-7-11) rows. 44 (64-92-112) dc.
Next row: (WS). Work row 6 (8-10-14) of chart.
Keeping cont of chart, proceed as follows:
Leg Openings: Next row:  (RS). Ch 3. Pat across next 5 (7-11-15) dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Pat on these 6 (8-12-16) dc for left belly 1 (1-3-5) row(s) more. Fasten off at end of last row.
With RS facing, skip next 4 (8-10-12) dc. Join appropriate color to next dc. Ch 3. Pat across next 23 (31-47-55) dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Pat on these 24 (32-48-56) dc for back, 1 (1-3-5) row(s) more. Fasten off at end of last row.
With RS facing, skip next 4 (8-10-12) dc. Join appropriate color to next dc. Ch 3. Pat to end of row.
Pat on these 6 (8-12-16) dc for right belly 1 (1-3-5) row(s) more. Fasten off at end of last row.
Joining row: (RS). Join appropriate color to first dc of left belly. Ch 3. Pat across next 5 (7-11-15) dc. Ch 4 (8-10-12). Pat across 24 (32-48-56) dc. Ch 4 (8-12-12). Pat to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3. Pat across 5 (7-11-15) dc. Pat across 4 (8-10-12) ch. Pat across 24 (32-48-56) dc. Pat across 4 (8-10-12) ch. Pat to end of row. Turn. 44 (64-92-112) dc.
Cont in chart until row 14 (24-32-38) of chart is complete. Fasten off at end of last row. PM at each end of last row.
Shape Belly: With RS facing skip first 6 (10-14-16) dc. Join appropriate color to next dc. Ch 3. Pat to last 6 (10-14-16) dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 32 (44-64-80) dc.
Next row: Ch 3. Dc2tog. Pat to last 3 sts. Dc2tog. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. Rep last row 2 (4-5-5) times more. 26 (34-52-68) sts rem. Cont even in pat to end of chart. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby Stripes™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 287 yds/262 m) Contrast A Summer Picnic Stripe (53014) 1 2 2 3 ball(s)
Bernat® Softee® Baby™ (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m) Contrast B Grass Green (54003) 1 1 1 1 ball
Sizes U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) and U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of stitch at back of work, inserting hook from left to right. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Sizes to fit chest measurement: 6 mos 17" [43 cm], 12 mos 18" [45.5 cm], 18 mos 19" [48 cm], 24 mos 20" [51 cm]. Finished chest: 6 mos 21" [53.5 cm], 12 mos 22" [56 cm], 18 mos 23" [58.5 cm], 24 mos 24" [61 cm].
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for 6. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written 6 (12 -18 -24 ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

BACK 
Note: Back is worked sideways.
**With larger hook and A, ch 42 (46-48-52).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. 41 (45-47-51) sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.**

Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 10½ ( 11 -11½ -12 )[26.5 ( 28 -29 -30.5) cm] ending on a WS row.

Fasten off.

LEFT FRONT 
Note: Front is worked sideways. Work from ** to ** as given for Back.

Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 3 (3¼ -3¼-3½)" [7.5 (8.5 -8.5 -9) cm], ending on a WS row.

Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 2 sc and first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same ch-1 sp as last st. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. 39 ( 43-45-49) sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 37 ( 41-43-47) sts.
3rd row: Sl st in each of first 2 sc and first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 35 ( 39-41-45) sts.
4th row: As 2nd row. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 33 ( 37-39-43) sts.

Rep last 2 rows 3 ( 3-3-4) times more. 21 (25 -27-27) sts. Fasten off.

RIGHT FRONT:  Work as for Left Front, noting 1st row is WS to reverse all shaping.

SLEEVES: With smaller hook and B, ch 25 (27-29-31).
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 23 ( 25-27-29) sts.

2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st) 1 dcbp around post of first st. *1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dcbp around post of next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around post of first st. *1 dcbp around post of next st. 1 dcfp around post of last st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row, joining A at end of row. Break B.

Change to larger hook.
5th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc (inc made). Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc (inc made). Turn. 25 (27-29-31) sts.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
9th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1 (inc made). 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 1 (inc made). 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 27 (29-31-33) sts.
10th row: As 6th row.
11th to 18th rows: Rep 7th to 10th rows twice more. 35 ( 37-39-41) sts.
19th row: As 8th row.
20th row: As 10th row.
21st row: As 7th row. 37 ( 39-41-43) sts.
22nd row: As 8th row.
23rd row: As 10th row.
24th row: As 8th row.
25th row: As 9th row. 39 ( 41-43-45) sts.
26th row: As 10th row.
27th row: As 8th row.
28th row: As 10th row.
Cont even in pat until Sleeve from beg measures approx 7 ( 7½-8-8½)" [18 (19-20.5-21.5) cm] Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Place markers on side edges of Back and Front 4¼ ( 4½-4¾-5)" [ 11 ( 11.5-12-12.5) cm] down from shoulder seams. Sew in Sleeves between markers. Sew side and sleeve seams.

Bottom Ribbing:  With smaller hook and RS facing, join B with sl st to bottom corner of Left Front.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 23 ( 24-25-26) sc evenly across bottom of Left Front, 48 (50-52-54) sc evenly across bottom of Back and 23 (24-25-26) sc evenly across bottom of Right Front. 94 ( 98-102-106) sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2 ( does not count as st). Dcbp around post of first st. Dcfp around post of next st. *Dcbp around post of next st. Dcfp around post of next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2 ( does not count as st). Dcbp around post of first st. Dcfp around post of next st. *Dcbp around post of last st. Dcfp around post of next st. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.

Button Band and Collar: With RS facing and larger hook, join B with sl st to bottom Right Front. 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 7 sc across side edge of Bottom Ribbing, 1 sc in each of next 21 ( 25-27-27) sts up Right Front sts, work 20 ( 20-20-24) sc up across Right Neck, 18 ( 18-20-20) sc across Back neck, work 20 ( 20-20-24) sc down Left Neck, 1 sc in each of next 21 ( 25-27-27) sts down Left Front sts and 7 sc across side edge of Bottom Ribbing. 114 ( 122-128-136) sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row (buttonhole row):  Ch 2 ( does not count as st) Dcbp around post of first st. Dcfp around post of next st. Dcbp around post of next st. Ch 1. Skip next st. [(Dcbp around post of next st. Dcfp around post of next st) 3 ( 3-4-4) times. Dcbp around post of next st. Ch 1. Skip next st] 3 times. *Dcbp around post of next st. Dcfp around post of next st. Rep from * to end of row. 4 buttonholes made. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. Dcfp around post of first st. Dcbp around post of next st. *Dcfp around post of next st. Dcbp around post of next st. Rep from * to end of row, working 1 dc in each ch-1 sp as it appears. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 27 ( 31-33-33) sts. (Dcfp around post of next st. Dcbp around post of next st) 29 ( 29-30-34) times. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
6th row: Sl st in each of first 3 sts. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 dcbp around post of same st as last sl st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. *1 dcbp around post of next st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. Rep from * to 2 sts before last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
7th row: Sl st in each of first 3 sts. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 dcbp around post of same st as last sl st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. *1 dcbp around post of next st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. Rep from * to 2 sts before last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
8th row: Sl st in each of first 3 sts. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 dcbp around post of same st as last sl st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. *1 dcbp around post of next st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. Rep from * to 2 sts before last turn. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
9th row: Sl st in each of first 3 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row (across unworked sts of previous rows). Fasten off.

Sew buttons to Button Band to correspond with buttonholes.

materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece Finest™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 888 yds/812 m)
1 ball(s) for sizes 6 mos, 12 mos, 2 ball(s) for size 18 mos
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 6 mos - 17" [43 cm], 12 mos - 18" [45.5 cm], 18 mos - 19" [48.5 cm]; Finished chest: 6 mos - 20" [51 cm], 12 mos - 22" [56 cm], 18 mos - 23¾" [59.5 cm]
gauge: 14 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for size 6 mos. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written 6 (12-18) mos. Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

BODY
With A, ch 72 (78-84).
See diagram on page 2.
**1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 71 (77-83) sts. Break A. Join MC.
2nd row: With MC, ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.**
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures 6¾ (7-8)" [17 (18-20.5) cm], ending on a WS row. 
Divide for armholes: Right Front: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Pat across 15 (17-19) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
Cont even in pat on 15 (17-19) sts for 8 (10-12) more rows. 
Shape neck: 1st row: (WS). Ch 3. Pat across 13 (15-17) sts (neck edge). Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows once more, then rep 2nd row once. 8 (10-12) sts rem.
Next row: (WS). Work even. Fasten off.
Back: With RS facing, skip next 7 sts. Join MC with sl st in next st. Ch 1. Pat across next 27 (29-31) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
Cont even in pat on 27 (29-31) sts for 13 (15-17) more rows. Fasten off.
Left Front: With RS facing, skip next 7 sts. Join MC with sl st in next st. Ch 1. Pat across next 15 (17-19) sts. Turn. 
Cont even in pat on 15 (17-19) sts for 7 (9-11) rows more. Fasten off.
Shape neck: 1st row: (WS). Skip first 2 sts (sc and dc). Join MC with sl st to next sc. Ch 3. Pat to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows once more, then rep 2nd row once. 8 (10-12) sts rem.
Next row: (WS). Work even. Fasten off.
Sew shoulder seams.
Right front edging: 1st row: With RS facing join A with sl st to bottom right corner of Front. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work in (sc/ch-1) pat evenly up right side front edge to top corner, ending with 1 sc in top corner at neck edge. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.

Left front edging: With RS facing join A with sl st to top left corner at front neck shaping. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work in (sc/ch-1) pat evenly down left side front edge to bottom corner, ending with 1 sc in bottom corner. Turn. Work as 2nd and 3rd rows for Right front edging.

SLEEVES 
With A, ch 30 (34-38).
Work from ** to ** as given for Body. 29 (33-35) sts.
Work in pat until work from beg measures 7½ (8½-9½)" [19 (21.5-24) cm], ending on a WS row. 
Fasten off. PM on side edges 1" [2.5 cm] down from final row.

HOOD 
Beg at face edge, with A, ch 66 (70-74). 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 65 (69-73) sts. 
2nd row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. Break A. Join MC. 
With MC, work 3 rows in pat, ending on a WS row.

Shape neck edges of Hood: 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 
Rep last row 5 times more. 53 (57-61) sts. PM at beg of last row. 
Work in pat until Hood from marked row measures length to fit from shoulder seam to center of back, ending on a WS row. Place second set of markers at each end of last row.

Shape back of Hood: Next row: Ch 1. Pat to last 6 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
Rep last row 7 times more. Fasten off.
Fold Hood in a half, having foundation chain around face. Sew shaped back edge between second set of markers. Sew shaped neck sides of Hood to neck edge (matching shapings and color changes).

FINISHING 
With RS facing, PM for 3 buttonholes on Right Front for boy and Left Front for girl: top marker ½" [1 cm] below neck edge, bottom marker 7" [18 cm] above lower edge and rem marker centered between. Sew buttons to correspond to markers. 
Loosen fabric of button band to let button be buttoned. 
Sew in Sleeves, placing rows above markers along unworked sts at armholes to form square armholes. 
Pompom: With A, ch 12. 
Work from ** to ** as given for Body. 11 sts. 
Work in pat until 3" [7.5 cm] total length. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end onto tapestry needle and gather around outer edges of Pompom, inserting stuffing before fastening off. Sew to point of Hood.

materials: Red Heart® With Love™ (7 oz/198g; 370 yds/338m)
Size U.S. J/10 [6 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® split-lock stitch count markers.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
Scbl2tog = Draw up a loop in back loops each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit chest measurement 6 mos 17" [43 cm] 12 mos 18" [45.5 cm] 18 mos 19" [48.5 cm] 24 mos 20" [51 cm]. Finished chest 6 mos 20" [51 cm] 12 mos 22" [56 cm] 18 mos 24" [61 cm] 24 mos 26" [66 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: The instructions are written for 6 mos. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written 6 (12-18-24). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Notes: • Fronts and back of cardi are worked in one piece to armholes, then divided for fronts and back. • Sleeves are worked in joined rounds directly from armholes. • Hood is worked back and forth in rows directly from top edge of cardi. • Buttonhole and button bands are shown for boy’s sweater. Refer to instructions in parentheses for a girl’s sweater. • Unless otherwise instructed, work in back loop only throughout including joining. BODY: Ch 64 (70-76-84). 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 63 (69-75-83) sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 6 (7-8-9)" [15 (18-20.5-23) cm], ending on a WS row. RIGHT FRONT: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl each of first 15 (17-18-20) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 15 (17-18-20) sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until armhole measures 3¾ (4¾-5¾-6¾)" [9.5 (12-14.5-17) cm], ending on a WS row. Neck shaping: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Skip first sc. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. 14 (16-17-19) sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked. Rep last 2 rows once more. 11 (13-14-16) sc. Fasten off. BACK: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st in first unworked st of body. Ch 1. 1 scbl in same st as sl st. 1 scbl in each of next 16 (17-19-21) sc. PM on last st made. 1 scbl in each of next 16 (17-19-21) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 33 (35-39-43) sc. Note: Move marker up as each row is completed. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until armhole measures 5 (6-7-8)" [12.5 (15-18-20.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. Leave marker in place to indicate back center of hood. LEFT FRONT: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st in first unworked st of body. Ch 1. 1 scbl in same st as sl st. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 15 (17-18-20) sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until armhole measures 3¾ (4¾-5¾-6¾)" [9.5 (12-14.5-17) cm], ending on a WS row. Neck shaping: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked. 14 (16-17-19) sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. Skip first sc. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last 2 rows once more. 11 (13-14-16) sc. Fasten off. Shoulder Seam: With RS of right front and back held tog and working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sl st in first st at outer edge. Sl st in each of next 3 (4-5-6) sc. Fasten off. Rep for other shoulder. 25 (25-27-29) sc left for back neck. 7 (8-8-9) sc left for each front neck. SLEEVES: Notes: To keep look of fabric the same as for Body, turn after join at end of each rnd. To Join all rnds with sl st to first sc. 1st rnd: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at lower edge of armhole opening. Working in ends of rows, work 30 (32-36-38) sc evenly spaced around. Join. Turn. 2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 1 scbl in each sc to last 3 sts. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. Turn. 5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join. Turn. Rep last rnd until sleeve from pick up rnd measures 3½ (4-5-5)" [4 (10-12.5-12.5) cm], turning at end of each rnd. Next rnd: Ch 1. Scbl2tog. 1 scbl in each sc to last 2 sc. Scbl2tog. Join. Turn. 28 (30-34-36) sts. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st around. Join. Turn. Rep last 2 rnds 5 (5-6-7) times, turning at end of each rnd. 18 (20-22-22) sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join. Turn. Rep last rnd until sleeve measures 7½ (8½-9½-10½)" [19 (21.5-24-26.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Do not turn. Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off. HOOD: 1st row: (WS). Join yarn with sl st in first sc of Left front. Ch 1. 1 scbl in same st as sl st. 1 scbl in each of next 5 (6-6-7) sc. 2 scbl in next sc. PM on first st of 2-sc group just made. 1 sc in seam. PM on sc just made. 2 scbl in next sc. PM on 2nd st of 2-sc group just made. 1 scbl in each of next 23 (23-25-27) sc. 2 scbl in next st. PM on first st of 2-sc group just made. 1 sc in seam. PM on sc just made. 2 scbl in next sc. PM on 2nd sc of 2-st group just made. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 45 (45-47-53) sc. Move center marker up as each row is completed. 2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 6th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to next marked sc. (2 scbl in next marked sc. PM on first st of 2-sc group just made) 3 times. 1 scbl in each sc to next marked sc. (2 scbl in next marked sc. PM on 2nd st of 2-sc group just made) 3 times. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 51 (51-53-59) sc. Rep 2nd to 6th rows once more. 57 (57-59-65) sc. Next row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until Hood from pick up row measures 7½ (8-8½-9)" [19 (20.5-21.5-23) cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off. FINISHING: Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. Fold hood in half at center marked st and working through both thicknesses, sew last row edges tog. Buttonhole Band: Note: Instructions in parentheses are for girl’s sweater. 1st row: With RS (WS) facing and working in ends of rows of left (right) front, join yarn with sl st in first row at lower edge. Ch 1. Work 34 (40-44-49) sc evenly spaced across front edge. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sts. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 4 buttonholes. Fasten off. Button Band: Note: Instructions in parentheses are for girl’s sweater. 1st row: With RS (WS) facing and working in ends of rows of right (left) front, join yarn with sl st in first row at lower edge. Ch 1. Work 34 (40-44-49) sc evenly spaced across front edge. Turn. 2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Do not fasten off. Edging: 1st rnd: Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working up first front, *1 sc in each sc to next ch-2 sp (buttonhole). 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each st to hood. Working in ends of rows of hood, 2 sc in first row, 1 sc in each row to last row. 2 sc in last row. Working down other front, 1 sc in each sc to first sc. Join. Fasten off. Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

materials: RED HEART® Unforgettable™: 3 (3, 4, 5, 5) balls each 3955 Winery.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 15 sts; 10 rows = 4” in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BOLERO
Yoke
Ch 51 (53, 55, 57, 59).
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc), dc in next 4 ch for first front, place marker in last dc made, dc in next 8 ch for sleeve, place marker in last dc made, dc in next 22 (24, 26, 28, 30) ch for back, place marker in last dc made, dc in next 8 ch for sleeve, place marker in last dc made, dc in last 5 ch for 2nd front, turn—49 (51, 53, 55, 57) dc. Note: Move markers up as work progresses. When 3 dc is worked into a marked st, move the marker to the center dc of the 3-dc group.
Row 2 (Wrong Side): Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st to marker, 3 dc in marked st; [hdc in next st, Bpdc around next st] 3 times, hdc in next st, 3 dc in marked st, dc in each st to next marker, 3 dc in marked st, [hdc in next st, Bpdc around next st] 3 times, hdc in next st, 3 dc in marked st; dc in each st to end, turn—57 (59, 61, 63, 65) sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc in each st to marker, 3 dc in marked st, Fpdc around next st, [hdc in next st, Fpdc around next Bpdc] across to 2 sts before marked st, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next st, 3 dc in marked st, dc in each st to next marker, 3 dc in marked st, Fpdc around next st, [hdc in next st, Fpdc around next Bpdc] across to 2 sts before marked st, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next st, 3 dc in marked st, dc in each st to end, turn—65 (67, 69, 71, 73) sts.
Row 4: Ch 2, dc in each st to marker, 3 dc in marked st, [hdc in next st, Bpdc around next st] across to 1 st before marked st, hdc in next st, 3 dc in marked st, dc in each st across to next marker, 3 dc in marked st, [hdc in next st, Bpdc around next st] across to last st before next marker, hdc in next st, 3 dc in marked st, dc in each st to end, turn—73 (75, 77, 79, 81) sts.
Rows 5–28: Repeat last 2 rows 12 more times—265 (267, 269, 271, 273) sts.
Row 29: Repeat Row 3—273 (275, 277, 279, 281) sts.
Large, X-Large and XX-Large only:
Row 30: Repeat Row 4—285 (287, 289) sts.
Rows 31–32 (32, 36): Repeat Rows 3 and 4, 1 (1, 3) more times—301 (303, 337) sts.
Row 33 (33, 37): Repeat Row 3—309 (311, 345) sts.
Body
Row 1 (Wrong Side – Divide for Armholes): Ch 2, dc in each st to first marked st, skip first marked st and all sleeve stitches, skip 2nd marked st, dc in each st to 3rd marker, skip 3rd marked st and all sleeve sts, dc in each st to end of row—143 (145, 163, 165, 183) sts. Leave markers in place.
Row 2: Ch 2, [dc2tog] twice, dc in each st to last 5 sts, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last st, turn—139 (141, 159, 161, 179) sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, [dc2tog] twice, [dc in next 24 (24, 27, 27, 31) sts, dc2tog] 4 times, dc in each st across to last 5 sts, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last st, turn—131 (133, 151, 153, 171) sts.
Row 4: Ch 2, [dc2tog] twice, [dc in next 23 (23, 26, 26, 30) sts, dc2tog] 4 times, dc in each st across to last 5 sts, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last st, turn—123 (125, 143, 145, 163) sts.
Row 5: Ch 2, [dc2tog] twice, [dc in each of next 22 (22, 25, 25, 29) sts, dc2tog] 4 times, dc in each st across to last 5 sts, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last st, turn—115 (117, 135, 137, 155) sts.
Row 6: Ch 2, [dc2tog] twice, [dc in each of next 21 (21, 24, 24, 28) sts, dc2tog] 4 times, dc in each st across to last 5 sts, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last st, turn—107 (109, 126, 129, 147) sts.
Row 7: Ch 2, [dc2tog] twice, [dc in each of next 20 (20, 23, 23, 27) sts, dc2tog] 4 times, dc in each st across to last 5 sts, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last st, turn—99 (101, 119, 121, 139) sts, do not fasten off.
Sizes Large, X-Large, XX-Large only:
Row 8: Ch 2, [dc2tog] twice, [dc in each of next 22 (22, 26) sts, dc2tog] 4 times, dc in each st across to last 5 sts, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last st, turn—111 (113, 131) sts, do not fasten off.
Size XXL only:
Row 9: Ch 2, [dc2tog] twice, [dc in each of next 25 sts, dc2tog] 4 times, dc in each st across to last 5 sts, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last st, turn—123 sts, do not fasten off.
EDGING
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across to last 3 (1, 3, 1, 3) sts, sc in last 3 (1, 3, 1, 3) sts, do not turn; working up front edge, work 3 sc in end of each of next 6 (6, 8, 8, 9) rows, 2 sc in end of each row to neck corner; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across; working down front edge, work 2 sc in end of each row to last 6 (6, 8, 8, 9) rows, 3 sc in end of last 6 (6, 8, 8, 9) rows; join with slip st in first sc, do not turn.
Round 2 (Right Side): Slip st in each st around; join with slip st to first st. Fasten off.
SLEEVES
Round 1 (Right Side): Join new yarn with slip st in marked st before the underarm join, ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), work 7 (7, 7, 9, 9) hdc in the underarm area before the next marker, Fpdc in marked st, hdc in next st, *Fpdc around next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—72 (72, 80, 82, 90) sts.
Round 2 (Wrong Side): Ch 2, hdc in next st, *Bpdc around next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in next st, *Fpdc around next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around, hdc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn.
Rounds 4 and 5: Repeat Rounds 2 and 3.
Round 6: Repeat Round 2.
Round 7: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), 4 dc in same st; *skip 1 st, Fpdc around next Fpdc, 3 dc in same st, Fpdc again around the same Fpdc; repeat from * around, skip last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch– 36 (36, 40, 41, 45) groups. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: Funky Donkey Kids Crochet Blanket Hoodie
materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit chest measurement 6/8 yrs 25-26½" [63.5-67.5 cm] / 10/12 yrs 28-30" [71-76 cm]. Finished chest measurement 6/8 yrs 48" [122 cm] / 10/12 yrs 58" [147.5 cm]
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instruction will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Notes: 
• Body and Sleeves are crocheted in rnds until armhole. 
• At end of each rnd, turn work, to alternate rnds on RS and WS. This will ensure the sections worked in rnds will match sections worked in rows.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first hdc.

BODY
With A, ch 120 ( 144). Join in rnd with sl st to first ch, being careful not to twist chain. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join. Turn.
2nd rnd: ( WS). Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each hdc around. Join with MC. Break A. Turn.
3rd rnd: (RS). With MC, ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join. Turn.
4th rnd: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join. Turn.
Rep last 2 rnds until work from beg measures 17 ( 20)" [ 43 ( 51) cm], ending on a WS rnd. Turn.
Divide for Back and Front:   
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 60 ( 72) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Back: 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until armhole measures 9 ( 10)" [ 23 ( 25.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape shoulders: 1st row:  Sl st in each of first 10 ( 12) sts. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 9 ( 11) hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row:  Sl st in each of first 10 ( 13) sts. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 9 ( 12) hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Fasten off.
Front: With RS facing join MC with sl st to rem sts and proceed across 60 ( 72) hdc until armhole measures 6 rows shorter than Back before beg of shoulder shaping, ending on a WS row.
Shape left neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 20 ( 25) hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 22 ( 27) sts rem.
2nd row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 21 ( 26) sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 20 ( 25) sts.
Work 3 rows even.
Shape shoulder: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 10 ( 12) sts. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off. 
With RS facing, skip next 14 ( 16) hdc (center front neck). Join MC with sl st to next hdc. Cont on rem 23 ( 28) sts as follows:
Shape right neck: 1st row:  (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 22 ( 27) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 21 ( 26) sts.
3rd row: As 1st row. 20 ( 25) sts.
Work 2 rows even.
Shape shoulder: 1st row: (WS). Sl st in each of first 10 ( 12) sts. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.
SLEEVES
Sew shoulder seams. 
With RS facing, join MC at side edge between Left Front and Back. 
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 2. Work 45 ( 53) hdc evenly around armhole. Join. PM for beg of rnd. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Turn.
3rd rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rnds once more, then 2nd rnd once. 
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Join. Turn. 43 ( 51) sts.
Work 3 rnds even, turning at end of each rnd.
Rep last 4 rnds twice more. 
39 ( 47) sts.
Cont even in hdc, turning every rnd, until work from pick up rnd measures 9" [23 cm], ending on a RS rnd. 
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with A. Break MC. Turn . 
20 ( 24) sts rem. 
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Turn. 
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each hdc around. Join.
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
HOOD
With A, ch 59 ( 65) loosely.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 57 ( 63) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each hdc to end of row. Join MC. Break A. Turn.
3rd row:  With MC, ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 4½ ( 5)" [ 11.5 ( 12.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape neck of Hood: 1st row: (RS). 
Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 55 ( 61) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 
51 ( 57) sts. PM at end of last row. 
Work a further 2" [5 cm] even from markers, ending on a WS row.
Shape back of Hood: 1st row:  
(RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 23 ( 26) hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. PM on last hdc just worked. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 49 ( 55) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to 2 sts before marked. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 47 ( 53) sts.
Rep last row 2 ( 3) times more. 
43 ( 47) sts at end of last row.
Fasten off. 
Fold last row in half and sew back seam.  
Overlap fronts of Hood at foundation row 1½" [4 cm]. Sew Hood around neck opening, matching Hood seam with center back neck edge.
POCKET
With MC, ch 37 ( 42).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 35 ( 40) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape sides: 1st row:  (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 33 ( 38) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.  
Rep last 2 rows 3 ( 4) times more, then 1st row once. 25 ( 28) sts rem.
Fasten off. 
Try on Hoodie. Pin Pocket at comfortable height on center front. 
Sew Pocket edges in position, leaving shaped sides open.
Outer Ears (make 2)
With MC, ch 10. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 hdc. 
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Shape top of Ears: 7th row:  (RS). 
Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 6 sts. 
8th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
9th row: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) twice. Turn. 
2 sts.
10th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. Fasten off. 
Inner Ears (make 2)
With A, work as given for Outer Ears.
With WS of Outer and Inner Ears tog, Join MC with sl st at foundation ch. 
Working through both thicknesses, work in sc around Ears to opposite side of foundation ch, having 2 sc at top point. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Fold foundation row in half. Sew to Hood as shown.
Mane: Cut strands of MC and A 6" [15 cm] long. Taking 2 strands each MC and A tog, fold in half and knot into fringe across center of Hood. 
Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: V-st = (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in indicated stitch or space
gauge: 16 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook in bodice st pat.
instructions:
BODICE PATTERN STITCH
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * across. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * across. Turn.
Rep 1st and 2nd rows for Pattern Stitch.
NOTE: Bodice back and front are worked first then seamed. The skirt is then worked in rounds from the foundation row to the bottom edge.
HELPFUL: When, due to decreasing, a WS row begins with a dc, begin and ending Pattern Stitch Row 2 with 2 sc.

BACK
With larger hook, ch 70 (78-86-94-102).
Foundation row: (WS). 1 sc in second ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 35 (39-43-47-51) sc and 34 (38-42-46-50) ch-1 sps, for total of 69 (77-85-93-101) sts.
Work even in Bodice St Pat until work from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a RS row.

Shape Armholes
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 4 (6-6-8-8) sts. 1 sc in next st. (Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st) 30 (32-36-38-42) times. Turn. Leave rem 4 (6-6-8-8) sts unworked. 31 (33-37-39-43) sc and 30 (32-36-38-42) ch-1 sp. Total 61 (65-73-77-85) sts.

2nd row: Ch 1. Leaving last loop of each st on hook, 1 sc in first st. 1 dc in next st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - dec made. Cont in Bodice St Pat to last 2 sts. Leaving last loop of each st on hook, 1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - dec made. Turn. 59 (63-71-75-83) sts.

3rd row: Work even in Bodice St Pat.
Note: This row may require working 2 sc at beg and end, to maintain pattern.

4th row: Ch 1. Dec over first 2 sts. Cont in Bodice St Pat to last 2 sts. Dec over last 2 sts. Turn. 57 (61-69-73-81) sts.

Rep last 2 rows 2 (2-4-4-6) times more. 53 (57-61-65-69) sts.
Work even in Bodice St Pat until armhole measures 3 (3½-4-4½-4½)" [7.5 (9-10-11.5-11.5) cm], ending on a RS row.

Shape Left Shoulder
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 sc in next sc) 6 (7-7-8-9) times. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (for neck and right shoulder). 7 (8-8-9-10) sc and 6 (7-7-8-9) ch-1 sps, for a total of 13 (15-15-17-19) sts.
Work even in Bodice St Pat until armhole measures 6½ (7-7½-8-8)" [16.5 (18-19-20.5-20.5) cm], ending on a RS row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 (5-5-5-6) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 (5-5-6-6) sts. 1 dc in each of next 5 (5-5-6-7) sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

Shape Right Shoulder
1st row: (WS). Skip next 27 (27-31-31-31) sts following left shoulder (for back neck). Join yarn with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 sc in next sc) 6 (7-7-8-9) times. Turn. 7 (8-8-9-10) sc and 6 (7-7-8-9) ch-1 sps, for a total of 13 (15-15-17-19) sts.
Work even in Bodice St Pat until armhole measures 6½ (7-7½-8-8)" [16.5 (18-19-20.5-20.5) cm], ending on a RS row.
Next row: (WS). Ch 3 (counts as d.c.). 1 dc in each of next 4 (4-4-5-6) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 (5-5-6-6) sts. 1 sc in each of last 3 (5-5-5-6) sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

FRONT
Work as given for Back until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm], ending on a RS row.

Shape Neck and Right Shoulder
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. (Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st) 16 (18-20-22-24) times. 1 sc in next st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (for front neck and left shoulder). 18 (20-22-24-26) sc and 16 (18-20-22-24) ch-1 sps, for a total of 34 (38-42-46-50) sts.

2nd row: Ch 1. Dec over first 2 sts. Pat to end of row. Turn. 33 (37 -41-45-49) sts.

3rd row: Work even in Bodice St Pat.

4th row: Ch 1. Dec over first 2 sts. Pat to end of row. Turn. 32 (36 -40-44-48) sts.

Rep last 2 rows 11 (11-13-13-13) times, AT THE SAME TIME, when work measures 5" [12.5 cm], work armhole shaping as given for Back. 13 (15-15-17-19) sts.
Work even in Bodice St Pat until armhole measures 6½ (7-7½-8-8)" [16.5 (18-19-20.5-20.5) cm], ending on a RS row.

Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 (5-5-5-6) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 (5-5-6-6) sts. 1 dc in each of next 5 (5-5-6-7) sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

Shape Neck and Left Shoulder
1st row: (WS). Skip 1 unworked st following first shoulder, join yarn with sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. (Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st) 16 (18-20-22-24) times. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 18 (20-22-24-26) sc and 16 (18-20-22-24) ch-1 sps, for a total of 34 (38-42-46-50) sts.

2nd row: Pat to last 2 sts. Dec over last 2 sts. Turn. 33 (37-41-45-49) sts.

3th row: Work even in Bodice St Pat.

4th row: Pat to last 2 sts. Dec over last 2 sts. Turn. 32 (36 -40-44-48) sts.

Rep last 2 rows 11 (11-13-13-13) times, AT THE SAME TIME, when work measures 5" [12.5 cm], work armhole shaping as given for Back. 13 (15-15-17-19) sts.
Work even in pat until armhole measures 6½ (7-7½-8-8)" [16.5 (18-19-20.5-20.5) cm], ending on a RS row.

Next row: (WS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 (4-4-5-6) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 (5-5-6-6) sts. 1 sc in each of last 3 (5-5-5-6) sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Block pieces to measurements. Sew shoulder seams. Sew side seams.

Skirt
With larger hook and RS facing, join yarn with sc in right side seam.

1st rnd: (RS). Working across opposite side of Foundation row, *Ch 3. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc before left side seam. Ch 3. Skip last sc. 1 sc in left side seam, **Ch 3. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from ** around. Ch 3. Join with sl st in first sc. 70 (78-86-94-102) ch-3 sps.

2nd rnd: Ch 5. 1 dc in same sp as sl st (counts as V-st). *1 sc in next ch-3 sp. V-st in next sc. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch-5. 70 (78-86-94-102) V-sts.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in ch-2 sp of next V-st. V-st in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc.

4th rnd: Ch 5. 1 dc in same sp as sl st (counts as V-st). *1 sc in ch-2 sp of next V-st. V-st in next sc. Rep from * to last V-st. 1 sc in ch-2 sp of last V-st. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch-5.

Rep 3rd and 4th rnds until skirt measures 9" [23 cm], ending on a 4th rnd. Do not fasten off.

Lace
1st rnd: Sl st in ch-2 sp of next V-st. Ch 5 (counts as tr and ch 1). [(1 tr. Ch 1) twice. 1 tr] in same ch-2 sp. *Skip next sc. [(1 tr. Ch 1) 3 times. 1 tr] in ch-2 sp of next V-st. Rep from * to last sc. Skip last sc. Join with sl st in 4th ch of beg ch.

2nd rnd: *2 sc in next ch-1 sp. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. 2 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc.

3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sc and ch-3 sp. Ch 5 (counts as tr and ch 1). [(1 tr. Ch 1) twice. 1 tr] in same ch-3 sp. *Skip next 6 sc. [(1 tr. Ch 1) 3 times. 1 tr] in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Skip last 3 sc. Join with sl st in 4th ch of beg ch-5.

4th and 5th rnds: Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds.

6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next ch-1 sp. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-1 sp. 2 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.

Neck Edging
With smaller hook, join yarn in shoulder seam at neck. Work sc evenly around neck. Join with sl st in first sc.

Armhole Edging
With smaller hook, join yarn at side seam at underarm. Work sc evenly around armhole. Join with sl st in first sc. Rep around second armhole.

Tie
With smaller hook, ch 200 (215-230-245-260). Fasten off. Weave tie through first row of skirt and tie in a bow. Using yarn needle, weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion Crochet size 3: 10 (12, 13, 15, 16, 18) balls 310 Copper Mist
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 16 sc = 4” (10 cm); 24 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PULLOVER
Front/Back Panel (make 2)
Loosely ch 73 (81, 89, 97, 105, 113). 
Row 1 (right side): Working in back loops, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—72 (80, 88, 96, 104, 112) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops, sc in each st across, turn. 
Rows 3–6: Repeat Row 2.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 8–10: Repeat Row 7.
Rows 11 and 12: Ch 4 (counts as first tr here and throughout), tr in each st across, turn.
Rows 13 and 14: Repeat Row 7.
Rows 15 and 16: Repeat Rows 11 and 12.
Rows 17–24: Repeat Row 7.
Rows 25 and 26: Repeat Rows 11 and 12.
Rows 27–34: Repeat Row 7.
Repeat Rows 11–34 until piece measures 22 (22½, 23, 23½, 24, 24½)” [56 (57, 58.5, 59.5, 61, 62) cm] ending with a WS row.
Next 7 rows: Repeat Row 2.
Leaving a long tail for sewing, fasten off.
Sleeve (make 2)
Ch 37 (39, 41, 43, 45, 47). 
Work same as Front increasing 1 st at each end every 1 (1, ¾, ¾, ¾, ¾)” [2.5 (2.5, 2, 2, 2, 2) cm] 18 (19, 20, 21, 22, 23) times—72 (76, 80, 84, 88, 92) sts.
Work even in pattern until sleeve measures 20” (51 cm). Leaving a long tail for sewing, fasten off.
Finishing
Beginning at outer edges, sew Panels together 4 (5, 6, 7, 8, 9)” [10 (12.5, 15, 18, 20.5, 23) cm] across top edge. Sew Sleeves to Front and Back, then sew side and Sleeve seams. 
Weave in ends. 
Fringe
For each fringe, cut 6 strands, each 18” (45.5 cm) long. Fold strands in half to form a loop. Insert crochet hook from right side in first st of Row 1 of Front Panel. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe every 1” (2.5 cm) around bottom edge or as desired. Trim ends evenly.

materials: Bernat® Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Sc2togbl = Draw up a loop in back loop only of each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit bust measurement Extra-Small/Small/Medium 28-38" [71-96.5 cm], Large/XL/2XL 40-48" [101.5-122 cm], 3/4/5 X-Large 54-62" [137-157.5 cm]
gauge: 9 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. 8 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. FRONT: With smaller hook, ch 36 (40-44). (See diagram on page 3). 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 35 (39-43) sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 5 times more. Next row: (WS). Ch 1. *Sc2togbl over first 2 sts. 1 scbl in each of next 5 (6-7) scbl. Rep from * to last 7 sts. Turn. Leave rem 7 sts unworked. Place marker on last st of 7 unworked sts. 24 (28-32) sts. Change to larger hook. Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 dc in next st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 dc in next sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures approx 53 (59-63)" [134.5 (150-160) cm], ending on a RS row. Change to smaller hook. Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 2 scbl in first st. 1 scbl in each of next 5 (6-7) sts. *2 scbl in next st. 1 scbl in each of next 5 (6-7) sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 28 (32-36) sts. 2nd row: (RS). Ch 8. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. 35 (39-43) sts. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 5 times more. Fasten off. COLLAR: With RS facing and smaller hook, join yarn with sl st to marked first scbl of 7 unworked sts of Front. 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. 7 sts. Turn. Rep last row 7 (11-13) times more. Inc Shawl Collar: 1st row (inc row): (RS). Ch 1. 2 scbl in first sc. 1 scbl in each scbl to end of row. Turn. 2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each scbl to end of row. Turn. Rep last 4 rows 8 times more. 16 sts. Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each scbl to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from marked st measures approx 34 (39½-42)" [86.5 (100.5-106.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Dec Shawl Collar: 1st row (dec row): (RS). Ch 1. Sc2togbl. 1 scbl in each scbl to end of row. Turn. 2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each scbl to end of row. Turn. Rep last 4 rows 8 times more. 7 sts. Next row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each scbl to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 7 (11-13) times more. Fasten off. Sew last row of Collar to bottom of extended scbl section at top of Front using whipstitch. Sew straight edge of Collar to side edge of Front using whipstitch. BACK: With smaller hook, ch 69 (77-85). 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 68 (76-84) sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each scbl to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 5 times more. Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 2 scbl. *Sc2togbl. 1 scbl in each of next 6 (7-8) scbl. Rep from * to last 2 scbl. 1 scbl in each of last 2 scbl. 60 (68-74) sts. Change to larger hook. Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 dc in next st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 dc in next sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures approx 13 (14-14)" [33 (35.5-35.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. FINISHING: Center top edge of Back along bottom edge of Front. Sew in place using whipstitch. Sew side of Front ribbing to side of Back ribbing to form armhole. Rep on opposite side. (See Diagram on page 3).

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6 oz; 288 m/315 yds)
One size US P-15 (11.5 mm) crochet hook, or size to obtain gauge
One size US N-13 (9 mm) crochet hook
abbreviations: V-st = (Sc, ch 1, sc) in indicated stitch or space
gauge: In pattern, using size US P-15 (11.5 mm) hook and holding 2 strands of A and one strand of B together, 4 V-sts (12 sts) and 6 rows = 4" / 10 cm.
instructions: BACK With larger hook and 2 strands of A and one strand of B held together, chain 53 (59, 65, 71, 77, 83, 89). Row 1 (WS): (Sc, ch 1, sc) in second ch from hook (V-st made), *skip next 2 ch, (sc, ch 1, sc) in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—18 (20, 22, 24, 26, 28, 30) V-sts. Row 2 (RS): Ch 1, working in front loops only, (sc, ch 1, sc) in ch-space of each V-st across, turn. Repeat last row until piece measures 9 1/2 (10, 10, 10, 10 1/2, 10 1/2, 11)" / 24 (25.5, 25.5, 25.5, 26.5, 26.5, 28) cm from beginning; end with a RS row. Shape Arms Next Row (increase): Ch 1, working in front loops only, V-st in first sc, skip next ch-space, V-st in next sc (increase made), skip next sc, *V-st in ch-space of next V-st; repeat from * across to last V-st; V-st in next sc, skip next ch-space, V-st in last sc (increase made), turn—20 (22, 24, 26, 28, 30, 32) V-sts. Next Row: Ch 1, working in front loops only, V-st in ch-space of each V-st across, turn. Repeat last row until piece measures 19 (19 1/2, 20, 20, 20 1/2, 20 1/2, 21)" / 48.5 (49.5, 51, 51, 52, 52, 53.5) cm from beginning. Fasten off. FRONT Work as for back until piece measures 4 (4, 4 1/2, 4 1/2, 4 1/2, 4 1/2, 4 1/2)" / 10 (10, 11.5, 11.5, 11.5, 11.5, 11.5) cm above arm shaping; end with a RS row—20 (22, 24, 26, 28, 30, 32) V-sts. Shape Neck and First Shoulder Note: Work in front loops only throughout. Row 1 (WS): Ch 1, V-st in ch-space of first 9 (10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15) V-sts; leave remaining sts unworked (for neck and second shoulder), turn. Row 2: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next ch-space, V-st in ch-space of remaining V-sts across, turn—8 (9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14) V-sts and 1 sc. Row 3: Ch 1, V-st in ch-space of each V-st across, sc in last sc, turn. Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3—7 (8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13) V-sts and 1 sc. Row 6: Ch 1, skip first sc, V-st in ch-space of each V-st across—7 (8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13) V-sts. Row 7: Ch 1, working in front loops only, (sc, ch 1, sc) in ch-space of each V-st across, turn. Repeat last row until piece measures 19 (19 1/2, 20, 20, 20 1/2, 20 1/2, 21)" / 48.5 (49.5, 51, 51, 52, 52, 53.5) cm from beginning. Fasten off. Shape Neck and Second Shoulder Note: Work in front loops only throughout. Row 1: With WS facing, skip next 2 unworked V-sts following first shoulder; join 1 strand each of A and B held together with sc in ch-space of next V-st, ch 1, sc in same ch-space (first V-st made), V-st in ch-space of remaining V-sts across—9 (10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15) V-sts. Row 2: Ch 1, V-st in ch-space of each V-st across to last V-st, sc in ch-space of last V-st, turn—8 (9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14) V-sts and 1 sc. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, V-st in ch-space of each V-st across, turn. Row 4 and 5: Repeat Row 2 and 3—7 (8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13) V-sts and 1 sc. Row 6: Ch 1, V-st in ch-space of each V-st across; leave last sc unworked—7 (8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13) V-sts. Row 7: Ch 1, working in front loops only, (sc, ch 1, sc) in ch-space of each V-st across, turn. Repeat last row until piece measures 19 (19 1/2, 20, 20, 20 1/2, 20 1/2, 21)" / 48.5 (49.5, 51, 51, 52, 52, 53.5) cm from beginning. Fasten off. FINISHING With WS together, with 2 strands of A, sew or crochet shoulder seams. Beginning at lower edge, sew or crochet side seams up to beginning of arm shaping on each side. Cowl Neck Round 1: With WS facing, larger hook, and holding 1 strand each of A and B together, join yarn with sc at center back neck; work 66 sc evenly spaced around neck opening; join with slip st in first sc, turn. Round 2: Ch 1, skip first sc, V-st in next sc, *skip next 2 sc, V-st in next sc; repeat from * around to last sc, skip last sc; join with slip st in first sc, turn—22 V-sts. Round 3: Ch 1, V-st in each V-st around; join with slip st in first sc, turn. Repeat last round until cowl measure 6" / 15 cm from beginning. Fasten off. Trim With RS facing, smaller hook, and holding 2 strands of A and 1 strand of B together, join yarn with slip st at center back neck; slip st in each st around (skip the joining slip st). Repeat this process around armholes. Note: Using a smaller hook will cinch the edges of the neck and arm to create a smaller opening. Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.

materials: Caron® Colorama Bamboo Blend™ (8 oz/227 g; 396 yds/363 m)
Sizes XS/S M L Clear Sky (82008) 2 2 3 balls
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Beading needle or needle small enough to pass through bead hole.
2 packages x 1000 of 6 mm beads with hole large enough to accommodate yarn thickness.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. 3½ ch-5 sps and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern with smaller hook when slightly stretched.
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written XS/S (M-L-XL-2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes:
• Beads are threaded onto yarn before beginning; Ensure your chosen beads have a center hole that will accommodate both the yarn thickness and the beading needle.
• Beaded rows are worked on WS, as beads will naturally push through to RS.
• When working sc into top of bead, insert hook through 2 loops at top of bead.
To work Bead: Slide 1 bead to hook. Yoh and draw through loop on hook, working around bead to secure.
FRONT & BACK  (make 2 pieces alike).
Thread 340 (380 -445 -535 -605 -675 ) beads onto yarn. Note: Extra beads have been added to this calculation. Push beads down yarn length and with larger hook, ch 70 (78 -86 -94 -102 -114 ) using yarn with no beads. 
1st row: (RS). Using yarn with no beads, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 69 (77 -85 -93 -101 -113 ) sc.
Change to smaller hook and proceed as follows:
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. Bead. Ch 2. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 17 (19 -21 -23 -25 -28 ) beaded ch-sps. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 2. *1 sc in top of next bead. Ch 5. Rep from * to last bead. 1 sc in top of last bead. Ch 2. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. Bead. Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * to last (sc. Ch 2. Sc). Ch 2. Bead. Ch 2. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for pat 17 (17 -18 -20 -21 -21 ) times more. Work should measure approx 18 (18 -19 -21 -22 -22 )[ 45.5 (45.5 -48.5 -53.5 -56 -56 ) cm] when slightly stretched, ending on a 2nd row. 
Fasten off.
SLEEVES
Thread 240 (240 -272 -272 -290 -290 ) beads onto yarn. Note: Extra beads have been added to this calculation. Push beads down yarn length and with larger hook, ch 58 (58 -66 -66 -70 -70 ) using yarn with no beads. 
1st row: (RS). Using yarn with no beads, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 57 (57 -65 -65 -69 -69 ) sc.
Change to smaller hook and proceed as follows:
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. Bead. Ch 2. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 14 (14 -16 -16 -17 -17 ) beaded ch-sps. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 2. *1 sc in top of next bead. Ch 5. Rep from * to last bead. 1 sc in top of last bead. Ch 2. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
