2nd row: [Increase (Inc) row]. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 8 ( 8-9-9) times. Skip next dc. Ch 1. 1 dc (center dc) in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. (3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc Skip next 3 dc) 8 ( 8-9-9) times. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to ch-1 sp before center dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. Skip next (center) dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 18 ( 18-20-20) groups of 3-dc.

4th row: (Inc row). Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to center back ch-3 sp. [3 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc (center dc). Ch 1. 3 dc] in center back ch-3 sp. Rep from * to * to last 3 dc. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to ch-1 sp before center dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next (center) dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 20 ( 20-22-22) groups of 3-dc.

6th row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 

7th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 9 ( 9-10-10) times. Ch 3 (center back). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

8th to 13th rows: Rep 4th to 7th rows once more, then 4th and 5th rows once, having 1 more 3-dc group before center. 24 ( 24-26-26) groups of 3-dc at end of last rep.

14th row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

15th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 14th and 15th rows until Hood measures approx 10" [25.5 cm], ending on a RS row. 

Shape top of Hood: See diagram on page 6.
1st row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 10 ( 10-11-11) times. Skip next 2 groups of 3-dc. *3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 9 times. Skip next 2 groups of 3-dc. *3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. 
Fasten off, leaving a yarn tail 20" [51 cm] long for seaming. Fold top of Hood in half. Using yarn tail, sew Hood seam, being sure to keep edges flat.

SLEEVE CUFFS
See diagram on page 5.
With RS facing, join corresponding color to keep cont of Stripe Pat with sl st in sp between 2 groups of 3-dc (in last sp between 2 groups of 3-dc before shoulder seam) on last row at bottom of Sleeve.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as sl st. * Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.

2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.

Rep last rnd until Sleeve from underarm measures 17" [43 cm]. Fasten off.

Rep for 2nd Sleeve.

BOTTOM HEM
See diagram on page 5.
With RS facing, join corresponding color to keep cont of Stripe Pat with sl st in corner ch-2 sp at bottom of Left Front. 
1st row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same ch-2 sp as sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * along bottom edge to ch-2 corner sp at bottom right front, taking note that at center back seam, 3 dc in last ch-2 sp of left side. 3 dc in next ch-2 corner sp of right side. 3 dc in bottom right front ch-2 corner sp. Turn.

2nd row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

3rd row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ch-1 sp. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Turn.

4th and 5th rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows.

Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of stitch at back of work, inserting hook from left to right. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: To fit bust/chest measurement: 6 mos 17" [43 cm], 12 mos 18" [45.5 cm]; Finished chest measurement: 6 mos 19½" [49.5 cm], 12 mos 21½" [54.5 cm]
gauge: 16 dc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pat. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd counts as dc. Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch 2.

With A, beg at neck edge, ch 56 (60) loosely. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 7 (8) ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc – V st made) in next ch. 1 dc in next 10 ch. V st in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 16 (18) ch. V st in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 10 ch. V st in next ch. 1 dc each of last 8 (9) ch. Join. 60 (64) dc and 4 ch-1 sps.

2nd to 9th (10th) rnds: Ch 2. (1 dc in each dc to ch-1 sp of next V st. V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 4 times. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join. 124 (136) dc and 4 ch-1 sps at end of 9th (10th) rnd.

Divide Sleeves and Body: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in next 16 (18) dc. 1 dc in ch-1 sp of next V st. Ch 3 for underarm. Skip next 28 (30) dc. 1 dc in ch-1 sp of next V st. 1 dc in each of next 34 (38) dc. 1 dc in ch-1 sp of next V st. Ch 3 for underarm. Skip next 28 (30) dc. 1 dc in ch-1 sp of next V st. 1 dc in last 17 (19) dc. Join.

Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each dc or ch around. Join. 72 (80) dc. 
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each dc around. Join. 
Rep last rnd until work from underarm measures 3 (4)" [7.5 (10) cm]. Break A. Join B and work 3 rnds even.

Next 5 rnds: Ch 2. *Dcbp around next st. Dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. Dcbp around last st. Join. Fasten off at end of 5th rnd.

Sleeves: 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st to center of underarm ch. Ch 2. 1 dc in each ch or dc around. 29 (31) dc. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join. 
Rep last rnd until work from underarm measures 3 (4)" [7.5 (10) cm]. Break A.
Join B and work 2 rnds even. 
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in next 15 dc. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join. 28 (30) dc.
Work from ** to ** as given above.

Neck edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st in center back. Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each rem ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Unforgettable™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 270 yds/247 m)
Size U.S. J/10 [6 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcbp made
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Finished chest measurement - S 36" [ 91.5 cm], M 40" [ 101.5 cm], L 44" [ 112 cm], 1XL 48" [ 122 cm], 2XL 52" [ 132 cm], 3XL 56" [ 142 cm]
gauge: 15 dc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in dc/sc pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for size S. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written S (M-L-1XL-2XL-3XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the Pat. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes: -
• Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as stitch.
• Sweater is made with front, back, and sleeves sewn together and allows for 4" [10 cm]of ease.
• Placing a stitch marker to indicate RS of the work is helpful
Pat Stitches
Body Pat
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep Rows 1 and 2 for Body Pat.
SWEATER
Back Ribbing
Ch 70 ( 77-85-92-100-107). Sizes S, 1X, and 2X only:
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (beg ch count as first dc) and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 68 ( 90-98) dc. 
Rows 2–4: Ch 2 ( does not count as st). 1 dc in first st. 1 dcbp around next st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
Sizes M, L, and 3XL only:
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (beg ch count as first dc) and in each ch to end of row. Turn. (75-83-105) dc. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
All sizes: Body Work even in Body Pat until back measures 14 ( 14½-15-16-16½-17)" [35.5 ( 37-38-40.5-42-43) cm] from lower edge ending with a Row 2. Place markers on each end of last row. 
Armhole Shaping
1st row: (RS). Slip st in first 4 ( 5-6-6-6-7) sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 4 ( 5-6-6-6-7) sts. Turn. Leave last 4 ( 5-6-6-6-7) sts unworked. 60 ( 65-71-78-86-91) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each st to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 58 ( 63-69-76-84-89) sts.
Sizes S and L only:
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each st to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn.
Rep Rows 3 and 4 0 ( 2) time(s) more. 56 ( 63) sts.
Size M only:
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 61 sts.
4th row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 60 sts.
Size 1X only:
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 74 sts.
4th row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each st to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 72 sts.
Rep last 2 rows once more. 68 sts.
Sizes 2X only:
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 82 sts.
4th row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each st to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 80 sts.
Rep last 2 rows once more. 76 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 75 sts.
Sizes 3X only:
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 87 sts.
4th row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each st to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 85 sts.
5th row: As 3rd row. 83 sts.
All sizes: Work even in Body Pat until armhole measures 6½ ( 7-7½-7½-8-8½)" [15.5 ( 18-19-19-20.5-21.5) cm] ending on “sc" row.
Left Neck Shaping
1st row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 15 ( 17-18-19-22-24) sts. Dc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 16 ( 18-19-20-23-25) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Right Neck Shaping
1st row: With WS facing, skip next 22 ( 22-23-26-27-31) sts. Join yarn in next st. Ch 2. Dc2tog over same st as join and next st. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 16 ( 18-19-20-23-25) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
FRONT
Work same as Back until armhole measures 4½ ( 5-5½-5½-6-6½)" [ 11.5 ( 12.5-14-14-15-16.5) cm] ending on “sc" row.
Right Neck Shaping
1st row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 19 ( 21-22-23-27-29) sts. Dc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 20 ( 22-23-24-28-30) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 19 ( 21-22-23-27-29) sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 18 ( 20-21-22-26-28) sts.
4th and 5th rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows. 16 ( 18-19-20-24-26) sts.
Sizes S, M, L and 1X only:
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Sizes 2X and 3X only:
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. (23- 25) sts.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Left Neck Shaping
1st row: With WS facing, skip next 14 ( 14-15-18-17-21) sts. Join yarn in next st. Ch 1. Dc2tog over same st as join and next st. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 20 ( 22-23-24-28-30) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 19 ( 21-22-23-27-29) sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 18 ( 20-21-22-26-28) sts.
4th and 5th rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows. 16 ( 18-19-20-24-26) sts.
Sizes S, M, L and 1X only:
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Sizes 2X and 3X only:
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. (23- 25) sts.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
SLEEVES
Ribbing
Ch 44 ( 48-50-54-56-58). 
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (beg ch count as first dc) and in each ch to end of row. Turn. 42 ( 46-48-52-54-56) sts. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. 1 dcbp around next st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
Body of Sleeve
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: As 1st row.
Last 2 rows form dc/sc Body Pat.
Size S and 1X only:
4th and 5th rows: As 2nd and 1st rows.
6th row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. 44 ( 54) sts. 
Rep 1st to 6th rows 6 ( 5) times more. 56 ( 64) sts.
Size M only: 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each st to end of row.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. 48 sts.
6th to 9th rows: Work even in Body Pat.
10th row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. 50 sts.
11th to 14th rows: Work even in Body Pat.
15th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. 52 sts.
16th to 20th rows: Work even in Body Pat.
21st row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. 54 sts.
22nd to 36th rows: As 15th to 20th rows 3 times more. 60 sts.
Size L only:
4th row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. 50 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
7th row: As 5th row.
8th row: As 4th row.
9th to 16th rows: As 4th to 8th rows twice more. 56 sts.
17th to 20th rows: Work even in Body Pat.
21st row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. 58 sts.
22nd to 25th rows: Work even in Body Pat.
26th row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. 60 sts. 
27th to 36th rows: As 17th to 26th rows once more. 64 sts.
Size 2X only:
4th row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. 56 sts.
5th to 6th rows: As 1st and 2nd rows. 
7th row: As 1st row. 
8th row: As 4th row. 58 sts.
9th to 12th rows: Work even in Body Pat. 
13th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. 60 sts. 
14th to 17th rows: Work even in Body Pat.
18th row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. 62 sts.
19th to 28th rows: As 9th to 18th rows. 66 sts.
29th to 33rd rows: As 9th to 13th rows. 68 sts.
Size 3X only:
4th row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. 58 sts.
5th to 6th rows: As 1st and 2nd rows. 
7th row: As 1st row. 
8th row: As 4th row. 
9th to 28th rows: Rep 5th to 8th rows 5 times more. 70 sts.
29th to 32nd rows: Work even in Body Pat.
33rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. 72 sts.
All sizes:
Work even in Body Pat as needed until sleeve measures 15 ( 14-13-13-12-12)" [38 ( 35.5-33-33-30.5-30.5) cm] from lower edge. Place markers on each end of last row. Continue in Body Pat until sleeve, from lower edge, measures 16 ( 15¼ -14½ -14½ -13¾ -14 )" [ 40.5 ( 38.5-37-37-35-35.5) cm], ending with “sc" row.
Sleeve Cap Shaping
1st row: (WS). Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each st to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 54 ( 58-62-62-66-70) sts.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 ( 2-3-2-2-2) time(s), then 1st row 0 ( 0-0-1-1-1) time(s) more. 52 ( 54-56-56-60-64) sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. 
Neckband
1st rnd: With RS facing, join yarn with slip st in left shoulder seam. Ch 1. 12 dc down left front neck edge, evenly spacing sts. Work 14 ( 14-15-18-17-20) dc across front neck edge. 12 dc up right front neckedge. Work 30 ( 30-31-34-35-38) dc across back neck edge. Join with sl st in first dc. 68 ( 68-70-76-76-82) dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. 1 dcbp around next st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
Fold sleeve in half and place marker on fold line at top of sleeve. Align top marker with shoulder seam, match sleeve markers with markers on ends of rows of bodies, and pin in place. Sew sleeve to back and front. Sew side and sleeve seams. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Shimmer®: 5 (5, 6, 7, 8) balls of 1810 Royal
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.5mm [US K-10.5] and 8mm [US L-11]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: With larger hook, 9 sts and 5 rows in pattern = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hooks to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BACK
With larger hook, ch 45 (47, 49, 53, 59).
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from the hook, *dc in next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch, dc in last ch; turn – 44 (46, 48, 52, 58) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *dc in next sc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across to last sc, dc in last sc; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until back measures 13 (13, 13½, 14, 14)” (33 [33, 34.5, 35.5, 35.5] cm) ending with a WS row.
Shape Armholes
Row 1: Slip st in first 4 sts, ch 1, *sc in next dc, dc in next sc; repeat from * across to last 4 sts; turn, leaving remaining sts unworked – 36 (38, 40, 44, 50) sts.
Row 2 (decrease row): Ch 1, sc in first dc, BPdc in next st, dec 1 st, work in pattern across to last 4 sts, dec 1 st, BPdc in next dc, dc in last sc; turn – 34 (36, 38, 42, 48) sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first dc, FPdc in next st, work in pattern across to last 2 sts, FPdc in next st, dc in last sc; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first dc, BPdc in next st, work in pattern across to last 2 sts, BPdc in next st, dc in last sc; turn.
Dec 1 st at each end of next row and every 3rd row 3 (3, 3, 3, 0) times; then dec 1 st at each end of every other row 3 (4, 5, 5, 12) times – 20 (20, 20, 24, 24) sts at end of last row.
Work even on 20 (20, 20, 24, 24) sts until armhole measures 9½ (10, 10½, 11, 12)” (24 [25.5, 26.5, 28, 30.5] cm) from beginning. 
Fasten off.

FRONT
Work same as Back until Armhole measures 7½ (8, 8½, 9, 10)” (19 [20.5, 21.5, 23, 25.5] cm) from beginning.
Shape First Neck
Continue to work decreases for armholes same as Back, AT THE SAME TIME, work neck shaping as follows:
Row 1: Work in established pattern across first 9 (11, 13, 13, 15) sts; turn, leaving remaining sts unworked.
Maintaining decrease pattern at armholes, dec 1 st at neck edge every row for 5 rows. 
Fasten off.

Shape Second Neck
Row 1: Count 9 (11, 13, 13, 15) sts from left edge, and rejoin yarn in st, ch 1, work in pattern across; turn – 9 (11, 13, 13, 15) sts.
Maintaining decrease pattern at armholes, dec 1 st at neck edge every row for 5 rows. 
Fasten off.

SLEEVE (make 2)
With larger hook, ch 25 (25, 25, 27, 27).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *dc in next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch, dc in last ch; turn – 24 (24, 24, 26, 26) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *dc in next sc, sc in next dc; rep from * across to last sc, dc in last sc; turn.
Row 3 (increase row): Ch 1, 2 sc in first dc, work in pattern across to last sc, 2 dc in last sc; turn – 26 (26, 26, 28, 28) sts.
Note: Simply work a dc in sc and sc in dc when increasing, this may mean that sometimes you will have 2 sc or 2 dc next to each other, these will disappear in the seam. Once the next increase is made the pattern will resume its alternating pattern of sc, dc, sc, dc, etc.
Work in pattern, increasing 1 st at each end of every 5 (5, 5, 5, 3) rows until 36 (36, 38, 40, 50) sts are on work.
Work even on 36 (36, 38, 40, 50) sts until Sleeve measures 15 (15, 16, 16½, 17)” (38 [38, 40.5, 42, 43] cm) from beginning.
Shape Cap
Row 1: Slip st in first 4 sts, ch 1, work in pattern across to last 4 sts; turn, leaving remaining sts unworked – 28 (28, 30, 32, 42) sts.
Row 2 (decrease row): Ch 1, sc in first dc, dec 1 st, work in pattern across to last 3 sts, dec 1 st, sc in last st; turn – 26 (26, 28, 30, 40) sts.
Dec 1 st at each end of every other row until 8 (8, 10, 10, 12) sts are on work. Work even on 8 (8, 10, 10, 12) sts until cap measures 9½ (10, 10½, 11, 12)” (24 [25.5, 26.5, 28, 30.5] cm) from beginning. Fasten off.
Sew Front to Back across shoulders. Sew Sleeves in armhole openings.
Neck Edging
Try on sweater. There are two ways to finish the neck. To wear off the shoulder in more of a boat neck look, simply follow instructions without decreasing. All decreases (if you are using) will happen at the top of the shoulder.
Round 1: With right side facing and smaller hook, join yarn at left shoulder seam, ch 1, working in row-end sts of neck shaping, [sc2tog over next 2 sts] 4 (4, 5, 5, 6) times, working back loops only of center sts, sc in each st across to neck shaping, [sc2tog over next 2 sts] 4 (4, 5, 5, 6) times evenly working in end of rows sc down neck sts, working back loops only, sc in back loop only of each st across to shoulder; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2-3: Working in back loop only, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Bottom Edging
Round 1: With right side facing and smaller hook, working across opposite side of foundation ch on bottom edge of sweater, join yarn with a slip st in first ch to the left of one side seam, ch 1, sc in ch at base of each sc, FPdc around the post of each dc in Row 1, around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc, FPdc around the post of each FPdc; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Sleeve Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, and smaller hook, working across opposite side of foundation ch on cuff edge of Sleeve, join yarn with a slip st in first ch to the left of one seam, ch 1, sc in ch at base of each sc, FPdc around the post of each dc in Row 1, around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc, FPdc around the post of each FPdc; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends. Block lightly.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m)
Bernat® Pipsqueak™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 101 yds/92 m)
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit dog chest measurement: 11 (16-20)" [28 (40.5-51) cm]
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook and Bernat® Super Value™.
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. COAT Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. With larger hook and D, ch 18 (24-30). Beg at Back: 1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 (22-28) hdc. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 18 (24-30) hdc. Rep last row 6 (9-11) times more. 30 (42-52) hdc. Next 5 rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Place marker at each end of last row. Cont even until work from beg measures 9 (14-17)" [23 (35.5-43) cm]. Place marker at each end of last row. Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 28 (40-50) sts. Rep last row 4 times more. 20 (32-44) sts. Fasten off. Belly Band: With larger hook and RS facing, join D with sl st to left side edge of Coat 1½ (2-2½)" [4 (5-6) cm] down from first marked row. 1st row: Ch 1. Work 19 (21-23) sc across to 2nd marked row. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until Belly Band measures approx 4 (4½-5)" [10 (11.5-12.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Buttonhole row: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 1 (2-3) sc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * once more. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 1 (2-3) sc. Turn. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across, working 3 sc in each ch-3 sp. Turn. 19 (21-23) sc. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Fasten off. Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes on right side edge of Coat. Neckband: With larger hook and D, ch 10. 1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 hdc. 2nd row: Ch 2. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS) in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until Neckband measures approx 8 (12-15)" [20.5 (30.5-38) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a WS row. Buttonhole: Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of first 3 hdc. Skip next 2 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 3 hdc. Turn. Next row: Ch 1. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of first 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 3 hdc. Fasten off. Sew Neckband to neck edge of Coat, lining up edge of Neckband with edge of Coat. ICE CREAM SCOOPS (make 1 each in A, B and C) With smaller hook, ch 2. 1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc. 7th and 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Sizes M and L only: 9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc. 10th and 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Size L only: 12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc. 13th and 14th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. All sizes: Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working in front loops only, 3 dc in first sc. *4 dc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off. ICE CREAM WHIP CREAM (make 3) With larger hook and F, ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring. 1st rnd: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 24 tr in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 4. Fasten off. CHERRY (make 3) With D and larger hook, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. 3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sts. Stuff Cherry. Break yarn, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely. BANANAS (make 2) With smaller hook and E, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. 4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. 7th and 8th rnds: As 4th and 5th rnds. 9th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 10th and 11th rnds: As 4th and 5th rnds. 12th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc. 13th and 14th rnds: As 4th and 5th rnds. 15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 35 sc. 16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until piece measures approx 8 (12-16)" [20.5 (30.5-40.5) cm]. Beg decs: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts. 2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 24 sts. 5th and 6th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds. 7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 18 sts. Cont as follows, stuffing Banana as you work: 8th and 9th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds. 10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 12 sts. 11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.

materials: Bernat® Bundle Up™ (4.9 oz/140 g; 267 yds/244 m)
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 6 mos 17" [43 cm], 12 mos 18" [45.5 cm], 18 mos 19" [48 cm], 24 mos 20" [51 cm]. Finished chest measurement: 6 mos 19½" [49.5 cm], 12 mos 21½" [54.5 cm], 18 mos 23½" [59.5 cm], 24 mos 25½" [65 cm].
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. 
Notes: 
• Sweater is worked in one piece from neck edge down.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. 
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc. 
• To change colors, work to last loops on hook of stitch. Draw new color through last loops and proceed with new color. 
• Larger hook used for foundation chain only to ensure neck opening is not tight.

With A and larger hook, beg at neck edge, ch 56 ( 60-64-68) loosely (foundation ch needs to pull over baby’s head). Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
Change to smaller hook and proceed as follows:

1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join C with sl st to first sc. 
3rd rnd: With C, as 2nd rnd. Join D with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: With D, as 2nd rnd. Join MC at end of rnd. Break A, B, C and D.

With MC only, proceed for Yoke as follows:

1st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 7 ( 8-9-10) ch. ( 1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc – V-st made) in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 10 ch. V-st in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 16 ( 18-20-22) ch. V-st in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 10 ch. V-st in next ch. 1 dc in each of last 8 ( 9-10-11) ch. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.

2nd rnd: Ch 3. *1 dc in each dc to ch-1 sp of next V-st. V-st in ch-1 sp of next V-st. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
Rep last rnd 7 ( 8-9-10) times more. 124 ( 136-148-160) dc and 4 ch-1 sps at end of last rnd.

Divide Sleeves and Body:
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 17( 19-21-23) dc. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of next V-st. Ch 3 for underarm. Skip next 28 ( 30-32-34) dc. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of next V-st. 1 hdc in each of next 34 ( 38-42-46) dc. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of next V-st. Ch 3 for underarm. Skip next 28 ( 30-32-34) dc. 1 hdc in ch-1 sp of next V-st. 1 hdc in each of last 17( 19-21-23) hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc.

2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc or ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 78 ( 86-94-102) hdc.

3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep last rnd until work from underarm measures 6½ ( 7½-8-8½)" [ 16.5 ( 19-20.5-21.5) cm]. Join A at end of last rnd. Break MC.

Ribbing:
1st rnd:  With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each hdc around. Join B with sl st to first sc at end of 2nd rnd.
2nd rnd:  With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join C with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: With C, as 2nd rnd.
4th rnd: With D, as 2nd rnd. Fasten off.

SLEEVES
1st rnd: (RS). Join MC with sl st to center of underarm ch. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch or dc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 31 ( 33-35-37) hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep last rnd until work from dividing rnd measures 2½ ( 3-3-4)" [ 6.5 ( 7.5- 7.5-10) cm].

Proceed in Stripe Pat:
1st and 2nd rnds:  With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join B with sl st to first sc at end of 2nd rnd.
3rd and 4th rnds:  With B, as 1st and 2nd rnds.
5th and 6th rnds:  With C, as 1st and 2nd rnds.
7th and 8th rnds:  With D, as 1st and 2nd rnds. Join MC at end of last rnd.

Next rnd: With MC, ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep last rnd until work from underarm chain measures 6½ ( 7½-8-8½)" [ 16.5 ( 19-20.5-21.5) cm].

Ribbing:
1st rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd once more. Fasten off.

Saturn Applique:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Circle: With C and smaller hook, ch 2.

1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 8 times. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. Join. 56 sc. Fasten off. 
Position Circle on center front as shown in picture and sew in position. 
Using Chain St and 2 strands of yarn, embroider Saturn ‘rings’ as shown in picture in the following color sequence: A. B. MC. D.
With single strand of C, using straight st, embroider “Stars” randomly on front. Use picture as reference.

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6. oz;288 m/315 yds)
Main Color (MC) Dark Country Blue (9711): 1 (6 mos), 2 (12 mos), 2 (18 mos), 2 (2 yrs), 3 (4 yrs)
Contrast Color (CC) White (9701): 1 (6 mos), 1 (12 mos), 1 (18 mos), 1 (2 yrs), 2 (4 yrs)
gauge: 15 hdc and 10 rows = 4"/10 cm
instructions:
2hdctog: yo, insert hook, pull up loop in first stitch, yo, insert hook, pull up loop in next stitch, yo, pull through all loops (1 stitch decreased).

PATTERN STITCH Half Double Crochet Ridges:
Right Side rows: Ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc), hdc in each st across, working through back loops only, turn.
Wrong Side rows: Ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc), hdc in each st across, working through front loops only, turn.

BACK:
Using MC, ch 43 (47, 51, 55, 59). Foundation row: Hdc into 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—41 (45, 49, 53, 57) sts. Work even in Half Double Crochet Ridges until body measures 6 1/2 (7, 7 1/2, 8, 8 1/2)"/16.5 (18, 19, 20.5, 21.5) cm. Place markers in each edge for sleeve placement. Continue to work even until Back measures 11 (12, 13, 14, 15)"/28 (30.5, 33, 35.5, 38) cm, ending after a WS row. Fasten off.

FRONT:
Work same as Back until sleeve placement. Place markers in each edge for sleeve placement, ending after a WS row.

Shape left front neck:
Row 1 (RS): Work in pattern across 18 (20, 22, 24, 26) sts, hdc2tog over next 2 sts, turn leaving remaining sts unworked (1 st decreased at neck edge).
Row 2 (WS): Ch 2, skip first st, work in pattern across (1 st decreased at neck edge), turn.
Row 3 (RS): Work in pattern across until 2 sts remain, hdc2tog over next 2 sts, turn (1 st decreased at neck edge).
Repeat last 2 rows until a total of 10 (10, 11, 11, 12) decreases have been worked and 10 (12, 13, 15, 16) sts remain. Work even in pattern until left front measures same as Back to shoulders, ending with a WS row. Fasten off.

Shape right front neck:
Row 1 (RS): Join yarn to center front, ch 2, skip 1 st, work in pattern across, turn (1 st decreased at neck edge).
Row 2 (WS): Work in pattern until 2 sts remain, hdc2tog over next 2 sts, turn (1 st decreased at neck edge).
Row 3 (RS): Ch 2, skip first st, work in pattern across (1 st decreased at neck edge), turn.
Repeat last 2 rows until a total of 10 (10, 11, 11, 12) decreases have been worked and 10 (12, 13, 15, 16) sts remain. Work even in pattern until right front measures same as Back to shoulders, ending with a WS row. Fasten off.

Shoulder join:
Holding Back and Front, with right sides together, sl st across 10 (12, 13, 15, 16) sts for each shoulder.

SLEEVES:
With right side facing, join yarn to sleeve placement marker, work 36 (40, 44, 48, 52) hdc across to matching marker. Work even in pattern until Sleeve measures 2 (3, 3, 4, 4)"/5 (7.5, 7.5, 10, 10) cm, ending with a WS row. Fasten off.

FINISHING:
Sew side and Sleeve seams.

Collar:
Note: Collar is worked using short rows. An initial row of sc is worked around the neck, then short rows form the shaping of a wider collar in back than in front.
With RS facing, join CC to right shoulder at neck edge. Row 1: Sc across 20 (20, 22, 22, 24) back sts, 18 (20, 22, 22, 24) sc along left front and 18 (20, 22, 22, 24) sc along right front—56 (60, 66, 66, 72) sts. Do not turn.
Row 2: Sc thru front loop across back 20 (20, 22, 22, 24) sts, sl st thru front loop into each of next 4 (5, 5, 5, 6) sts, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sl st in each of next 2 sts, sc in each of next 22 (23, 25, 25, 28) sts, sl st thru back loop into each of next 4 (5, 5, 5, 6) sts, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sl st in each of next 2 sts, sc in each of next 26 (28, 30, 30, 34) sts, sl st thru front loop into each of next 4 (5, 5, 5, 6) sts, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sl st in each of next 2 sts, sc in each of next 30 (33, 35, 35, 40) sts, sl st thru back loop into each of next 4 (5, 5, 5, 6) sts, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sl st in each of next 2 sts, sc in each of next 34 (38, 40, 40, 46) sts, sl st thru front loop into each of next 4 (5, 5, 5, 6) sts, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sl st in each of next 2 sts, sc in each of next 38 (43, 45, 45, 52) sts, sl st thru back loop into each of next 4 (5, 5, 5, 6) sts, turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, sl st in each of next 2 sts, sc in each of next 42 (48, 50, 50, 58) sts, sl st thru front loop into each of next 6 (5, 7, 7, 6) sts, turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, sl st in each of next 2 sts, sc in each of next 48 (53, 57, 57, 64) sts, sl st thru back loop into each of next 6 (5, 7, 7, 6) sts, turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, sl st in each of next 2 sts, sc in each of next 54 (58, 64, 64, 70) sts, turn.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 12-15: Repeat last row 4 times. Fasten off.

Tie:
Using CC, ch 7.
Row 1: Hdc into 3rd ch from hook and in each of next 4 chs, turn—6 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Repeat last row until tie measures 20"/51 cm. Fasten off. Tie in a bow and sew to bottom of V-neck. Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.

materials: Caron® Angel Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 14 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes, the instructions are written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Border: Ch 70 (78-86-94-106-120).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 69 (77-85-93-105-119) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more, ending on a WS row.
Proceed in Mesh Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 1 dc in next sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last row for Mesh Pat until work from beg measures 13 (13-13-14-14-14)" [33 (33-33-35.5-35.5-35.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Shape armholes: PM 9 (11-13-15-19-21) sts in from either side edge – this should be a ‘ch-1 sp’. 51 (55-59-63-67-77) sts between markers.
1st row:  (RS). Join with sl st to marked ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to marked ch-1 sp. 1 dc in ch-1 sp. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last row until armholes measure 7½ (8-8-8½ -9-10)" [19 (20.5-20.5-21.5-23-25.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

RIGHT FRONT
**Border: Ch 30 (34-36-40-46-52).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 29 (33-35-39-45-51) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more, ending on a WS row.
Proceed in Mesh Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in next sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.**
Rep last row for Mesh Pat until work from beg measures 13 (13-13-14-14-14)" [33 (33-33-35.5-35.5-35.5) cm], ending on a WS row.**
Shape armhole: PM 9 (11-13-15-19-23) sts in from left side edge – this should be a ‘ch-1 sp’. 1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to marked ch-1 sp. 1 dc in ch-1 sp. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 21 (23-23-25-27-29) sts.
2nd row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last row until armhole measures 7½ (8-8-8½-9-10)" [19 (20.5-20.5-21.5-23-25.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

LEFT FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Front.
Shape armhole: 1st row:  (RS). Skip first 8 (10-12-14-18-22) sts. Join yarn with sl st to next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 21 (23-23-25-27-29) sts.
2nd row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last row until Armhole measures 7½ (8-8-8½-9-10)" [19 (20.5-20.5-21.5-23-25.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

SLEEVES 
Ch 54 (58-58-62-64-72).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 53 (57-57-61-63-71) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more.  
Proceed in Mesh Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in next sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last row for Mesh Pat until work from beg measures 4 (5-5-6-7-8)" [10 (12.5-12.5-15-18-20.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. 
PM on side edges of Sleeves 2¼ (3¼-3½-4-5-6)" [5.5 (8.5-9-10-12.5-15) cm] down from top edge.

FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Sew in sleeves placing rows above markers along unworked sts of armholes on body pieces to form square armholes. Sew side and sleeve seams.
Edging
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom right corner. 
1st row: Ch 1. Work 60 (62-62-66-68-70) sc evenly up Right Front, 10 (10-14-14-14-20) sc along Back neck and 60 (62-62-66-68-70) sc evenly down Left Front. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
Rep last row 4 times more. Fasten off.

pattern_name: TAKE IT FROM THE TOP PULLOVER
materials: Bernat® Baby Sport™ (12.3 oz/350 g; 1256 yds/1148 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Beg Puff st = Ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop) twice in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 4 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through rem 2 loops on hook.
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Puff st = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through rem 2 loops on hook.
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 6 mos 17" [43 cm], 12 mos 18" [45.5 cm], 18 mos 19" [48 cm], 24 mos 20" [51 cm]. Finished chest: 6 mos 19" [48 cm], 12 mos 20½" [52 cm], 18 mos 22½" [57 cm], 24 mos 24" [61 cm]
gauge: 16 hdc and 13 rows= 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.
Note: Pullover is worked in one piece from neck edge down. Garment bodice section is worked in rows from neck edge to end of raglan shaping, then body section is worked in rounds. Sleeves are worked in rounds with turns at the end of each round to maintain same pat as bodice section.
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
Bodice Section: Beg at neck edge, with MC, ch 50 (52-56-58). 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 8 (9-10-10) ch. 3 hdc in next ch and PM on center hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 ch. 3 hdc in next ch and PM on center hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 14 (14-16-18) ch. 3 hdc in next ch and PM on center hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 3 hdc in next ch and PM on center hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 9 (10-11-11) ch. Turn.  56 (58-62-64) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each hdc to marked hdc. 3 hdc in marked hdc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 8 hdc increased. 64 (66-70-72) hdc.
Rep last row 7 (8-9-10) times more. 120 (130-142-152) hdc.
Divide for Body: Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 18 (20-22-23) hdc. Ch 5. Skip next 26 (28-30-32) hdc (Sleeve). 1 hdc in each of next 32 (34-38-42) hdc. Ch 5. Skip next 26 (28-30-32) hdc (Sleeve). 1 hdc in each of last 18 (20-22-23) hdc . 78 (84-92-98) sts for Body. Fasten off.
PM on Fronts in 2nd hdc from each end of last row. Overlap Right Front over Left Front at markers and pin in position.
Proceed in Body Pat as follows:
1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st in center ch of ch-5 of left armhole. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each hdc or ch around, working through both thicknesses across 2 hdc at center front. Join with sl st to first sc. 76 (82-90-96) sc.
2nd rnd: Beg puff st in first st. *Ch 1. Skip next st. Puff st in next st. Rep from * to last st. Ch 1. Skip last st. Join B with sl st in top of beg puff st.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Working around ch-1 from previous rnd, 1 dc in next skipped st. 1 sc in next puff st. Rep from * to last st. Working around ch-1 from previous rnd, 1 dc in last skipped st. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join MC with sl st to first hdc.
5th rnd: With MC, as 2nd rnd, joining A at end of rnd.
6th and 7th rnds: With A, as 3rd and 4th rnds, joining B at end of 7th rnd.
8th rnd: With B, as 2nd rnd, joining MC at end of rnd.
9th and 10th rnds: With MC, as 3rd and 4th rnds, joining A at end of 10th rnd.
11th rnd: With A, as 2nd rnd.
Rep 3rd to 11th rnds for pat until Body from armhole joining rnd measures approx 6½ (7-9-10) [16.5 (18-23-25.5) cm], ending on a 3rd, 6th or 9th rnd of pat. Fasten off.
SLEEVES
1st rnd: With RS (WS-RS-WS) facing, join MC with sl st in rem loop of center ch of ch-5 of armhole. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 26 (28-30-32) hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 ch. Join with sl st to first hdc. 31 (33-35-37) hdc. Turn.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Rep last rnd 3 (4-4-5) times more.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. Turn.
Next 4 (5-5-6) rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. Turn. 27 (29-31-33) hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Rep last rnd until Sleeve from armhole joining rnd measures 6½ (7-8-9½) [16.5 (18-20.5-24.5) cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Left Front edging: 1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st at corner of neck edge at foundation ch. Ch 1. Work 17 (19-21-23) sc evenly down left front opening. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Right Front edging: 1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st at base of neck edge before Body. Ch 1. Work 17 (19-21-23) sc evenly up right front opening. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 3. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 (5-6-7) sc. Rep from * once more. Ch 3. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off.
Neck edging: 1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st at corner of right front neck edge at foundation ch. Ch 1. Work sc evenly across neck edge to opposite corner. Do not turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew buttons in position to correspond to button loops.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn™”: 1 (2, 2) Balls No. 4614 Black CA
and No. 3729 Grape CJ [solid colors – 5 oz (140 g), 256 yd (234 m); print colors – 4 oz (113 g), 204 yd (187 m)].
abbreviations: CA, CB, etc = Color A, Color B, etc
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: To Fit Chest: 19 (23, 28)”. To Fit Neck: 16 (18, 20)”. To Fit Length: 10 (12, 16)”.
gauge: Square = 4.5” x 4.5”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BASIC GRANNY SQUARE (See color sequence below):
Ch 6; join with a sl st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), [3 dc in ring, ch 2] 3 times, 2 dc in ring; join with a sl st in 3rd ch of ch-5. Fasten off.
Rnd 2: Join yarn in any ch-2 sp; ch 5, 3 dc in same sp, [ch 1, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in next sp] 3 times, ch 1, 2 dc in beg sp; join. Fasten off.
Rnd 3: Join yarn in any ch-2 sp; ch 5, 3 dc in same sp, *ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 sp, ch 1 **, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in corner ch-2 sp; rep from * around, end at **; 2 dc in beg sp; join. Fasten off.
Rnd 4: Join yarn in any ch-2 sp; ch 5, 3 dc in same sp, *[ch 1, 3 dc in next sp] twice, ch 1 **, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in corner ch-2 sp; rep from * around, end at **; 2 dc in beg sp; join. Fasten off.
Make 2 (3, 4) squares in the following color sequence:
Rnd 1: CB; Rnd 2: CC; Rnd 3: CD; Rnd 4: CA.
Make 2 (3, 4) squares in the following color sequence:
Rnd 1: CE; Rnd 2: CF; Rnd 3: CG; Rnd 4: CA.
Make 2 (3, 4) squares in the following color sequence:
Rnd 1: CH; Rnd 2: CI; Rnd 3: CJ; Rnd 4: CA.
BODY: Sew 6 (9, 12) squares together. Weave in ends.
Neck: Sew one square on each side of body. Make a chain 20 (25, 30)” long and weave in and out of granny squares for neck closure.
CHEST PANEL-Size Small: Make 1 square in colors of your choice.
Row 5: Join yarn in any corner sp; ch 3, 2 dc in same sp, [ch 1, 3 dc in ch-1 sp] 3 times, ch 1, 3 dc in next corner sp. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
CHEST PANEL-Sizes Medium and Large: Make 1 square in colors of your choice.
Rnd 5: Join yarn in any ch-2 sp; ch 5, 3 dc in same sp, [ch 1, 3 dc in next sp] 3 times, ch 1 **, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in next corner sp; rep from * around, end at **; 2 dc in beg sp; join. Fasten off.
Rnd 6: Join yarn in any ch-2 sp; ch 5, 3 dc in same sp, [ch 1, 3 dc in next sp] 4 times, ch 1 **, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in next corner sp; rep from * around, end at **; 2 dc in beg sp; join. Fasten off.
Row 7: Join yarn in any ch-2 sp; ch 3, 2 dc in same sp, [ch 1, 3 dc in ch-1 sp] 5 times, ch 1, 3 dc in next corner sp. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FINISHING: Sew the chest panel to both sides of the body. Sew on one button at the neck for closure, using a ch-1 sp as the buttonhole. Weave in ends.
RED HEART® “Super Saver®”, Art. E300 (7 oz solid color and 5 oz prints, multis, fleck skeins).

materials: Yarn: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Tools: Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 12 single crochet (sc) and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S size. If changes are necessary, the instructions will be written XS/S (M/L-XL-2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.

NOTE
• To change colors at end of rows, work until last 2 loops are left on hook when working final dc. Yarn over hook (yoh) with new color through those last 2 loops and proceed.

DETERMINING YOUR SIZE
Click here to learn how to take proper measurements for the best fit.

MEASUREMENTS
SIZES XS/S M L
TO FIT CHEST
28-34" [71-86.5 cm]
36-38" [91.5-96.5 cm]
40-42" [101.5-106.5 cm]
FINISHED CHEST
40" [101.5 cm]
42" [106.5 cm]
46" [117 cm]
SIZES XL 2/3XL 4/5XL
TO FIT CHEST
44-46" [112-117 cm]
48-54" [122-137 cm]
56-62" [142-157.5 cm]
FINISHED CHEST
52" [132 cm]
56" [142 cm]
64" [162.5 cm]

Model is wearing size XS/S in RedHeart® Super Saver® Model has 34" [96.5 cm] chest and is 5 feet 9 inches tall.

FRONT & BACK (Make alike).
Slip Knot
With A make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then draw through to make slip knot. 
Chain
Yarn over hook (Yoh), draw through loop – 1 chain made.

With A, chain (ch) 62 (65-71-80-86-98).
1st row: [Right Side (RS)]. 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 61 (64-70-79-85-97) sc.

2nd row: Ch 3 [counts as double crochet (dc) here and throughout]. 1 double crochet (dc) in first sc. *Skip next 2 sc. 3 dc in next sc. Repeat (Rep) from * to last 3 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 2 dc in last sc, joining B in last dc. Turn. 19 (20-22-25-27-31) groups of 3 dc, with 2 dc at either side edge. Break A.

3rd row: With B, ch 3. Skip next dc. 3 dc in sp between last skipped dc and next dc group. *3 dc in next sp between 2 groups of dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Skip next dc. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.

4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. Skip first group of 3 dc. *3 dc in next sp between 2 groups of dc. Rep from * across, skipping last group of 3 dc. 2 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.

5th and 6th rows: Rep 3rd and 4th rows. Join A in last dc at end of 6th row.

7th to 10th rows: With A, as 3rd and 4th rows twice. Join B in last dc at end of 10th row.

Rep 3rd to 10th rows for Granny Stripe Pattern, working 4 rows each in A and B, until work from beginning (beg) measures approx 25 (25-25-28-28-28)" [63.5 (63.5-63.5-71-71-71) cm], ending after working 4 rows of A or B. Fasten off.

SLEEVES
With A, chain (ch) 53 (56-59-65-65-68).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 52 (55-58-64-64-67) sc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 1 dc in first sc. *Skip next 2 sc. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from* to last 3 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 2 dc in last sc, joining B in last dc. Turn. 16 (17-18-20-20-21) groups of 3 dc, with 2 dc at either side edge. Break A.

3rd row: With B, ch 3. Skip next dc. 3 dc in sp between last skipped dc and next dc group. *3 dc in next sp between 2 groups of dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Skip next dc. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.

4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. Skip first group of 3 dc. *3 dc in next sp between 2 groups of dc. Rep from * across, skipping last group of 3 dc. 2 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.

5th and 6th rows: Rep 3rd and 4th rows. Join A in last dc at end of 6th row.

7th to 10th rows: With A, as 3rd and 4th rows twice. Join B in last dc at end of 10th row.

Rep 5th to 10th rows for Granny Stripe Pattern, working 4 rows each in A and B, until work from beginning (beg) measures approx 17" [43 cm], ending after working 4 rows of A or B. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Place markers on Front and Back pieces 4½ (5-6-7½-8½-10)" [11.5 (12.5-15-19-21.5-25.5) cm] from sides along top edge for shoulders, leaving 11 (11-11-11-11-12)" [28 (28-28-28-28-30.5) cm] space for neck opening. Sew shoulder seams. Place markers on Front and Back side edges 8½ (9-9½-10½-10½-11)" [21.5 (23-24.5-26.5-26.5-28) cm] down from shoulders. With A, sew in sleeves between markers. With A, sew side and sleeve seams. We love seeing your makes! Share your photos using #YARNSPO and tag us @yarnspirations on Instagram or find us on Facebook.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Soft Pink (39719): XS/S 1, M 1, L 1, XL 2, 2/3XL 2, 4/5XL 2 ball(s)
Contrast B Soft Blue (97003): XS/S 3, M 4, L 4, XL 4, 2/3XL 5, 4/5XL 5 ball(s)
Contrast C Gold (39782): XS/S 1, M 1, L 1, XL 1, 2/3XL 1, 4/5XL 1 ball
Contrast D Persimmon (39754): XS/S 1, M 1, L 2, XL 2, 2/3XL 2, 4/5XL 2 ball(s)
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge. Stitch markers. Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
gauge: 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

CROCHET LANDSCAPE SWEATER
Notes:
• When working from chart use intarsia technique. Wind small balls of the colors to be used, one for each separate area of color in the design.
• When changing yarn colors, work hdc to last 3 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 3 loops and proceed in new color, leaving old color at WS of work.
• Ch 2 at beg of rows counts as hdc throughout.

FRONT
**Ribbing:  With A and smaller hook, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing, when slightly stretched, measures 22 ( 24-26-28-30-32)" [ 56 ( 61-66-71-76-81.5) cm], ending on a RS row. Rotate to work across side edge of ribbing.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 72 ( 78-86-92-98-104) sc evenly across side edge of Ribbing. Fasten off. Do not turn. **
With RS facing and larger hook, join B with sl st to first sc.
Place Chart: 1st row:  (RS). Ch 2 (counts as 1st hdc of row). Work 1st row of Chart in hdc. Turn.
See chart on page 4.
Cont to work Chart in hdc until 40 rows of Chart are complete, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right. Break all colors but B.
With B only, cont even in hdc until work from lower edge (including ribbing) measures 19½ ( 19½-21½-21½-23-23)" [ 49.5 ( 49.5-54.5-54.5-58.5-58.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape left neck: 1st row:  (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 23 ( 26-29-32-34-37) hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 26 ( 29 -32-35 -37 -40) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row:  Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 23 ( 26-29-32-34-37) sts.
5th and 6th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
Shape right neck: With RS facing, skip next 18 ( 18-20-20-22-22) unworked sts of Front. Join B with sl st to next hdc.
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 26 ( 29-32-35-37-40) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row. 23 ( 26-29-32-34-37) sts.
5th and 6th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
BACK
Work from ** to ** as given for Front.
With RS facing and larger hook, join B with sl st to first sc.
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Back from lower edge (including ribbing) measures same length as Front to shoulder, ending on a WS row.
Fasten off.
SLEEVES
Ribbing: With D and smaller hook, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing when slightly stretched measures 9 ( 9-10-10-11-11)" [ 23 ( 23-25.5-25.5-28-28) cm], ending on a RS row.

Rotate to work across side edge of ribbing.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 30 ( 30-34-34-36-36) sc evenly across side edge of Ribbing. Break D. Join B. Turn.
Change to larger hook.
2nd row: (WS). With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row (inc row):  Ch 2. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 2 sts inc’d.
Rep last 2 rows 4 ( 4-12-12-12-12) times more. 40 ( 40-60-60-62-62) sts.
Sizes  XS/S and  M only: Next 3 rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Next row (inc row):  (RS). Ch 2. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 2 sts inc’d.
Rep last 4 rows 5 times more. 52 sts.
All sizes: 52 ( 52-60-60-62-62) sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Sleeve from lower edge (including Ribbing) measures 18½ ( 17½-17-16-15½-15) " [ 47 ( 44.5-43-40.5-39.5-38) cm], ending on a WS row.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams.
Neck edging: With RS facing and smaller hook, join B with sl st to neck edge at right shoulder seam.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. Work sc evenly around neck edge. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Neckband:  With A and smaller hook, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Neckband measures length to fit around neck edge, when slightly stretched. Sew long edge of Neckband to neck edging, beg at right shoulder seam. Sew ends of Neckband tog.
Place markers on each side edge of Front and Back 8 ( 8-9-9-9½-9½) [ 20.5 ( 20.5 -23-23-24-24) cm], down from shoulder seams.
Sew in Sleeves between markers. Sew side and sleeve seams.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Contrast A: Pop Culture (2029) 2 balls for XS/S, 2 balls for M, 2 balls for L, 2 balls for XL, 2 balls for 2/3XL, 2 balls for 4/5XL
Contrast B: Carnation Code (2020) 2 balls for XS/S, 2 balls for M, 2 balls for L, 3 balls for XL, 3 balls for 2/3XL, 3 balls for 4/5XL
Contrast C: Totally Teal (2031) 2 balls for XS/S, 2 balls for M, 2 balls for L, 2 balls for XL, 3 balls for 2/3XL, 3 balls for 4/5XL
Size U.S. J/10 [6 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® Split Lock stitch markers
gauge: 15 stitches (sts) and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Moss St pattern (pat) counting sc and ch-spaces (sps).
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written XS/S (M-L-XL-2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes:
• Carry colors not in use loosely up side of Cardigan.
• Body is worked in one piece to armholes.
• When beginning (beg) to work in Stripe Pat, start A at beg of 5-color granny repeat (rep); start B on third shade of 5-color granny rep to prevent pooling.
Stripe Pat: With A, work 2 rows. With B, work 2 rows. With C, work 2 rows. These 6 rows form Stripe Pat.
BODY
Bottom Ribbing:  With C, chain (ch) 8.
1st row: 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd chain from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Bottom Ribbing, when slightly stretched, measures approximately (approx) 31 (35½-39½-43-51-56½)" [78.5 (90-100.5-109-129.5-143.5) cm].
Note:  Carry colors not in use loosely along front edge of Cardigan.
Next row: [Wrong side (WS)]. With C, work 117 (133-149-163-191-211) sc evenly across long edge of Bottom Ribbing. Break C. Join A. 
**Work in Moss St Pat as follows, and beg working in Stripe Pat:
1st row: [Right Side (RS)]. With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 space (sp). Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.**
First 3 rows of Stripe Pat are now in place. Keeping continuity (cont) of Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rows for Moss St Pat until work from top of ribbing measures 19 (19-19½-19-19½-20)" [48.5 (48.5-49.5-48.5-49.5-51) cm], ending on a WS row.
Right Front: Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, work Right Front in Moss St Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 9 (11-13-15-18-20) times. Turn. Leave remaining (rem) sts unworked. 
Continue (Cont) on 19 (23-27-31-37-41) sts.
***2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rows until Front from divide measures 9 (9-9¾-9¾-10½)" [23 (23-23-25-25-26.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.***
Back: With RS facing, skip next 10 sts. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, join yarn with slip stitch (sl st) to next sc.
Work Back in Moss St Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as sl st. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 29 (33-37-40-48-54) times. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont on 59 (67-75-81-97-109) sts.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until Back from divide measures 9 (9-9-9¾-9¾-10½)" [23 (23-23-25-25-26.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Left Front: With RS facing, skip next 10 sts. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, join yarn with sl st to next ch-1 sp.
Work Left Front in Moss St Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same ch-1 sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Work from *** to *** as given for Right Front.
SLEEVES
Cuff: With C, ch 8.
1st row:  1 sc in 2nd chain from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Cuff, when slightly stretched, measures 10 (10-10-11-11-12)" [25.5 (25.5-25.5-28-28.5-30.5) cm].
Next row: (RS). With C, work 45 (45-45-49-49-53) sc evenly across long edge of ribbing.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc.  Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 67 (67-67-75-75-79) sc.
Work from ** to ** as given for Body.
First 3 rows of Stripe Pat are now in place. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rows for Moss St Pat until work from top of Cuff measures 17½ (17½ -17 -17 -16 -15½)" [44.5 (44.5-43-43-40.5-39.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Place marker at each side of Sleeve 1½" [4 cm] below last row.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams.
Note: When working 1st row of Collar and Front Band, take care to cover carried strands.
Collar and Front Band: 1st row:  (RS). Join B with sl st at lower edge of Right Front. Ch 1. Work 1 row of sc evenly up Right Front, across Back neck edge and down Left Front. Turn.
2nd row:  (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only,  1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Band measures 3" [7.5 cm]. 
Fasten off.
Sew in Sleeves placing rows above markers along unworked sts of Front and Back to form square armholes. Sew sleeve seams.

materials: Patons® Linen™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 275 yds/251 m)
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 14½ sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Floret Pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written XS/S (M-L-XL-2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

MOTIFS (Front Panels) (make 16). Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as ddc. Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 15 dc in ring. 16 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). *1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-4.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 48 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 5. Sl st in 5th ch from hook. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around, omitting final sc in last rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Sl st in next ch-5 sp. Ch 3. (4 dc. Ch 3. 5 dc) in same sp. *1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 5 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch 2 sp. ** (5 dc. Ch 3. 5 dc) in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
6th rnd: Join yarn with sl st to any corner ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in same sp. *Ch 5. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 5.** (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp. *6 dc in next ch-5 sp. (4 dc in next ch-3 sp) twice. 6 dc in next ch-5 sp.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each dc and (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in each corner ch-2 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc and (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in each corner ch-2 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 9th rnd until work measures 6½ (7-7½-8-8½-9)" [16.5 (18-19-20.5-21.5-23) cm] square. Fasten off.

BACK PANEL
Ch 67 (77-85-93-103-113).
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 65 (75-83-91-101-111) dc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first st. *1 dc in next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Last 2 rows form Floret Pat. Cont in Floret Pat until work from beg measures 26 (28-30-32-34-36)" [66 (71-76-81.5-86.5-91) cm]. Fasten off.

SLEEVES
Ch 41 (45-49-53-57-61).
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 39 (43-47-51-55-59) dc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first st. *1 dc in next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. Last 2 rows form Floret Pat. Cont in Floret Pat until work from beg measures 4 (4-3½-2½-2-1½)" [10 (10-9-6.5-5-4) cm], ending on WS row.

Shape sides: 1st row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first st (inc made). 1 dc in each st to last 2 sts. 2 dc in next st (inc made). 1 dc in last st. Turn. 41 (45-49-53-57-61) dc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 dc in first st. *Sl st in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first st (inc made). 1 dc in each st to last 2 sts. 2 dc in next st (inc made). 1 dc in last st. Turn. 43 (47-51-55-59-63) dc.
6th row: Ch 1. Sl st in first st. *1 dc in next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
7th row: As 3rd row.
8th row: As 6th row.
Rep these 8 rows 4 times more. 59 (63-67-71-75-79) sts. Cont even in Floret Pat until Sleeve from beg measures 18 (17-17-16-16-15)" [45.5 (43-43-40.5-40.5-38) cm]. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Front Panels: Sew Motifs tog into 2 rectangles: each 2 Motifs wide x 4 Motifs high as shown in assembly diagram below. Place markers for armholes on sides of Back Panel 13 (13½-15-16½-18-19½)" [33 (34-38-42-46-49.5) cm] up from lower edge and 5 (6-6-6-6-6)" [12.5 (15-15-15-15-15) cm] down from top edge, leaving 8 (8½-9-9½-10-10½)" [20.5 (21.5-23-24-25.5-27) cm] open for sleeve. Sew sides of Back Panel to Front Panels between markers. Sew in Sleeves. Sew Sleeve seams.
Front Edging: With WS facing, join yarn with sl st at lower corner of Left Front Panel. Work 103 (115-127-133-139-145) sc evenly up to top corner. Turn. **Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next 2 sc. (5 dc. Ch 2. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook - picot made. 5 dc) in next st. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.** With WS facing, join yarn with sl st at top corner of Right Front Panel. Work 103 (115-127-133-139-145) sc evenly down to lower corner. Turn. Rep from ** to **.

materials: Caron ® Simply Soft (Heathers: 5 oz/141.7 g; 250 yds/228 m) Main Color (MC) Gray Heather (H9509) 3 3 4 4 5 6 balls
Caron ® Simply Soft™ (Ombres: 5 oz/141.7 g; 235 yds/215 m) Contrast A Teal Zeal (22002) 1 1 1 1 1 1 ball(s)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd/row does not count as st.

Yoke
Beg at neck edge, with MC, ch 60 (64-68-72-80-88) loosely. Join in rnd. PM on first st.
1st rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join. 60 (64-68-72-80-88) hdc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
Rep last rnd twice more. Work Chart in sc to end of chart, reading rnds from right to left and noting chart will be repeated 15 (16-17-18-20-22) times. 225 (240-255-270-300-330) sc. Chart is shown on page 3.
Next rnd:  With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 1 (0-1-0-0-0) sc. 2 (0-2-0-0-0) sc in last 1 (0-1-0-0-0) sc. 226 (240-256-270-300-330) sts.
Next rnd: With MC, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd 0 (2-4-4-6-6) times more. Fasten off.

Divide for Body and Sleeves:
Starting at beg of rnd, PM at 4 points across last row of Yoke, mark 66th (71st-75th-81st-91st-103rd) sc for Back, then following 47th (49th-53rd-54th-59th-62nd) sc for Left Sleeve, then following 66th (71st-75th-81st-91st-103rd) sc for Front and leave rem 47 (49-53-54-59-62) sc for Right Sleeve.

Lower Body
Note: Lower Body is worked vertically in rows, then sewn to Yoke.
With MC, ch 25 (25-25-28-32-34).
1st row:  (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 23 (23-23-26-30-32) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked – see diagram). Rep from * 5 times more. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 6 hdc. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row. Rep from * 5 times more. 1 hdc in each of last 6 hdc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures to fit length between markers for Front and Back. Sew in place as you work.

Sleeve Ribbing
Note: Sleeve Ribbing is worked vertically in rows, then sewn to Yoke.
With MC, ch 25.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 23 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked – see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures, when slightly stretched, to fit length between markers for sleeve. Beg at underarm, sew in place as you work.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Size U.S. I/9 [5.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: Motif = Approximately (Approx) 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S/M/L. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written XS/S/M/L (XL/2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

MOTIF
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color repeat (rep)) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 round (rnd) in the Motif with 5 colors in total.
